review_body: The hotel is nice and clean, even during the COVID19. I like the handicap room, which is close to the ice machine, laundry, and vending machine. Before the covid19 hit, the hotel was well maintain, my room was always clean. Staff are friendly. I especially want to shout out to ROFEL for all her fantastic friendliness and always keeping my room clean even during the current pandemic COVID19. She have a passion for her work, she remember my schedule, which she use to keep my room clean with all the right social distancing applied. Many Many thanks for your kindness. You are ESSENTIAL!

Very Nice airport hotel for a transit or a stay in Honolulu. Warm welcome. Devoted welcoming bellstaff as soon as shuttle doors opened. Efficient nice helpful staff at front desk. Cup of coffee or tea offered at checkout. Clean comfortable rooms. Good wifi. Effective air conditionning. Coffee or tea in room. Fridge. Iron. Restaurant and shops for souvenirs or essentiels. I highly recommend this airport hotel for leisure or business.

The hotel was great. Clean room and is dated a little bit very clean. Bed was comfortable and had a microwave and freezer if you were staying longer. We stayed for only one night before a flight home. The free bus transfer took us at 5 am to the airport and he was lovely. We had a good experience.

Great place to stay! The hotel is in a safe area, within 5-10 minutes from JBPHH, NEX, and the airport. The hotel staff were so friendly and helpful as well as the maid staff! HUGE shoutout to the maid staff and especially Ms. Nieda for her warm welcome, service and assistance. She truly embodies the “E komo mai” and Aloha spirit.Thank you very much for making our families stay memorable!

We just needed an overnight place to sleep. The place needs an upgrade in the worst way. It was humid inside the hotel, the decor looks like it hasn't been updated in eons and we couldn't wait to get out of there. Pity because it's right at the airport, they offer pickup and delivery to/from the terminal and the room was clean.

Stayed here for one night as I arrived late and had a early afternoon flight out. Shuttle is very handy and location is great. Close to airport, fast food and bus stop. USS Arizona Memorial only 10min away by city bus. Gift shop open late for snacks and drinks.

I had a good time staying, (13days) everyone was nice and helpful. Gigi our housekeeper went the extra mile to help, she is diligent and trustworthy.But the hotel Wifi service was crappy and unreliable. They need to improve their bandwidth to the top floors.

We have been staying here for about 3 weeks (military move) now and are very content here. We’ve had to do a lot of running around with car shopping and house hunting so the location has been great for that. The hotel is centrally located on the island and literally right next to the airport. The room we have is comfy enough for the four of us and Teresita has been great about keeping our room clean and always making sure we have everything we need. We’ve dined at the restaurant pretty much every night. They have a variety of foods which are all good and the staff there are all so friendly. I would definitely recommend this hotel and would stay here again.

Restaurant only serves dinner (bummer, I'm a breakfast eater); night front desk clerk a bit cranky, but day clerks are all very lively and welcoming; housekeeping is their best department - thank you, Mila, Marriane, and Elie for always keeping our room clean and free of negativity (lol). Been here for three weeks now, and will be here another 3-4 weeks. My family and I could stay at any top notch hotel in Honolulu on my insurance dime, yet we're here and very much content..this place ain't so bad//

I was very surprised when I checked in to the hotel.......it was very easy to get a FREE ride to the hotel ....the phone was at the baggage pickup 8 made a call and they were there in about 15 min.........fast polite check-in.....and very helpful finding places to eat near the hotel.......the room was quiet and clean lots of space and even a pool........there was a strip mall just 2 blocks from the hotel with a wide selection of places to eat.......even a Dunken Doughnuts ......free newspapers every morning and hot cocoa , coffee or tea......great microwave and mini fridge ......the only sad thing was that if you wanted to watch movies it was an extra $30.......local stations were Free

Great service straight from the airport. Amazing staff extremely helpful. Got picked up from free shuttle. All staff go out of their way to make you feel welcome. Very clean and comfortable. Everything I needed for my stay. They have a little gym but all the equipment I needed. I would defiantly stay there again.

Picked this location simply because of it's proximity to the airport and what a hidden gem!We stayed all week at a 5 star resort right on Waikiki the other 6 nights we were here, so, all that to say, we weren't expecting much...just a place to lay our head before a big travel day the next day. Wow! Were we surprised at how clean our room was (thanks Norma!) and how friendly everyone from the shuttle driver, front desk, room keep, even the gift shop! All so very nice, professional and VERY CLEAN!!! May stay here longer next visit. What a bargain !

We had a really nice stay, easy access to airport and bus line to city. They stored my bags, which was really handy. The room was cool, and secure up on the fourth floor. Sketchy neighborhoods. The fox news though. They need to stop with hateful partisan propaganda.

Free shuttle service was very convenient and in time. Hotel is just 15 minutes away from major shopping center by bus also Pearl Harbor and the Arizona Memorial. Only inconvenience was the restaurant didn’t service breakfast or lunch. Front desk was courteous and friendly along with housekeeping staff.

My housekeeper her name is Lorna she was very sweet and I really appreciate her cleaning and keeping the place nice very nice place to stay at thank you so much for making my stay pleaseant and comfortable.

I stayed in this hotel with an overnight layover. It was ok. The restaurant was ok. The room was ok. But I wasn’t super happy with the establishment. When you have to walk out of the main building to another building across the parking lot with all your luggage, well it’s a pain. On my return trip I stayed at Best Western just a little bit up the road. It was much nicer for just $10/ night more.

During a military move to Hawaii we stayed at this airport. If you have pets, this is one of the best choices to make. Close to the bases and the Navy Exchange. We didn’t have a pet fee which can be ($30-$40 per day) also a dog area that is fenced in ,free parking- military (which is normally $20-40 per day) and they give meal vouchers at their restaurant every night. And wow their meals are good. Pool were well kept and great for our kids. Also had security roaming the halls or near by. Our house keeping service was on point, nice tidy rooms. Geraldine was always smiling and went above and beyond to make sure I had all I needed. Made the whole experience of staying in a hotel for a month, living out of suitcases pleasant. Would recommend.

Great hotel. Staff is outstanding. Special thanks to Mila in housekeepy for the clean and neat room . Exceptional service by shuttle team and front desk staff as well. Will definitely make this my go to lodging when in Honolulu

One of the better friendly staffs of places I have stayed. Would stay again The shuttle driver was especially good and helpful in advice about getting around Honolulu. Food at the restaurant was very goods. Only thing I would add would be a breakfast.

Only a few minutes from airport with the free shuttle. Several fast food stores within short walking distance.Very good standard for 2** hotel. Nice comfy room with fridge, coffee maker and microwave. Bathroom well stocked with gel, shampoo, conditioner and body cream.Staff were very helpful and welcoming...lots of smiles on our arrival.Highly recommend this hotel for access to airport.

I was working weird hours and my room attendant Josie worked around all her other rooms just to accommodate me. It was one of the nicest experiences and made it feel a little like home. To Josie and all the staff there I want to thank you for all you do.

This place is nothing fancy but if you need a room with a bed so you can get prone, this fits that bill. It is close enough to the airport that they have a free shuttle. It felt a little bit like my hostel stays from way back
user_name:
James C
Hyde Park, New York

review_body: Les is fantastic and super accommodating when it comes to helping military members during a PCS. He saved my family and I a ton of money and honestly I don't know that we wouldn't even have been able to find a place if it weren't for him. The hotel is clean, the staff is friendly, and the amenities are top notch. Les doesn't sugar coat anything. He tells you how things are in the hotel, and advises you to take care of other things (like laundry) elsewhere since they're expensive in the hotel.I had to take away a star though for the internet. He claims that they have the best wifi of any hotel in Honolulu, but that's like claiming you have the fastest turtle. More and more I see hotels refuse and even remove the wired internet option (the wired option is in this hotel, but disabled) in favor of WiFi.I am an IT security professional, and I have been working with computers my whole life. Rather than bore you with the specifics I will just say that WiFi is awful, and it gets worse the more people are connected to it. You will experience a great many disconnects while connected to the hotel's Internet. It will be basically unusable between the hours of 4-9pm every day, and sometimes around breakfast and lunch time. This would be true of any hotel you go to that has a lot of people and few access points on their WiFi. In my opinion, a single access point per user is the only way to make WiFi bearable -- but if you were going to do that you'd just choose the cheaper option of having wired internet.Also, the WiFi is COMPLETELY UNSECURED. The connect portal doesn't require a password, and just lets you connect. Again, I work in IT security, and it's extremely upsetting to see that any miscreant in the parking lot could see every packet I'm sending on the WiFi. Worse, they could masquerade as an access point for a man in the middle attack.So, tl;dr Les is great, WiFi is awful. Stay here if you're military, but get an unlimited plan on your phone so you can tether. Don't use the WiFi. Seriously. Don't use the WiFi.

Our last night in Honolulu and we wanted to be near the airport so we booked a single night here. Much to our delight it was a gem of a hotel with excellent customer service all around. The pool area and seating area by the check in was nice. The only drawback is they do not serve breakfast or lunch but do have dinner service across from the cute gift shop. I especially want to give a shout out to “Alex” who works in front and stores luggage for you, calls taxis and directs you to the bus system along with putting our luggage on the shuttle to the airport. Alex is just an all round personable and genuine man who we appreciated interacting with a bit during our stay. Kudos to him for being so chipper and cheery, your New Jersey guests Jim and John appreciated it!

With a long day layover in Honolulu, my wheelchair bound son needed a place to rest. The Airport Honolulu hotel offered us a room from noon until 7. While my daughters went to the beach, my son was able to lay down and relieve the pressure after a long flight from Australia. Bonus, we could all freshen up with showers before our flight back to the mainland. Great restaurant for dinner on site and free wheelchair accessible transportation to and from airport

Receptionists, like Ashley, Ann, Kehau, Rose, Susan, Uhanekai,etc. are always very welcoming and accommodating especially my husband being in a wheelchair. I love coming to this hotel than any other hotel.due to their sincere kindness and caring. I also love the housekeepers especially Nieda who took care of us this past year. Nieda always smiles and greets us and tends to our needs. Thank you all for showing the real ohana spirit! You are a testament of local hospitality.
user_name:
Moana P
Pago Pago, American Samoa

review_body: The rooms were a maze and very hard to find room. I desperately wanted to get into the pool around 0800 to do some laps before my international flight but didn’t open till 0900. Bitterly disappointing.

It was good for what we needed: a place to crash for a night in order to see Pearl Harbor before traveling on to Maui. Clean and staff was nice. Convenient airport shuttle and easy access to Pearl Harbor by taxi or Uber.

I stayed here for two months for work, and thoroughly enjoyed my time spent here. The front desk staff is extremely sweet and helpful (shout out to Ann), the rooms were clean and comfortable, the wifi was good, even mentioned the need for fitness mats in the fitness room and three days later they were there! They truly care about your experience and the location is centrally located with easy access to Honolulu and the Interstate. Also, they have a great restaurant on site, the food is great and the service is even better. Mila, our housekeeper, went above and beyond in her service, constantly going out of her way to make sure our needs were met, and treated us kindly. Thank you Mila for all your hard work and taking care of my family.

Nieda cleaned for me daily and did an excellent job. Always friendly with a smile on her face. Willoughbys restaurant is a 3 star. Not any other restaurants in the area but are only a taxi ride away. If you need to be near the airport this is a good place to stay for a short stay.

Our room was perfect when we arrived and also perfect after our first night. Our room attendant Merly performed her job to the highest standard. While not always getting a chance to be face to face with the person who looks after your room, you can tell when someone takes pride in their work as Merly surely does. A hotel's reputation is often judged on the quality of the housekeeping department, which as a Tourism teacher, I emphasize to my students as just about the most important department in any hotel. Thank you Merly for contributing your part to your hotel's excellent reputation.

This hotel has a good Kama'aina rate for locals. Great check-in experience, free newspaper at front desk, restaurant opens at 5:00 PM with full bar. Comfortable beds, clean rooms, ask to be placed on the backside of the hotel for extra quiet. The restaurant food was very good with large portions, the service was excellent. Be sure to order the bread pudding for dessert - easily enough for 2-3 to share. It was fantastic!

I went there twice during the past months for business reasons. It is a good hotel, it has great easy access to the airport with a free shuttle, is clean, has complimentary coffee in the lobby in the morning, a dining option on site, a little shop, it's very convenient if you need to be near the airport for any reason. Some of the rooms can be quite noisy because of the nearby highway but the staff is very helpful and will very likely accomodate your needs.

We arrived after a long day of sightseeing, staying close to the airport for our return home. The room was OK, although quite dated. The hotel was very busy, although the staff was friendly and efficient.The location here is excellent for travelling to and from the airport. However, there is not much to see here on the grounds other than concrete - freeway, buildings, etc. This is an extremely developed area, and you will not find peace and quiet outside. The room was relatively quiet though.For convenience, you cannot beat this hotel.

I arrived late at night. It was well past 8:30pm when I checked in. The girls at the front desk were friendly and accommodating as usual. I stayed here on numerous occasions for business trips on Oahu and the rooms were always clean and comfortable. Ms Sandra was my housekeeper and did a great job. Ill be staying there again soon. Aloha!

Nieda would always clean my room and she is the sweetest ever highly recommend staying here! they are always so energetic and very postitive attitude highly recommend people to stay here while they’re visiting hawaii.

Our group stayed while on island for a sports activity. We were all roomed close together, parking was a breeze and rooms were clean and comfortable. The property is so easy to get in and out of and so close to the freeway onramp. Josie from housekeeping kept our room spotless and the Front desk staff are so pleasant and helpful.All in all a very wonderful stay. Comparable to hotels that are much more expensive!

I would like to say that the housekeeping staff especially Ms Lorna are awesome. She greets with a smile and is attentive to any request you may have and delivers. Each day we were there and she came by to clean she was friendly and hardworking. You could this if all their housekeeping staff. Cheers to her and the staff at the Airport Honolulu Hotel

We have been staying here for over a month and have loved the housekeeping staff! Geraldine has been so helpful and kind! She always does a great job in our room, greets us everyday, and even remembers my kids names!

As a military couple in the middle of their pcs this hotel really took care of us. From the woman at the front desk, to Les the military liaison, and our very friendly house keeper Marie (Ive never seen a room cleaned so fast all while having a friendly chit chat) our stay was great. I know this hotel isn't in the center of Waikiki or Honolulu, but it is only a short drive away and definitely can't beat the price. Would recommend!

We arrived in Honolulu on a 5am flight and didn’t depart again until 2:30 so took a chance on the Airport Honolulu Hotel. They gave us a room for a reasonable price and a noon hour checkout, perfect.This isn’t the fanciest hotel but for a short layover it was just what the doctor ordered.The rooms are a bit tired but still clean and comfortable.Getting 4 or 5 hours of sleep before we continued on was great!

If you are arriving late or taking early morning flight then this is a good place to stay.They have 24 hours complimentary shuttle service from the Airport. Rooms are clean and quite a few places to eat nearby. The staff is very helpful and courteous.

Enroute to Marshall Islands for work we had a 1 night layover. Aging 2-3 star hotel in need of an upgrading and a facelift. Carpet are old but clean. Rooms are basic but again - clean. Shuttle service 24/7 to and from the airport. Connivence store on premises. Sells liquor and food stuffs. Military travelers and families.

Mary Ann was an amazing house keeper! I am 8 months pregnant and she made my stay so comfortable and easy! There was days were I couldn’t even get out of bed and she came through, even with my kids and I in the room and made It spotless for us!

Nieda who cleaned our room was very friendly and helpful. Hotel was convenient to bus stops and just minutes from the airport by their free shuttle bus. Clean room and good wifi reception. Can also use the free shuttle for breakfast at the Best Western..

Clean room with comfortable beds, nice pool, fast wifi, friendly and helpful front desk, high quality restaurant, and a thorough, detailed room cleaning staff. Shout out to Mila for the excellent service!

The down side is I was not able to get a room change in the 12 days staying at the hotel - The amenities were great. Local Store had a great suply of food items and stayed open late enough so when i came back from work late I was able to get something from the storeMy house keeper - She was great hrough out the entire stay - very detail oriented - MILA - thank you for making my stay comfortable - thank you Darrenfront desk Staff for assisting - in creating this booking for me Uhanekai

Great stay good location, super sweet maids and staff. Complimentary coffee in the mornings and free trips to and from airport. The airport shuttle actually worked out perfect for me because during my stay I got a job at the Airline and was able to catch the shuttle back and forth to conduct my business.

My husband and I had an overnight layover in Honolulu on our honeymoon. We just needed a simple hotel close to the airport. This hotel exceeded our expectations. It was cute and clean. Staff was very friendly and accommodating. We ate dinner at the restaurant and it was super yummy! We got katsu chicken and the chicken teriyaki bowl. Also they have free shuttle to and from the airport. Overall I highly recommend if you want to be near the airport. It’s about 20 minutes to get to downtown so if you’re in town for a long vacation this may not be the best location, but that wasn’t an issue for us.

We stayed at the Honolulu Airport Hotel and the staff was fantastic. Very friendly and helpful. Marites was fantastic. She always had our room ready to go and clean. Very friendly and helpful. I would recommend this hotel

It doesn't matter where the location is. What matters is the sincere and heartfelt hospitality that the staff and employees present and it is ALWAYS with a smile! Front desk very knowledgeable, appreciative for inquiries, total commitment and attention to detail. Rooms are spacious, clean and comfortable and oh the much needed quietness. As for the view? I'm fortunate to catch the sun almost all day no matter if I face the parking lot. Ms. Lorna, from house keeping. Very courteous and always asks if things needed to be replaced even though most of everything is clean and I have not used much from the room I stayed in. She carries herself proudly and our cnversations are never ending. She has one child and works very hard to ensure the future for her family. Always greeting, smiling while tending to her daily routine and bids farewell with a "God Bless" parting. This woman is amazing. Overall, grounds are clean well kept and safe. Lighting at night and secured doors after daylight hours. Great people. Thank you and Fa'afetai. Jr.

Aloha, my name is Kat and I am staying at airport hotel in the month of November. I wanted to take time out to review my room service with Auntie Geraldine. She has been very kind and did an excellent job with cleaning my room whenever I asked for anything. She is a true example of a hard worker with aloha spirit. I hope the airport hotel is able to recognize her for the hard work she does and how well she does it.

Lorna took excellent care and paid close attention to housekeeping needs providing a very comfortable room and stay.Will also like to mention the front desk staff, restaurant staff, and shuttle team all took liberties to assure amenities and full services were provided.Thank you.

There was supposed to be a transfer us to the hotel, but it did not come, When we left there was one for us. We arrived late and they gave us a room where we didn't have to walk far. The room was very clean and comfortable

Have never stayed here before but was pleasantly surprised! Very convenient location to Waikiki, Ko Olina, and Windward side. Housekeeping (Nieda in particular) was the sweetest and went above and beyond what we needed for our stay. Will definitely be back!

We really enjoyed our stay here. Quiet, clean and fantastic staff helpful and happy. Great location and great meals for night time really loved pudding. Convenient bus stop nearly front door. So close to airport and wonderful airport shuttle.

Our last hotel stay before we headed back home, great location with a free shuttle bus from the airport and free back to the airport the next morning. I realised I left my prescription glasses behind so I promptly sent them an email asking if they had been found by housekeeping, they were located and are in the process of posting them back to me..great communication thank you, just waiting for my glasses to arrive soon.

My wife and I stayed here for two nights and thoroughly enjoyed our stay. The person at the front desk provided very helpful, and spot on, directions on using public bus to a couple of shopping centers and things to do. Property is quite close to bus stops going in both directions (away from downtown Hono and towards). Nice, and cheap, option for getting around. The room was comfortable, the restaurant had very decent food, and the pool and surrounding area was very clean and refreshing. All this and a highly competitive price so close to the airport and we will certainly stay here again when passing through Honolulu. Shuttle ride to airport a breeze. Great find.

I stop in at this hotel every couple of months and I'm always comforted with how well they take care of their guests here. This place feels so much like a second home! We start with Kehau greeting us by name into the hotel and making sure all of our check-in needs are met and if we have any questions they are answered. She also goes above and beyond by staying up to date on va policies that affect our stay. Our housekeeper, Nieda, always does such a good job cleaning our room and is so nice and friendly that we always request a room in her area. Gigi is another housekeeper that has been wonderful as well. They are both professional, but seem to go out of their way to make sure we have everything we need. I have no complaints with the staff here.

Comfortable, clean but dated. Close to several restaurants as well as an onsite restaurant open only for dinner. I called 2 months in advance to be sure they understood our unusual travel arrival and departure dates and times. Upon arrival, they had our travel dates wrong and no knowledge of our previous conversation. Fortunately, they had a room available during our 2 night stay.

Convenient location (near airport & highway), clean room, and friendly staff. I spent about a month in the Airport Honolulu Hotel. I appreciated how kind and attentive my room attendant (Rofel) was during my stay. Rofel was always cheerful and did a great job of replacing towels and servicing my room in general.

This was an unplanned stay, and the Airport Honolulu Hotel is a very good option for travelers needing to stay near the airport. Shuttle service runs every half hour from the hotel and you can call for pickup from the airport. Front desk staff was helpful and friendly. I was there such a short time, the same person checked me out that checked me in.

I've had two occasions now that this hotel has been rude and discourteous.The first occurrence, I traveled with companions from work earlier this year. While booking the rooms at different times, my confirmation wasn't completed by the admin. The clerk said it wasn't a problem and that she was adding it to our groups business expense card. Each of us took turns signing in for our rooms. They informed us that they required our personal credit cards for any possible damages. When they got to my card, without permission or notification of anything different, they charged the entire cost of the room to my personal card and then handed me a receipt. It took ten minutes of convincing the clerk that she wasn't supposed to charge me, she hadn't even received permission to charge any dollar amount to my card, and that their refund policy didn't apply to this circumstance. It took our business manager and their manager another 45 minutes to get them to refund my money and put the charge on our business card. The refund took three days to arrive in my account. Those were three of the five days I was in town.My second instance was when I recently was scheduled for training by the state. State covers all the booking and charges for other items, but hotel is left to the individual and reimbursed at a later date. I booked my own stay and within five minutes I was told that the dates were different and that this hotel wasn't on the approved list of hotels for my trips. I called and attempted to cancel within the five minutes of booking and they refused due to the hidden fine print on only this room that said non-refundable. I tried reasoning with the person because this is a state funded trip, I hadn't seen the button on the screen you had to click to see it was non-refundable, the state will not reimburse me for this hotel, and that it was less than five minutes from the time I had booked the room. Again they refused to refund the room, even with over three weeks notice.I am a very patient and calm person under pressure. I have not spoken to them rudely at any point. There is no instance of me acting out of line with them. The first instance was completely their fault and still took over three days to get fixed. The second was a simple error based on their hidden disclaimer. Both times they have been rude and unrelenting without cause.They don't deserve the business of friendly and well natured people.I would recommend finding any place else to stay. From what I've since seen, most other places are much cleaner with better views for only a few more dollars per night.

Hotel staff were always helpful and courteous and went out of their way to help me recover from surgery. I want to Especially thank Kehau in reception and Marilyn in Housekeeping. Thank you for all that you did for us.

Several weeks ago I was in Waikiki and was flying to Canada but we were returning to Waikiki to break up mb our trip before returning home to Australia. I stumbled upon Way2Gohawaii and I booked this shuttle on our return to the island. We were met at the airport by Bo you arranged for a shuttle to take us to the Premium Outlet centre at Waikele whilst taking our bags to our hotel. 4 hours later we were met by the shuttle bus which took us, and our shopping, to our hotel. As we were flying home the next day we were met again by the shuttle and taken to the airport. It cost US $156 for 3 people which was an absolute bargain and was totally hassle free. This is an excellent service which I would thoroughly recommend to anyone. The drivers were friendly and very professional and took out all the stress. Thanks way2Go for this great service.

My husband had surgery on Oahu and our insurance company housed us overnight at the Airport Honolulu Hotel. It was a nice place, very clean, quiet, beautifully decorated and functional. It is close to Daniel K. Inouye Airport, so convenient for travelers. I would not recommend it for a vacation stay, but for business or a situation like ours, it was perfect. The desk staff and bell desk staff are wonderfully friendly and accommodating. The room was large and well-appointed. The lack of an onsite breakfast is a drawback, but I would definitely stay there again!

Janice was the nicest maid and did an exceptional job. She worked around our cats which was very helpful. It reduced a lot of stress they already had from being in the hotel. Even when we had a do not disturb she would greet us and ask if we needed anything additional.

The hotel staff were very friendly, nice welcoming smiles. The room was quite clean. The internet was a bit sluggish. The price is a bit high, but that is Hawaii for you. It was also inconvenient as far as eating places.We used the shuttle service to the airport. The driver was very nice and friendly.Cleaning service was provided by Gigi and she did a great job.

Best thing - room is basic but clean and functionalWorst things - service, service, service and inflexibilityDefinitely OVERPRICED for quality of productRoom comes with microwave and fridge. When we asked to borrow china to heat up food, restaurant said that "policy is against allowing that". We offered to bring the plates back when done and for them to take a $ deposit. Still no. When we said Styrofoam containers are not good for microwaving, they just said there was nothing they could do... no paper plates either.Restaurant food was mediocre and only open for dinner... Does not make sense for an airport hotel when no breakfast is served. Have to take a bus to sister property and only breakfast buffet.One of the worst experience we have had recently. DO NOT STAY unless you have to.

High price for an average room with noisy aircon. However this was anticipated going in. Low review score is due to lack of facilities you'd assume from an airport hotel - no overnight luggage storage allowed, and no room service/takeout food available (restaurant was also booked out so had to wander the streets). Shuttle service worked well.

from calling in to tala for the shuttle service and travelling here for the past 20 years the girls in the front counter, susie, anne, kehau, rose, ashley, etc. forgive me if i forget your name but, they are so caring and always going out of their way to assist my husband & I due to not having reservations and my husband is a wheelchair patient. i love these ladies they treat us like family. thank you so much for your kindness, respect and aloha.the housekeeping staff is just as sweet and supportive with the needs of my husband. my husband has several illnesses and they always greet me with a smile and always ask if there is anything they can do for us. this trip nieda on the 4th floor is our housekeeper, service with a smile and the concern she always show to my husband and I. thank you airport honolulu hotel for your aloha and support. we love you all...
user_name:
Moana P
Pago Pago, American Samoa

review_body: Absolutely wonderful hotel, the staff at the front desk are great, very helpful especially if you are military. Anytime we’ve a question they have always given us a direct answer. Very nice front lounge, food is great as well. House keeping is probably the best i’ve seen, everyone has a smile on there face when they see you if your lucky to have Nieda has your house keeper then your in luck. Nieda made us feel right at home had us laughing the whole time while she was cleaning and the room came out spectacular and so quick as well. Great place to stay.

Abraham the maintenance man and Geraldine the house keeper are amazing they really set the standard and the hotel is lucky to have them on their team they were so accommodating .Abraham helped us get into a room when our room key wasn't working and he also helped to install a new AC because that wasn't working and he was super fast in and out very helpful very polite kind man just a great guy all around. Geraldine she came every day at the time that we had requested very polite super sweet very professional greeted my kids everyday everything was super clean and her attention to detail is on another level best housekeeper by far super sweet lady.

The room services in my opinion is "excellence and superb" service, courteous and polite, friendly atmosphere. The rooms I'd stayed in the past 10 years were very cleaned and sanitized. Furthermore, very secured.

The Airport Honolulu Hotel is a perfect place to stay for my family visits. And don't let the "Airport" in the name scare you. No airplane noise at all! The staff are friendly and helpful and personable and make you feel welcome. Nieda in Housekeeping was exceptional in her work. She did the best with my room in terms of cleanliness and neatness. Love that lady!

I cannot stress how wonderful this hotel and they are definitely military friendly. I had the pleasure of staying here for 2 weeks and everyone was amazing. From the gentleman who helped us with our luggage upon arrival, the front desk staff and restaurant personnel. I'd like to give a special shoutout to our housekeeper, Clarita, who kept our room so clean! Between the daily vacuuming, making sure the bathtub was scrubbed and cleaned, I just couldn't believe how hard everyone worked to make sure we were well taken care of. We've never been to Hawaii before and are moving here so they made an outstanding impression on us. I will say, I'm going to hold other Hotels to this standard but I don't think they can do as well.

this hotel is super cute and the location is perfect! Our family is staying here for my husbands work. The room is very nice with a lot of space and well equipped. Our housekeeper JOSIE is amazing, she is super kind and always smiling. She makes our stay even more better! She is very friendly and my daughter loves her so much! She keeps our room super clean, she works very hard and have such a positive vibes! She makes me feel home! She always makes sure we have everything we need! Mahalo Josie for your professionalism.

Our housekeeper for the 2 months we were staying at Airport Honolulu Hotel was AMAZING! Nieda is fast, and also a hard worker. Nieda did the BEST cleaning during our stay, and also made sure we stayed equipped with our necessities. She is great at her job.

Clean & comfortable enough, does the job adequately for a transit stopover at airport. Helpful staff, airport shuttle is a great service. Willoughby restaurant good. Other eating places nearby just a short walk away.

We stayed here for about 3 weeks for a PCS move. This hotel is very accommodating for TLA. We got free parking and $10 meal vouchers for each family member to use for breakfast at their sister property (with free shuttle) or dinner at the hotel restaurant Willoughby's. Breakfast was typical continental breakfast and Willoughby's had a decent dinner selection, you just have to pay the difference that the vouchers didn't cover. We had excellent servers at Willoughby's, especially Emil. He was quick, attentive, and very pleasant. The rooms are mediocre, but the beds were comfy and had lots of pillows. We had a boxer with us and her kennel took up a lot of space, so we were very cramped together in the room. (I recently found out it was one of the smallest rooms in the hotel.) There were 2 dog park areas, one was big and open with 2 pet bag stations, and the other was small and gated with 1 pet bag station. Both had seating available and were nice. The pool was BEAUTIFUL and the highlight of our stay. We went almost everyday. It was 8 feet deep, so the cannonballs were epic! We had an amazing housekeeper, Marites. She was always so polite, cheerful, and knew us by name. One day she came in on us while we were eating dragonfruit. She asked what day we were leaving so that way she could bring us a cutting from her dragonfruit plant from home so we could have a plant at our new house. She went above and beyond to make sure we were comfortable during our stay, The staff at Airport Honolulu Hotel made our 3 week stay a pleasant one all things considered.

My wife had a medical appointment on Oahu and the hospital made reservations for us at this hotel. It's in a good location near the airport if that works for your stay but that's about it. There was ample parking on the side and rear areas of the hotel which you have to pay for. It's not free or included in your stay. We checked in about 4pm and we're assigned to a room on the second floor of this four floor older hotel. As we entered the room we noticed a stale odor. It was a typical room nothing special but comfortable. We got settled then went to get dinner. Upon our return the lot was full with cars also double parked. The hotel was having some type of special event with many non guest attending. So much for pay parking. Fortunately we found a car leaving and took their spot. Trying to go the sleep we had to deal with a noisy AC. Then at about 3am a fire alarm went off with an audio telling everyone to evacuate. Five minutes later we were notified it was a false alarm. As we're trying to go back to sleep, at about 4am the alarm goes off again. No audio, no nothing. So much for a restful sleep. We decided to stay up as we had to leave for the hospital at 5am. Then while attempting to leave the parking lot my validated parking ticket doesn't work to let us out. Calling the front desk they say they don't have any record of us paying for parking. I tell them about my stamped validated parking ticket and paid parking receipt with the reference number and they still can't find any information. They finally let us out and I return two hours later. The hotel front desk apologized for their error and I go back to my room to get a couple hours sleep to make up for the rest I lost. As I'm tying to doze off, a kid in the next room starts pounding the walls and yelling. Don't make the same mistake we did in staying here even for free!

Amazing housekeeper. I stayed at this hotel for two weeks and Rofel took care of all my needs and more! My room was cleaned every day with no complaints. Sometimes it's the little things that matter, and Rofel did a great job at fulfilling them.

We had two separate rooms with two queen beds in each. Both rooms were clean, but furnished completely differently. One had furinture that looked newer and high end, while the other had dated, lower quality furniture. Both rooms had a small fridge and microwave. Truly, the furniture makes a difference as the newer furniture made a better impression as well as offered more storage in the large dresser and bigger table. Both rooms had tile floors. The outdoor was beautiful, but pretty deep for the little kids. The restaurant had large portions and very tasty food. It opened up to the lush pool area. The staff was very courteous, friendly, and accommodating. The coin operated laundry on the second and third floors had two washers and dryers (on each floor, although one washer was broken during our visit) was convenient, but expensive. There was a dog walking area next to the gated parking lot. The dog area was small, but had green grass and receptacles with bags for dog waste. The hotel offers shuttles to the airport. A McDonald's and Starbucks are within walking distance as well as a few car rental companies. The coffee provided in the room was wonderful, but the cups provided didn't have lids. I am so happy we found this hotel and would recommend it to any family looking for a clean place to stay with their pet. This is a GREAT choice for anyone looking for a pet friendly hotel in the area!!!

My husband and I have stayed at the airport honolulu hotel for a month now and have had a wonderful stay. Les was very approachable and friendly. He was the first person I contacted months before we arrived to Hawaii. The front desk and the bell boys are very friendly and pay so much attention to detail. When we arrived, my husband and I were extremely tired from the 8+ hr flight to Hawaii and the bell boys picked our luggage up and took it to our rooms- no questions asked- and even settled my luggage down so it wasn't in our way. The ladies downstairs have been very helpful and call me when I have received mail. I LOVE our servers downstairs in the restaurant. They know my husband and I by name and love their service. Seriously in love with the service we have received here. They are making my stay wonderful. My housekeeping ladies are the best. Thank you Nieda and Josefa! Josefa was cleaning our room at the beginning of our stay and shes very friendly. Nieda, thank you so much for being very friendly and having a conversation with me each time you come into my room. I appreciate the fact that after day 1 of us meeting you remembered my name and my situation. Thank you for being very attentive to detail and remembering every small detail of my family. Service like this makes PCS season very calming. As stressful as this move was, the people who we have come in contact with have made this a pleasant stay. Thank you guys so much and I look forward to coming back again when we are ready to leave the island.

Although the parking is very difficult here the staff is very friendly and we have an amazing housekeeping service. Annabella has gone way above expectations for our daily services, the accommodations have been suitable for my family’s transitional needs and it’s pet friendly. Thank you Airport Honolulu Hotel and thank you Annabella

We especially enjoy how close it is from the airport. We arrive inter island cross the street and call for the shuttle. The drivers come within 15 to 20 minutes only because their shuttle runs every 1/2 hour dropping people inter island and mainland flight terminals. We are greeted with respect.The bus stops outside the hotel under the bypass and make travel fun to Pearlridge , Ala Moana or even Waikiki or out in the country.It is also convenient to the Aloha Stadium when there are concerts we enjoy or weekend swap meets.The staff has excellent Aloha Spirit. It can be trying at times when its busy but they always recognize a guest in a polite manner where everyone feels important. From the drivers to the porters, to the front desk staff, to back end office, to housekeeping, to gift shop, restaurant staff, management and lastly to security, all are trained with hospitality and respect for race creed or color.Come experience.PS Do not expect a luxury hotel. It is a hotel based with an aura of Hawaiian Hospitality. Simple yet elegant in its own right!We shall return!Mahalo Airport Honolulu Hotel

Every Hotel has its cool things and things that can be improved upon... was it perfect... well, nothing is.... But we have stayed here 1 month & 8 days and the length of time we had to stay...what makes this a top place to stay is an-“exceptional staff”- (Everyone) made this place such a wonderful place to stay. Everyone is so happy and smiling all very accommodating!!! I even have favorites that have wiggled their way into our hearts were so sweet to my girls and I. First Les Nishimura, he made the PCSing and transitioning easy for us and without his program for the military this would have not been so easy. He is just what a Family needs. The front desk (there are many but....) these 5 ladies are the one who helped me mostly and were so very lovely. Ren, JC, Rose, Suzie & Kahau.... anytime, anything they were right there and so fun chatting with. The servers at the restaurants: All nice but Donna & Stella stood out & were just amazing; its gets so overwhelming in the restaurant sometimes but no matter under pressure they were so smiling and kind. And what is better to find a fun energetic lady like Sweetly (yes! that is her name maybe because she is so sweet) in the hotel store... she finds a way to make small conversation to let you know your -welcomed- even if you are just getting a bottled water. My girls just adored her. They even started calling some of the ladies Auntie/Tita. The ladies that serviced my room, so hard working & they take direction so well, the greet you genuinely really want to know how you are doing... and do it all with gentleness: Janice, Geraldine & Merly just just top notch and I think I will miss them the most since I interacted with them the most. The Bell/shuttle bus guys too: Alex even tried to speak to me in my own language and Jolo. Such Cool, cool guys!Rustin the houseman, even if he sees you, no matter what he is doing he always stop to ask if you need anything. Very hard working. Even the maintenance guys especially the young funny Kevin, I didn’t even know if he was old enough to even work but definitely know what he is doing!!! Last but not least one of the managers Ashley!!! I have never seen such calmness in chaos during heavy PCS season but she really talks to you on a level that is very reassuring and is very kind and empathic towards a situations that are tough for a family. Such an excellent staff to all that crossed our family’s path I thank you all! It felt like family Pictured below is is 2 of ladies that serviced my room (Janice & Geraldin)

This is not a resort hotel. The staff is friendly and accommodating. Parking can be hard to find at times but the staff will free up additional space to help as necessary. The restaurant only serves dinner, but good food and huge portions can be breakfast the following morning. Or you can walk to sister hotel (best western) for their breakfast buffet. Military meal vouchers for the restaurant make the whole stay worthwhile, especially when receiving TLA. And very pet friendly. Josie is our normal outstanding housekeeper! Always greets us by name and always has a smile! Sweetlyn always takes the time to ask how we slate doing any time we visit the gift shop which has a lot a key items. One of the kids broke out in hives and we found children’s Benadryl, awesome! Not to mention cereal, milk and anything else you might need or want. Front desk staff are always friendly and do their best to help and make great recommendations on anything you may want to know, the best beaches, luaus, restaurants etc. my only complaint would be the laundry facility, because it’s pet friendly, your clothes may come out smelling like someone else’s dog....

Recently renovated. Clean and quiet. Free parking (big deal). Airport shuttle and free shuttle to sister hotels for dinner. Serve breakfast only; no lunch or dinner. Was traveling with medical destination 15 minutes away; all went well with taxi service. Airport under reconstruction so plan extra time getting in and out with a rental car.

Clean hotel, decent prices and everyone from the staff was always helpful with any issues I had. I stayed in one of the king bed rooms and the experience was great, clean bathroom, AC worked great and best of all no bugs! The housekeeper, Rofel did a great job at keeping the room clean & providing fresh sheets & towels everyday!

Our stay at the Airport Honolulu hotel has been great! The restaurant and pool have been wonderful, but most of all, our housekeeper Josie has made our stay fabulous. She is so sweet and incredibly fast and efficient. Thank you so much!!!

I have been at AHH since May and I am impressed with the hospitality, particularly room keeping by Josie. She has made our stay very welcoming and completely as if we were in our own home. Exceptional

PCSing off island and staying here has been smooth, free parking, dinner vouchers, and waived pet fees. The NEX and Target are very close, as well as IHOP, Dunkin Donuts, McDonalds and others within walking distance. Since we have pretty much moved in, seeing Josie each day as our housekeeper has been reassuring. She is always pleasant and willing to do as little or as much as we would like each day. Highly recommend for those PCSing on or off the island!

The popcorn ceilings with cracks, the mold, or the smell - all of these were not as bad as waking up for my next flight to discover the room itself was not as clean as it could be. We were only there for less than 12 hours between flights, so I cannot speak to the amenities. However, the shuttle is slow, the rooms are below average hotel standards for clean, and the place needs updated. Was it unclean enough to leave - no, the bathrooms and sheets were clean, except for the mold in the bathroom. However, this is not a place that I would visit twice.

If you’re like me then you have suddenly relocated your family thousands of miles away from what you used to call home, and you have been placed on a giant rock in the middle of the Pacific Ocean—all because the military has said you GOT TO GO! It’s not exactly the easiest transition. However, the friendly staff at the Airport Honolulu has made this transition less painful and actually quite enjoyable. The front desk, maintenance, and the housekeeping have all been extremely nice and helpful. More specifically, I’d like to give a big mahalo to Auntie Josie (housekeeping). She always makes sure our room is tidied up and refreshed for the rest of the day. On top of that, she just SOO nice. Always great to see her! I’d also like to give a shoutout to Kevin with maintenance for replacing our A/C unit super fast. Thank you, to the staff at the Airport Honolulu. Y’all are real onez.

It’s a great place to stay , close to Waikiki rooms are cleaned everyday and my housekeeper Lorna is Amazing and the sweetest . The food is also pretty good . The waiters are all so nice and friendly .

Miss Teresita from the Honolulu airport hotel housekeeping was as accomadating and nice as every housekeeper should be. My wife and I really commend her effort as she is very meticulous when it comes to how a room should look after a good cleaning.

Great, professional staff! Incredible, friendly house keeper named Josie, who made sure our room was perfect. Would recommend hotel to friends. Especially if you have a dog. Vouchers were used in hotel restaurant for great food at reasonable prices.

My visit has been amazing Loma the house cleaning lady was so nice and did everything super quick.she was good for conversation also the hotel is really nice the pool isn’t to warm but isn’t cold all the staff is amazing

coming home is always amazing but when your staying at the honolulu airport hotel its a plus all the staff treats you like family and you feel the aloha right away. the ladies on the 3rd floor housekeeping pili wing (brenda and anna) really made my stay amazing. warm and happy greetings every morning a few giggles as we part for the day, come back to a clean and comfy room. I also got sick on my stay but Sweetlyn from the gift shop got me all fixed up with meds and fluids for a couple of days. i truly felt spoiled and the feeling of the aloha spirit is clearly there. what a amazing staff all the crew (aunties) really made my stay the best and to feel like family is so wonderful ,beyond wonderful my regular spot where they make you feel like family. thank you for my amazing vacation get away mostly thank you to the aunties that took care of me while being at home. THIS IS ALOHA !!!

My husband & I have been here two weeks now. This hotel is very military friendly & accommodates the best they can to your needs. Also is pet friendly. Our house keeper Josie did a wonderful job keeping our room clean & always said hello in the hallway! She even remembered our names which is something you don’t see where we are from.

Convenient to the airport with shuttles to and from the airport. Ample parking with tight security to dicourage the homeless population. Not much to see or visit within walking distance, restaurants are very limited in the area. There is one restaurant within the hotel but was only open for dinner. Rooms were a little datedbut clean. This hotel was ideal for a business trip with very little distractions. It is on the bus linewhich comes quite often throughout the day Pearl Habour and the Amazon Memorial are about 10 minutes by bus also PearlRidge shopping Center is about 30 to 45 minutes by bus depending on the traffic. As I mentioned before this hotel was ideal for a business trip but as a vacation distination or romantic rendezvous I would go elsewhere.

Although outdated the customer service has been exceptional. From the front desk personnel, to the parking attendant and housekeeping staff (Merly), thank you for your accommodation and kind service. Would stay here again just for that reason.

I want to commend the Nancy for doing an outstanding job in cleaning our room as well as making sure my family was cared for as it pertains to the room. The staff was very professional & was willing to help in any way possible. I would highly recommend this hotel to my family & friends.

Very good location especially for a first time visitor. The shuttle service from Airport to Hotel was good, but had to wait a little .The Bell Boy especially Mr. Alex was exceptional.The reception staff was helpful in guiding me to places of interest in Honolulu.

Stayed here for 62 days and loved how I was treated. Staff are friendly—thanks to our housekeeper Mila and the front desk for providing a clean and friendly atmosphere. Food was great at a reasonable price. Security is friendly and helpful.

We have had a great experience here at the Airport Honolulu Hotel in Hawaii, as we await housing on the Marine Corps base. We have had an exceptional housekeeper, named Josie, who makes us feel so appreciated and we love her smile and knowing us by name!! She is excellent!! Thank you! Dawn R Hrynewych

We are currently staying here while we are house hunting on the island. We have been incredibly impressed by the quality of service and fantastic attention that the staff has towards their guests. The When we first arrived, our A/C unit had gone out in the middle of the night. We called the front desk who promptly sent maintenance to our room. Kevin arrived with great conversation and recommendations on the island while he replaced our A/C. It took less than an hour to fix! Josie, the housekeeper for our room, has gone above and beyond to ensure we are comfortable and that our room is clean and at it’s highest quality. She always greets us with a smile or says hi to us in passing. And she always uses our first names! We look forward to seeing Josie everyday! She has made our stay outstanding. The hotel is in walking distance to a handful of restaurants/take out (i.e. Starbucks, McDonalds, Dunkin Donuts, L&L, Big Kahuna’s Pizza, iHop, Sushi and more). It is always near the airport and they offer a free shuttle to and from for all guests. We would definitely recommend this hotel!

Having moved here from Europe we wasn’t sure what to expect , but we’ve been here for a month now and thanks to Les who helped us from day one while being in Europe book two rooms forOur big family and for having such an amazing heart ♥️ to the hotel staff at the front desk, the amazing cook and waiters at the restaurant here and especially to our housekeeper Merly who is the BEST and makes us feel at home even while waiting on a home to call our own. Thank you! Thank you! You guys are the best!!!

Teresita, our housekeeper, was by far our favorite part about our stay at the hotel! Each day she comes in with a smile :) I enjoyed talking to her each day & she always made sure we had everything we needed! Couldn’t ask for anyone better :)

The rooms are very comfortable and nice while we stayed here. The staff were really friendly and helpful and very informative. If I come to Hawaii again I will definitely stay here again. I would recommend staying here.

This is an average to below average 2 star property. Old and in need of updating. Small tv, poor mattress and old carpeting. I would not stay here again. Only good things were no amenities fee, airport shuttle and pool.

My family and I moved here on military orders and we highly recommend this hotel. There's alot of amenities available like onsite pool, gym, mini indoor shop and a dining restaurant. We have been residing here for about a month now due to house hunting. The staff is extremely friendly and Housekeeping is phenomenal, our Housekeeper is Josie and let me tell you she makes you feel right at home. She always makes sure that your room stays clean with her on time daily room service and always ask if there's anything else that you may need. She makes sure that you're satisfied during your stay here. Like I said we've been here for about a month now and I highly recommend this hotel and their services.

I stayed at this hotel for a couple of weeks with my husband and three children. I can not recommend enough! The whole staff is more than great. But we became really close to our housekeeper “Josie”, from the beginning she treated us like family, always happy and always asking if we needed anything else!!! Will Definitely come back!!! Thank you to the complete staff for making our stay enjoyable!!!-Maria

It's definitely hard moving from the east coast to Oahu alone. As soon as I checked into the hotel I was greeted kindly, patiently and I felt like ohana. Not only have the front desk staff been awesome but the bellman are always eager to help and have not only helped me with my luggage but also my groceries (which is awesome). The restaurant has amazing food; the portions are so big you can feed two people. I think the biggest impact I have had during this stay though would have to be my housekeeper Teresita. She always has a smile on her face while about and she strives to make personal connections with the people who stay in the hotel. She is super kind and i always have a great time talking to her. She has also been flexible to my schedule which is important to me. Overall I am so happy that I booked my stay here. Thank you guys so much for my enjoyable experience!

The hotel was so nice! Everyone treated us great, the food was good too. Housekeeping was wonderful to us. Teresita was very friendly and kept our room tidy when we were away from the hotel. I would recommend this hotel to anyone who visits. It’s right next to the airport and they do have a shuttle service to and from the airport.

Josie was our keeper. She’s very hospitable and does an excellent job maintaining our room. She’s always greeting us no matter the time of the day and ensures that we are accommodated. She made our stay at Airport Honolulu Hotel enjoyable. Thank you Josie

The hotels staff were nice.The hotel Was extremely loud being located in the centre of three highway overpasses.Rooms were not particularly clean. The breakfast and the shuttle were handy.Overall well below my expectations

My husband and I spent one night here. I don't love the location, but the free shuttle is convenient. The rooms are clean and the staff is friendly. I wouldn't vacation here, but it was a great place to stay while in town for business.

My daughters and I stayed here because of the easy access to the airport and the free shuttle, but we ended up enjoying the nice pool and great food at the restaurant. The staff is very friendly and everything was clean and well kept. I would definitely recommend this hotel!

We needed a hotel close to the airport, as our flight out was at 7am. We booked this one as it had a free airport shuttle. It runs 24/7 on the hour and half hour. The room was spacious and bigger than we had down in Waikiki. We also had a fridge and microwave. Plus they had a nice pool and a restaurant on site. Definitely a great value for the location.

lots of smiles from everyone. Lorna our room attendant and the other ladies, when she was off, were all very sweet and did a great job making sure our room was clean and that we had everything we needed every day! Gym was good but needs a new treadmill and needs an eliptical or stair climber

We recently stayed at the Airport Honolulu Hotel, primarily just because it provided airport shuttle for our early flight next morning. We were so happily surprised they also had very helpful staff, especially Matt and Rose! The restaurant downstairs had the best food. Everything about our stay was just right.

We used this hotel as a stop over and as much as the bed was reasonably comfortable we found the room was very very basic. The check in was very slow and not at all friendly. Its really like living in an industrial area. We ate in the restaurant and the staff were friendly there. It is not open for breakfast so you have to find other options or catch a shuttle to their sister hotel. Yes you can duck out the back gate and find food within 10 minutes but its not a pleasant walk. There is a shop in the hotel where you can buy food and other things but the man working in there was really not interested in what he was doing. Didnt even acknowledge us even when we said hello. They do offer a airport shuttle which we used. Would not choose to stay here again.

Our shuttle driver, Alex, was super friendly, prompt, reliable and unbelievably helpful.We were in the process of moving to Hawaii from Massachusetts, and we were traveling with 7 very large suitcases, a huge cat carrier with my kitty, and numerous carry on bags. Alex helped us quite a few times to load and unload all of our stuff, going to and from the hotel.He helped us with a beautiful smile, laughter, and enthusiasm, and, after a very long, exhausting journey, it was truly a pleasure to meet him.The hotel staff was also very friendly. The room was nice and clean, and the pool was fantastic.Thank you all!

The accommodation is comfortable and the staff are friendly. The disappointing thing is they no longer have breakfast options. The small convenience store opens at 7am but the fridge was empty of breakfast items. We have stayed at this hotel on many occasions, on layovers in Honolulu, and have enjoyed breakfast in the restaurant. A shame this is no longer available.

Our group of 3 couples stayed 1 night before our Pride Of America cruise. The hotel is just ok for a pre-cruise stay but I wouldn’t recommend it for any longer. It’s clean but only basic amenities, no breakfast on site but they offer free shuttle to another hotel just down the street. It’s very close to the airport and adjacent to a busy highway. We didn’t hear any aircraft noise but heard cars and motorcycle noise from the street. They provided free shuttle from the airport which arrived quickly after we contacted them after we picked up our luggage. They have a fairly decent restaurant that is only open for dinner after 5pm. Hotel staff was friendly.

We chose this hotel because of its proximity to the airport, free airport shuttle and free wifi. It was perfect for our overnight stay. We had a nice room with a king size bed. The air conditioning worked really well and there was a coffee maker, with a pair of coffee sachets and an in room fridge. The decor could be described as "old style Hawaiian". We had dinner at Willoughby's the on site restaurant. You can also use the shuttle to go to their sister hotels restaurant. The service at the restaurant was friendly and fast. We had a table in the lannai over looking the pool. Our meals were huge so you may wish to share. I dont know if they serve breakfast as we had an early flight and left around 6.00am. We used the hotel airport shuttle on two occasions. Both times the drivers were polite and helpful. This was a great choice of hotel for an overnight stay close to the airport. It was reasonably priced for the location at approx Aud $200.

It was adequate. We walked from the airport, but I wouldn't advise it. It was close and we didn't have much time so it worked out OK. There was no breakfast or restaurant! They did have a coffee drink machine in the lobby in the morning. The people working there were nice. There were a lot of dogs staying there. Have low expectations and it will be fine.

We first stayed at this hotel in 1969 on our first Hawaii vacation. It was a Holiday Inn at that time. What an exciting time we had. They had a nice restaurant and Bar/Lounge and even had a Pineapple Juice dispenser in the lobby. Fast forward 50 years....we had a late arrival (10:50 PM) in to Honolulu for a cruise the next day. Since they had an airport shuttle, we decided to stay there. This hotel has not kept up. They no longer have a restaurant or Lounge. The rooms have been updated, but still remained me of the way they looked in 1969. The bathrooms are small.On a positive note...the hotel was just a short Uber ride to the cruise port where we boarded our ship.

It is conveniently located for an overnight stay. We flew in from Maui in the evening and flew out in the morning. It was just a place to sleep.Comfortable bed. Good shower.We didn’t bother with breakfast.

We stayed here overnight to make our transition to the airport easier. And that it was!! The service staff fantastic & friendly, able to drop our luggage off at 930am (just happens to be when we got there by uber from Cruise terminal) to be stored in secure room until our room was available after 2pm. Gave us information how to get the bus around so we could enjoy Honolulu & head over to Waikiki for the day. Bed was so soft I could of slept for days!! Clean room, fantastic facilities. Would definitely use them again!!

We only had one night there in between flights but were very disappointed in most ways. Service pick up was good and efficient to get us there but although the room was clean and adequate it was dated and lacking a jug to make a cup of tea, they only provided plastic disposable cups, the bed was very uncomfortable, nothing in the fridge like fresh milk, only powdered milk, fridge didn't seem to work anyway! The hotel is massive and you have to walk for ages to get to your room despite having two lifts! And it was expensive to stay here! There must be somewhere better to stay close to the airport. Overall a negative Honolulu experience... such a pity.

I had a 12hr overlay at honolulu, so this hotel was a smart choice for having a good sleep and a real shower.PROS: location - it is 5min from airport, email the hotel in advance so they can provide instructions on pick up areas (all near baggage claims). The room was clean, basic but just ok for some hours stay. Some rooms are in front of the highway so if you need to sleep during day hours make sure you dont get these rooms (its ok for nighttime).There is a convenient store next to the lobby with snacks and personal amenities for purchase ( closes at 10pm)CONS: this hotel does not provide breakfast at all (or any restaurant meal), there are other hotels nearby which include it though. So I had to go earlier to the airport to eat something.

Convenient shuttle service, and located near HNL. Hotel was clean, staff was friendly, and my brief overnight stay was good. I had a layover prior to flying to Maui, and this was the best choice (no cab, Uber, rental car needed). There are restaurants within walking distance. I did not eat dinner at the hotel restaurant due to being tired, but the front desk staff recommended nearby breakfast spots, since hotel restaurant wasn't open in the morning.

Good location shuttle is super handy. Good clean rooms, spacious and quiet and friendly staff, nice big pool.Had dinner in the restaurant and that was also great, the the staff there too were amazing.A great gift store, that also sells food and some other supplies this place really has it all covered, its clean and friendly, could not ask for anything more than this place. Will defiantly be back!

If you have to use TLA and can't get lodging on base I highly recommend Airport Honolulu. It's about a 5-10 minute drive to JBPHH and don't hit too much traffic. The process to get a room in the hotel is very quick and the staff are very nice and friendly. The meal voucher I think is good for $10 off of your meal at the hotel but at least for me the food wasn't as good as I had hoped. Decent portions though so you get what you pay for. Noise level was pretty good. I didn't hear anybody from adjacent rooms unless they were in the hallways. Room service was excellent. All in all I think you can't beat the location and service this hotel provides if you're military. I can't vouch for civilian side but like I said before the service is great here.

The airport hotel is a short distance from the Honolulu airport. The onsite restaurant opens 5pm daily for dinner. Breakfast and lunch are available at their sister hotel the Best Western which is a short distance down the street. Both airports offer free shuttles to the airport.

This hotel is handy where it is located and if you are heading out to the islands of Hawaii. The room was comfortable and quiet although the bed wasn’t made very well and came apart. There is complimentary tea and coffee in the mornings and a free airport shuttle.

If you're traveling to Oahu to visit on vacation for any length of time, this may not be the place. But, as a layover location, close to the airport, it was perfect. Nice pool, restaurant was good and we walked to several stores and restaurants close by.The staff was super friendly, from the shuttle drivers to the gift shop woman, and we enjoyed talking to a lot of them! We only stayed overnight to catch an international flight, and it was a pleasant, relaxing stop to recharge. The morning we left, Alex and Rene were really awesome and helped us out with anything we needed. Will use this place for future layovers for sure.

There are not many options for lodging adjacent to the Honolulu Airport. When we have a next day departure we stay at the Airport Honolulu Hotel. This is a 3 star property but gets 4 stars for location. Free shuttle 3 minutes from the terminal. Friendly staff, on site poolside restaurant and convenience store/gift shop. Rooms are basic but clean and neat and you can’t beat the price.

Used this hotel twice before and after our Honolulu vacation. Easy access from airport and car rental locations, clean, very nice staff, restaurant on site (average), clean rooms. Will definitely when we visit Honolulu. Mahalo!

Stayed 1 night on a layover flight in this older hotel. It's in a great location for the airport. The room was clean and comfortable, the A/C worked well. At $185 per night, this is an overpriced hotel for the older condition and lack of amenities here, so I will probably not stay here again.There is nowhere to shop or eat close by, but they have a free shuttle to a nearby restaurant. Be sure you use the extra latch to lock your hotel room door. A maintenance man tried to get in my room, while I was in it, using his master key. Had I not had the latch on the door, he would have been able to enter. Really scary! Alex at the front desk was very apologetic.

We had great service the entire stay. Our room attendant Nieda made us feel at home, she went over and beyond to make sure we were comfortable. The rest of the staff were friendly and always willing to help should we need it.The pool was great too. I’d love to come back again!

Conveniently located near the airport, this hotel provides 24 h shuttle, and the service works very well. Older property, but well maintained, the room was clean and well equipped. Staff was very nice. Would stay again before an early flight, or after arriving late.

Moved to Oahu on Military Orders, had to pick from a select list of hotels that were “TLA” approved. Was restricted due to the time of year I was coming and due to the fact that I had a dog coming with me.Found this hotel, and contacted them... ended up being a perfect choice, despite being close to an overpass/highway and the airport. Noise was sometimes pretty loud due to the location, but never the less didn’t effect us with sleeping or relaxing in the hotel. Staff is extremely nice and very helpful and understanding. I would say they cater to a large majority of Military folks coming and going so they are quite knowledgeable with anything that may come up. They also have a “Military Liaison” that will help you out with any questions too. If you are Military in orders and are staying here through TLA, they will provide you and very member of your family with a $10 Meal Voucher for their restaurant every single day you stay there. And the restaurant is actually quite amazing for a hotel restaurant, so don’t turn it down... They wave the parking fee and pet fee for military as well. So that helps a lot! Will definitely recommend to Military families moving to the island!

Stayed here for 1 night, visited for work. Check in took a little time but there were several people from the same work meeting that I attended who also checked in at the same time. Was able to get zero balance receipt right away. I stayed at their other building. Quite a walk but i didn’t mind. Staff were excellent and very helpful and friendly. Nice thick walls and perfect for making sure you are well rested.

Aloha,I had called this morning regarding a credit card charge. Dujon Curtis assisted me with this issue. He made my call very seamless and he was also very kind and eager to resolve my issue. My company has employees that come and stay here periodically throughout the year. I am VERY BIG on customer service it could make your experience GREAT or HORRIBLE. In this case it was GREAT!!! Again Much Mahalo Dujon for your patience and kindness it is greatly appreciated!!!

This airport, like most others, in under "improvement construction," but still is very pleasant with its nice areas past security...especially the garden below C concourse. It's easy to enjoy this airport when you need to get their early for your flight.

I’m assuming if you’re staying here’s it’s because you have an early flight out of HNL. Then this is a great option. Less than 5 mins by shuttle to terminal. Rooms are clean and basic. Bed is surprisingly comfortable. Slept great and I’m a light sleeper! Lol. Definitely a good option for airport

We are a Military family who got medical orders to Trippler. Command had messed up our reservation and only had me and not the rest of my family and Honolulu airport hotel military liaison was amazingly empathetic and kind and was able to fix our situation ASAP. Josie the housekeeper was also so amazing. She cleaned our room everyday and left smelling fresh and clean it was honestly the highlight of a busy day out! She was so kind and helpful if we needed anything and such a kind soul! Enjoyed are stay at this hotel and would definitely come again! Honestly The customer service from every employee we came in contact with was down to earth and super helpful. As a military family would definitely hands down recommend getting booked here and as a civilian I would definitely recommend getting booked here. Also they are pet friendly and that’s a plus!

My son who is a disabled Veteran was placed here after having surgery at Tripler.Because the VA is inept, every thing was done at the last minute as far as a reservation, checking in and checking out. The hotel staff went above and beyond to accommodate and assist us, they were kind and friendly throughout.The hotel itself is clean and they are upgrading it, but it is a bit worn in some places. Nice pool.The noise from the freeway and idiots who are inconsiderate about their car noise were tiresome on a couple nights. Parking is tight and you pay for it. Coffee is only served in the lobby from 630 - 10, but it’s pretty good. There are several places to eat with in 5-10 minutes.

My husband and I stayed here when we moved with the military. The hotel could use some updating but it was always clean and comfortable. The staff could not have been more kind and helpful. They were extremely accommodating for military and for our dog. We enjoyed our stay and would recommend.

We arrived late after a long flight, the shuttle arrived straight away! The reception staff were friendly and efficient , even though it was way past midnight and the reception area was full of travellers and boxes. The room was neat and clean but noisy. We asked for a change of room and the very helpful staff were very accommodating. We changed from a room near the highway to one at the back of the building. Location is perfect to get to places such as Pearl Harbour memorial, Waikele factory outlets, Ross Dress for Less, Waikiki, Ala Moana centre, China town by local bus.

Stay here almost two months! Could have moved to a fancier hotel, but the service is what kept me here. These folks are amazing and will go to any lengths to help you and get to know you. This service is better than 4 and 5 star resports I have stayed at. One in particular individual who made all the difference in my stay was my housekeeper, Nieda. Two words, simply amazing!!! Every single day I was greeted and we would chat. I was here during the holidays and she went out of her way I believe to ensure I was ok during these times. She is probably the biggest reason I stayed here and didnt change hotels. It is staff like her and of course others I have net that truly made a difference in my stay. This isn't the fanciest of hotels, but it makes up for it in service for sure. I will miss the folks I have met here, but I must say kudos to the management here and what you are doing to raise the bar in hospitality services! Nieda, thank you, you are an amazing person!
