Honolulu Airport Hotel, thank you!!! Would stay here again ina heartbeat!! The way you all treat the military is above and beyond!!!

From check in receptionists, housekeeping to the complimentary drivers they are so caring & professional. My husband is a wheelchair army veteran and they always welcome us with smiles and friendship. Love always to stay at the Airport Honolulu Hotel. We have been coming here for the last 5 years and they always treat us like family. Thank you to the management & staff for always making us feel welcome!
user_name:
Moana P
Pago Pago, American Samoa

review_body: Our stay at the Airport Honolulu Hotel was a good experience overall. The room was clean with good housekeeping services. We had dinner at the hotel restaurant. The food was good with fair prices. The pool was nice and there were several chairs to accommodate many. The pool wasn't heated, which made it difficult to stay in the water for long.A few things were not to our liking. They charged us $30 for parking per day. This was not disclosed when we made our reservations. Also, breakfast is not served at this hotel, but it is at their "sister hotel" 6 blocks away. A shuttle bus is avaiable for transport. This also was not disclosed when we reserved our room online.I prefer breakfast where I am residing, but, McDonalds, Ihop, Starbucks,and Dunkin Donuts are nearby.The area is very industrial and a freeway runs right along the hotel site. If traffic noise bothers you, then this is not a place for you. Dogs are also allowed and can be a barking nuisance at times. I did hear a few planes TakingThe airport is minutes away with shuttle service, which is a plus.Overall I would rate this hotel 8 out of 10.

A little old and tired, but extremely convenient for transit stays in Honolulu. The shuttle to the airport is easy to get and the drivers super-helpful. Reception staff are sometimes helpful and sometimes not depending on who is on duty.

We stayed here two nights - Dec. 22 and Dec. 23, 2018. It was a comfortable stay. Don't expect a luxury room, but a comfortable one. The air conditioner masked out any noise from the roadway outside our room. The beds are double and since we were three in the party, we asked for an extra roll-away bed for $30 a night. The room is clean and the complimentary shuttle was great. You call from the courtesy phones from the airport and wait for the pick up. It took about 20 minutes. The ride to the hotel is very quick - about five to ten minutes. From this hotel, you can take The Bus, the local bus that takes you to Waikiki Beach or any other location on Oahu. There is a white paper that you can take from the front desk that tells you what bus to catch.

We just loved this quirky airport hotel. It’s basic in older, but beautifully maintained, it’s like a little time warp. The staff are excellent the room are clean. The shuttle is great, fantastic little shop with everything you could imagine including a huge selection of alcohol. Nice well priced restaurant by the pool. Perfect

Clean place, people are helpful, not too big. My only complaint is with Alaska Air and them not having any people there in the evening between flights. We get there early like we are told, then have to sit on hard concrete step in the heat, waiting for them to open up the place. We waited 2 hours (So much for showing up early) Then you have to stand in line to have your checked baggage scanned for agriculture items, then you can go to the desk to get your bags checked. After all that, we then have to go to security, I was pushing a wheelchair though these long lines of roped off area, back and forth with nobody in the line. We get to the security check in and have to go through all the requirements and they change their rules as you stand there. Here they tell you put everything in your bag and run it through.

A quick trip to and from the airport and easy access to Pearl Harbor. Nice staff and big rooms. The pool is small but clean. Very comfortable bed and modern interior design. Would stay there again. Enjoy.

We arrived around 2am in the morning, so it suited us to stay at an airport hotel before heading over to Waikiki the next day.The service was good and the staff quite attentive to our needs.We felt a bit mixed overall though about our stay --- we had 2 rooms, of which 1 had a very noisy (and almost unusable) air con. We'd requested a folding bed be set-up in advance and had called and emailed the hotel in advance, but this wasn't present on arrival and was very uncomfortable when provided. We were also told it would be complimentary, but this turned out to be incorrect. There was also a faint musky smell throughout the hotel.However, it was still a fairly comfortable stay for one night.

Terrible front desk service! Just horrible attitude...as if we were a bother to her. checked in 12/29-12/31 at 8;30pm. Then parking I was told if we book straight with hotel website and with poof of Kamaina that parking was free..then I was charge with $15.00 a day for parking...with the price that was paid per night, you would at least get some sort of customer service...other then that, great locations for layovers.

Room was OK. Main benefit was 24 hour airport free shuttle. No restaurant on site,but a number in walking distance. Our room faced the freeway-but the noise wan't a problem. As no restaurant on site we walked to the Best Western for a meal,but it was not something I would recommend.

My wife and I recently stayed here between flights. We arrived at the airport late, but the shuttle was there in no time. Check in was quick, even though the shuttle was full. The room looked a little dated, but was very comfortable. We must have been near a highway, the road noise was pretty loud, but was not a problem and we fell asleep quickly. We had a nice breakfast in the hotel the next morning. Would highly recommend if you need something near the airport.

We found ourselves with a day layover on our way "down under" which is a nice break in the long flight. This hotel is very close to the Honolulu airport yet the rooms are quiet. We found our room clean and very comfortable. The staff are friendly and helpful. They offer free shuttle to and from the airport 24/7 and free wifi. There is a delicious pizza place, the Big Kahuna, about a 5 minutes walk from hotel. Prices are mid-range for Honolulu but well worth a good night's sleep.

The service was excellent and the rooms were much nicer than we expected. The pool area was clean and not too crowded. The hotel is conveniently located next to the airport. Parking is expensive (ended up being more than the cost of the car) so if you need a car for just a day, we would recommend renting for a day taking it back at the end of your trip. It’s not a beachfront property and it’s not in a really convenient location (not a lot of entertainment nearby), but for a few nights stopover or a less expensive option, it’s a great choice!

Good afternoon,I stayed at your hotel, on the 14th April and it was very pleasant. I wanted to take this opportunity to thank on your staff , Ms Nani , who advised me on the weather conditions at The Big island. A place I was planning to go to, but her mother who was living there informed her of the very bad weather that was going on. That piece of advise helped me alot as I was very fortunate not to go there. Please do convey my thanks to her and do tell her I hope to visit Molokai as she advised me too :) On another note, she also helped me give my SIM card to a friend of mine who also stayed at your hotel 2 weeks later. Thank you.Yours,Ibrahim.From Singapore & Bali

After a long flight we needed some rest.....hmmmmm that did not happen! Put in a room right beside a very busy freeway and the air conditioning unit was so noisy! Otherwise it was tidy and the customer service was good.

My parents had an overnight stay on their way to San Diego. I wanted to get some important information to them regarding their next flight. I was very fortunate to speak to Misty on the phone and she was very lovely. She suggested I email her and she would print it and pass it on. She followed up with me to say she found them.Her customer service skills went above and beyond. Thank you Misty!

This hotel was completely fine for the one night we were there. Our room overlooked the highway & it did not bother us that much at all. We were exhausted after the flight from Australia & appreciated the free shuttle. Yes, it’s an old hotel but we didn’t really care about that. Our beds were comfy & the bathroom was clean. The restaurant meals were fine too.

We stayed here one night since we had an early morning flight on the next day and were just passing through to break up travel. First experience was a little poor at the airport because we watched the shuttle drive right by us and we had to wait over 20 minutes after 15 hours of travel. Hotel itself was clean and welcoming with an easy check-in and checkout. Their gift shop was great and had everything we wanted on hand. It was also a pretty decent price to stay here. All in all it was what we were expecting and it was very convenient to be so close to the airport.

#1; You are surrounded by military. Literally. The base is right by the airport AND this hotel is housing for many miltray families waiting for housing. So it's a weird vibe. We did a forced 22 hr layover in order to go to Pearl Harbor, Arizona memorial (ramp still not finished, so you go close to it in a Navy launch), the Bowfin, etc. With a 6 hr time change it was easy to be at the memorial just after it opens at 7:30 AM.Staff and restaurant were much better than "average." Food reasonable and well prepared. Would I stay there again? Yes, in order to accomplish what I mentioned and still make a 2 PM internation flight to Auckland the next day.

Be aware that the fee for parking is $30 a night. This hurts when you arrive late at night and pick up a rental car to avoid going back to the airport and picking it up in the morning. This means parking, standing in line to register your car, then returning to your car to put the receipt on the dashboard. Which would be better if they had enough staff to avoid a 15 minute line to check-in and 10 more minutes to register your car!

This hotel is better than some of the reviews indicate. Our room was large and nicely decorated as were the public spaces. The restaurant had good food and service. Proximity to the airport is a huge advantage. There was a room key mix-up and apologetic desk staff quickly resolved the issue.

My husband had to have surgery at Kaiser and Kaiser provided subsidy for this hotel for the first night. Second night -- he stayed in the hospital -- and I paid for the hotel night myself. Great kama'aina rate!!! Room was very, very clean...I check the mattresses first. Clean! Bathroom, clean! Hallway to room -- clean! Beds were very comfortable with more than ample pillows! Willoughby's Restaurant in the hotel furnished delicious breakfasts and dinners at reasonable prices! Very nice pool and pool area (altho I did not take advantage of it -- too anxious to be with hubby at the hospital). Best part? The hotel staff! Smiling, friendly, competent, accommodating!

Hotel was typical average airport hotelGood for a quick over night when catching early morning flight. Room was comfortable enough. We arrived late, so no food or room service available. Only a snack shop, so that wasn’t great.

I only had a very short stay, arrived in the evening and had to return to the airport early in the morning. Had a large double room for single use. The room and bathroom were very clean, as it has to be. Shower gel, shampoo and body lotion were available. Also hair dryer and clean white towels. TV worked perfectly, bed was very comfortable.In the in-house restaurant I ordered a dinner and was able to take it with me to my room - delicious. And it has a small shop with drinks, snacks, souvenirs, etc. The staff was very nice. Super shuttle service to the airport, free of charge.Unfortunately, as elsewhere, there was no discount for single travellers. Apart from that I was very satisfied and recommend it to others.

We were arriving all the way from Florida and just needed a place to stay for the night and crash, before moving on to a resort the next morning. We booked day-of through the hotel after they confirmed there was a free airport shuttle. Similar to other reviewer’s experiences, we waited at least 30 minutes for a shuttle and had to call twice. But I was unbothered but this and am familiar with Hawaii Time! The reason I would not return was the conditions of the rooms. They are not in pristine condition and I wouldn’t bet my life that the bedding had been washed...perhaps for a hostel, this would have been ok, but not for $170/night. It is worth about $70 max. Although they have a fantastic gift shop, for lodging I would suggest elsewhere.

I arrived shortly after midnight at the Honolulu Airport and quickly rung up the hotel to inquire on their next shuttle. The operator requested my name and itinerary and then insisted that I had NO reservations. Tired and helpless, I ask if there are any rooms for the night and that I had to catch a flight mid-day. He said the shuttle will be by to pick me up in 5 minutes. Roughly 30 minutes later the shuttle arrived and took me to the hotel 3 minutes away.I meet the front desk lady and proceed to check-in and she too tells me that I had NO reservations. Too tired to argue, I gave her all the numbers and itineraries I had to which she said I had NO reservations. I then ask to get a room for the night - really just about 6 hours. She says the hotel is SOLD OUT. Both operator and front desk person were downright RUDE. When I turned around to leave the counter, I realized I had an audience and they were all shocked - and I felt so embarrassed. I saw the shuttle bus starting up, so I ran back to catch a ride to the airport.I rung my corporate travel desk and wanted to inquire how my reservations never made it to the hotel, and to possibly send in a complaint. To my surprise the agent insisted that I had a reservation and that she was going to contact the hotel. A minute later, the agent called and said that the hotel FOUND my reservations and to return.I already resigned to the fact that I didn't have a room, so I had rented a car to catch some sleep along side some road or beach. I made my way to the hotel and when the front desk lady saw me, she apologized and provided me some room keys. She started some banter, but I was neither amused or in the mood. I mentioned that I had a vehicle and wanted to catch a few hours of sleep. She comp'd my parking ($30 value). I caught a few hours of sleep and checked out as soon as possible.I will never return to the place where I was made to feel so bad as a guest. No one should ever be made to feel that way. I checked out of the hotel as soon as possible and never looked back.How embarrassing that any hospitality staff can conduct themselves in this fashion and think it is ok. The two I had interactions with were good at raising their voices, cutting you off as you spoke and showing all of the humor your situation presented to them. Stay clear from this place. Go somewhere where you are valued. You are most welcome.

Let's be honest, there aren't many options this far west in Honolulu. I had business near the airport and this hotel fit my needs. Don't expect Waikiki or Maui comfort, you get what your pay for. The property is old and you feel it but clean. I noticed many military personnel staying in the hotel so I assumed value was a key selling point. The pool was small and empty which makes sense since the beach is pretty close. I didn't see any children so vacationing families probably weren't the target audience. The biggest gripe I had was the noise from the military partiers in the parking lot at night. You'd think playing loud music from pickup trucks late at night right outside a hotel window would be frowned upon by hotel staff. You'd be wrong.

I stayed at Airport Honolulu Hotel while visiting family. The room overall was okay but there was some mildew in the bathroom. If you take a shower in the morning, be warned there is no hot water. The front desk staff isn’t trained well. They didn’t follow check-in procedures, which cause them to complain that I never authorized my credit card. When I complained about why they didn’t do it when I checked in, they make excuses for their staff. If you don’t want bad customer service, I wouldn’t book this hotel.

Staying at this property long term while searching for local housing. I've been a fan of this hotel since the 1970s and have experienced stays here ranging from one night in length to more than nine months. The rooms here are clean and comfortable; perfect for business travelers or people on an overnight transit. The fourth floor of the hotel was recently renovated and the rooms are quite nice. I understand that the remainder of the floors are also scheduled for renovation work.If you stay, be sure to check out the hotel restaurant, Willoughbys. Outstanding food quality and service. Western "comfort" food with a good menu. Open for breakfast every day and for dinner Tuesdays through Thursdays. There are other dining options within easy walking distance.This hotel caters to the military, and the public areas can seem a bit dorm-like at times, but this is never overly noisy nor troublesome.Be aware that this hotel is a nice, local-style place away from the bustle of Waikiki, but charges ancillary fees that some Waikiki properties might be ashamed of. I am currently paying my room rate, plus a $30/night "pet friendly" fee for my Chihuahua, $15/night to park my first car, and another $30/night if I want to park my second car.Overall, a great property if you can afford the room rate and avoid most of the fees.

Arrived about 7am, easy shuttle to hotel, asked about early access to room to be told it would be another AUD $170, WTF. We had to sleep, so paid it, room was already ready so this was money for jam for them. Walked to the 2nd building - 150 metres away from lobby. Overlooked carpark/freeway, not pool. Be careful if you are booking this, suggest transit only, overpriced otherwise. Will try other Airport hotel next time.

I called the reservation line to cancel a reservation 3 weeks before the arrival date only to be told that I had reserved on a Book Early and Save rate and if I cancelled I would still be charged the full amount. Really! Calling 3 WEEKS before and I was to pay them in FULL for NOTHING! I could understand being charged a fee to cancel, but paying in full, what a rip off! I always stay at this hotel when passing through Honolulu, but no more! Very disappointing.

The best part of our stay here was the miles gained through my airlines mileage plan! Otherwise, I will be giving this hotel a big miss in future. From the nonchalant front desk staff who appeared to be doing us a great favor by checking us in, to the rundown, dated, dirty, smelly room, our overnight stay in this hotel was a huge disappointment.The one redeeming aspect was the friendly staff in the dining facilities and the plain but adequate breakfast served but....... please hold the flying cockroaches next time!

Nothing special but nice enough: free shuttle airport shuttle service (to & from). We live on an outer island and must stay over in HNL for early morning international flights. The desk clerks can sometimes be off-putting; depends on which one you get. There are some basic cafes within walking distance - Starbucks for one. If you arrive late - you will be accommodated with the shuttle but do not expect cafes to be open past 'nineish' (check for information). The hotel does have a small store where basic supplies can be purchased - a few sandwiches, drinks, beer, and wine. Take earplugs in the event they are required - it's not noisy but can be unsettling if you get a room facing toward the main drag. We've stayed here many times - it's not four star accommodation but not much to choose from around HNL airport: better than the other two choices, imo. Hope this helps.

When you arrive, don’t expect an Aloha or Hello... just a “Name !?” from the front desk employee.After that it won’t get any better ... as they seem unable to find the reservations made and confirmed on internet (Booking.com).No worries, you’ll just have to wait an hour to get a room at an overpriced rate (not the one you initially booked ... because now it’s late, you are there and have no other choice). Of course it’s not their fault, it’s Booking.com who messed up... But just call Booking.com (spend another hour) yourself, get the confirmation that they confirmed your reservation to the hotel and magically the hotel will charge you the amount for which booked in the first place.And how about the room ? Well let’s say that if you’re just staying overnight waiting for a flight, just buy a 2$ earplug and sleep directly in the lobby of the airport, it won’t be worst than this hotel’s rooms.The room is “almost” clean, but reeeaally simple and very old. You can feel any spring of the mattress, and the best is to come : walls and noise. Wait ... walls ? Really? Can you call these walls ? Not sure as you can hear even a can being opened in the room next dors (pssshhht). If you are unlucky enough, your neighbor will turn your TV on while you try to sleep... well his TV... but you won’t tell the difference as you can hear them as well from your bed.Remember the 2$ earplugs mentioned above ? Definitely bring them to the hotel if you were courageous enough to stay there after reading this.

I love the location of this hotel it is between the military base and Waikiki so accessibility is not an issue. The room was very comfortable and the A/C was super cold just how I like it!! No issues!!

Found a home for hops to or thru the islands. Clean, great welcoming staff, frequent shuttles and tasty food. Although this mainlander never got up early enough to get to breakfast. Yes, comfortable beds! Great find.

If you are looking for a hotel, which is nice and affordable and already have a rental car. This hotel can't be beat. I have stayed at this hotel more than seven times and if I am given a choice of any hotel on Oahu, I do choose this one hands down

The staff (Front desk thru Room Staff are friendly and very warm.They try to make your stay as good as they can with no problems or headaches. My door key got demagntized they re keyed it ( reprogramed ) after a quick id check. They also said if there is any other problems please call or come back. The way it was presented it was very warm and friendly. Lots of ALOHA

Having been to Oahu many times, I was actually unaware that this hotel even existed until I needed to find a place close to the airport for a 10 hour layover. Having arrived just after 3:00 a.m. on the Island Hopper from Guam, the Airport Honolulu Hotel was a godsend! The hotel shuttle picked me up within minutes of retrieving my luggage. The front desk staff was polite, professional and prepared for my late arrival. The room was clean and well stocked with coffee for the morning and all the amenities I needed. The restaurant was open until 10:00 a.m. for breakfast, allowing me a decent amount of time to sleep, have a meal, check out and get back to the airport for the continuation of my journey back to the Mainland. If I happen to have another long layover at HNL or if I have to do business in that part of Oahu in the future, I would absolutely consider staying here again. This was a terrific find and I would not hesitate to recommend it to others.

It's close, that's for sure. You could walk it if need be. Other than that it's a pretty tired place. There are two main buildings and I was in the back, which was a bit of a stroll from the lobby because of the way the doors/elevators were configured. The elevator works but slow. The food was available but mostly vending machines at night. The bed was clean not that comfortable. The aircon worked but was a bit noisy.Nothing bad about it, just have realistic expectations. On the further building, floor 3, it was pretty quiet and that's what counted.

Great location for a one night stay before leaving to fly to another island. The room was clean and comfortable. The restaurant was closed in the evening so the shuttle took us to a nearby hotel that they seemed combined with to have dinner. The restaurant was open for breakfast and had a wonderful selection to chose from. The shuttle runs to the airport every 30 minutes.

We always stay here before our early morning flight home as it’s very convenient to the airport.This time we were met by an incredibly grumpy lady at check in who was rude and unhelpful. The rooms are dated with noisy air cons but they’re always clean.The free shuttle is great for getting you to the airport.The biggest frustration for me was when housekeeping bashed on my door at 6am and woke us all up. They were delivering fresh towels (which had been requested and already delivered at 7pm the previous evening). There was no apology from the man who woke us either.

The room was big and nice. It had TV, fridge, alarm clock and coffee facilities. The beds were wide and very comfortable. The shower was very good.The hotel is clean, and provides a very good service.But the best thing is a free 24 hours shuttle to the airport.

After travelling 18 hours, you are beat.Third stay at this property. The lobby is pretty.The rooms are not modern but so clean, quiet and comfortable beds.Not shabby, just not modern. We arrive in HNL so tired, we always stay at this property to catch up on our sleep from the 6 hrs time difference and 18 hours of travelling. We get up refreshed and have a great breakfast in their restaurant. Some review mention it is a shabby property.Some reviews mention over priced. I am a very critical retired airline person. I have travelled far a wide. This property is older, not shabby. As far as price, do your homework. Join Discovery hotels reward program. It is free! Find discounts that way, bookings.com gives good rates for this property too! Believe me, this is a perfect property when you need one night close to the airport. They offer free airport shuttle which is very prompt in their pickups. They even have flat rate taxis to transfer you to Waikiki. Can't say enough good things about this property.

If you need to overnight before heading home this is the closest Hotel to the international airport. A liitle expensive for what it is but that is what you pay for convience. There is an inhouse resturant open so days, but not open the day we were there. About 400m away there is a small shopping wall with a few dine in or take out food. There is also a convience store that sells wine, beer and soft drinks. There is a complimetry shuttle bus to pick you up from the airport and return you to the airport for your flight.

We stayed there one night because we thought it was close to the airport. It's in a corporatecampus and there is nothing near it. We had to take Ubers anywhere we wanted to go. The receptionist was not very helpful when we asked for information about where to go to eat.

The staff was very nice but we had come from the emergency room at the local hospital where my husband was taken from the Airport and they had no rooms available which they did not tell us when we called and booked the room from the hospital.

I stay here when I travel to Hawaii for Medical. I travel back and forth between Hawaii and American Samoa every other month. I got nothing to complain about. Services is great and Staff are hospitable, the experience as a whole is welcoming and inviting. Ive stayed at other hotels but I like this one on my top 3.... Perfect Location, shops are all in a walking distance.....

This hotel had great staff and great service in the restaurant. The rooms were okay but very humid. Most people staying here have something to do with the military. Made me feel safer there. Close to airport and Pearl Harbor bade

We were in transit with an early flight out the following morning, but if you have the time then stay in Honolulu itself rather than here. On arrival at the airport we had to call three times for the hotel shuttle bus to pick us up. We waited 30 minutes even though it s only two blocks away. Check-in took ages even though we’d prepaid. Rooms don’t seem particularly clean and they definitely need a facelift from the stained carpets to the ageing wallpaper. But the major problem is the extremely noisy a/c and the lack of sound-proofing. We were worried about being woken by the airplanes but in fact we’re disturbed by the highway traffic! We had two rooms poolside but I can only imagine that the noise level is even worse in the exterior rooms.On a positive note, Willoughbys restaurant in the hotel, does a good fare at reasonable prices.

We are repeat guest at this hotel and will continue to stay here on future visits to Honolulu. From the front desk personnel to housekeeping staff they extended their usual warm and inviting aloha. We highly recommend this hotel to others.

Stayed here for one night based on Trip Advisor reviews. I needed to stay somewhere simple, clean, safe and close to the airport. Worked perfectly for me. Pick up was easy - I couldn’t find the phone mentioned so called the hotel direct and they sent me to the pick up location. Driver was nice and friendly, check in easy. Room bigger than expected and clean. Ubered to Pearl Harbor and downtown Waikiki...I had less than 24hrs in Honolulu and an early flight; highly recommend this hotel.

Stayed here for one night, in order to get an early morning flight. It's a 10 - 15 minute walk from the airport, although there is a shuttle bus.It is quite possibly the ugliest hotel I've ever stayed in, and the interior is in dire need of a make-over (think, faded 1980s). And it's not exactly cheap. However, service was polite and efficient, and the room was very clean and equipped with a microwave and fridge. The bed was also large and comfortable. The best thing, however, was the array of USB charging sockets mounted on the bedside table. Hallelujah! I've lost count of the number of hotels in which I've stayed and had to crawl around on the floor in order unplug the bedside light so that I can charge my phone overnight and have it next to me (so that it wakes me up).

Since the purchase of the hotel by the Outrigger chain, the price of a room has gradually risen to now approach $200 a night. For a hotel with no restaurant (the desk told me that it is easy to walk to nearby restaurants -- nice thought but I don't want to walk to nearby restaurants most of which are fast food oriented). They do have a free shuttle to and from the airport though you have to call from the airport to find out where to go to be picked up (there is a phone to call many hotels in the baggage claim area). The shuttle seems to run every half hour if there is someone going to the airport from the hotel or someone calls from the airport. The rooms are ok but nothing special. The wi-fi is ok in the lobby but not always available in all the rooms and sometimes quite slow. I gather there is a breakfast service available in the hotel though I have always had to leave too early to make use of it. Before the Outrigger took over, there was a quite nice restaurant that served breakfast, lunch and dinner and was better than average but no longer. Now that the price has increased to the point that a taxi to more distant but lower priced hotels is cheaper, I think that from here on I will forego staying at the Honolulu Airport Hotel though I have been staying there on my many stops in Honolulu over the past 30 years to transit to flights to Guam.

We needed to find a one night place to stay so we could catch a 7am flight. So we flew in from Maui and picked this place because it said it was an outrigger hotel. Well it’s not. It’s very small. Very expensive. No restaurant. The pool was good. The room was clean and do able. I will shop better next time.

We stayed for one night for a quick day trip to see pearl harbor and diamond head. Hotel is a little dated but rooms are spacious (our room had queen bed) and include refrigerator and microwave. My wife normally does not sleep well in hotels but very quite all night.

We thought from the price tag that we would end our US holiday in style at the Airport Honolulu hotel. We should have consulted Trip Advisor! We arrived at about 9pm after a long day travelling. It felt later for our body clock! As we don’t like the snacks sold on US flights we were looking forward to our evening meal. The first problem is finding out where the hotel is. There is a free shuttle but first you have to find the telephone to ring for it. The information desk was helpful, but why not have a sign, or include this information with the booking details? Then a long walk to the pick up point. When we checked in we found there was no cafe eithor in or near the hotel, only the gift shop that sold some food, mostly soft drinks, tins, or asian dehydrated snacks. We found some yoghurt and a small carton of pawpaw. It was also expensive. On reaching the room we found the coffee maker was missing the glass jug, there was a microwave but no crockery or cutlery, or a tin opener if we had bought tin soup, which we couldnt have heated as there were no dishes to put into the microwave. Reception found us one small plastic spoon. There were two polystyrene cups. The bed was average, the water was hot, but the overall impression was tired and rather grubby. This hotel is overpriced for what it offers guests.

I was traveling for work and stayed here for two nights. The service front the front desk to maid service was excellent. Very clean and quiet just the way I like it, I will be back here the next time I am staying for a while.

At the end of a fabulous round the world holiday, we had booked into the Airport Hotel in Honolulu on the night before an early morning flight back to Australia. That was our first accommodation mistake (disaster) in seven weeks of travelling. After an evening flight in from the Big Island and collecting our luggage, we called the hotel and were picked up by their shuttle around 8pm ... that was the best part of the night. Ready for a meal and a celebratory glass of wine, we headed downstairs to the restaurant, only to discover it does not open on a Monday night. Despite the late hour, we were not advised at check-in that there were no dining options at the hotel that night ... they didn't even have room service! The only option was to take a shuttle to their 'sister hotel' (Best Western) for dinner - which was closing at 9pm. This tired soul-less 'restaurant' had the ambience of a noisy bowling alley cafe, and our bland tasteless meals were adorned with near cold vegetables. Blah! And, of course, we had to eat quickly as they were soon to close.But the worst was the absolute stench of stale cigarette smell that permeated the room, and especially the bathroom. Running the noisy airconditioner didn't seem to make any difference to the smell. We rang reception to complain about 11pm, as it seemed to be getting worse, and were advised that someone would come up to check. Instead, they called back a little later and offered to move us to a room in another tower, but we declined as we were in bed and had to be at the airport very early in the morning. All in all, a terribly disappointing end to a glorious holiday. Let's just hope we can explunge the experience at this hotel from our memory banks!

We enjoyed our stay at this hotel. The room was clean, smelling fresh, and maids were super nice. Front desk was very helpful and welcoming. Restaurant food was awesomely tasty. Massage chairs at the lobby was a great bonus for relaxation. Will definitely return.

Old hotel, good A/C, wifi and TV is good. , honeymoon rooms, clean. Close to base about 12 minutes. DOD $177 a night, plus another $15 for parking. Not a great neighborhood. If here for pleasure or honeymoon pick another place. Restaurant is nothing to brag about ($$). It is OK for a place to stay, and leave to go galavanting. You are captive here, and it's all about the $. There are decent places to eat within walking distance. Security seems very good at the hotel. Starbucks 400 feet out the rear security gate.

Our extended stay at the Airport Honolulu Hotel has been made all the better due to our wonderful Room Attendant NIEDA! She always has a smile and friendly attitude and has made sure that we have what we need in our room. I would also like to give a ‘shout out’ to the wonderful front desk, shuttle, and restaurant staff. They are always pleasant, even when super busy. I would love to see management do something special for all of the staff that work so hard to make things nice for people who are traveling away from home. I’ve been to a lot of hotels around the world. It’s nice to walk in to a friendly face and kind greeting. ~L~

My wife and I recently stayed 2 nights at this hotel. We selected it exclusively because of its location. It is right outside of the airport, which made it perfect for catching a very early flight and for its proximity to Pearl Harbor. We were able to catch an Uber to Pearl Harbor and be there in less than 15 minutes. The hotel had a free shuttle to and from the airport, which was helpful. As to the hotel itself, it was a very basic place with very limited food options. However, that noted, the location was very good.

The rooms are substandard. WiFi sucked. No fooding around. This place should be closed down. This is place is substandard. I do not have 200 words to say about this place. I dod not want to talk about it anymore.

Just minutes away from the airport, perfect choice for an extended layover. Clean rooms and friendly, helpful staff. Late checkout available. Shuttle service is prompt and reliable. I always use this hotel for single night stays in Hono.

I stayed at this hotel during an extended flight connection stopover. It met my needs perfectly, the airport shuttle runs every 30 minutes. Oahu Public transportation known as The Bus runs on Nimitz highway just outside the hotel. The staff are courteous and polite. There is an on-site restaurant that serves breakfast and dinner but I didn’t use the facilities so I can make no other comments. Overall it was a pleasant stay though not one I would choose coming to Oahu for vacation.

A very good airport hotel. Free 24 hour shuttle, decent clean rooms, friendly staff, good wifi. Short bus ride over to the Pearl Harbor Memorial, so really an ideal location if you have a long transit stop over.

Hi Brent, Thanks to your promote reply to cnjocelyn (my wife) regarding the incident while we stayed at your hotel. However I need to clearly stated to you that I have never been to the back kitchen. I only visited the front desk in that evening and asked for hot water, however I been told there is none, so I returned to our room straight after that. When you wrote down "You walked to back of our house and get what you needed", do you mean the place is not allowed the guests to be there? If so, do you have any sign to stop this? As a first time customer, we thought there is part of your restaurant. All of the Hotel staff are wearing uniform, so the cleaner lady do clearly aware my wife is one of the customer, also my wife did asked the lady and explained what she need is just a plate that can be used in the microwave, once again, the plate were been given by the lady. She didn't HELP HERSELF to your own items! We do totally understand you have your own policy. However, your team can always treat the customers in a much better/friendly way. We may not be important to you, but we did paid to stay at your hotel and we have opportunity to share our experience. Our stay at Airport Honolulu Hotel has polluted our fantastic trip to Hawaii, we feel extremely disappointed at the end of our trip. I hope you will find a way to improve the service that your front line staff have provided, as Military is not your only customers, also everyone else from the world who has decided to stay at the hotel as part of their holiday trip. Appreciate for your time, and we do wish your business all the best in the future.

I recently stayed at this hotel on a layover on my way to Kiritimati. The hotel was very covenient and close to the airport. The hotel and rooms were a little dated, but clean and overall pretty nice. No problems, and will stay here again in the future.

Was a hotel I booked through Expedia. It has a 24 hour free shuttle from airport. Rooms are spacious. Nice tv and refrigerator in room. We had king size bed. Free internet. This place also has a place to store luggage in the lobby. Rooms facing road are a bit noisy.

We stayed at Airport Honolulu Hotel for 1 night as we need to caught our early flight in the morning . I am so glad that we only been there for 1 night as their service has really scared me! Snobbish is the only word I can think to describe the front desk service. Not recommended for foreigners travelling with young kids. The front desk ladies was so rude when I asked to borrow a bowl/plate that we can use at Microwave to heat up the baby food. I have been told I need to buy one from the gift shop. When I finally get one borrowed from one of the cleaner lady at the kitchen, the front desk lady even yelled on me, as they reckon the cleaner doesn't work for the Hotel. However, is this my problem?? Worse customer service ever!

We arrived early afternoon, flying from Newark, NJ. We wanted a hotel that was convenient to Pearl Harbor, where we planned to visit the next day, before flying to the Big Island. The hotel is perfectly adequate, reasonably priced, for what we wanted to do with our limited time in Honolulu. The room was very clean. No noise issues whatsoever. We drove into Honolulu to eat poke at Ono Seafood which was well worth driving to from anywhere, in spite of the dreadful traffic congestion on a Friday afternoon. We also went to La Mariana Marina tiki bar for a drink before going back to the hotel but cannot recommend. If doing over I would skip that & head up to the North Shore. Our bodies were still on EDT of course so we were up very, very early next day & got coffee & food at nearby Starbucks (open @ 4:30 A) and then we drove to Diamond Head to see the sunrise and hike the trail to the top. Came back, took showers and got to Pearl Harbor so fast that we were able to move our tour reservation up from 11 to 9! This in turn permitted early arrival at the airport and we were able to switch to a much earlier flight out. We rented a car in order to accomplish this. Honolulu traffic on Saturday morning was minimal.

It's super close to the airport and they offer complimentary shuttle. Rooms are simple, but clean and there's everything you need. I didn't have any issues with noise during the night. Will stay again if I have an overnight connection in Honolulu. Plus, they can store your luggage if you plan to go to Pearl Harbor on the checkout day.

We booked this hotel to be close to the airport as we had an early flight out the next day and was told that it could take time to get through security. The hotel provides a free shuttle 24 hours a day and picks you up from the airport and drives you back to the airport. The room had two twin beds, a card-key is used, and free Wi-Fi is provided. We had a long walk from the front desk to the room. It should be noted that there is a "food court" within walking distance of the hotel, as this provides an option if you did not want to eat at the hotel restaurant, Willoughbys. At the "food court" there is a Starbucks, IHop, McDonald's, and other fast food options. The hotel is reasonably priced, clean, and served its purpose.

Conveniently located a couple blocks from Honolulu Airport and closest hotel to Joint Base Pearl Harbor Hickam. Many families on TLA stay here. Very close to NEX complex and numerous fast breakfast and lunch options a block away. Big plus for Pearl Harbor and Pearl City business travelers is not having to commute in heavy traffic from/to Waikiki and avoid crowd of tourists. Another plus was self parking. Rooms are spacious, well equipped with mini fridge and powerful A/C, and comparable to Hampton Inn or HI Express. On-site restaurant, airport shuttle, and free Wifi. I will definitely stay here for future business travel. Only reason I did not rate location as excellent is because of its proximity to busy H-1 for noise, and not a great location if tourist wanting to be closer to Waikiki. But very convenient for rest of the island.

My daughter and I stayed at the Airport Honolulu Hotel because our home was being treated for termites and we needed a hotel that would allow us to bring our 3 small dogs. I chose this property because it had decent reviews, was close to my home, had very good rates, and, again, would let me bring my dogs.My positive experience with this hotel began with my call to their reservation line. I had originally booked through hotels.com but needed to make a last minute change so I thought it best that I call in. The person I worked with, Jennifer, was phenomenal. She got me the reservation I needed, got me a better rate, and got a waiver for me to bring 3 small dogs when the property has a limit of 2 animals per room. What more could I ask for? Her service was great.When I got to the hotel I was warmly greeted. The front desk staff actually got me lower prices on some of the extras I was paying for like parking. They said they were able to do this because I had called the reservation line and recommended that I always call in rather than book online. Lehua took good care of me and got me into the room early.My room was small but tastefully decorated. I really liked that the air conditioner had been turned on prior to my arrival so that the dogs and I walked into a very comfortable room. The beds were comfortable, there were plenty of drawers to store things in, the WiFi was free and it's performance was reasonable. I liked that the in-room coffee maker used Keurig K-cups. This made it really easy to brew some coffee.I took my dogs for a walk. The hotel has a little dog park with a nice double gate system. My dogs had fun in the little park. It was a great little area for them to get some exercise. I noticed that the park was well-kept. There were bags provided for clean up and people were obviously using them and/or the staff were making sure that the area was kept clean.For dinner that night, my daughter and I decided on something quick and easy. There are many fast food options nearby including McDonalds, IHOP, Dunkin Donuts, Big Kahuna Pizza (a really great place), and others. Willoughby's, the restaurant at the hotel, was not open the night we were there but we did have great breakfasts there the next morning.Parking was plentiful so I never had a problem finding a space. Entrance and exit were via a parking card that you get upon your first entry and have validated at the front desk. The one card is good for you entire stay.The staff was friendly and helpful each time we needed to interact with them. The room was very comfortable. The food and service in the restaurant were excellent. I truly recommend this property.

Recently I spent a night at this hotel because it was paid for by insurance for a medical procedure.The pros are it was close to the airport, and not far from the hospital. Room was clean and spacious enough.The night we stayed there was dinner served in the hotel which was o.k. A choice made instead of a drive elsewhere for food.The perpetual and loud bathroom fan was a match for the irritating freeway traffic. Sleeplessness prevailed. Rooms away from that exposure would be a good choice.The front desk staff as well as the restaurant staff were accommodating, efficient and cheerful. They get the stars.

We ended up having to stay the night because of a long layover. This was the only hotel we could find that was close to the airport and offered a free shuttle service every 30 minutes. The hotel looked nice when we walked in, but once we got to the room it was pretty gross... The room needed to be dusted, there were dead roaches on the floor and every time we moved on the bed I felt we were gonna busy through it. It worked for the night and the situation we were in, but I definitely wouldn’t recommend a long stay. There is also nothing close by to eat if your hungry, there is a little grocery store inside the hotel that is convenient.

After landing in Honolulu, we stayed 2 nights at the Airport Honolulu Hotel in order to take advantage of some local tours before moving on to our main vacation on another island. Our room was nice and the price was right. The shuttle to/from the airport was very convenient (note, though, that the van lists many hotels on the side so be on the lookout while you wait at the shuttle pick-up spot).The hotel swimming pool closed at 6pm so we didn't get a chance to use it (way too early for overnight guests!). There's a small restaurant on site that serves breakfast but we skipped that, buying something instead from the hotel store that opens early. A small shopping area one block away has a Starbucks, a pizza restaurant, ice cream, and other places for a quick snack. Our room had a small refrigerator.This hotel is practically adjacent to the airport and is within walking distance to many car rental companies, making it perfect for our needs. The area feels industrial and the main road is busy but there are sidewalks for walking.

As we arrived late at night, the hotel filled its mission - a place to sleep close to the airport with free shuttle service. The receiption was warm and enjoyable. The room rather average with a good bed, noisy a/c, odd furniture choices and placement, decent bathroom.Would we stay here again, most likely if we were not staying longer in Honolulu. This is not a hotel for vacations, just a place to sleep to go on to somewhere else. Though the price does seem a bit steep for what is provided.

This hotel is very close to the airport and offers a shuttle service to the terminal every 30 minutes, so it’s a convenient choice for those who stay in HNL just over night. The property is a bit run down with a very old and noisy air condition and heating system. The rooms are equipped with basic amenities. To my surprise, there was also a microwave, though I think that the money would have better been spent on a modern air con or new furnitures. The bed is ok with a good mattress, but very soft pillows and just a thin blanket. I didn’t sleep well, but that may also be related to my jet lag. A big plus is the staff, which were all friendly and efficient. Given the lack of competition, this hotel is a choice for those who need to stay close to the airport. But there are clearly some improvements and upgrades to be done.

Room was clean and comfortable- staff saw I was in a wheelchair and offered a handicapped accessible room. Our only complaint is that my husband was extremely uncomfortable unloading our car at night. There were scary looking people in the parking lot. Not sure if they were guests smoking or perhaps there’s another reason why they were hanging around.

We stayed her on our way to New Zealand. The shuttle is free and comfortable, but the hotel is in an industrial park. If you don't want to eat at the onsite restaurant, it is a $20 Uber ride (each way) to a decent restaurant. The room was OK, think Motel 5. The courtyard area was under construction (January 2018). The workmen were considerate to stop jack hammering when we walked by. One night is OK, but no longer than that..

Around a five minute (free) shuttle bus ride from the airport, this hotel is ideally located if you need a night to recover from some flying before your next flight. We stayed in a room with 2 x double beds with 2 adults and 2 children.I personally think the beds are a little small, would have preferred 2 x queens, but this option wasn't available. The hotel is quiet, we didn't experience any issue with noise. We arrived from Australia at 6am and although we weren't meant to check-in until around 3pm, the hotel staff called me at 12pm to say our room was available which was a nice touch.There's some free fast food type restaurants within walking distance. We went to iHop for breakfast and went to the sister hotel (free shuttle bus ride) for dinner. Can't remember what it was called, but the food was nice.The front desk service can be a little slow during busy periods, as quite often there is only one person serving customers. But no real complaints. The room was clean and tidy.Thumbs up for a good overnight stay.

If you plan to stay here due to convenient location next to airport as we did, Don't do it! I don't write bad reviews but this was so bad I had to. And they had a card on the table in room asking to write a review on TripAdvisor. So here I am. I couldn't even sleep this place was so gross. Outdated. Smells. Rude front desk staff. Just don't stay here. I would rather have slept in a tent in the parking lot or in the airport. Obviously this is the closest hotel to airport and we had a very early flight to finish off our great stay in Hawaii. But This hotel kind of spoiled the end of the trip. It is really bad. I go into hotels a lot for my work responding to 911 calls and this is on my list of the worst hotels I've ever been in. The cleaning lady was super friendly and frankly I think she is doing the best she can with what she has to work with. But this place really should be condemned. I don't think it is healthy or safe to stay. They also have notices about problems with theft. They were replacing a broken window in hallway.
user_name:
luke m
Metro Minneapolis-Saint Paul, Minnesota

review_body: After long flight, we decided to stay at the nearest hotel from the airport as we didn’t wish to be in a long cue to check in or stuck in the highway to the hotel.This was a very good decision to ease tired bodies and adjust jet lag.This hotel was just a few minutes away from the airport. Just needed to walk long to the pick up area but once we hopped in the bus, no time to the hotel.No line at the lobby- quick process to check in, but our room was a different wing, needed to walk the long corridor to drag suitcase.The room was decent - bed, TV, bathroom, desk, pot ... minimum requirements were arranged.No restaurant was operated and nearest one was the neighbor hotel, 5 min walk; that was very inconvenient. Kiosk was luckily open - we got yogurt and milk. Better bring something from the airport stores.I didn’t see the swimming pool but that’s no big deal.From this hotel to the city central, we needed to use Uber (taxi is alternative option).For one night, it’s good enough.
user_name:
nyay
New York City, New York

review_body: I was in search of a reasonably priced hotel for an unexpected business trip to Oahu when I found this place. High end luxury? No. However, the lobby and registration area exceeded expectations, my room was spotless and comfortable (with a bit of a nostalgic 1960’s feel) and every employee I encountered was incredibly helpful and friendly. The restaurant was fine — not high end gourmet, but perfectly adequate for my purposes. My only disappointment was with the fitness center — it is in need of a serious update. But that aside, I give this hotel four stars because it delivers on it’s promise of value, comfort and location.

Hotel is a block from terminal.Nice rooms ,seems like its a nice resting spot for active military and veterans retireres Has very nice selection of cable channels on a lcd tv.Could have more selection and quantity of knuerig coffeeIn rooms.Beds are comfortable,USB strip for recharging phones and media devices is a nice touch.Pool is great and restaurant next to it is nice.Housekeeping forgot to make our adjoining rooms one out of five days but did after I brought it to the front desk attention while we were there and an older lady employee at reception desk,will not name her but rest of staff know who she is ,had a bad attitude toward my request to add a day extension to one of our rooms and to extend our parking.Other then that hotel is within walking distance to a McDonald's,Dunkin Donuts,and Ihop.

This hotel is nice enough.Friendly staff..Beds harder older perhaps.Alittle street noise as interstate close.Retaurant closed alot.But some in walking distance..Pool closes early which wa a disapointment.No extra coffee..Never had that befoew..Just convenient to the airport..

This hotel is brilliant for an early flight. They provide a free and very quick shuttle to/from the airport; the room was clean and comfortable. The hotel provides free , reliable wi-fi which is important to us, there is also a desktop computer with a printer in the lobby. The on-site shop is great for last minute souvenirs. We didn't get to use the pool, but it looked good.

Stayed one night en route to final destination. Chose this hotel due to proximity to airport. Should have taken the shuttle because Google maps was not up to the challenge of all the one-way streets, 'no U-turn' intersections and construction lane closures. Not fun to deal with after a long flight. Room was clean but obviously not renovated recently. Did encounter one cockroach, a nice big one, but didn't give us any problems. Pay for parking. No problems with street/airport noise.
user_name:
somewhereoutthere129
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: At morning time, 6:36am, we checked out, there was no shuttle, one way shuttle/half hour, we called Uber for 10 dollars to airport. The heaters had terrible smell like something burned. And another thing was good.

We stop here overnight to break air flights from Australia to mainland USA. Friendly staff and helpful. Rooms decor and hotel are older but very comfortable and only 10minutes shuttle or taxi to the airport. The shuttle is free and runs every 30 minutes. We will stay here again when on layovers.

Just a quick night's stay before a cruise. Staff was friendly and helpful and room was clean, but woke up to a huge cockroach on the wall of our first floor room which we killed and flushed, but shortly thereafter there was a baby cockroach on the lid of a pill bottle as we picked it up. We called the desk and they offered to change our room right away but we were checking out anyway. Another couple in our party had a room on the 4th floor and didn't notice any critters. We live in cold climate and don't have a lot of cockroaches, so maybe this wouldn't people from those climates, but I wouldn't go back there and wouldn't risk a first floor room in a tropical climate again.

We spent one night here on our way to Maui. They do have a shuttle service from the airport, but the directions I received for how to contact the shuttle weren’t quite right- courtesy phones were outside where cabs pick up. The staff was courteous but check in was slow. The room was nice and clean. The WiFi was unsecured and didn’t work. I would stay here again because of its location but a working WiFi would be nice.

We are a military family who came to Hawaii with five, yes five, pets. We had a home rented when we arrived and our pets were boarded at the airport for a few days upon our arrival, so we didn't need any hotel pet services when we arrived. (We stayed one night at AHH upon our arrival to Oahu.) But upon leaving Hawaii to go back to the mainland, we were in need of a hotel that would accommodate us and our five pets. We knew AHH was pet friendly but we didn't realize just HOW pet friendly they were! We have one very large dog, a medium sized dog, and three cats. The hotel has a "pet wing", which is a relief because most (maybe all, not sure) of the people on this wing have pets. So I don't have to be worried that the people here are being disturbed by my ever-barking Great Pyrenees (though we didn't just let her bark to her heart's content). They also have two "dog park" areas, one which is completely fenced in with a double gate. Huge sigh of relief! They both have plastic bags and trash cans for you to pick up after your dogs and dispose of the waste. Also, there is no carpeting in the rooms which is a huge relief for guests with multiple animals! The only downfall for pet owners is that the hotel is VERY near (literally just a few steps) to a very busy highway and if your pet gets loose, he could end up on that highway very quickly and, he's very unlikely to survive the experience.Aside from our pet situation, we had a couple of other issues that arose over the nine days we were at AHH and the hotel went out of their way to help us correct the issues that we caused ourselves. The atmosphere here is very friendly and accommodating and is a great choice for military coming in and out of the island. Would it be ideal for vacationers? Not really because it's in a very unattractive part of town with absolutely no view of anything desirable. Because of the undesirable location (it is, however, walking distance to the airport), the price is probably decent (the Army paid for our accommodations, so I don't even know the nightly rate), so for that (the lower rates, if indeed, they are low for the area), some vacationers might be interested in staying here. Finally, one thing that really floored me is that my husband made the reservation on his own ahead of time, but when we arrived, the front desk said we should have gone through their military liaison. So she canceled our reservations and rebooked them through the military liaison and, by doing that, we ended up with TWO ADJOINING rooms, instead of just one room! Now, this did make us go over our daily allowance from the military and we lost our meal vouchers because of it, but having that extra space with two teenage boys and five pets was a Godsend and was well worth the extra price and loss of meal vouchers. (There are plenty of restaurants around the hotel anyway...within walking distance...for lower-cost eating.)I'm very happy with the AHH. Very happy. In Hawaii, we've been taken advantage of so many times by local companies and it was a breath of fresh air to be treated with the care and kindness we would desire from any company. Thank you AHH! We are very impressed with you! I gave the hotel four stars instead of five only because the hotel is not in the most desirable location, which, of course, you guys can't really control, but vacationers will want to know about that. And also because that highway is so close and it made me very nervous. (We have a couple of escape artist pets.) Please don't take the four stars personally, we were very thankful for you and all your care and courtesy! Your customer service was ten stars!

The Airport Hotel was our choice to avoid an even earlier start to catch an 8.30am flight. The shuttle runs every 30 minutes and sure beats being caught in peak hour traffic on the Highway.Ask for a double bed as they are in the rooms on the quiet side of the hotel - the side not facing the Nimitz Hwy.Staff were friendly and helpful and the room clean.We were told that meals were not available but could be obtained by taking the shuttle to a nearby sister hotel. We weren't told there were takeaways a couple of hundred yards away - but out of sight!

My wife and I had a layover after our vacation on Kauai. Since our flight back to the mainland was five hours after returning from Kauai; I decided to get a hotel and relax. I checked out the hotels close to the airport and decided to stay at “Airport Honolulu Hotel” rather than sitting at the airport for five hours and not get any rest... The hotel is NOT a 4 Star Hotel, but the staff were friendly and the facilities were clean. Both my wife and I got some much needed rest and the hotel was within a five minute walk to McDonald’s and other restaurants. Great place to go between long layovers...

We stayed here for one night, after landing at Honolulu late in the evening. The desk staff were extremely pleasant and accommodating, and our room was on the second floor, looking out over palm trees. The room is basic - very comfortable beds with good quality linen, a dresser, TV and microwave and a fridge. The washroom is all enclosed, and toiletries were plentiful. A coffee maker sits on the microwave, and it could have been emptied/dried more thoroughly by housekeeping (this is written by someone who cleaned hotel rooms many many years ago). Otherwise housekeeping was of a high standard.The room was quiet (not sure which direction it faced - the highway?) which is great! The hallways were clean and well kept, and, breakfast the next morning at Willoughby's was excellent. The restaurant faces the pool area, open to the weather (beautiful) and the server was very accommodating and efficient. The sweet coconut syrup that is served with the pancakes - fantastic!!!This is a pleasant, basic hotel that serves its clients well, in the areas of service and hospitality.

Stayed here for one night before my flight back from Honolulu in the morning. The hotel is nice enough and has everything you need. Very convenient for the airport and has a reliable and regular shuttle that is complimentary (other than a small tip for the driver of course). I found the staff in the hotel to be extremely friendly and helpful. We had a bit of a mix up with my rate as I had booked on one website then cancelled and re-booked on another and I ended up being charged twice because of a computer error which caused me a bit of stress at first, but they got to the bottom of it and sorted it out for me. I didn't eat at the restaurant as I decided to order pizza instead but it looked nice enough. There's also a bus stop a few meters away where you can take a bus to Waikiki for $2.50. Recommend this hotel if you need somewhere close to the airport.

Comfortable rooms, friendly Staff, great Location and provides Shuttle for transportation to and from the Airport. Convenience store has snacks and drinks galore. Great restaurant. Enjoyed our stay. Parking did not cost as much as other hotels.

Staff were very friendly and they provide frequent free shuttle service to and from the airport. Comfortable beds and nice small store to pick up necessities and souvenirs.Stayed there at beginning and end our our 2 week Hawaii vacation.

I book into this property about six times a year for business. It mainly caters to the military and military contractors who are waiting for a flight somewhere. The airport is within walking distance I found as I returned my rental and simply walked five minutes back to the hotel on a nice tree-lined street.Rooms are twin double beds and I ask for the rear building which have sliding door onto a "balcony" but still I like fresh air, even though the highway noise is pretty loud.I would have normally given this a 3 star but the extra is for the friendly staff, the free shuttle, the great little store on site, and the location to airport. Warning, there are NO good restaurants within walking distance.

We stayed for one night due to convenience to the airport/airport rentals, etc. The hotel shuttle is efficient. The front desk staff working the PM of December 7th were very friendly and helpful as were other staff we encountered in the hallways. Thank you to all of them. We stayed in the "annex" which appears to be undergoing some painting, upkeep, etc. The rooms are clean but worn. The beds feel a bit older and are not terribly comfortable. Some of the lamps did not work. The pool hours are 9 to 7 which are not very logical for travelers. We tried to use the pool but it was too cold--maybe good for a hot afternoon. Recommend this hotel only for a short stay due to friendly staff and convenience to the airport.

I had a 3 night stay at the HNL airport hotel. The staff were extremely rude, with a tinge of complacency. My problems began at the front desk where I waited for employee to finish a personal conversation for about 3 mins until they were able to assist me..Hotel charges $15 per day for hotel parking. Hotel also charges $50 for parking ticket. Regardless of you've paid for $15 parking ticket, if you lose $50 ticket you're required to pay before they will release your car. I was held against my will for about 5 hrs for losing parking ticket, The Honolulu Police department was called im to resolve situation. I was booked at hotel by the Veterans Affairs office for follow up appointment post surgery. This Hotel Service was horrible and will be filing complaint with Veterans affairs office for other hotel options as I will not accept staying here again.

We stayed at this hotel just for one night as we had just arrived from Fiji rather late.The shuttle service they provide is quick and reliable you just need to know how to use the telephones in the airport we had to ask a local couple to help. The hotel is clean and the rooms are quiet big with a fridge a coffee machine.The bathroom is fine with a good hot shower.Would stay again if needed a stopover.

The staff were very helpful friendly and helpful. The room was a little tired, but adequate.Great convenient location for a stopover. Shuttle service runs 24 hours a dayThe manager very kindly arranged to accept a small parcel for me from Texas which would not have reached the UK in time.

We stayed at the hotel on the last 2 days of our holiday in Hawaii, in the preference of near the airport, and the hotel has 24h shuttle service.We arrived from Maui in the morning around 9am., and we could not check-in, but we could leave our luggages at the concierge. The staff at front desk and concierge were nice. So we went to Pearl Harbor Memorial, and when we came back to the hotel at noon, was still to early for check-in, but the lady at front desk gave us early check in, and we had our room with connecting door. Nice.It was Saturday, and in the evening there was a party at function room at L1, the music was loud, and we felt it was noisy, even though we stayed at L4. Luckily, the party was over around 10pm, so we still have good rest.The window was not sound proof, so the sound of traffic at Nimitz highway was a bit noisy.The other things were good; WIFI was OK, the room were clean, AC was a bit noisy, room amenities was OK. Bus stop was in front of the hotel at Nimitz highway, taxi stand was in front of the hotel. Shuttle service was good, every 30'; we used it.

My wife and I and another couple stayed here twice on the way to and back from Australia. We picked this hotel because of the free airport shuttle service and its proximity to the airport. We were not disappointed. They are very nice, easy to work with and the hotel is clean. They allowed us to check in our rooms at 10 AM which was greatly appreciated. Everybody we encountered were very friendly and welcoming.

Clean, neat, adequate lodgings.Good airport shuttle service. Friendly staffMeal options provided... ala carte daily breakfastShuttle to shared dinner locationsWalking distance for other meal choicesNice pool area

If you're looking for a hotel close to the airport for the night with shuttle service back to the airport this place is fine. There's coffee in the room, a microwave, a swimming pool, and breakfast and that should take care of your needs. There's a bus service right outside the door if you wanted to go downtown too.

The staff has a great ALOHA sprit ! They always are friendly and caring for your needs and wants. They treat you like family which is rare in this age.I usually stay there to stay away from the crowds and traffic of Waikiki.

Nothing special but it is just a nice cheap place to stay for a late flight in. The rooms are very old and not well maintained which make it seem dirty. The free shuttle to and from the airport is a great bonus. The staff is also very friendly and super helpful.

I booked a king size bed for a one night stay online 48 hours before my flight. Having flown from Florida to Hawaii I was looking forward to the kingsize bed and a good nights sleep before another long flight on to Sydney. On arrival I was told there were no kingsize beds available. I then said I had a reservation for a room with a king size bed. She said there was no guarantee of getting what you reserve and pay for. I was given a room with two double beds. VERY DISAPPOINTED.

We stayed in the hotel to overnight the flight from Maui to Europe. The shuttle was easy to get, and we could go to the room even though we arrived at hotel before noon.The bus station for Waikiki (or other different locations in town) is close and buses easy to get, but take into account that it may take quite some time to get there as the Honolulu traffic is quite dense. We got the room in 4th floor and it was really very noisy due to the traffic noise from the nearby busy highway.

We stayed here overnight after a cruise, and before catching a flight the next morning. The overnight stay was very comfortable, the rooms are neat and clean. Nothing special, but exactly what you would want when on a budget and not wanting a dive. We ate at the restaurant onsite (Willoughby's, see separate review) and found the entire experience very satisfying. They have a shuttle every half hour to the airport, which is very close by (but not so close the noise is bothersome). We left two hours before our flight and it only took about 5 minutes to get there. We had plenty of time to get through security, do a little last minute shopping and relax at the gate before boarding. It is not the Ritz, but I would stay there again in a heartbeat.

Property is deceptive. Outward appearance is older construction, in an industrial neighborhood. Inside: beautiful, modern, very evident that it's an Outrigger property. Room was fine, with all the expected amenities; staff and shuttle driver were great. A stone's-throw from airport. Parking is (understandably) pricey, so we checked in, got settled, and then decided to return our rental car (walking distance), and just relax at the hotel. Good decision. Would definitely stay here again.

We live on an outer island, but had to stay on Oahu while my husband had surgery. I chose the Honolulu Airport Hotel because I had stayed there before, it is extremely convenient and I feel safe there. While it is an older facility, the service was 5 star. From the front desk clerks to the very kind shuttle driver, everyone was wonderful, friendly and helpful. They are replacing one of the elevators, so upgrading. The lobby is large, and beautiful. I had a king size bed, and slept peacefully after spending LONG hours at the hospital. And while the furniture isn't new, it was very clean!  I will definitely come back and stay here again! Airport shuttle leaves every half hour. Lot of military use this hotel, so I felt very safe! And while I didn't use the pool, I could see it from my room, and the deep blue water looked so inviting & refreshing! Thank you Honolulu Ohana, your former name fit you too! A very peaceful, restful stay.

We had an early flight back to Sydney so decided to return the hire car (Dollar) the night before the flight and then stay here and catch the shuttle. Within walking distance from Dollar so was able to drop bags at the hotel and then return the car and then walk back. Rooms are nothing special. Beds are ok, bathroom is ok...not in the same league as hotels in Waikiki or Aulani where we stayed but did the job. The shuttle comes every 1/2 hour. Check in and out was quick and no issues and shuttle was on time

It's close to the airport and that's about it Cost a fortune to get anywhere from this place unless you happen to be wanting to get to Pearl Harbor which is one place you do not want to missStaff are friendly and courtious and that a plusHotel is in need of some T.L.C

Hey, you get what you pay for. The hotel is a tad old and a bit tired but you can't beat it's convenient location just around the corner from the airport. Has shuttle to the airport every 30 minutes. Servers in the restaurant were very friendly and professional.

My sister was having surgery on Oahu (we live on Maui), so I accompanied her and booked 2 nights at this hotel to take a break from sleeping in a chair at the hospital and hopefully get some good sleep. Silly me.I arrived on a Friday, thinking I'd find something for dinner, then settle in and sleeeep - HOWEVER..... the on site restaurant is not open on Fridays. What??There may be fast food places nearby, but when I ventured out, all I saw were freeways, so eventually I settled for something from a vending machine.Ok, I'll live.My next discovery was that this hotel is actually surrounded by freeway, so the traffic noise is loud and constant, as is the a/c - if you plan to sleep here, I highly recommend earplugs.The next morning, the restaurant was open for breakfast, and it was fine, although my hash browns tasted like they'd been cooked in old grease - y'know, I had been sleeping in hospital chairs and eating from vending machines, so I wasn't too picky at that point.So. The hotel and the room itself seemed basically clean, although everything is a bit dated and somewhat musty.The bed was comfortable.The front desk employees were quite friendly, efficient, and accommodating when I cancelled my second night.And...that's about all I can say. There is nothing awful about it besides the noise factor, but nothing awesome, either.

We had to be at the airport by 4:40am, so decided to stay here rather than pay for an extra night at the Waikiki Resort. It was simple but served us well, with a great pool area and poolside restaurant, and plenty of eating places within walking distance. The free shuttle and having the airport only minutes away was fantastic.

This was our second visit to break the long flight home so we knew what to expect the 2nd time round. No it's not a flash hotel, but it's clean and the rooms are spacious and it has a great little shop with all the essentials (apart from plain milk for us fussy tea drinkers). We find it easier to grab a cab than try to find the shuttle from the airport but have used the shuttle in the morning on our return flights home and find it great - friendly and helpful drivers and runs on time & only 5 mins to the airport. The front desk staff are very friendly and efficient considering they have to deal with hot and tired and sometimes grumpy customers. We asked for a room that didn't overlook the freeway that was quiet and not any bright lights outside this time and got that. Yes, you do have to bring earplugs because the aircon is noisy but you definitely need it as it is so hot. We thought it was bargain at $180 a night compared to what you pay in Waikiki. Definitely not a hotel to choose for a holiday but perfect for an overnight stay to work in with flights.
