Greeted by really nice people at the front desk who got us checked in right away, the hotel is a bit retro but their restaurant and store is really handy.Wendys is about 1.6 miles away but Mcdonalds and Dunkin Donuts is alot closer.Pool was really nice and the shuttle driver was amazingly hospitable.For people who are complaining about the shuttle service, they state it leaves ON the hour EVERY hour and some on the half hour so if you had an issue with the service it was exactly that, YOUR issue and poor time management skills.Shuttle service was super handy.I think the amazing touch was the VET's and serving military who were staying due to a convention or something who were really nice and it was especially nice to see people we can thank for their service who give us the luxury of living in the west where it is safe and war free.Also seeing the pets made us extremely happy considering we left our own dogs at home and were missing them dearly!We had an awesome stay

We needed a one night stay before we flew out, so this was a great location for that, and has the free airport shuttle. Lobby is nice upon arrival, but "nice" stopped there. We stayed in the next building over from the main one and it was kind of dreary and noisy. The a/c could barely keep up and the room was really humid. It was good to have a microwave and mini fridge though. If you're looking for scenic, this isn't it...it's right on the highway. There's also nowhere to walk to for food, but there is a restaurant on site. Like I said, close to airport, but for these prices and such a dated hotel, I'd stay elsewhere and just wake up earlier to get to airport next time. Staff also wasn't that welcoming, which could add to my general opinion.

We'll be looking to stay somewhere else next time, for a few reasons:- Poorly organised pickups, with no communication between the hotel and driver. We were left behind, and saw others nearly forgotten. Not great with kids.- Extremely loud AC. We turned ours off and could still hear the neighbour's unit.- Poor bedding. Tiny beds, and odd little square pillows.

My husband and I booked a room here the night before our international flight due to depart at 9am the next morning.Unfortunately our flight got cancelled just as we had checked in - the hotel staff were extremely helpful in extending our stay for a further 2 nights in the same room so we didn't have to pack up our stuff, check out and check back in.The free shuttle too and from the airport is very convenient and runs every 1/2 hour - a tip to the driver is expected and there is a sign in the busy saying so.Free wifi is fast and doesn't drop out and there are a good range of tv channels available.The rooms are clean with a large bed and small bar fridge.There is a pool however this was not in operation during our stay - there was a free shuttle available to their sister hotel so you can use their pool however we didn't do this.The restaurant is satisfactory- we enjoyed breakfast the Most and had Stella look after us both days. She is an absolute joy, so friendly and obliging! You are able to get take out as well so one night I sent my husband down to collect some Dinner as I didn't feel like getting dressed.There are a few take aways a short walk - McDonald's, Hawaiian BBQ, Starbucks, Jamba Juice, convenience store etc.We also caught the bus into Waikiki which was easy enough though the trip was 45 minutes plus.We didn't have a car however everyone says there is a cost for parking.Overall a good place to stay if you have an early flight but not much to do entertainment wise unless you have a car or are happy to sit on the bus.

Rooms clean, tidy but noisy. Can hear families in the next room and the freeway noise can be heard from certain rooms. I wouldn't go out onto the tiny balcony, paint is peeling and flaking off. The pool area is nice and offers towels - well done. The restaurant is very basic. Offers no cocktails and the food was average even though the serving size was huge. Such a waste of food. Reception staff polite. Has a mini shop on site which is handy. The on site laundry is very expensive. The hotel shuttle bus is a huge bonus as it's only a 5 min trip to the airport. The hotel is pet friendly which I'm not a fan of.

I really enjoyed my stay here. The staff was excellent and very friendly. Ms. Norma was in charge of my room. She was simply amazing. Anything I needed she provided it for me. She definitely made my stay here a wonderful experience. I would definitely stay here again.

The Excellent Hospitality at this hotel was a much appreciated welcome to the island of Oahu. Ohana means Family. Feel the Aloha! It’s minutes away from Honolulu International Airport! Best Western the sister hotel is a few walking blocks down some of your dinners will be served here. Enjoy the weather and try the Spam.Pros: Perfectly located near post office, other food spots, and Nimitz Highway (while driving around when you find Nimitz you know you aren’t 'lost' anymore as a new arrival to the island). Great people work at this hotel. Great variety of food for breakfast and dinner, relaxing pool area, safe parking lot, quiet rooms with Wi-Fi and comfortable beds, refrigerator/microwave in rooms, and small coffee maker. Small snack store and laundry located inside the hotel. Not so much a Con but….: Everything in the hotel is a little expensive but worth it for the convenient location. Get out and sight see for some free family events. Traffic increases @ 2pm, so plan accordingly.If you are military pick up your food vouchers daily at the hotel. If possible use 1 voucher for breakfast and the other for dinner. The food is very good and colorful but also…not so cheap. Supplement your meals by shopping at 1 of the local commissaries/Costco until you find housing. The laundry room is very small but perfect in a pinch. The fitness room is very small but hey, you can go outside THIS IS HAWAII. A few blocks down is a beautiful ocean.

This is not a resort hotel (thus, no resort fee!), and there is nothing special about it. It is perfect for an overnight stay if you have a morning flight. It does not look like much from the outside and seems rather dismal in the inside hallways. However, the room was very clean, comfortable and the AC and wifi worked great. There is no sense paying for a Waikiki hotel and its resort fee (and traffic) if you are looking for an overnight stay. I would not want to stay here more than a day though. Did not like the $30 parking fee, a little high for the quality of the hotel. Very convenient to Pearl Harbor. We got there at 6 AM for a tour before our 11 AM flight. Hotel location made this available. Rental car return is literally right down the street Staff very friendly and no problems while there.

The hotel was very nice and clean. The staff was also very nice. They have a free shuttle to and from the airport and the hotel is very convenient. It is also only a short ride to Magic Island, Pearl Harbor and Waikiki Beach. Staying here before a flight is a good idea so that you don't have to deal with traffic.

I think it was overpriced....we actually only stayed for less than 8 hours!When we arrived, there was a long line (and this was at 10:30 pm!)The front desk representative was very nice and helpful.Parking was terrible, had to squeeze into the last available stall.When we finally got to our room, it smelled musty...we found out the reason, the carpet was soaking wet!!!! Called the operator, who was helpful and apologetic, told us to come get a new key. 2nd front desk rep wasn't so helpful, or apologetic!Got to the 2nd room (which ended up being at the very very very far end of the hall) and we were more satisfied.Sorry, don't think I'd stay there again

Very nice & friendly staff, great location, kid & pet friendly, they respect your privacy, shuttle is great. i plan on staying here again.. it is not beach front or anything but it's in a great location for everything. I like to enjoy the whole island not just Waikiki and Honolulu area so i really like this hotel because i can jump on the highway and go where ever!!

My husband was transferred to Honolulu, HI, with his new job. We needed a "practical" hotel while we were searching for a home to lease. This hotel was priced well, located close to H-1, & offered necessary amenities. Our room was spacious to accommodate my husband, adult son & me PLUS our large pieces of luggage. We were there an entire week. Front desk staff is very efficient; housekeeping very attentive. Hotel was recommended by the American Airlines concierge and we are pleased we took her up on the information.

Stayed here on business for two nights. Checkin was slow, and the process of getting into/out of parking was annoying. Further, though they have a large, mostly unused parking lot, parking is $15/day. My room came with a fridge and coffee maker. Although right on top of the airport, the room was very quiet. The one problem with this place is that it is not close to anything other than the airport and the base. Probably not a good tourist location given the cost per night.
user_name:
Scott_M_SubGuy
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: The front desk staff was very nice, but the shuttle driver was not, yet there was a sign that stated tips were expected. This hotel was one of those that charge extra for everything. $30/night to park you car for instance. T

My housekeeper during my stay is by far an amazing person! Her name is norma and I will always be requesting to stay in a room on her floor. The VA has me stay at this hotel every time I travel here for medical. Norma has a way of making me feel like i'm home. She is very sweet and she always makes my morning. My room was always clean and the staff are friendly.

The room was standard. Clean, comfortable, cool. The shower had decent water pressure. Staff was nice. I bought stamps in the gift shop and the machine jammed---staff was nice enough to try to help, and ultimately refunded my money.

This hotel is a transit hotel, ok for a night or two but any longer and it is not really ideal. There is very limited restaurants around, McDonald, CPK, Starbucks and L&L BBQ. If you want to eat anything other than fast food you need to catch The Bus (one hour trip) or a taxi ($35.00 each way).It is right on the freeway so traffic noise is a really issue and then you also have patron's dogs to contend with.Staff are great, pool is nice restaurant is ok.Wi-Fi drops out regularly.

We have been staying at this hotel for about two weeks while getting ready to move off island. Overall the hotel is ok it's kid friendly, staff is nice and accommodating, (Norma our housekeeper for the stay was always nice and welcoming, she always took the time to ask how our day was and how she can help with our room) Thankyou Norma! The elevator was scary it has been worked on 3-4 times since we got here. The restaurant is decent kinda expensive but is only opened half of the week for dinner so they have a sister hotel at the best western and a shuttle every half hour to take you back and forth.

We booked a 3day tour of Oahu and then the 7 day cruise that visited the other islands we wanted a stopping place before and after our trip and this suited the bill. We also were able to book an additional half day at the hotel because all flights leave at 11:30 at night and we did not know this until we were in Hawaii . This enabled us to have a place for luggage and to be comfortable . This is not luxurious but clean , comfortable and more reasonable than the RESORT HOTELS,airplane noise is an issue ,but it is convenientfor the purpose that we required.

The hotel is right near the airport and the free shuttle is easy to catch from there to the hotel and back. The friendly staff makes my stay here enjoyable. On entering the shuttle we were taken care of and when my reservations were not in from my travel agent, Kehau got us a room in a matter of minutes. Throughout our stay here Norma our room attendant, has kept our room clean, supplied fresh towels and toiletries daily. She greats us every morning when we see her and is very pleasant and outgoing. The dinning room staff is very friendly and the food has been great. The small gift shop across the dinning room makes it easy to get gifts, drinks, over the counter meds, hygienic products, food and snacks. McDonald's, Starbucks, L & L, and other courts are only a five minute walk away. Overall, we enjoyed our stay here and the Airport Hotel.

I booked a last minute trip to Oahu to attend a wake, and decided to stay close to the airport. Although this hotel is right next to the airport, driving there from the rental car spot down the street can be slightly confusing with the quick and sharp turns. Booked a room with 2 full beds, perfect for 2 people.This hotel isn't too far away from Waikiki - it was about a 15 minutes drive without traffic.

I recommend this hotel if you are just trying to get away and chill. Upon arrival staff was very friendly & helpful. When checking out Suzie went above and beyond her way to make sure I was good to go and she shows what the aloha spirit is all about.

We had an early flight out of Hawaii and had been staying at the Disney Aulani resort, so rather than miss a full day of fun on our day of check out, we instead spent our last night at the Airport Honolulu Hotel. We arrived late and left early but this hotel exceeded our expectations in every way. It's clean and comfortable and had a gift shop come convenience store in-house that allowed us to get some late night snacks. Staff are friendly and the bellman helped with our luggage. There is a shuttle that runs 24 hours a day to the airport so we couldn't ask for more.

Free airport shuttle, good restaurant by the lovely pool, clean, comfortable, and well appointed rooms. Best aspect is the staff. Warm and friendly, accommodating, and helpful. To quote Arnold, "I'll be back."

This is always a nice place to stay for a long layover in Honolulu. The staff are fantastic - very accommodating and cheerful, and during my last stay they made an extra effort to help take care of my girlfriend traveling in her wheelchair with a service dog. The property is in good condition and is easy to get around in, and the restaurant has great service and good food. Did I mention that the staff were great? Everyone from the shuttle driver who picked us up to the room service folks were helpful and friendly. The front desk staff proactively found us a wheelchair accessible room (even though we'd have survived without it and hadn't set it up in advance), and got us a delayed checkout with no hassle. I've stayed here for both work and personal travel about a half dozen times, and had a thoroughly pleasant stay each time. Being close to the airport, there's not much of interest to do near the hotel, but as an airport hotel it can't be beat.

Convenient location (about 2 minutes from the airport). The shuttle service was not reliable. We called once we collected our bags and sat in the pick up location for about 45 minutes. We had to call back and was told the driver (who drove right by us) was on his way, so we had to wait an additional ten minutes. The check-in wait was an additional 30 minutes because there wasn't adequate staffing. The rooms are very outdated and have a stale cigarette smell. The tub had dirty resting water, but the room was clean for the most part. the lobby shop had pre-packed food items, drinks, (beer and wine included). The restaurant had good wait service and the food was good but a little on the expensive side ($45 breakfast). If you're looking for a place to just lay your head for the night, this is the place, not a favorable place for an extended stay.

Convenient location close to the airport. The front desk staff were very pleasant and helpful. We arrived early into Honolulu from a cruise and a we had a late night flight, we were looking for a day rental so we could relax and leave our bags. This hotel has day rates that are affordable. The hotel is clean but it is a bit outdated and tired. It is very noisy as you are extremely close to the highway.

I had to stay close to HNL airport because my next day early flight.It is a very nice place if you want to stay close to the airport. But if you are not staying close the airport you sure can find better hotels/choices.Eating places are walking distance.

I was sent to Hawaii for a doctors appointment and I had to stay 2 nights here. We used to live there, so my wife and daughter came with me and we stayed an extra night. We loved it. It was convenient for my appointment and centrally located. The room was very comfortable and clean and well priced. The staff was very friendly and helpful. We would stay there again.

My wife and I stayed here while waiting for our next flight, the rooms are clean, beds are super comfortable, staff are very friendly and helpful and they have a 24 hour free shuttle to the airport. We would definitely stay here again.

We were in Honolulu for just one day and had a 5:00 AM flight the next morning, so we chose to stay at the Airport Honolulu Hotel and are so glad we did! They have a 24 hour shuttle service to the airport that leaves every half hour. The room was immaculate and comfortable, the amenities of coffee and bathroom amenities were appreciated. It was quiet and cool. We would definitely stay there again.

stayed overnight at this place before flying out next day. very close to airport. this would be a good waikiki alternative. buses to waikiki and pearl harbor are very close to the front door of the hotel. great internet service. rooms are better than average size, clean, and have great internet service. serve breakfast daily (u gotta pay) and dinner tues thru thursday with a little beer and wine bar. but if you are craving something else within a five minute walk there is a mcdonalds, starbucks, a sub place, korean bbque, pizza place, a juice place, a sushi/udon place, and some other places, so you aint gonna starve.

Hotel was very convenient. We arrived very late and stayed here the 1st night. Breakfast was very good, but you have to pay for it. Accommodations were average. Hotel is between the airport and car rental, there was a shuttle for both.

My family and I stayed at this hotel. Everything was a blessing ranging from availability, rooms, wifi, and all services. Thankful for the hotel, staff and Mr. Lest (military Liaison) for taking outstanding care of my family and I.

Returning to the mainland after a week-long trip to South Pacific and arrived in Honolulu at 3am. Next flight was 7pm that night. The Airport Honolulu Hotel was perfect for catching up on sleep, taking a swim in the pool, and catching a quick bite to eat. My room was attended by Marie who did a great job.

My husband and I recently had to extend our stay at this hotel due to a medical emergency. During our time there, the staff was most helpful and very friendly. The room itself was comfortable and the bed was great. Our privacy was respected and we were most appreciative of our housekeeper, Clarita, who understood our situation and was sensitive to our needs during a difficult time. Thanks to all the staff of the Airport Honolulu Hotel.

We stayed at the Airport Honolulu Hotel in Oahu, Hawaii on Saturday 02-25-17 and we were assigned room 110 on the first floor. When me & my wife entered the room the first thing my wife said was that the room had a moldy smell. The room was a normal hotel room but later that night when we turned off the lights & went to sleep I woke up about 3 am and when I reached over to my phone on the stand next to the bed & turned on the phone light to see the time I saw something crawling on the phone screen & it was a roach. When I got up & walked to the bathroom & turned on the bathroom light I saw numerous roached on the sink counter. The rest of the night was a very unhappy night. In the morning I notified the front desk of the room issues and provided my complain in writing and left a note in the room for the cleaning person. I had booked the room through Cheap Hotels so when we arrived home I called Cheap Hotels and notified them of the condition and they called the Airport Honolulu hotel and they were told they had not received any complain from us. I told Cheap Hotels that I had provided the front desk on the morning of our check out 02/26/17 in writing and verbally. They need to fumigate the room and or entire hotel for roaches and steam clean and deodorize the carpet for the moldy smell.

We've stayed at this hotel for the past 20 years. This hotel has always been our first choice whenever we needed a place to stay near the airport. Convenience is the reason we choose this hotel, it is very close to the airport and there's a shuttle to get you to the hotel and back. The rooms are nothing special, cozy and comfortable, but, it does show its age. They have two buildings, but both show the same wear and tear. Not the place to stay if you want to be near beaches and shopping. The area surrounding the hotel is more industrial, with a couple of fast food type eateries within walking distance. The only meal we've ever had at the restaurant was breakfast. The meals were good, and the service always attentive. There is a bus stop near the hotel offering you a way to get to Ala Moana Shopping Center, downtown Honolulu, and Waikiki.

Walked in through the lobby to check-in and waited in line, Suzie was on her computer while I waited and another Agent was helping a Guest. I stood in line for a good 4-5 minutes while Suzie continued to play on her computer, when the Agent currently helping her Guest finally finished - Suzie finally looked up and acknowledged me and said, 'I can help you here!', I responded to Suzie that 'I would rather wait because you seemed very busy to acknowledge me.', when I was called up - the Agent was very pleasant and very efficient. My check-in process was rather quick but not soon before I was done, another Guest walked through the lobby and Suzie immediately acknowledged this Guest and assisted him right away.Not sure if it was the way I was dressed and maybe looked local because I was in shorts and a tank top, but it felt very unpleasant to me in observing this. We send our team here to this hotel for accommodation during training and meetings including myself, I travel 2600 miles at least 7-9 times a year - if not more as does my team. Just did not feel the OHANA I've come accustomed to when I walked in the lobby, not the usual faces I am used to seeing either but nonetheless - service should not be selective. Just a bit disappointed w/ Suzie but will not take away from the great service I received from the Agent who helped me.

Nice hotel and close to airport. Bit out of town if you want to get in the thick of things downtown but great overniter close to airport. Not brand new but well maintained. Not much around immediate area. Quite good little store onsite. Room was good, bed was comfortable and quick shuttle to and from airport.

This hotel is very close to the airport. Over priced for this older hotel. Hotel is comfortable but is a old. Rooms are nice. The hotel has a pool, restaurant, free wifi, free airport shuttle service. There is a McDonalds, Starbucks and other stores in walking distance.

Close to everything for mility,! The staff, especially the reservation personnel, the bell boys, restaurant waiters and waitresses, the housekeeping is outstanding. Those women are so friendly and always make sure you have everything you need!

I live in Hawaii so bugs are a very typical occurrence, however in a hotel... This is not the norm. The building we were in was obviously going through a remodel so I will leave out some things per typical construction. However some, simply need to be said... The room had cockroaches, beetles, etc in it. The room also smelled as if they freshly painted it, but over time we started to note an almost "moldy" smell. Also the lady at the desk was clearly unhappy with her day and was very vocal around finishing her shift and "getting out of this place".

Having travelled to Oahu several times, I stayed here because other members of my family were here as well. The staff is top notch and went out of their way to be pleasant and patient. My room was outdated and the window looking out was dirty. Although the view was of the highway. I am not in the room much so it really didn't matter. There are restaurants within walking distance and close to the highway. If you are the kind of traveller that is just there to sight see and go, go go, I recommend this hotel for the location and service. If you want to be pampered and spend a great deal of time in your hotel - I would look closer to Waikiki. This is a great deal for the price considering it is Oahu. For a quick trip I would for sure stay again.
user_name:
Marlene W
New York City, New York

review_body: We needed a place to stay our last night on Oahu. This hotel is really close to the airport & they offer free shuttle service every half hour. All of the hotels close to the airport are pricey, including this one. The hotel is off Nimitz Highway. Between the highway & the airport we expected it to be noisy. We requested a quiet room & got room 327 in the back of the hotel. The room was large, clean, a bit dated, but it was quiet. The bed was comfortable, and we had a restful sleep before heading home. We didn't eat diner or breakfast at the hotel. We took the bus into Waikiki our last night for one last meal at Marukame Udon. The hotel secured our luggage the next day, and we took another bus into Honolulu to look around Chinatown & the docks. The bus stop is right outside the hotel on Nimitz Highway. There's not much around the hotel, but McDonald's a block away.

I stayed at this Airport Honolulu Hotel earlier this month, my 30th or more stay, and it just keeps getting better. As I noted in my review last year the rooms not only had a Refrigerator, Microwave and Complimentary Wi-Fi but they have now added Keurig Coffee Makers along with Kona Coffee Pods. Always a clean room with everything working and a staff with lot's of Aloha. Excellent Courtesy Shuttle to the airport and frequent bus service, at a very reasonable fare, to Ala Moana Center, Waikiki or even around the Island. Give the Airport Honolulu Hotel a try next time you are in Honolulu to experience what Hawaiian Hospitality is all about.

The staff was friendly, the prices were reasonable. Close to the airport, which was perfect for us because we got in very late. Comfortable and very clean. Met our expectations. If you are looking for fancy, this is not it. Its a simple but great hotel.

Clean, tidy place with good sized rooms. Free shuttle service provided every half an hour. An on site mini market that sells a variety of products available. A mini supermarket of sorts with a few restaurants available behind the hotel. Dining options limited depending on the day of the week. Free internet available.

Stayed there one night after flying in from a long distance. The room was clean, the linens crisp, which was really great after spending so much time on planes.The staff, especially the bellmen were very helpful and got me checked in as fast as possible.They have a shuttle to/from the airport, it's only a couple of minutes away.Great service!

Loved the outdoor pool here and we made the most of precious time left on our journey. We were disappointed that there was no dinner available on site and felt this should have been made known to us upfront. The first option put to us was to walk to some fast food outlets, which was Ok for a snack, but offered no hearty, healthy meals. After complaining to the manager, we were offered a free shuttle ride to the hotel's sister hotel up the road. It shouldn't have taken a complaint to be offered this option. We took the free shuttle service to the airport a short drive away. The rooms were fine and clean.

This is a great place if your looking for a cheap place to stay. They have a good store just off the lobby. The restaurant was a bit frustrating as it is not open every night? The breakfast at their restaurant was good, but be ready to spend $20 or more? My room also had some problems with the plumbing? I know, you get what you pay for! But in this case it was cheap if your passing through and just need a place to stay. It is also next to the industrial area off the airport, no view, no walking around the area? The pool area was very nice and at least that part is a good place to hang out.

However, there was only one bath towel in the Double superior room and we were charged incorrectly.When we checked in I was asked for a credit card and I asked why to be told to pay for the night. So I handed over my multi currency card. Had I been told it was for security I would have used my Amex card. That's what I've done for past 7 weeks at car hire and hotels. At checkout in the morning I found that my card had been reduced by $30 more than reservation amount and that the hotel wanted to take a further $203 as they said the initial amount was just a security charge! Security charges don't work on currency cards but manager didn't seem to appreciate the problem! He promised to contact his bank and get reversal today. Now waiting to see if I've been conned out of $234!

The employees were nice, but the service is terrible. It is a 5 minute walk to the airport, but we had 3 large bags so we had to wait for their shuttle! We waited 50 minutes, yes 50 minutes for a shuttle. There is no restaurant so you have to walk 10-15 minutes to a neighbor hotel to eat. Enough said.

Hotel is located next to airport parking and 5 minute walk to the terminal. Rooms are clean and comfortable. Fitness room and laundry room available. Staff is helpful and friendly. Pets are allowed which is why we stayed there because we were departing Honolulu with our pets.There is one restaurant which opened for breakfast and dinner. Large portions of comfort food are served at the restaurant. That's the only place you can dine other than the McDs a block over if you don't have a car.There is a 24 hour airport shuttle that runs every half hour which is very convenient.

After a long flight to Honolulu, I decided to stay the night because my flight to Maui wasn't until the next morning. The hotel is average but they do have a free shuttle to and from the airport which is exactly why I chose to stay. If you are just staying for the night and need to get to the airport, I recommend this hotel.

Decor from the 70's in the rooms. Odd restaurant hours and amenities. Horribly overpriced in house store. X2,x3 pricing elsewhere. I would use this as a one night stay if you arrive late or need to depart early . I would not stay here on a personal trip. Room was clean and fairly quiet .

We chose this hotel because it was close to the airport and had a shuttle. We only stayed one night. The hotel was clean and the front desk people were very friendly. The shuttle driver was friendly, efficient, and on time. The hotel itself wasn't fancy and seemed a bit worn, but it served our purpose. The beds were comfy.

We stayed one night for an event on the airport side of Honolulu - its a room without a view; lots of noise and few facilities. Our room was poorly laid out and furnished - the first one had the bath full of the previous guests shower water and the second one, the door to the bathroom didn't close. A few interesting twists on dinner and the like - it was forgettable.

This hotel is very conveniently located to the airport if you are catching an early morning flight. We overnighted here on our way home to New Zealand. The hotel is a typical transit hotel it was very clean and had everything we required, including a free shuttle to the airport.The restaurant was basic but the food and the service was good.Downside, it was a little noisy, as mentioned it is close to the airport, but double or triple glazing would have helped, this is normally standard for hotels in similar locations, not here though.I wish American hotels would consider overseas travelers and put a kettle in their rooms, or even a few teabags , any alternative to the coffee equipment which is standard.

This Hotel was ideal for our stop over between flying in from Minneapolis and then on to Melbourne Australia.Our flight landed around 11pm and pre phoned Hotel the day before to let them know-very helpful friendly person registered this and gave clear instructions re phoning from airport to call free shuttle bus.Once arriving this all went like clockwork and shuttle arrived within 5 minutes of calling-very friendly driver and short drive to Hotel.Check in person efficient but unfriendly-however in our room quickly. This proved to be well cooled, clean and comfortable and we had a restful night-no noise at all.Check out identical in morning-we had planned for 6am shuttle from hotel-this only hitch as the bus did not arrive until 6.20 causing a little anxiety re timing of our flight at 8am-in event no problems.

We stayed here in between our inter island and international flights. The hotel served its purpose for us, although the hotel is not new, the staff were reasonably helpful, with them being quite responsive. This worked for us. Thanks.

We arrived late into Honolulu so this hotel was close. The hotel is clean and relatively quiet so it was great for a good night's sleep. We had breakfast there the next day and we were on our way. It was a good way to start our vacation. The hotel offers a shuttle service on the half hour.

The staff of this hotel are the best part. Everyone was so courteous, helpful and genuinely friendly. It is very Military friendly and even has a meal voucher program for Military, $10 per person per day. This voucher really helps out when you are living in a hotel for months looking for a house. The food is also very good at the restaurant. The pool is excellent but closes a bit early at 6 or 7. I saw many people with there pets staying in the hotel as well. It is only about 5 minutes to Hickham Pearl Harbor Joint Base. The Navy also has a huge Nex, Commisary, and food court within a 5 minute drive. This is not a luxurious hotel but it is clean and well kept.

Let me start by saying that you shouldn't plan a vacation to Hawaii and stay at this hotel. It's an airport hotel right off of a major highway in a warehouse district. But... if you are transferring from someplace else and need a night to sleep near the airport, this hotel is just fine. It is less than a mile away, they offer free shuttle service and it even has a small pool, garden and restaurant. But it's a place to transfer, not plant yourself.The rooms themselves are good enough for what it is. The price is a little higher than you might expect to pay but ironically, there are only one or two choices for overnight accommodations right at the Honolulu Airport, and I believe this is the best choice of those options. The main reason for my high marks is because of the service. We actually arrived a day earlier than our intended reservation because I made a mistake during booking. Since I had prepaid (for two rooms), I was now in a situation where I was going to need to purchase rooms for multiple nights when I only needed them for one night. On top of that the hotel was full when we arrived close to midnight with our kids. Suzie, who was working the front desk took care of us. She found us two adjoining rooms in an adjacent building and she even dealt with my travel agent to work out canceling my non-refundable payment for the night that we no longer needed. I was surprised at how helpful they were! That was the first thing that they did. Next, my wife left her jacket by the pool when we went to the airport to check in to our outbound flight. She called the hotel, and they dispatched a shuttle driver to take it to the airport directly to her. It's the little things that make a big difference when you're traveling, and having people that are willing to go a little out of their way to smooth out the rough patches are simply the best. The Airport Honolulu Hotel has those people and for me that means it has to be a top destination for travelers that have a choice. Great people will always tip the balance.

This hotel is nothing fancy, but it's clean, has a pool and the restaurant food is really good. The restaurant is only open for breakfast 7 days a week and dinner on Tuesday thru Thursday. The pool is very clean (and also very cold) and 8 feet at the deep end. Even though it is right by the airport it really wasn't very noisy. The staff is incredibly friendly and always helpful, they even greeted us by name. It is a little older, but in decent condition.

We arrived in Honolulu about midnight. We had an international flight scheduled in the morning. I selected this hotel because it had an airport shuttle and was close to the airport. We could not find the hotel courtesy phone at baggage claim so we phoned the hotel for a pick-up. We waited only five minutes before the hotel bus arrived. The airport passengers were loaded, sometimes with the suitcases being thrown onboard by the bus driver. Apparently an entire flight had recently been cancelled and almost all the stranded passengers were being transported to this hotel. Clearly the bus driver was stressed. He told us that if we had a morning flight we should take the airport shuttle 3 or 4 hours prior to departure. He expected the shuttle service to be delayed. Surprisingly we checked in without delay. Our room was clean, the bed was good. We decided to take a cab to the airport in the morning so we could sleep a bit longer. I was surprised that the hotel staff seemed disorganized and could not really handle the situation of cancelled flights.

There really isn't much to say about the place. It's clean, the beds are soft, and it's near the airport. The giftshop has a good selection of leis and flowers for your hair. You can walk to L&L Hawaiian barbecue, which you should do.There are no views, the area around it is a rather ugly industrial park. But if you want a place near the airport to stay. It will do.

As other reviews have mentioned, this is an older property, but not vintage. The rooms and bathrooms are smaller than newer hotels, but they are clean and comfortable and have most everything you need. Staff at this property are amazing. The food in he restaurant is good and not outrageously priced. The location is terrible -- this is not where you want to spend your Hawaiian vacation, but super convenient to the airport. Solid property, but way overpriced.

The hotel is nice and close to airport. Good place to be when you have to be at the airport at 6am in the morning. The hotel was clean, staff very professional and helpful. It is very dated decor, but it is the location that is important. The bed was comfortable enough for a one night stay. The shop is a real bonus, being able to pick up a few items. The shuttle bus picks you up from the airport and drops you back the following day.

Nothing fancy but works for a quick ride from airport and overnight stay. Rooms are small and dated but fine for a quick stay. Shuttle is fine but was crowded even at midnight, so takes a little longer for transport on both sides.

We stayed one night at Airport Honolulu Hotel. We arrived in Honolulu late afternoon and had a long layover, and left early the next morning, so this was a quick solution, close to the airport, with a free shuttle. The shuttle was quick and efficient. The front desk staff were personable. The room we booked was not available, and they ended up giving us a double room, but didn't adjust the price at all. It was a fair- sized room with a fair-sized bathroom. The hotel is dated and does need updating. But the rooms were clean and comfortable. Other guests said the highway noise Disturbed their sleep, but our room was quiet, and we slept well.

We have stayed in a lot of hotels recently and the Airport Honolulu was by far the most expensive. Even though it was the most expensive it didn't provide anything that the other hotels provided, except for maybe a little more bling in the lobby. If you need a place to stay close to the airport this hotel is very convenient. Otherwise, there are cheaper or fancier for the same price options available.Pros:- Great locations for travelers.- Good amenities: restaurant, pool, etc.- Room had a microwave and fridge (no freezer) in the room.- Easy check-in and very helpful front desk.- Rooms were clean and housekeeping did a good job.Cons:- H1 and Nimitz traffic right in front of the hotel.Slow/intermittent internet.- Housekeeping staff really seemed to have a sullen attitude as a whole. - $6 to do a small load of laundry, more to dry a larger load. - Restaurant is overpriced and poorly staffed: $28 minimum for breakfast for two without drinks or tip, once witnessed 12 unbussed tables and not a waiter or waitress in sight.

I have stayed at this hotel several times and am always thoroughly delighted. The front desk staff is always warm and inviting. My housekeeper, Amy, was excellent. The room was always crisp and clean. The bellman are friendly and helpful. The on site restaurant offers great menu selections. I have never been disappointed and I will continue to return to this wonderful hotel.

Older style hotel. More like a motel. It has a motel style pool and a small gym. It was clean and the staff were Friendly. We had 2 adjoining double rooms for our family of 5. There is a McDonald's 5 min walk away which seemed to be open at midnight. About 3 minutes walk (from the back of the hotel ) is a small cluster of shops -Starbucks, pizza place, take away for hawaiian/Asian food which opens at 6, a juice place, a bank with an ATM, a sushi place and a couple of other shops. The hotel is adjacent to a industrial estate so not much to see. It was about $250 each per room which seemed quite expensive for an airport hotel bit there aren't that many alternatives. The air conditioner was also noisy during the night.So a decent clean place to stay of you have to stay overnight in Honolulu. If you were staying more than one night I would be inclined to stay closer to waikiki. The staff were good and the free shuttle also.

When you arrive go to the tourist telephone to book your free shuttle to the hotel. Ride was about 5mins. Our room was large and clean, also had our cot that we had requested, which was great as we got in late. There is a little general store down near the lobby where you can purchase ready meals, etc, or MacDonald's is in walking distance. Rooms do have a microwave. Front desk staff are super friendly and will help with any questions you might have.Good hotel for an early morning flight!!!

American Airlines booked me a room here since my flight was canceled. The staff here were very friendly. The room was clean, the bed comfortable, and the shower put out hot water. It is by no means a stylish hotel but worth it if you need to be close to the airport and are staying for a night or two.

I usually don't write negative reviews, but in this case I just have to. I stayed at Honolulu Airport hotel from 17 to 18 Dec, and my experience was disastrous. First of all, I had to go twice to the terminal to call the hotel reception for pick up with free shuttle. Then, while check in was smooth, in the room there were house cockroaches. Also, the bed linen was literally dirty. There was also dog smell, but I can understand it to some extent as the hotel is pet friendly. The air conditioning unit was extremely noisy and probably hundred years old. I didn't have any rest and didn't sleep before my long haul flight at all. Finally, all this terrible experience was for $169 per night + tax!

Overall, it served as a great location prior to boarding our NCL cruise and bell staff, bus transportation and front desk were all helpful. Room was a bit humid and outdated, but got a good deal by booking 6 months in advance so few complaints.

I was spending only one night but had 3 big pieces of luggage. Matt graciously helped me from my room, chatting amiably, making me comfortable. I was to meet my daughter and two young grandchildren flying in from Seoul the next hour. Matt held my luggage past the time we'd agreed on, which meant I was was able to get my family transported to their condo, drop off all their luggage, then return to Matt for my own.He handled it all kindly and professionally. I commend you for hiring such a fine young man.

Stayed here overnight after missing a flight connection. Nothing fancy but was generally fine for what it was. Room was clean and quiet, although a little musty (not enough to make is want to change rooms but we left the a/c overnight to keep air fresh). 5-10 minutes from airport, with free shuttle. Only complaint was $30 charge for rollaway for our son - phone agent led us to believe there wouldn't be a charge but when we got to front desk 15 minutes later, the check-in clerk dismissed it saying, "that's just the reservation service".

Stayed overnight on our way to the Big Island. Hotel decor is dated (from the 80s). But the room was clean, a decent size and quiet. There's free wifi but connection is temperamental. About a 5 minute drive from the airport. 24hr shuttle service.

Very close to airport and where most of the locations where I had to visit were.The staff was very helpful in directions and helping with the few items that i needed.they alway greeted you with a smile and friendly greeting in passing.

The hotel was a typical 3 star hotel, neat and clean with a loud AC. But everyone was nice and the van picked us up promptly at the airport. I would recommend it for a stopover stay. The restaurant seemed a little pricey but I didn't try it, it wasn't to far to take an Uber into town to eat at something a little more exotic.

No frills hotel for busy traveler. Nothing extraordinary here in fact the restaurant closes on some days but they'll shuttle you the sister hotel a few blocks away. take the shuttle the neighborhood does have homeless walking around. The eats at the inhotel store are a better buy than most markets in the area (not many). For me it was get in get out location far from waikiki, about a 35.00 cab fare one way...Room was clean with 20 year old motif, quiet for being next door to the highway. Nothing to write home about. If you eat in their restaurant the salads are huge and the best buy for the money..

The hotel is in need of a makeover but was clean enough and extremely convenient for a one night stop over. You pay a bit more than Waikiki but you don't have to travel for an hour each way to get to your bed so I guess you break even. There's a small shop inside the hotel where you can get a sandwich, fruit, snacks & drinks at a reasonable price. The free airport shuttle was a great bonus. It arrived within 10 mins of our phone call, the driver was friendly, helpful, polite on both journeys and the hotel bell hops were wonderful. IN fact all the hotel staff we came in contact with were freindly and helpful. Will stay again if we need a one night stop over.

We only stayed at the Airport Honolulu Hotel for one night, a last minute plan. they were kind enough to let us into our room at 10 AM rather than the customary 3 PM. Very helpful. (Another hotel that we called wanted an additional $75 to give us the room that early.)

We stayed at the Airport Honolulu Hotel for 3 months while we waited for housing on the air base, and so we know the hotel very well. While it may not seem to be the most posh hotel in Honolulu, it is definitely one of the most friendly, accommodating, and pet and military friendly hotels we've ever stayed at, and we have stayed in hundreds of hotels in the U.S. and Europe.The staff at AHH are definitely the best part of the equation. They were warm and friendly and attentive right from the moment we stepped in the door, even at nearly midnight. The military liaison, Les, goes out of his way to accommodate and meet the needs of military families. We were able to stay in two large rooms with our 2 kids and 90lb dog for the same rate we would have stayed in one room on the military base. The housekeeping staff is incredibly friendly, greeting us warmly even just in passing in the hall. Our housekeeper for the bulk of our stay, Geraldine, was so sweet and kept our rooms absolutely immaculate! We were able to eat breakfast daily at the hotel restaurant, Willoughby's, with little out of pocket expense due to military friendly vouchers, and the food was always delicious. The restaurant staff, Sharon, Robin, Stella, JaNae, Donna, Tim, and John, were always so friendly and seemed sincerely interested in our happiness and comfort. By the time we left they seemed like old friends. The front desk staff were also absolutely wonderful! Even when they were super busy, especially on Tuesday mornings as they worked so diligently to accommodate visiting veterans on medical trips, they cheerfully greeted us and were always super helpful. On our departure, we got lots of hugs and wishes for us to return to visit often. As for the physical accommodations, as I said, AHH may not be the poshest hotel in Honolulu, but it is very nice all the same. Our rooms were large and very convenient to parking, the dog walk area, the laundry facilities, and the gym. The beds and bedding were comfortable enough, and we had mini-fridges, Keurig Coffee makers, and microwaves in both rooms. the hotel gym, while small, was adequate with a treadmill, elliptical, weight machine, and good selection of free weights. The pool and surrounding area was clean and inviting. Parking was another military perk and was comped for both our cars, and there was usually ample parking. On the handful of nights when the lot was over full, there was free valet parking.Finally, my reason for the four star rating in lieu of five stars, was simply the noise. Our rooms, being on the outter side of the east building, were next to a noisy rental car park which got very noisy at various hours of day and night. Also, the hotel is right next to Nimitz Hwy which is under Hwy 1, and so the traffic noise is a bit much. I'm not sure if this was just due to the location of our rooms, but I can't imagine it being much better in any other part of the hotel. That said, the location is very convenient to Joint Base Pearl Harbor-Hickam, the airport (obviously), and major bus lines.I highly recommend Airport Honolulu Hotel to anyone coming to Oahu on military orders, for other business purposes, or even on holiday. It is comfortable, friendly, and affordable enough that you can save your money for other fun things on the island!

I stayed for just over 2 weeks, and had a positive experience every day. Hotel is a little older, but clean, well-maintained, and efficiently staffed. The Front desk was communicative and the concierge so helpful - every time I asked for assistance, they were at the door within 5 minutes. Everyone I encountered was polite and friendly. Gene took care of my room, and did a fantastic job. Definite recommendation when you want to stay near the Airport!!

We disembarked from the Pride of America Saturday morning and needed an overnight stay for our 8:30am flight home to Sydney on Sunday Morning. Taxi was $40 with tip.Checked in early at 10:30am after a short 30 minute wait in which time we utilised wifi available(connectivity was good).We were trying to prolong our Hawaiian holiday as long as possible so we took advantage of the large and very uncrowded pool . Drawback is there is a busy highway next to you however a set of headphones solved that problem.There is a shop in the hotel that sells everything which we used for drinks and snacks around the pool (good value$)The bed was comfortable and shower more than adequate. Didn't eat here (we had a pizza delivered-papa johns )The place is old and dated but everything was clean. The shuttle bus runs every 30 mins and is only 5 minutes drive to airport.Would stay here again when needing a nights stay

The staff, especially Norma in housekeeping, was polite, helpful and friendly. The hotel was clean and comfortable but we did have some issues with their parking system. Three times we had trouble exiting and had to park and get out of the car and go back into the lobby to redo our parking ticket.Other than that no complaints.

Due to issues with our overseas flight, we were unable to make our inter-island connection and needed a place to stay for the night. Thankfully, Airport Honolulu Hotel had available rooms. The staff were very welcoming, the room was clean and spacious, and he bed was extremely comfortable. While the building is older, it is clean and neat! We ate dinner at the restaurant; large portions for a decent price. I would definitely stay here again if I had a layover in Oahu.

Great staff working extra hard in a run down hotel. The place desperately needs a makeover but my room was spacious and comfortable. The shuttle service to the airport was very efficient. Recommend taking a taxi if heading into Honolulu as the hotel is a little isolated but there is a local bus service available.

If you're doing business in the airport area this is the place to stay since it's very easy to get on and off of the freeway (H-1) or just going to Pearl Harbor or the aloha stadium. If you're in between flights and need a nights rest, again, this hotel will is very convenient since it's close to the airport and they have a 24 hr. shuttle. They also have an on the premise restaurant that is quite adequate and affordable. Did I mention that also have a small store that sells almost everything that you need.

Great location for transit schedule to/from airport. The shuttle service was very efficient. Although not fancy, the Room was clean and bed was good. Due to brief time between flights , we did not use any of the other hotel amenities.

We live on an outer island and had to overnight in Honolulu when our mainland flight got in after 10PM. I remembered that the Holiday Inn was now another hotel and checked it out on google. The Airport Honolulu Hotel is located at the best spot on Nimitz - just at the main airport entry. We rented a car and was there in 3 minutes. Front desk was efficient, friendly and helpful. Room was very clean and the bed was comfortable. Used a Keurig type coffee maker in the room, and free wireless internet at the hotel. Parking was convenient right outside the hotel and $15/day. There is only so much you can do to upgrade an old hotel without doing a complete tear-down and Outrigger did a wonderful job! It's bright, clean and affordable for an airport hotel. We left early next morning so did not try the restaurant on property. Highly recommend.

I had a great stay here and everyone is military friendly. Norma, our housekeeper was always friendly and asked if we ever needed anything. Always did a good job taking care of our room and stay here.

The check-in clerk was a nightmare...extremely condescending (early 30s/medium length black haired female). There is not even close to enough parking and at night there were always random people everywhere. I was here on a business trip, but would never spend my own money on this hotel.

As our flight time into Honolulu was rescheduled and would arrive too late for us to make the connection for our inter-island flight to Kauai, Westjet were kind enough to book us a room at the Airport Honolulu Hotel for the night. All I can say is that I'm glad we didn't have to pay as there were others that arrived and were required to pay and left. At first glance, the lobby is o.k. We were told that our room was in the 'other building' across the parking lot. When we began to walk down the hall, across the parking lot and into the 'other building', we felt very nervous and uncomfortable about the condition of the hotel, the characters that were hanging out in the parking lot, and the fact that the building we were staying in was not even secure. We made it to the room which was dated but clean so we decided to put up with it, lock the door, and stay in the room until we had to leave to catch our flight the next day. I would definitely not recommend this hotel if you can help it!

Unfortunately my flight was canceled we needed to fly into Honolulu to catch a flight the next morning to Maui. The airline booked us at the hotel for the evening. We were pleasantly surprised by the service and the accommodations. We checked in at midnight and it was fast and efficient as well as very friendly. Many of the travelers with the group were disgruntled and tired because they had been traveling since 8am. The check in staff was great. The room was very nice and had a refrigerator and a microwave. The beds and the linens were very good and the water pressure in the shower was very good. The next morning the breakfast staff especially the hostess was very accommodating. The morning hotel staff was very good and helped us with directions. The shuttle back and forth from the airport was very good also. Its not easy dealing with upset travelers and they did an outstanding job making us feel good about coming to Hawaii. It changed our attitude and put us on a happy path for the rest of our trip. The Chamber of Commerce should give them a medal for promoting Hawaii.

free airport pickup and return. Quite, peaceful, with very friendly staff. Some local shopping within walking distance. Meals onsite and self serve laundry with a nice little market in house. Staff will help anyway they can.

Older hotel.....Ok for over night....good location next to the airport....so it is easy to get to the airport with their shuttle service. A bit expensive for the grade of hotel but your paying of the easy of not having to fight the traffic and crowds downtown. Friendly staff makes up for the condition of the room.

While the staff were amazing and efficient in checking in over 200 people after our flight was cancelled and the airline put us up for the night, the hotel itself is kinda basic and definitely in need of an updating. I had to get security to let me in my room since the deadbolt kept slipping and not allowing the door to open. The room insight was sufficiently cold, the beds basic but clean, the room itself lacking only one thing: spare outlets to plug in a phone charger (mine ended up in the bathroom). I was there for only one night, and if I had to stay near the airport again, I would not discount the place, but it wouldn't be my first option.

I stayed there this past week and would like to thank 2 people that made our stay fantastic Julius and Alex made us feel so much like family. Keep up the Aloha Spirt We enjoyed our stay and we look forward to returning one day Kalani and AnuheaMahalo nui

We were on our way home from a long trip, exhausted from an over-night flight, and desperate for food and sleep. We were picked up by the free shuttle within minutes of hanging up the phone. In fact, our shuttle driver received the call while picking up another passenger and he had his eyes peeled for us. Such service! When we arrived at the hotel, we asked for the earliest available room, which we were happy to check into at 10:00 a.m. While we waited, we enjoyed a light breakfast from the friendliest waitress we have ever met! You would have thought she was our very own daughter the way she cared for us in our sleep-deprived state! After breakfast we sat by the pool and were not sent away even though the groundskeeper was working around us and the pool area was not officially open yet. Once in our room, we found it cool and quiet. We were able to sleep soundly all day, then enjoy a very generous dinner in the hotel restaurant. Again we had the friendliest, kindest, most generous waiter on the planet! He was very attentive and funny and generous with our beverages. When we checked out, we were effusive in our thanks to the hotel staff and we meant every word! What a great place!

We arrived after a long flight, very tired, with an early morning flight the next day. The shuttle came soon after the call to collect us. The staff on the desk were very welcoming and nice. The hotel is comfortable and very convenient for the hotel, and it was just what we needed. It is very light on for meal options, but has a small store which helps.

At Airport Honolulu Hotel, Ohana really means family. The service was excellent every single day and for the 2 months that we stayed with them, we became familiar with the people who work there and I can truly say that they are friendly, very welcoming and the whole place is full of hospitality. Thank you Honolulu Hotel, I will sure recommend you to many of my family members who will be traveling to Honolulu for the holidays. Until we meet again, mahalo :) -With love, The Matagi Family.

This was a great place to stay near the Airport, comfortable and with true Hawaiian Hospitality. From the moment I arrived until I left I felt like everything was taken care of and there was always someone there to help with anything I needed. My Porter/Shuttle Driver was Excellent, on time, more than helpful and kind. It was a pleasure staying at this property.

I booked this hotel only because it was close to the airport for an early morning flight out with free shuttle service. I didn't expect much. What a nice surprise, starting with Alex, the shuttle driver. The check in was quick and easy. The room was clean, the towels and amenities were far better than the Waikiki hotel I had stayed in, the bed was very comfortable, my room had good lighting, quick internet connection-everything I needed. I didn't try the restaurant but I did shop in the gift store, which had everything one could want or need, whether on business or pleasure. I will definitely stay there again when I return next month.

Clean, but tired with limited meal options, but close to airport and convenient. I had a third floor room and could hear a lot of traffic noise. When you get a day room to sleepover on a long layover it wasn't helpful.Also note day room hours are 9:00am to 6:00pm so if you arrive mid-afternoon you might need to pay the overnight rate even if you only want your room until 8:00pm

Great place to stay near airport. John at front desk and John our waiter at breakfast were very good in assisting us and other customers. Rooms clean and parking available a reasonable fee for location. Shuttle service to and from the airport runs on a regular basis.

This hotel was nice and close to the airport. We were able to stay overnight and see Pearl Harbor in the morning and leave our luggage in our room because checkout wasn't until Noon. The mattresses need to be replaced but for an overnight stay it was sufficient

Good sized clean rooms, prompt wake call, small shop on site, minutes from Airport by hotel shuttle. All that is needed for a one night stopover to catch the next flight. Did not try the on-site eatery, and there is nothing in the Neighborhood. Note you are is a Uber hole as the Ubers are all working Waikiki area.

We stayed here 1 night on return from another island as we had early morning flight the next day.The hotel itself is pretty basic, with windows looking over a freeway. Rooms are clean and adequate.Position very handy for an early flight. Buses into Waikiki also run regularly from the corner.

I go to Hawaii quite often, but this visit was not a fun trip. I was there for a military memorial service for a dear friend who was a Captain in the Air Force. I chose this hotel because of location and the discount I received as an airline employee. This hotel is not luxurious, but it has been updated. The room was clean and updated. It was quiet and comfortable. It has a microwave and mini fridge. With the on-site store, I didn't have to eat out. The elevators are slow, but the staff is friendly. There is really nothing bad I can say about this hotel.

Nice clean room with everything I needed. Staff was very friendly and helpful. There is a nice pool on property. Fast food locations are within walking distance. There is a shuttle to the airport, which takes about 5 minutes.

Honolulu airport hotel is by far the worst hotel visited,located 5 minutes from airport and directly on the front highway,it is very noisy,we have been there following and aircraft failure by Air Canada for 2 nights,do not expect any smile from the staff,very basic room with beds completly used and we caught nasty insect,i will let you guessed!The food is horrible and again the staff not interressed in your business,avoid that hotel!

When we have an early am flight we always stay here. Nice clean rooms, friendly helpful staff and on site restaurant ( or food close by). It is a good place to start our vacations. And convenient airport shuttle

I stayed at Airpirt Honolulu Hotel durning my house hunting days when I first moved to Oahu. The hotel is basic but the staff here are amazing! Ms. Marilou & Ms. Lei were always there at the front desk to greet me with smiles and asked about my day. The restaurant and cleaning staff are amazing too. There wasn't a single time that a staff member didn't say hello with a smile in passing. Even though I was staying at a hotel which seemed like forever, the staff made sure to make me feel at home. There is a convent store with late hours. The restaurant has some tasty items on the menu. My favorite was breakfast. Loved eating out by the pool feeling the fresh air, warming sun, and birds hoping around while drinking my coffee.

I find all airport hotels a little depressing, but this takes the prize so far. We arrived on a Monday night at around 8pm to be told that we could take the shuttle bus to a nearby hotel for dinner (open until 9pm), or eat Mackers around the corner. The walk to Mackers is pretty horrible, under overhead highway by-passes. There is nothing around this hotel. It is very bleak outside and almost the same within. Nothing really feels clean. When we opened the fridge a cockroach crawled out. Between the sheets were some baby blue terry towelling blankets left over from the '70s. I won't be going back.

I am on island for three weeks, 30 September to 22 October, and staying at the Honolulu Airport Hotel for convenience. Based on stays at airport hotels in the past, I was not expecting too much. So far, I've been presently surprised. The location is perfect for my stay. Working west of Waikiki, I am going opposite traffic during rush hour, and it's a wonderful thing watching the traffic crawling into town as I am driving to the west. The service at the hotel has been excellent. Today, i requested a repair for the bathroom, and before i walked back from the desk to my room, the maintenance man was there doing the repair!The room is unremarkable (typical hotel room), but very comfortable. Considering how close it is to the airport, it is very quiet. The bed is very comfortable, and the housekeeping staff is outstanding. I will have no problems staying here for three weeks.I can easily recommend this hotel to business travelers to Oahu.Cheers

What a great location for business trips, my trips take me to Hawaii 7-8 times out of the year and have stayed in several locations. This location here - Airport Honolulu - is prime should you have business in and around the Airport, I receive great service the moment I enter the shuttle to the moment I walk into the lobby. My rooms are always very clean and with plenty of towels, beds are comfortable and plenty of room with my king size bed. Many of our staff members we send to HNL for meetings or trainings, I book them all with the Airport Honolulu Hotel. So thank you and BIG Aloha and Mahalo to these great employees: * Michelle & Ulu who is always taking good care of our team and myself on bookings * Marilou and Lei, thank you for being so pleasant everytime we walk in the lobby and check-in. Always very respectful and nice * Clarita who I seem to always have on my floor during my stay, thank you for being so attentive and keeping my/our room(s) clean and supplied w/ towels and soap, etc.A great staff from what I have seen so far during all of my business trips, I've come across others but my apologies for not remembering your names. But know that your kindness and great service has not gone unnoticed. Again, much ALOHA's and MAHALO's - thank you all so very much...

We use this hotel for transfer to KonaArrived Honolulu at nite but no inter island transfer in the eveningIt is a short ride from the airportThe hotel is located close to macdonald around the corner and a shopping centreThe hotel is four story's high with elevatorsThe entire building is somewhat oldThere is a free shuttle originating from the hotel on the hour and past the hourThough they say it is a free shuttle,specifically the driver expect a one dollar fee for handling the luggage by pieceThe bed and shower is okWe stay on the fourth floor way down the corner which is reasonably quietThey have a breakfast service started at 600-630 am which was too early for us to catch the morning flight to Kona

I had figured since the location is so near the airport I would have been bothered by the sounds of aircraft. My stay was five nights and never heard one jet! I can't explain it, but it's the truth. The rooms were clean and the staff was very helpful and friendly. Good size pool, restaurant open Tuesday thru Saturday. Hotel is centrally located without the Waikiki crowds. Jamba Juice, Starbucks, Big Kahuna Pizza are within walking distance (5 mins).The only thing lacking is the absence of USB charging ports, but maybe someday they will have them available. Highly recommended.

Nice, clean room and very spacious. Very helpful employees from the front desk to the maids. Location is convenient as it is right next to the airport. I was very pleased with the welcoming atmosphere in the lobby.

Over $170 a night (add in taxes and other fees rate was $212 a night) and you have to pay $30 a day to park. Are you serious? I would think that common sense would say that if car does not have hotel parking pass it gets towed, like everywhere else I've been. On top of that, for $212 a night you would think that the room would be better than what you would find in Best Western.....NOT!! Needless to say I did not stay as I found other accommodations for a quarter of the price and no charge for parking.

I stayed at the Airport Honolulu Hotel for one night after returning from an overseas trip, and before traveling back to my home on the Big Island. It was around midnight when I arrived and I was tired. I was greeted warmly, and quickly given a room. My room was clean and comfortable, with an extremely comfortable bed, great bath amenities, in-room coffee, and everything I needed for a restful night. The lobby is beautiful with unique wooden furniture and a hand built wooden outrigger canoe, which the lobby shuttle manager was happy to explain and discuss with me. What a welcoming place! The free shuttle to and from the airport is extremely convenient, and my next trip through Honolulu, I will definitely stay at the Airport Honolulu Hotel.

Always excellent guest service from everyone at the front desk. Especially Nani, Rose and Manager Wayne are always very helpful, friendly and make you feel like family. We stay very often and keep recommending it to everyone that needs a clean and welcoming place to stay.

Perfect one night stay! Our second trip to Hawaii...both trips we spent our first night at this property before moving on the next day to our final destination. This property is well maintained. The front desk staff is so helpful and friendly, property is so clean, and restaurant has very good food. We ate both breakfast and dinner there. Rooms could use to be refurbished but was comfortable and very clean and quiet. Shuttle service is 24 hours....prompt and friendly service. Keep this property in mind when needing a hotel for overnight in Honolulu. It is also reasonably priced too!

This was my second time here. The first visit was great. This time around not so good. Killed 5 roaches! If that wasn't bad enough I bent over to tie my shoes and there was someone's fingernail in plain view and within easy reach of a vacuum if one had passed by. This hotel is super close to the airport but not sure if I will be back.

Stayed here for 1 night. We arrived on an early morning flight. The shuttle service was quick and driver so helpful. We had to wait for room so had breakfast in restaurant. The host was so accomodating and helpful as it was first time in U.S so she explained things to us. The rooms are basic but good and we had a great sleep. Dinner service was just as good so I would say the biggest asset this hotel has is its food and beverage team. Check out was quick and transfer to airport was great. I would stay here again

Staff super friendly from front desk to housekeeping and shuttle driver. Always received a warm greeting from staff when walking in throughout the hotel. 24 hour shuttle to and from the airport is awesome.

Can't believe anyone would write clean in a review of this place. We killed not less than 6 roaches in our room. The airport shuttle only goes every 30 minutes so be on time, and the reservations desk was a disaster. We paid for 4 people to stay in the room, they left us 2 towels. When we asked for more they towels they told us housekeeping was closed. I am shocked that people would give this place a decent review. Not a fan.

If you're in Hawaii for DOD business and you want to save on commute time then the Honolulu Airport Hotel is a good choice. It was clean and within per diem. The hotel staff were friendly. This hotel is a TLA site for in bound military so it is crowded. Parking can be full at night but valet parking is free. Very little food choices within walking distance however food options are very close by carFree wifi

Basic old hotel. OK for an late, overnight stay. Twin doubles, not queens. Stayed in back section on ground floor. Think someone lives in the room next door. Two dogs visited our room as we had back door open that leads to a gravel courtyard. Clean enough. Pricey for standard.

We love this hotel, and came for a second stay September 2016. We found our room on the 4th floor of the Hale Pili Wing cozy, secure, clean, pleasant, comfortable and welcoming. The staff is courteous and friendly. Emmi, our housekeeper, made our bed perfectly every day and kept our towels and supplies fresh and abundant. Our maintenance man took care of a burned out light bulb right away. The hotel is special in the way they respect the environment, and encourage guests to do the same. The amenities are great, fast wi-fi, a wide variety of TV channels and movies on demand, fresh brewed coffee in the room, well-controlled A/C, a microwave and a small fridge as well. You can even see your guest account and balance as a selection on the TV menu. Sound is well-controlled, you don't hear your neighbors. I think they allow pets there too. We didn't use it, but we saw a guest laundry room with washer and dryer. The in-house restaurant, Willoughby's, serves delicious breakfasts and dinners with generous portions. There's a nice shop just off the main lobby with snacks, medicines, beverages, tropical gifts, food, newspaper, and post cards. The hotel pool is fresh and clean, in a grotto-like setting. The hotel is very close to the airport and car rentals. There's plenty of hotel parking. If you're local, you get half price to park per day. The place is safe and secure. The manager, Wayne Raposta, is responsive and attentive to guests' feedback and suggestions. We highly recommend this hotel to our friends and family. We are grateful, and enjoyed our stay. You will too.

Airport Honolulu Hotel is an excellent location for airport departure. We flew in late from Big Island and were departing the next day. The staff is extremely friendly and the airport shuttle is one of the most organized and efficient I have had the pleasure of relying on. They even made sure to find me on pick up, when I was in the wrong place, calling me to locate me. That is top notch. They also have a gift shop that has snacks and drinks, even champagne, for purchase if the restaurant Willoughby's is not open. The front desk was also helpful, no questions asked, when we requested a switch of room location from ground level in front of the elevator to a more quieter less trafficked room.
user_name:
sparkle099
New York City, New York

review_body: This is a great place to stay when making connections between inter island and international flights. The staff are friendly and the rooms clean and comfortable. The pool is a good place to refresh and the restaurant serves good quality meals at a very reasonable price. The free shuttle is an excellent service offered by this property, runs every half hour from the hotel. If you are arriving once you collect your bags ring the hotel on the courtesy phone in the arrivals area and they will advise you where the pick up will be and the shuttle arrives within a 15 minute wait. Will stay there again when transferring through Honolulu.

This is my second review of this hotel. Once again I find a need to just spend an overnight near HNL due to a very early flight to LAX. The shuttle is great as it runs 24 hours. The accommodations are basic yet clean and comfortable. You are near the industrial area around HNL but there are many options to order food for delivery. Note that the onsite restaurant is closed Fri/Sat/Sun/Mon but there is a sister property that is accessible by shuttle.

Pros:- Super friendly staffs- Clean room and bathroom- Great location for flight transition -- close to HNL airport with complimentary shuttles and the bus stationsCons:- Humid/moldy smell in the room if you don't keep the temperature low- Loud noise from and A/C (Not every room has a niosy A/C. If you happened to have one, ask to change the room.)- Pillows are tall and tough -- not very comfortable- The rate is a bit high given it is a 2.5 star hotel

We stayed in this hotel for about 28 days. All of the staff was very nice and helpful. They picked us up at the hotel and helped with all of our luggage. We are a family of 5 and with moving to the island we obviously came with a ton of luggage. They even helped us load our luggage the day of check out. The first day we arrived everyone in the front desk was very welcoming and helpful. They took their time and answered all of our questions and pointed us in the right direction. We also appreciated the vouchers they offered us for their restaurant. We enjoyed breakfast and dinner there when they served it. I LOVE their Bread pudding! ( definitely a must try) We enjoyed the pool and gym aswell. Our housekeeper (LORNA) was so nice and amazing to us. WiFi was great I was able to hook all of our devices including our Roku with no problem. The TLA brief they held was also very informative and helpful, especially to us since this was our first overseas move. Shout out to Les, Matthew (shuttle driver) Lorna and merly (house keepers), John (waiter at the restaurant) and all the front desk staff i didn't catch all their names but they were all wonderful. I we definitely continue to recommend this Hotel to any of our friends who are PCS'ing to Hawaii and need a place to stay while waiting for a home.
