This intrepid wanderer had been travelling for 48 hours...the full Planes,Trains and Automobiles experience...and arriving at the Airport Honolulu Hotel was like a welcome oasis in the desert.Having pre-booked in Australia based upon Trip Advisor reviews, this great hotel lived up to every need and all expectations.The staff were Aloha-delightful, friendly, kind and obliging...just the sort of folks you want to meet when all you want to do is sleep, relax and refresh.Lovely room overlooking the pool, a great sleep and ready and roaring to go on my Hawaiian adventure...and all of this achieved because of a charming venue and the thoughtful attitude of the staff.MAHALO

The hotel was great at helping me and my family with information, super friendly associates and awesome military liason named Les. They picked us up in the complimentary shuttle, helped with our bags and pointed us in the direction of shops and restaurants immediately. Matthew was at the bell desk and helped us carry our bags to our room on the second floor. He made sure we knew exactly was going on helped us make us feel at home here. They offer meal vouchers to families to use in the hotel restaurant which are extremely helpful. They are pet friendly. I would absolutely recommend this hotel to all military who don't have a home or can stay on post. It's 5 minute drive to Pearl Harbor and about 20-25 minutes to scofield barracks. Thank you, Honolulu Airport Hotel for everything!

We stayed here for one night only – we had an early morning flight and it seemed easier than trying to get back from the city.Apart from some confusion about the shuttle when we arrived, the overall experience was pleasant. As some people have mentioned here, it is right next to the highway and can be noisy. But the rooms were clean, the staff were friendly and the shuttle is available 24 hours a day. And the reality is, that’s what we needed after a long flight and an early morning onwards journey.As an added bonus, the beaches are only a quick $30-$40 cab ride away and there’s a decent little strip mall just around the corner (I can recommend the L&L BBQ there).

I have stayed at Airport Honolulu Hotel several times either for business, medical or personal reasons. I go back because the staff is amazing and it feels like my home away from home. All the front desk staff are friendly, professional and courteous, but I must say that Ann, Kehau, Rose and Ralph take it to another level and their amazing customer service is what keeps me coming back even if there are other hotel options. The airport shuttle is extremely quick, reliable and convenient.

Cleaned rooms everyday. Friendly staff. Wished rooms had kitchenettes for those whom have to stay more than a week. Honolulu is expensive to eat out everyday. Did not realize that guests had to pay for parking which I do not understand especially since we are paying for hotel rooms. Parking is terrible. Thank you to Marilyn for all her help.

Kind of a dump, it is right on highway....very loud street noise. But, close to the airport! Manager was rude. Walking distance to a 24 hour McDonalds. Two builds, they do not connect, you feel like you are staying in the ghetto......old hotel that has not been kept up...kinda smells old too.

The hotel people were nice. But TripAdvisor didn't notify my reservation to the hotel, so when I got there I didn't have a reservation. It took a long time to get my room because of that. It was a long trip for me to get there and I was so tired, I wasn't happy about TripAdviser.

Honestly speaking I booked this hotel because everything else was sold out. Even though those were the circumstances on how I end up in this hotel I have to admit that it was a good choice. The hotel has great customer service (Everyone has done a great job) it is geolocate in the center of everything. For example if you are military the Navy NEX super store where you can find anything...... Lastly is the $10 voucher for meals, if you are PCSing into Hawaii those $10 become great savings on your move.

I spent one afternoon and one short night at the Airport Honolulu Hotel. There are a few positive things to mention which are the free airport shuttle and the pool. However, being more or less literally underneath the highway, the pool area is very loud.What I do consider insufficient is that the restaurant works only a couple of days a week. For an airport hotel, that is quite disappointing.Last but not least, I think it is over-priced. If I hadn't had a 7 a.m. morning flight to the mainland, I would have gone to Waikiki, paid less and have enjoyed the beach once more.

My family and I just PCS to Hawaii. The staff of Airport Honolulu Hotel has helped us process the thought of being so far away. Thanks to all the ladies at the front desk, Matthew for all the information he has given and answering any questions we had. Thanks to the hotel, our first impression on Hawaii has been a great one.

We booked this hotel as it was very close to the airport and needed to be back the next day. There was a shuttle bus to collect from the airport once we had arrived...supposedly. We had been travelling for 19 hours from England and rang as soon as we collected our bags, as instructed. However, we had to ring 3 times and wait for well over 1 1/2 hours to be collected. When we eventually got there the receptionist said that we had only rang once - I don't think so! We wanted to file a complaint with the manager, who wasn't there at that time of night. They were not there in the morning either until 9am, after we left. The receptionist took my email address and said the manager would be in touch. However, we did not hear a thing...surprise, surprise. Very disappointing.

My wife and I stayed here for one night after flying in from Maui and before a 10 hour flight to Australia the next day. It is so convenient for a quick stop between flights. The shuttle to and from the terminals is excellent. Check in was quick and the lobby is welcoming. There is an onsite convenience store for those essentials. There is easy access (4-5 mins walk) to a nearby row of stores with several fast food outlets. If you choose to eat at the hotel restaurant (Willoughbys) keep in mind that it is not open every night. On the nights it is closed, there is a free frequent shuttle to the hotel's nearby sister property with a restaurant. Willoughbys is open every morning for breakfast. The room is a little dated, but everything works, the shower delivered good pressure hot water, the tv had about 80 channels, and most importantly the room was very clean. The bed was comfortable enough to get some quality sleep. The only downside is the large in-room air conditioning unit that needs to stay running to stop the room becoming a sauna - but this can actually be a blessing, as the white noise from the air con deadens the noise from departing aircraft nearby. The staff were also very friendly and helpful.My only gripe was the lack of staff in the morning, and lack of an express check out option. I went to the lobby at 945am to check out, hoping to get the 10am courtesy shuttle to the terminal. There was only 2 people in front of me (1 being served and 1 queued). The one being served was having issues, as they were on their cell phone and the staff member kept ducking out to the office behind the check in counter. After about 12 minutes they moved on and the next person stepped up. That person then also too appeared to have an issue checking in as the staff member was tapping and clicking at the computer with a bewildered look. At 959am I had to excuse myself and interrupt and say that I have to just leave the room keys and go. They advised that it was fine as long as I don't need a receipt. It would be so much easier if the hotel had an express check out option, where you can leave the keys in the room or at reception and have any charges billed to you and the receipt emailled to you. Most other hotels I have stayed at all had this option. It would be great here, and the majority of guests checking out from an airport hotel have planes to catch. As I said, this was my only gripe and it is very minor. I will certainly stay at this hotel again next time I fly out of Honolulu.

We arrived at 8.30am after an overnight flight from new Zealand, the staff were very friendly & even as check in wasn't until 3pm they asked us to check back with them in an hour or two. We did this & were in our room having a sleep by 10.30.Our room was clean & very well appointed. Very happy as a one might stay before heading to Seattle. Also it's really close to the airport & they also have a shuttle to get you too & from the airport.

Our flight home to the neighbor island was cancelled due to the weather. I called Airport Honolulu Hotel directly and made last minute reservations. I was pleasantly surprised that they had rooms available and the room fees were very reasonable. I have stayed there multiple times and always the rooms are very clean.

My brother and I had a wonderful experience staying at the hotel from July 7-18, 2016. We were visiting Hawaii for medical reason.When we first checked in,(our first time in this hotel), we were greeted with a warm aloha spirit and great smiles. Even our room attendants were respectful, accommodating and gave us big smiles while cleaning our room.We will certainly come back again, as Airport Honolulu Hotel will certainly be our home away from home. Special mentions go out to: Lei,Marilou,Ralph,Marites and Merly for a job well done. Thank you all.AMANDA LG CRUZ andRAYMOND LG CRUZ

We booked this hotel for a stay after flying overnight back from Bangkok. We were able to check-in early and found the room clean, neat and comfortable. The front desk staff were very helpful and the free shuttle was quick and efficient. I would definitely stay here again.

Not usually our first choice due to expense, but by far much nicer hotel than the one down the street we usually go to. The rooms are spacious and clean, with large clean rooms. We ate in the hotel restaurant and each had a very good meal that was reasonably priced. My favorite was the pool, which was very warm. Was a little disappointed there was not a hot tub nor restrooms out near the pool, but it made up for that. Would highly recommend for any one needing to stay near the airport.

OK, let's be clear. This is not a destination hotel. It's a place you pass through going someplace else. So different rules apply.You want efficient and hassle free shuttle. Tick. You want quick check in and out. Tick. You want the room basics. Tick. You want efficient dining and unobtrusive wait staff who just move it along quickly. Tick. Job done and move on.

I picked the Airport Honolulu hotel for a quick one night stay between island transfers. Our flight arrived in from Canada at 10pm local time, which felt like 2am to us. The pick up by the hotel 24 hour shuttle went super smooth: a quick call on the courtesy phone by the luggage carousel and 5 min later the shuttle arrived. The driver was very friendly and courteous. The rooms are basic but beds and pillows comfortable and all was very clean. Breakfast on site was great as we were all starving at 6:30am. Service at the restaurant was very friendly and reasonably quick. Kids pancake meal was the perfect size for my daughter.The pool area is fine- opens at 9am with checkout at noon, letting kids get in a swim before we use the shuttle again to go back to the airport.

Old, tired hotel with terrible beds...right next to the freeway..We had no sleep before our 7 am flight to Australia. This was the second time we booked this hotel. First time, in 2005 on our way from New Zealand. The first time was terrible as well, ( poop in the toilet), but I did't write my review at the time. We thought thing got chaged , but no. The paint in the bathroom was old, and there were termites droppings next to the bathroom sink. I looked up and right above, in the ceiling, was a hole....I wish I could leave a positive review, but I can't. The only thing is going on for this hotel, is the very nice staff.

I've been staying at this hotel a little over a week now, the service here is great! Everyone is so nice and helpful, and my room always looks amazing. The lady that cleans my room every day, Nieda, has been so friendly and great at her job, makes you feel like your right at home!

Very friendly helpful staff and free transfer to airport which leaves every 30 mins on the hour!Reasonable price rooms. Good size. Comfortable They also have a restaurant/bar which I didn't use as I got in late and left early, but it's there because there isn't any thing close by Cheers Lisa

Near the Airport, shuttle to sister hotel when not serving dinner. Starbucks and McDonald's within walking distance and Hertz rental cars next to hotel. Bus stop out front of hotel and taxi service right outside the parking lot. Friendly Staff.Washer and dryer.

Perfect fit.-every 30 minute an airport shuttle was available-even the gift shop has cheaper rates on souvenirs-front desk was very courteous-the room was comfortable for our needs, bathroom was clean-we had our own food to last us the entire time we were there but the hotel had a restaurant and a vending machine.

This hotel is about a mile from Honolulu's domestic/internationalairport so perfect for a quick stop over. Rooms comfortable and there is a pool but being next to some major overhead roads noisy but serves a purpose. There is a gift shop at the hotel and free courtesy transfers to airport. Not far from a small food court - walking distance. Hotel restaurant not opening every day but on the days it's not hotel provides free transport to its sister hotel the Best Western for meals. Shuttle buses depart every 30 minutes.

I have been staying at this Hotel for many years now and I can highly recommend it for either it's convenience to the Airport, free shuttle, or even for a entire vacation stay if you have a rental car or are willing to use the excellent Honolulu Bus service. The rooms are up to date, well kept, and offer all possible amenities, Free Wi-Fi, Microwave, Refrigerator, etc. The staff is most helpful and most of them have served for many years now. Staff members such as "Kehau" at the front desk have provided me with many years of friendly service and if you require anything during your stay you can count on her to assist you. The bottom line is do not hesitate to book the "Honolulu Airport Hotel".

We only stayed at Airport Honolulu Hotel as we had an early morning flight.As soon as we walked in the room we found bugs on the wall. We thought there were only a few until the next morning when we got rid of ten of them.I also found four bugs in my hand bag.We had family in the next room who also had bugs in their room.We were all disappointed as we paid $230 per room.

This was my third stay at the hotel and I never knew that it was a pet friendly hotel. If they're going to allow pets to stay at the hotel, a wing should be designated for pets and their owners to stay at all times and not all over the hotel, especially away from the main building. There were problems from time to time getting connected to the internet in my room, I kept having to go up front to the main lobby to get connected. Overall, my stay at the hotel was pleasant thanks to Marilyn my Room Attendant. Marilyn was superb in making sure my room always got cleaned in a professional manner and made sure that I had fresh clean towels and other supplies all the time. She always greeted her guests with a big smile on her face. If the hotel was giving out awards for Outstanding Performer, she should most definitely be one of the recipients.

Rooms are large, quiet, and well kept. Gift shop is well stocked. Airport shuttle every 30 minutes is a plus. Staff is friendly. Restaurant is open for breakfast daily, but only open for dinner on weeknights. They recommend their sister property a couple of blocks away and will shuttle there for free; still lacking dinner facilities on weekends is a big minus.

Front desk lady, Lei, was super nice and friendly. The room was a little outdated but not by much. The kind size bed was amazing and super comfy. Lots of airport noise so if that bothers you then definitely don't stay here. The only thing I didn't like about this place is that the pool closes at 7 pm. I found that to be really odd. The hallways smell like laundry soap which is a nice change of pace from the usual hotel hallway smells! Really close to the PHH base which was nice for us since we needed to take hubby to work everyday. Literally right now the road. The location of the hotel is odd too. Kind of a pain to get to but nice overall !

Due to a flight delay, the wife and I had an extra day in Honolulu so we reserved a room at the Airport Honolulu Hotel. This is literally within walking distance of the airport terminals, so while very convenient and with a 24 hr shuttle, the only drawback I noticed was that the street noise started up very early in the morning. Also, on weekends there is no dinner at the hotel restaurant, although behind the hotel and around the corner are barbecue, pizza, and other restaurants. Wifi was free but insecure (no password at all) so I was not willing to use it for any financial transactions. All staff at the hotel were very friendly and helpful. My wife had fallen on our trip and injured her leg, and the hotel staff was able to put us up in a handicap-accessible room, which helped a lot. Bed was comfortable and room had refrigerator and microwave as well. Not a resort hotel, but was a friendly, comfortable, and convenient stay.

We stayed here for our last night on Oahu, in order to grab a couple extra hours of rest before an early flight, and to avoid dealing with traffic and rental car return even before starting a long travel day.We might have been a little spoiled after 8 nights at the Four Seasons -- but this hotel was fine for what it was. Nothing fancy, but quiet, clean and comfortable. There was in-room complimentary coffee, nice toiletries with a pleasant, light scent, and good water pressure. There was free wifi. The free shuttle to the airport was convenient, and the staff were nice.I just really wish the hotel had a safe in the room. At the price point, and for an airport hotel, I would expect a safe. Other than that, the Airport Honolulu Hotel was fine for a 1-night stay.

We flew in from Maui and were picked up by hotel bus about midday so had the whole afternoon to do as we pleased before flying out very early next morning. We were directed by the helpful staff to the bus stop across the road which took us to Perl Harbor, so spent the afternoon there, before going shopping and dinner at Pearl Ridge center. Great bargains there all so easy. Would recommend staying here if you have an early flight out of Honolulu.

It is not the Conrad Hilton but it is ok if you have no issues with dogs sleeping in the rooms with their owners. We found little bugs but nothing it could scare your sleep away. However it beats the rush hours near the airport. I spent a lot of time during rush hour in Oahu. So I decided not to talk a chance with a big trip on Sunday Some people use this hotel just to move across islands

We were in town for my son's deployment homecoming at Pearl Harbor. The hotel was handy to everything we were doing. The bed was comfortable, the room was clean and the shower good. The restaurant served a great breakfast and the one night we had dinner was very good also. The pool area is a nice oasis in the middle of a busy highway and airport area. If there was anything that was negative, I would have to say the tight parking. Other than that we had a very enjoyable stay.

Harder to drive to this hotel because it has one entrance along Nimitz Hwy. Parking lot is secure and you have to have a pass displayed at all times. Hotel staff is very friendly. Rooms are clean and housekeeping does a great job with anything you might need. Same store in the hotel for anything you may have forgotten. Easy walk to McDonalds, Starbucks, Jamba Juice. Easy access to Nimitz Hwy. Wifi is free. Restaurant is open every day for breakfast and a few nights for dinner. Fridges and microwaves in the rooms.

The staff was very friendly and helpful. The restaurant staff were some of the friendliest people I have ever met, as well. The hotel itself was average. I applaud them for constantly working on it, but there were a few things that I did not like. One of the elevators seemed to always get stuck and the beds were in dire need of replacement. For the cost per night at the hotel, I was expecting a room that was upgraded more. The customer service made up for the negatives that the rooms had.

Clean rooms, bathroom nice and clean, beds comfy. Good tv and air con was good if a little noisy. Some of the rooms face the motorway which can get noisy. Breakfast was good, service was a little slow but overall a good stay. The hotel is dated and in need of repair especially in the lobby where some of the aircon was leaking.

My family and I just moved again for the military and had a reservation at a particular hotel which was charging a tremendous amount of money for pets based on a daily scale. At the last minuet we stumbled across this hotel and they immediately squared us away. They had all kinds of incentives for people in my situation, relieved the stress of the move and provided resort quality hospitality. The front desk woman by the name of Sue knew all the in's and outs of the process and even contacted the other hotel for my required paperwork. The housekeeper Janice ensured I had coffee in my room everyday, my rooms were always cleaned" I had 2 adjoining rooms". I also ha an issue with one of my toilets and they contacted maintenance right away and they resolved the issue in 20 minuets. This was after hours so I assume they have staff on 24hrs a day. Their sister restaurant located at the Best Western had excellent servers. Ramone memorized my families name and their drinks and offered great insight about the area. James was another server who gave some pointers of the Island life. They both were familiar with the menus and continuously asked if we needed anything else. Upon checkout, once again the process which is overwhelming because of the bill,they offered a great option for people in my position. When I move out of Hawaii I will definitely be staying at this hotel. The hotel was very clean and they are doing great upgrades to accommodate people in my position.

We stayed here on the first and last night in Hawaii purely because it is close to the airport and the hotel runs a shuttle. The rooms were fairly large with fridge, microwave and coffee maker. The free wifi has a strong signal. Some nights dinner is served, otherwise a food court is nearby as well as the option of taking the shuttle to the sister hotel. Lots of military put up in this hotel. The second time we arrived late morning and were pleased we were able to get our room straight away. The lady on the desk did her best to get us a quiet room as there is a lot of noise from the H1 nearby.

It was great to have the convenience of the Airport to Hotel shuttle. This came promptly once we had located where the telephone was located.The room was good standard and the bed lovely and comfortable. Staff were helpful, giving directions to the local bus stop so we could take a quick trip to Ala Moana centre. Good to have free wifi.
user_name:
bade f
Greater Wellington, New Zealand

review_body: I normally don't take the time to write reviews, but, I felt compelled to share my experience. My stay at the Airport Honolulu Hotel was great!!! The rooms were clean, the beds were comfortable and the staff was super courteous. This hotel is pet friendly, and reasonable in price. The wifi service is the best I have used in a hotel setting. The service and hospitality here is unparalleled by any hotel on the mainland, especially in regard to price.The in hotel restaurant was good, however the menu is not very large.A bonus is that it is close to the airport. What more could you ask for?I will definitely stay again upon the conclusion of my stay in Hawaii.

I had a wonderful time and stay very clean and simple . Staff very friendly especially "Numi" very ALOHA! Definitely returning. Great Location very close to the airport, good for overnight or two and who here to work close by airport and pearl Harbor area.

This is a simple, old-fashioned hotel with large rooms and an attached dining room. We enjoy staying here whenever we are waiting for our flights at the airport as they offer a shuttle bus for the 10 min drive to the airport. The food is good if we have a long-enough stay to take advantage of it.

We had a 10 hour stop in Hawaii, arriving at 3am in the morning. The hotel room was clean, beds comfortable, shower great & wifi fast. Everything we needed for a quick stop before the next leg of our trip.

The staff is super friendly and welcoming. The room was clean, but if you are looking for sleek and up to date this isn't it. It's all well kept, just a bit older. The restaurant is open daily for breakfast, but not dinner. They offer a shuttle to their sister hotel for the days it isn't. It's also close to fast food and a Starbucks.

Why does the USA have so much trouble getting people into rooms earlier than 3pm! The internet was terrible and the breakfast omelette was huge which isnt really a problem! The room was fine and the bed and pillow wonderful. Kept losing the channel we were watching on TV. Lovely pool and lots of food outlets near by but dont go to the chinese restaurant just down from Thrifty rentals. It was truly awful. Loved the shuttle. Thank you. I did think it quite expensive for what we got but then that seems true of the whole of Hawaii, an expensive place!

With an early flight out we had no choice but to come back to HNL from Big Island the night before. The airport hotel was perfectly adequate. Shuttle and driver very helpful. Room was good standard, quiet, overlooking warehouses in the rear.I Googled nearby eating houses and had a mad thought that we might stroll along. One look out the main entrance was enough to persuade me otherwise. Motorways and commercial fortresses, brisk winds and noise await the foolish pedestrian. The on-site eatery was tolerable but not open every night (splits with sister hotel along the road, free shuttle).

I had a very nice 5-day stay at the Airport Honolulu Hotel. I found the room comfortable and relaxing. I found all the hotel staff to be very hospitable. My housekeeper was helpful, she was pleasant and happy as we passed in the hallways. I enjoyed breakfast at the hotel and working outside by the pool area. I found the hotel very economical on my budget and would recommend to anyone looking for a nice place to stay.

Main thing going for this hotel is the location, it's just at the exit of Honolulu airport with a free 24 hr shuttle service. Other than that the hotel is ok but not great. Linen, carpet and services were clean but generally felt very dated and a bit grubby in places, corridors smelt a bit musty, greasy marks on paint near switches etc. Assuming you just want a place to rest for an early morning flight then it fits the bill and is more convenient than getting transport in/out of Waikiki.

Nice hotel specially if somebody else is paying for it. Hotel shuttle to and from the airport. Nice staff. They almost know one's woes for getting stranded. But the service is accommodating and pleasant. We will come back to this hotel whether we pay for it or not.

I recently relocated to the area. Although the accommodations (rooms) could be better, customer service has been great! Matthew in particular went above and beyond helping my family and I! Thank you so much Matthew!!! We appreciate you!!

It was very nice, came back every day to a clean room and clean towels, the pool area is great. The restaurant in the hotel is absolutely wonderful I would go back just for the food and the experience lol you get your drink in a fancy wine glass no matter what you are drinking there is open windows where you can see outside and hear the beautiful birds. I went there for breakfast every morning, I also got a $10 meal voucher. There's also a little shopette in case you need anything like medicine or food or plastic ware etc... I definitely recommend this hotel.

All the service personnel go over and above the call of duty - and seem genuinely glad to help with everything. Our bellman doubled as shuttle driver and he was terrific. A bonus is the little gift and sundry shop where you can buy snacks and goodies for your microwave in the room. All in all, a way better than average airport hotel.
user_name:
Lynette S
Hoolehua, Hawaii, United States

review_body: We stayed at this hotel the night prior to our international flight - I'd definitely recommend this place. For a hotel adjacent to the airport, the rooms were surprisingly quiet. There's a restaurant and plenty of eating options nearby. The staff were friendly & professional. The airport shuttle runs every half hour to & from the airport

Excellent location for overnight close to airport. Shuttle service prompt. Only five minutes from airport. Good rooms, clean, pleasant restaurant on premises. Staff friendly and helpful . Would definitely stay again and recommend for a short one night stay

The service is good. The staff, Rofel, is very nice. She kept my room clean and gave me good information to travel around. The hotel is a very convenient place to the attractive place is honolulu. I really enjoy the time living here.

The hotel is 5 minutes from the airport so it's great for an overnight layover. They have s shuttle, pool, and restaurant. The food is great and the property is family friendly. They are 2.5 miles from the Arizona Memorial and USS Missouri. Famous Waikiki Beach is only 8 miles. Besides the pool amenities include microwave, refrigerator, coffee maker, free wifi, laundry, hairdryer and ironing board. There is also a very small fitness center. ATM in the lobby. The negatives are that it is surrounded on three sides by freeway overpasses so the noise is constant and the restaurant doesn't serve lunch. There is a sister property one block away that had excellent lunch and a few small places such as Subway within walking distance. I didn't have a car since my stay was short so I took the bus to Waikiki one day to shop. The bus stop is right outside the hotel and the information provided in the room tells you what bus to take. It's $5.00 round trip.

We spent one night at this airport hotel on a Sunday. The restaurant is not open for dinner on sundays but their shuttle will drive you to their sister hotel where a restaurant is open. We did have breakfast in the morning as it is open. Very good service and I recommend the eggs benedict. They were simply delecious. Our room was very clean with big screen tv and small fridge. Since our flight was only in the evening, we got our stored our suitcases at the reception and spent the rest of the day by the pool. There is not much to see or do near the hotel.

I had an awesome experience during my stay at the Airport Honolulu Hotel.. The Staff was very professional from the Bell Desk, to front counter Check In, and any other place or Staff contact which was made....To name some of the Staff that extended extra care and attention help was Matthew, Bell Desk, Sharon, Café, Susie and Kehau, Front Desk, Myra, Sweetlyn, Patey, Wilimina, Myrna, and Darwin Store, and Norma in Housekeeping....A special Thanks to all especially Hotel Management for adhering to a concern that I had.... MAHALO-THANK YOU ALL BYE..
user_name:
fay6157
Coastal South Carolina, South Carolina

review_body: From the moment we walked into the lobby .. the hotel has a relaxed, clean ambiance. After check-in we walked by the gift shop that was also a mini grocery store. Cool!!You can buy just about anything you forgot at home and even take chips, soda, beer or wine to your room to relax. Our room was clean, large and overlooked the pool area. We definitely would stay again and certainly recommend.Franky

Airport Honolulu Hotel is very close to the airport and has free transfer to and from the Airport which was extremely handy. It literally took minutes to get picked up and dropped off. The hotel staff were friendly and the room for the price was above my expectations.

Ridiculous - they charge $20 for more than 2 guests in a room. Not sure if it's per guests or just flat fee. We had 3 people staying in our room; a couple and 1 other person. It's not like they had to bring another bed in the room or anything. Pretty furious about that extra charge! So, if they only expect 2 people to stay in a room, then they should have twin beds in there. And, they only had towels for 2 people, so had to call for more.Filter in a/c unit was dirty. Room was clean, but nothing special. Pillows were too thick.I must say, they have made tremendous improvements in renovating since I was last there many years ago, so that's something positive.Restaurant has good food with portion sizes to match the slightly high prices.

Stayed for a cancelled flight. Shuttle driver was nice as well as the front desk agents. Dinner was served at their sister property and everyone was nice. Even though our stay was because of the airlines we were treated well by all that we were in contact with.

A fairly standard hotel with no particular virtues or vices. The restaurant was closed when we stayed, so they provide a shuttle to/from the Best Western so one can eat there. We were not impressed with the Best Western menu though, so we walked to a nearby business centre which had a choice of eating places including MacDonalds a pizza place and a sushi bar. It's about a 200yd walk from the hotel.The 24 hour shuttle service to the airport operates every half hour. To pick it up at the airport you have to call on a free phone number and they come and pick you up.

Hotel location was excellent.. I was there overnight in order to connect to an early morning flight. Shuttle to and from airport was free and easy, service was excellent, friendly, and on time.Once I arrived to the hotel, staff were friendly and helpful. I didn't wait long for check in and room availability. They were very informative of dining, shopping, entertainment, and most especially their security.When checking out everything was already in place. Shuttle service was on time and I was able to get to my destination with ease.

Great place to stay, employees are very friendly. I like the location close to everything, it's like Centralized, rooms are very clean and well kept. I know I will be back there again l'm in town and also will let my family and friends know about this hotel.

I stayed at this hotel for 7 weeks while attending training in Honolulu. I found the hotel staff to be warm and friendly, willing to go above and beyond to assist me with any need that I had. They made me feel like family, checking in with me to see how my training was going and if I needed anything. The hotel property was clean and sufficiently appointed for my needs. They had on-site laundry, a convenience store and gym. The pool was a welcome respite after a long day. The location is great. Walking distance to the airport and post office. The bus stop was just outside the hotel entrance. It was only a short stroll to some restaurants. Grocery and drug store were only a mile away.

We chose this hotel for the convenience to the airport after a late flight, and before departing on an early flight the next morning. It seemed perfect and we all looked forward to getting a bite to eat and stretching out on a bed instead of an airplane seat. When we arrived and collected our luggage, we called for the airport shuttle and were told to walk a few doors down and it would be on it's way. After walking to the curbside and waiting for twenty minutes, I called back to the hotel to see what schedule was for the shuttle. The friendly dispatcher said--'a 5 to-20 minute wait' Since we had already waited twenty minutes, we figured it must be any moment until the shuttle arrived. Wrong. After another twenty or so minutes we gave up and started to look for a cab for the extremely short distance to the hotel. Sure enough, when we were marching towards the cab stand, the shuttle arrived-- over a 40 minute wait. The ride is short to the hotel and once at the hotel, I saw signs that the shuttle runs on the half hour. I don't know whey we weren't told that when we called for pickup. Perhaps we just missed one when we had to wait, but even if, it shouldn't have been so long. Once we finally got to checkin, the front desk staff were sweet and slow. There were two guests being helped when we arrived and we were first in line. It still took 15 mins to wait!! All the staff were courteous and friendly. I think the service leaves much to be desired.

I booked into the Airport hotel simply for the convenience and location! I had an early flight with Jetstar and decided to stay close and use the free shuttle service. I arrived from Waikiki at 11pm and check in was quick and easy. My room was very clean and very comfortable and wifi worked well. Although I only stayed for 6 hours I was at ease knowing I was close to the terminal. It did cost $245AU for this convenience and it is a shame that there are no late night, last minute check in rates for such short stays.The free shuttle service was punctual and took only 5 minutes to reach the terminal. The little store was open until 11pm and I made it just in time for a last minute snack purchase. Overall it's a clean hotel in a convenient location with lovely service. Mahalo. Happy and safe travels.

The staff member at reception was friendly and helpful and gave good advice for dining which is only available on some nights of the week, the other nights require a shuttle ride or short walk to sister hotel close by. My room was clean and quiet. The shuttle service is excellent and was a reason for this choice of this hotel. A handy stopover if you are going to other islands and don't wish to go to downtown Honolulu

Due to flight timing I selected this hotel which is only 5 minutes from HNL. It's close proximity is clearly it's primary benefit. The desk staff was 2nd rate, slow and unfocused. The room was very clean and basic. The highway and airport are, of course, just outside the hotels, but the windows are not insulated, so the room has noise which can be masked by the a/c unit.The restaurant is closed some days, so you have to take a shuttle to another hotel. Also, and ridiculously, the restaurant doesn't open until 6:30 a.m. for breakfast. This is a hotel designed to serve travelers on short time breaks. I guess it just doesn't understand the core notion of its business - which seems to be for military families transiting Hawaii.Skip it unless you have a very short turn.

We both were greeted with a welcome Aloha and friendly staff after phoning for a free airport pickup by their own shuttle which leaves every half hour 24/7.The room is huge, comfy large bed, good air conditioning, great shower & bathroom, fridge (no freezer part) coffee machine & paper cups. No cutlery or ceramic cups, which could be of benefit. Heaps of TV channels, good sitting area for eating & reading.Our room was close to the pool & highway which both were noisy, but expected being so close to the airport & highway. Price is good value for what it provides. Hallways are like long hospital ones, no colour or pictures, easy to get lost and find elevators as everything is cream. Hallways have ice makers, dispensing machines for drink, snacks etc. Good laundry room and convenient shop downstairs in lobby.We didn't go to the restaurant as prices were high for dinner which comprised of mainly burgers, so we ate in our rooms, close takeaway is only a 5 minute walk away & even a McDonalds.Convenient & good value :-)

I chose this hotel due to close access to the Airport. I was staying overnight before flying on to Vegas. After reading other reviews I was expecting an average hotel and this is what I got. It was comfortable, has excellent wifi, excellent bed, excellent shower, but has a rather tired look with a number of areas needing some tlc. The little retail food store suited my needs and the free airport shuttle was much appreciated. Front desk service was efficient and friendly. I had to leave too early in the morning to try out the breakfast. Overall quite good for an overnight stay

My husband and I were staying here for four weeks. Marvelous and exceptional treatment that we've been receiving not only from the front desk staff but also the housekeeping staff. Huge thanks to Ms. Norma who has been a friendly housekeeper, welcoming us every morning with her kind smile. This is a considerable hotel that I will choose to stay whenever we plan our next visit. Thank you...
user_name:
Rajen V
Pago Pago, American Samoa

review_body: We came twice - for a day booking and an overnight. It's relatively cheap, the rooms are comfortable, practical and clean. The shuttle bus to the airport runs every 30 minutes which is handy. I'd recommend it for being exactly what it is - neither over promises or under delivers.

Our family was relocating back to the mainland, travelling with several pieces of luggage and 3 pets. The property met all of our needs and then some. The connecting rooms provided us and our pets with enough room to move about for our 3 day stay. The staff were exceptional, especially Manager Reid Kobashigawa, our housekeeper Gigi and the bellman, Alika. The food at the restaurant was excellent. The gift shop had a wide variety of items and they were open until 11pm. I would highly recommend this hotel. They far exceeded the Aloha spirit!

After our plane had to land in Honolulu because of maintenance issues with the in-flight computer, American Airlines put us up at the Airport Honolulu Hotel. Although much of it was due to agreements with the airline, we were greeted and taken care of by efficient, courteous staff.The airport shuttle picked us up at baggage claim for the quick, easy trip to the hotel. We had to stand in line for our room assignment, but staff worked efficiently (even at 3 a.m. in the morning!) The room was not posh, but was very clean; the mattress inviting, and the towels were clean, fluffy and white!Breakfast is served both here and at its sister hotel - The Best Western - Plaza Hotel. Breakfast is ala carte at Willoughby's in the lobby. There is no lunch, but we went to the Plaza for dinner. There is a shuttle available from the lobby every hour and on the half hour. The pool is open from 9-7 pm, and the fitness center from 6-10 pm. There is also WiFi, newspapers, ATM, laundry, and cribs available.

This is not a fancy resort. However, this is a basic, clean, enjoyable place to stay. The staff are pleasant and helpful. The restaurant has good food and the wait staff fantastic. If you do not want to fight the traffic of Waikiki, want easy access to all the sights, and just need a clean place to lay your head at night, this is the place.

We stayed after arriving at 10 pm and were connecting to Maui the following morning. Pleasant frond desk staff, although one was in training and was a little distracted. Room was spotlessly clean and comfortable for one night. Wifi was quick. We didn't pay full price as we redeemed a free night on hotels.com and the cost was only 67.00, but I don't think we wou.ld have liked to have paid full price. The only real grizzle is the pillows on the bed were more like cushions. Very strange. Efficient shuttle service to and from airport but when you arrive internationally you have to call them to let them know where you are

My father is a Vietnam veteran and retired United States Marine who served over 20 years for our country. He recently underwent Quadruple Bypass Surgery and when he was discharged, he chose Airport Honolulu Hotel to stay until he was stable enough to fly home to the Philippines. I reached out to the Guest Services Manager, Daren and explained my father's situation. He went above and beyond the call of duty and made sure that my dad received the best care possible. The entire staff is just amazing. My father is greatly thankful and so am I!

We stayed before flying home because of the close proximity to the airport. The room was cool, clean and very comfortable. The staff were very friendly and the shuttle service was great. Free wifi was an added bonus

This hotel, only 5 minutes by hotel provided shuttle bus, is clean and comfortable for overnight stays in Honolulu. Friendly staff, good breakfast options, with clean comfortable beds. We have been staying here for over 10 years through various managing changes and continue to appreciate the positive features and location.This is not the hotel if looking for Waikiki beaches etc although the hotel does have an inviting pool surrounded by the tropical vegetation. It is used by families with children I believe for short stays

We had a very comfortable stay at the hotel. The service was great - quick pickup by shuttle, friendly reception, helpful bellboy, charming waitress. We really had a Hawaiian welcome.The facilities are aging but clean. Breakfast was good.The hotel is rather out of the way for tourism but great for a late airport arrival or early departure. We will stay again.

Stayed here for 3 months while looking for a place to live...my hubby got stationed here in Hawaii...Loved the breakfast....My maid "NORMA" was so nice! She's always smiling and happy whenever i see her...i feel bad she had to clean our messy room everyday but she ws cool abt it lol THANKS NORMA!!! :)

Due to mechanical problems on our airplane, American Airlines gave us a voucher to stay at the Honolulu Airport Hotel. We, along with many others from our airplane, were greeted at the front desk, and even though it was at 2:30 a.m., we were all quickly checked in and given meal vouchers. At that point, none of us knew when we would be able to re-book our tickets, so there was much lack of information. The staff at Honolulu Airport Hotel worked with us in such a friendly and helpful way, it really helped this potentially stressful situation turn out to be a fun mini-vacation. They worked with American to have our room available for us until their shuttle took us to the airport 2 days later. In the meantime, they provided suggestions for places to eat, things to do, and how to use the handy city bus to get to the places we chose to go, like Waikiki Beach and Pearl Harbor. The staff in the restaurant knew of our situation and asked of our current status. They were great servers and the food was always great, too! The bell man was also very helpful in all our shuttle needs. When it was time to leave, we felt like we were leaving family in our home away from home in Honolulu!

i had 1 overnight in this hotel. My room was very simple but clean. In the restaurant they serve good food and the staff is friendly. Also at thre reception the staff was friendly and gave me good suggestion about public transportation. This hotel is not at the top but the prices are also reasonable

The Shuttle picked us up quickly on arrival after 12 hours of travel. The restaurant provided good food with friendly and attentive staff. The rooms are ordinary but very clean. Good shower and a comfortable bed. We were off to Maui the next morning after a great breakfast. This was all I could ask for on over night stay. Highly recommended. We booked for a similar over night next year.

we stayed at this property for an overnight layover on our way from the east coast to australia. we arrived in the afternoon and checked into our modest, but very clean room. the hotel is located on a bus line so if you're brave enough for public transportation, you can easily get to waikiki or elsewhere in honolulu. we decided to go to ala moana for the evening and had a great night's sleep for our morning flight to sydney. it's not the best hotel in honolulu, but it was perfect for our needs.

This hotel is average and somewhat overpriced. The room décor needs to be updated, but it is clean. The hotel restaurant has a limited menu and limited hours and the décor needs updating, too. The one thing it has going for it is it's close proximity to the airport.

We have been coming to the Airport Honolulu Hotel for the past 10 years with our middle school band. The rooms are clean. The service is awesome! They always go above and beyond to accommodate our needs ... all for an affordable price! Mahalo to all the AHH staff!

My husband and I stayed here last week for his visit to the VA hospital. The staff was very helpful, the room was clean, and the beds were comfortable. We had an ADA room above the pool, but the sound proofing worked well. I wouldn't chose the hotel for a vacation, but for a one night stay in a convenient location it was fine.

Service was great. We had to stay another night as our airline (Jetstar) cancelled 2 international flights. We thank the front staff and Alex the shuttle bus driver for going beyond their rolls. I we would recommend a stay for anyone in the futureIrene and Noel from central coast NSW

My mom and I stayed at the Airport Honolulu Hotel while my father underwent knee surgery. What a great stay! The staff is friendly and welcoming. The rates are reasonable. They give a 50% discount to local residents for parking. It's easy to come and go through side entrances. They offer nice room amenities, cable TV, coffee and fast wi-fi connection. They are eco friendly. The place is clean, comfortable, casual and safe. . There's a nice outdoor pool in a private, grotto-like setting. Their restaurant, Willoughby's serves delicious meals for breakfast and dinner. Their gift store also has fresh fruit, packaged food and beverages, if you prefer to eat in your room. The housekeeping takes very good care of your needs and requests as well. We felt comfortable, welcomed and at ease there. So will you.

Only stay here if you need to be close to the airport as it doesn't offer much else. But it was friendly/clean free bus service and I slept super well so couldn't really ask for more. As a female solo traveller I felt safe here.

Minutes from the airport and rental cars. Free shuttle and within walking distance to McDonalds, L&L, Cafe Bale', etc. For military members, just a short distance from the Navy Exchange complex. Part of the Outrigger Hotel group.

We stayed here for 1 night because our reservation wasn't available until the next day. It was clean and the desk staff were friendly. The internet was free and it worked. There was a decent pool for our kids to swim in. The downsides are that there is a lot of highway noise so it wasn't exactly restful. But surprisingly we were not woken by noise at all during the night (on a Saturday).

Terrible place to stay, tried the bait and switch, called the hotel direct and made the reservation, told them 2 adults and 3 kids booked one room with my corporate rate, when we arrived called the hotel asked about the shuttle and it took them 40 minutes to show up, when we got on the bus it took 3 minutes to get to the hotel, how could it take 37 additional minutes when it only took 3 minutes to arrive? They tell me they don't allow 5 people to a room so I have to pay for an extra room, after explaining that no one told me this when I booked and that was in the notes. After they looked and had no extra rooms available they tried to charge me an extra 50.00 for the 5th person in the room, how can you charge for something you don't allow? Also $30.00 a day to park your car what the heck?After getting everything settled and going to my room the placed smelled like piss and vomit , room was dirty. Glad this was just a one night stay.

Alex and Joey are excellent porters and NIEDA is an excellent housekeeper! I stayed in the hotel for over a month and everyone made my stay comfortable and enjoyable. I appreciate everyone's hospitality at the hotel!

We used the airport honolulu hotel as we needed to leave quite early for our flight, they have a shuttle which was great and the driver very organised, room was very nice, and staff friendly, told us where to get a great meal walking distance away, all very convenient.

Our porter, Alex, was wonderfully helpful and friendly. We were traveling onto Maui and needed to store our winter baggage at the hotel. When we arrived I was concerned to find out that the hotel did not have space for our bags but Alex arranged for their storage off site, relieving much stress.thank you so much rom Jen & her kids

We were overnighting after flying in from the East Coast to catch a morning flight to Molokai. There are only a few choices to stay near the ariport so we chose this hotel. The shuttle was fast and convenient, the lobby is quite lovely and the staff were helpful. However, the room had a musty smell and was basically non-descript. I expect the room price of $180 is just Honolulu prices, but quite a bit more than the Springhill Suites in Philadelphia where we stayed the night before and no where near as nice an experience.

Anyone arriving on flight morning is stuck with their baggage until 3pm check in unless you make contact with Your Connection Hawaii. This is a valet luggage Service that takes and stores your bags and then delivers them to your hotel when you room comes available it costs about five bucks a bag. We use this service and it made all the difference to our stay. Prompt, secure, attentive service. Search yourconnectionhawaii to find it. Especially good for Airbnb guests as here is no porter or storeroom.

I booked a one night hotel and paid $290.00 for few hours of sleep to catch our next flight to NewZealand. Unfortunately we had to cancel our dream vacation to NewZealand and Australia due to sudden illness of my husband. I immediately contacted AMOM to let them know what has happened. He suggested to send them Dr's note confirming that he was not able to fly. With that note I was hoping AMOMcould convince Airpirt Honolulu Hotel to at least credit back some of our money but it seems the hotel management did not show any compassionate and understanding of our situation. I am extremely disappointed of Airport Honolulu Hotel as well as AMOM that was not able to convince them.

Room had been slightly updated, however the carpet is probably the same carpet that was in there when I was a little kid (I'm 45 now) and stayed there. Really gross and sticky is the best way to describe it. Carpet should not be sticky in any way. *shudder At least this time I didn't have a giant cockroach climb across my neck at 2:30 in the morning, bonus!

We stayed at this hotel for just one night before leaving for Maui in the morning. The hotel was very convenient to the airport but did not have all the airport noise. We had a very quiet room, comfortable bed, and found the bathroom and bedroom to be clean. The free shuttle service picked us up at the airport and returned us there in the morning. Although a bit pricey, like many other hotels in Hawaii, we had no complaints with either the room or our experience with check-in and check-out. We would not hesitate to stay here again for another overnight en route to another island.

I had an overnight stay at the Airport Honolulu Hotel. I arrived late and took the free shuttle from the airport. I was disappointed I had to go to reception (after arriving late) to get tea bags that are not provided in the room. Coffee however is provided. In fact, the coffee plunger still had a used coffee filter from the previous occupier. Aside from this, the room was very spacious and the pillows super comfy. I had a day to look around and it was easy to take the public bus to to Chinatown and Waikeke. I got the public bus back and took the shuttle back to the airport. It was very convenient. It was good to know the shuttle departs every 30 minutes so helps with planning. Do allow some time to get back from Waikeke if taking the public bus (No. 19). It can be a slow trip with people getting off and on.

I stayed in this hotel in two different occasions. First visit I had confirmation of the hotel booking however the receptionist told me I could not stay as there were not rooms available, the alternative was to go to the affiliate hotel, a Best Western hotel. I mentioned to her that I didn't understand why I had to go to another hotel when I booked to the Honolulu airport hotel and was in possession of a booing confirmation. Without saying anything the receptionist gave me the key for a room in the Honolulu airport hotel. To be honest I don't know why she wasted my time trying to send me to another hotel when clearly there were rooms available. The second time I stayed the receptionist asked me if I wanted to be in a rooms where previously there had been animals, I say no but she still sent me to the building where animals are allowed, the room and the corridor were dirty, not a nice experience, I would definitely not recommend anyone to stay in this hotel.

I arrived late in the evening and used the shuttle bus to save an extra day's car rental. The next morning, I took the shuttle back to the airport and rented the car. Very convenient. Staff is pleasant and nice. Room comfort, however, leaves something to be desired. The bed had the hardest mattress that I've ever slept on. I awoke with a bad backache every morning. Likewise, the pillows, while they look nice stacked neatly along the headboard, are overstuffed and very uncomfortable. Other than that, the room was adequate and clean. There is a microwave and small fridge, which takes hours to get cool enough to do its job. They should leave the thing on between guests. It would probably cost them less than turning it off every time. On the mainland, this would be an $80 hotel. I paid twice that, plus $30/day to park my rental car. I asked for a quiet room. There was a lot of highway noise, but amazingly, I only heard one or two planes go over. This is a big property, with two huge buildings. I had to walk about a half mile to get to the well-stocked shop and the lobby from my room. If you need to sleep late, do put the "Do not Disturb" sign on your door. The maids want to get their job finished and will be knocking on your door yelling "housekeeper!" if you don't.

Besides the great location near the airport and the shuttle- the hotel is only 10 minutes away from Pearlridge mall, 20 min from Waikele Outlets. I prefer to stay away from the mess of Waikiki and the Ala Moana area. Its good to get away from that and stay close to the airport. Parking is cheap for Kamaaina and the staff are great.

Absolutely Outstanding Stay Here! My family and I received the best customer service, and this is in comparison to 3 others we've been while on island! The receptionists Ann and Keahu are superb! Call them to make your reservation! Thanks!

My family visited Hawaii for a buddy's wedding and our flight out of Honolulu was 8AM. We wanted to make sure we arrived at the airport with enough time to check in luggage and get through security, so the plan was to arrive 2 hours before departure. That meant getting there at 6AM. So, we looked for hotels close to the airport and this one showed up. It can be a bit difficult to find because it's right underneath a highway and the buildings in the area can appear industrial. But it's there right on the corner. There's a McDonald's and Starbucks 1 block away, so you're good for breakfast (FYI, breakfast is not provided). If you're renting a car and need to park it there overnight, it will cost you $30 a night. Most of the car rental companies have a location within 0.5 miles of the hotel just down the street on Nimitz Highway. Pros:Free shuttle to airport runs every 30 minutes (in the hour and every half hour).Reasonable price, clean rooms, functioning A/C, courteous staff, no pests spotted. Close to many attractions, either east to Honolulu and Waikiki or west to Pearl Harbor. Cons:Surrounding area industrial with a slum feel, expensive car parking fee.

Our airline put us up at this hotel due to a flight cancellation. The staff were friendly and easy going. I didn't have a formal voucher because the airline hadn't given me one, but staff were not mean spirited about it...they looked at my paperwork and knew about that flight. The room was dated but immaculate. My only complaint was the breakfast started at 630am. Many guests already have to be at the airport by then, so we had to skip it. I suggest an earlier breakfast start due to airport location.

Aside from the room being very well accommodating, there is a very nicely stocked store in the hotel. There is a restaurant in the hotel but there are also nearby eateries within a short walking distance through the back gate.This is where you want to be on your last night in Hawaii if you have an early flight. It's just minutes from the airport.They were nice enough to let me check-in early too, although it's probably rare.There is a nice pool. Not an indoor pool, but come on! It's Hawaii!

We stayed here overnight since it was so close to the airport. The property was clean and comfortable so all is good. They did charge 30 to park the car so i decided to take it back when we were done for the night and took the airport shuttle to the airport in the morning to avoid that fee.

From the time that I arrived, I felt welcome and appreciated. The front desk staff were warm and helpful. My room was clean and well appointed considering that I was in a moderately priced hotel for just an overnight stay. This is the closest hotel to the Honolulu Airport.The restaurant provided an excellent breakfast with a wonderful view of the pool area. Arranging the shuttle to the airport upon departure was well organized and efficient.

We flew into Honolulu and had to stay overnight until we caught our flight to Maui the next day. This hotel is conveniently located 3 minutes from the airport. It is clean and the rooms are average, but it was tight sleeping quarters for our family of 4. However, we needed someplace inexpensive and close to the airport, so the Airport Honolulu Hotel served its purpose. And they have a free shuttle to take you to and from the airport/hotel.

rooms are nice and quaint.. staff is wonderful and helpful. lots of military families and military people on orders. down side to this place is parking is limited and small other than that location is central and close to stores and freeway.

Booked this when my sister was moving to the island. The shuttle was helpful and the location was good for getting started with the apartment search and getting acquainted with the island. We stayed 2 days then moved to a Waikiki area hotel so our downtime could be at the beach and since we rented a car. Felt it was a little expensive for a pretty average hotel with average to good service. You are definitely paying for the location. The pool was nice. Definitely a fair amount of highway noise but walking distance to some tasty food.

Airport is so close you can hear the flights and highway but when you are exhausted and looking for an oasis in the travel desert, this is the place to stay. The van picks up and drives you to the airport and the cost is included in your room. You do need to tip the drivers, no problem. We got in late and had to leave early so a quick work out and a fast breakfast (very nice too) and we were back in the plane. Make sure you tell the hotel what terminal you arrive as there are two, one for interisland and the other from the mainland. We did have a little mixup while we tried to find the van. Other transportation can cost you from 12 to 30 dollars per person!

Just a brief note to compliment staff of AIRPORT HONOLULU HOTEL on their wonderful hospitality and aloha spirit when I visited early November 2015.I had an early morning flight to Norfolk, Virginia. Unfortunately, it got cancelled. I was sleepy, hungry and exhausted. The flight was now leaving at 4 pm not 7 am! After I picked up some breakfast, I got the shuttle to your lovely hotel. All of the staff (like Fran, Nani, Ann & Kehau) was very pleasant and professional. They really made a rough morning much better for this traveler!I also appreciated the clean, well-decorated room provided for me. I was able to eat my meal, watch a little TV and take a much-needed nap in very pleasant surroundings!Please know that my brief stay at your hotel was a God-send for me. I left them feeling refreshed and ready for my long flight to the East coast.Do convey my appreciation to all the staff that helped out that day (including shuttle bus driver!) When I can, I will recommend your business to my colleagues in search of accommodations near Honolulu Airport.Mahalo,Gail Singleton Taylor, Ph.D.Spiritual Life and Accountability CoachWaikiki, Honolulu, Hawai'i

This hotel has the basic necessities you'd need for a one night stay. It's close to the airport and has a fantastic free airport shuttle service. When we landed in from Maui, we were flying to Sydney the next day. We collected our bags, used the shuttle service phone in the airport (which has all the available hotel codes on it), dialed the code and within 5 minutes our shuttle had arrived to take us to the hotel. The hotel is clean, and has a little convenience store in the foyer for any snacks/food you might need for the evening. I would not recommend this hotel for anything other than passing through, or staying close to the airport for your flights. If you want to see the island, head further in to waikiki.

NIce, very surprised at the remodeling that has been done, since the last time I stayed. Rooms are comfortable and fresh in appearance. Stayed overnight. Bonus shuttle transport to airport. Onsite dining, good food. Also nice little gift store for room snacks or last minute gifts. Overall I would stay there again.
user_name:
Sharmain M
Pago Pago, American Samoa

review_body: When I landed at the Honolulu International Airport I felt like I had never left it 45 years earlier. Yes, it has changed a lot but it still felt like I was coming home to something familiar. I used to spend hours at the airport watching people come and go. The airport is clean, the vendors are friendly, and I still think it is the best place to "people watch".It was a sad day when I had to leave Hawaii after 11 days of heaven but at least I was able to see my favorite airport before I left.

The staff didn't seem to know what they were doing at times. The beds were not comfortable resulting in little sleep. Restaurant in the hotel was only decent part. Food quality was good but didn't feel welcome to stay. For a stay that was less than 9 hours I spent too much money for my room. Recommend just sleeping at hotel for that.

This hotel was our base for one overnight and 3 additional nights on our return from the big island. The front desk check-in is fast and friendly with lots of area tips for site seeing. The bus service is great from right in front of the hotel, easy to Waikiki beach or Pearl Harbor, no need for expensive tour guides. Senior citizens ride the buses all over for 1$. The rooms are well equipped, fridge, microwave, good beds, all very clean. Obviously some airport noise, but slept well for 3 nights. Several places to eat within a block or two, used on-site restaurant for big breakfasts at fair prices. Its fifteen min to Pearl Harbor, don't miss it !

Very basic hotel close to the airport, essentially used for overnights in transit. I was stranded here by United Airlines and spent one night. It was noisy and crowded, with traffic running heavily outside all night, plus in the room, the aircon is very noisy. The lights in the room didn't all work and although there's a fridge, there's nothing in it. Not even water. The restaurant was pricey based on the poor standard of food and the tables were not bussed or cleaned. The rooms were clean and well kept, but basic. Wifi in the rooms is free.

The Airport Honolulu Hotel is an excellent choice for travelers overnighting in Honolulu for on-going travel. From the free shuttle service from and to the airport to friendly and cordial greeting at the reception desk, the staff is truly oriented to ensuring the customer is well served and accommodated. Prices are reasonable and rooms are clean and quiet. Their restaurant is open most times for breakfast and dinner and they offer transportation to a nearby hotel and restaurant to cover times when their facility is not open.

I've stayed at this hotel a few times before. Each time I had arrived in the evening and was booked on another flight the following morning. The location is very close to the airport. The hotel offers free shuttle service to and from the airport. The room is very basic, clean and contains the essentials (soap, shampoo, TV, etc.). The free WiFi is certainly a plus. For one night, it is a great property. For longer number of days, I personally would stay at a higher end hotel in a better location.

I found this very convenient for an overnight stay, because of the provided transportation to and from the airport. Several eating places are within an easy walk. The bed was very comfortable, and the hotel nice and quiet. I didn't stay long enough for the pool and gym did note they had both - in addition to an onsite restaurant.

As in my case, I didn't pick it. It was chosen for me. Thank goodness it was just one night. Let me tell you the best thing about this place - the staff. Everyone was friendly, helpful and nice even with a late arrival from check-in to check-out. They were all lovely. However, the only reason to stay here is that they have an airport shuttle service and you need a quick place to lay your head.

We stayed here overnight so we could visit pearl harbor before moving on to Maui. The lobby was beautiful. Service however needs improving. It took over and hour to check us in, but staff was very nice. Rooms need to be upgraded to keep up with the lobby. Very outdated.we only stayed here one night. The upside was it was super close to the airport, and with in close driving distance to Pearl Harbor. If I came back, would think about staying again.

Alex, the bellman, was exceptional!!!!! We arrived late from LAX and he not only helped us with our large boxes, but offered to keep them secure until our checkout the next day!!We returned the next afternoon with our rental car and he kindly loaded our car with the heavy boxes AND our luggage!!
user_name:
DL E
Fort Mill, South Carolina

review_body: The airport shuttle is definitely a plus. We were sent to the neighborhood Resturant at best western for supper. Good food but not a wow! Way overpriced but that's Hawaii for you. The breakfast at our hotel is not bad.

Hotel staff were extremely helpful and friendly. Pool was clean and nice towels were provided by the pool. Bedding felt new as did the towels. Room and carpets very clean.Walking distance to some fast food restaurants. Limited nightly meals at the hotel.Traffic and air conditioning noise was tolerable.

very pleasantly surprised with my overnight stay...after not expecting much based on other reviews. The room and overall property is very tidy and clean. The staff were all very nice. The shuttle was good. The bed comfortable. The pool was very nice. The restaurant breakfast was very good. I am not saying this is a four star hotel, but rather a four star experience. I would recommend it for an overnight or short stay. Yes, the air conditioning unit was loud but no worse than other hotels.

Positives: very convenient to the airport. Friendly staff, free shuttle. Main beds average comfortable. Rooms were clean.Negatives: We needed an extra cots for a third person. The cots are terrible. Not for adult use. You can feel every spring. The rooms are really quite dated, but fine if you are just sleeping there.

This hotel's top feature is it's location for a business traveller. It's just off the Nimitz Highway, about 15 minutes by car to downtown Honolulu. Its just a few blocks to the airport. The rates were reasonable, but like many Honolulu hotels, parking was extra, so figure that in for your nightly stay. You aren't really within walking distance of the beach, but this doesn't strike me as a resort hotel anyway. There's no onsite restaurant, but a shuttle runs to a nearby partner cafe every 30 minutes for breakfast. The room was generally clean, and well maintained, although some of the cabinet surfaces felt a little grimy. The service was very friendly if somewhat harried - seems like they could have used another person at the front desk. I stayed four nights, and there seemed to be some kind of activity or other in the parking lot night or day.The hotel appears to be a stopover for military personnel, you could usually spot a uniformed service person at any given time. All in all, a decent hotel if you plan to spend most of your time out and about.

This hotel is great for staying near the international airport, frequent transfers included. Check in staff were very welcoming and provided some useful information about the hotel and the surrounding area. Room was basic but contained all we needed, room was very clean. Security staff actively patrolled the property

Although difficult to find (for us at least) the airport hotel is walking distance to the car lot where we dropped our car off and a short free shuttle (every half hour) from the airport itself. Lots of well appointed rooms, very new and clean, simple check-in and a good price. Dinner wasn't available but was at their "sister" restaurant 1/4 mile away, again accessed by free shuttle if you want, though we managed to find a delivery service which would deliver pretty much any food you wanted from Waikiki if necessary. Air con worked well, TV with plenty of channels, everything you need if you have an early flight. Free wifi.

Nice, albeit very dated property. There is a hotel shuttle picks up outside baggage claim area "E" very quickly after contacting hotel. Check in process was expedient. Plenty of front desk attendants to handle check in. The hotel is a 4 story hotel, with elevator access to all floors. Higher numbered rooms can be a good walk to get to.Hotel also has a decent sized snack and souvenir shop open until 11pm.The rooms are ok. I stayed in a spacious, two double bed room. As with the hotel, the room was also dated, but very clean and had all the normal items you would expect (excellent AC, good TV, coffee maker, hair dryer, etc.).Good and convenient hotel if you are connecting in Honolulu or have a need to overnight as we did.

Had a layover in Honolulu , and had great service at this hotel..picked me up at the airport and delivered by friendly staff ..check in and out was great..Room was nice and comfortable ..the breakfast was a little pricey but was a filling omelet and friendly ladies

Since I was only laying over for the night, I stayed close, and it was perfect for that... But, if you're staying a while, I'd recommend elsewhere. I'm sure there are nicer, newer places for around the same money. Personally, when by myself, I'd stay here again. The staff was friendly, and there is a nice shopette on site.

Stayed here for 1 night in transit. I new they had a free shuttle and I rang the phone in the baggage claim and spoke to the lady who told me where to go for pick up. We walked 3 minutes and waited 7-8 mins before it arrived. It took 3 minutes to get to the hotel. Arrived at 12.15pm at the Hotel and could check in straight away. We got a good rate and the room was perfect. 2 beds, good size bathroom, bright and a good working air conditioner. Clean, plenty of hanging space, good Tv etc. The only negative about the room is that I would of preferred more Power points that the 1, I found. Its a large hotel, with 2 buildings. WE wanted lunch and were told to go behind the hotel to find restaurant's, You needed your key to get in and out of the gate. We walked 1 min and found a Starbucks with 405 other Restaurant's to choose from. We then noticed a McDonald across the road and went there to eat, everything was so close. We used our key to get back into the hotel gate again. The pool is a good size and war. The pool is right by the Interstate/airport road so sitting out by the pool you here the Traffic noise but it was fine.No spa. Shade and sunny spots, towels provided. The little shop there had all sorts of things from tourist things, alcohol, fruit, chips and personal products etc. Well priced. There were some conference rooms there that were being used. There was a computer and printer in the foyer that was available for use. We went to the Restaurant for Dinner. We came early and it was full of other young families. Good kids menu as well as choices for the adults. We were served early and the food came quickly. The food was well priced and the portions huge.We check out early for our flight. The shuttle runs every 30mins at that hour and it was waiting there when we check out. Its not a 5 star hotel but it has everything you need for your stay long or short. I've stayed at more expensive with less. The staff were great and they had lots of knowledge of the area and how to get into the main area of Honolulu. Totally recommend.

We stayed here twice ...once coming to Oahu...a planned stay that became necessary when plans changed and we needed one night at the beginning of our trip and an unplanned stay when our flight was oversold and we had to spend an extra night on Oahu. Both times were very pleasant. Great people. Great airport shuttle and driver. Nice room. Comfortable beds. we were very pleased. And the gift shop had food items that we could fill an empty tummy with when we were tired and had no restaurant accessible due to time and they gave us a pizza delivery option and flyer for our 2nd hungry visit!! They came to the rescue for food and a comfy place to sleep!!

We stayed here one night in between a flight from Australia to Kona. We arrived before check in an they were able to check us in to our room early which was great considering we were so sleep deprived.The airport coach was extremely convenient.the only thing I would love to see is room service for those tired people who are hungry. It would have been great to have had a decent meal in the comfort of our Pyjamas

The airport was OK very basic. When I arrived I thought I would see something amazing. Nothing it was very basic until you got into the city. When you leave the airport nothing amazing just a lot of storage containers. Homeless people walking the streets. We had a shuttle bus it was included in our package with AAA. Thank God because it would have been about a $75 cab ride. The roads are very bumpy from the airport its about a 45 minute ride to the hotel's.

I solute the good service of mama Norma, she is a working heart, faithful and a happy person. We really appreciate your good service and Hospitality Norma. Hope to see you around every time we stay at this Hotel. God bless you.
user_name:
Mauga F
Pago Pago, American Samoa

review_body: The hotel its ok, its old and a bit smelly (humid) but the beds are good, sleep quality is good, and the rooms are big and well furnished. They have a free shuttle that starts at 4:30 to the airport every 30 mins.nothing to complain, would stay again before heading to the airport
