stayed here more recently and the place is usually clean and room service is very efficient. the maids are always friendly and helpful. the old ladies at the front desk, Ann and Keahu, are very professional and friendly.

This is an over priced trashy hotel. Spend the extra $50-70 a night and find a better hotel near the beach. I was afraid to even leave my clothing at this hotel. Its gone down hill in the last 7 years.

This hotel was what I expected. Clean, comfortable, affordable. Checked in for one night before our flight to Tahiti. Was a nice place to shower and sleep. We walked down the street to the shopping plaza and had pizza for dinner in a cute, Hawaiian themed restaurant. Walked to Starbucks for breakfast. Hung out at the pool for a couple of hours. It was appealing and relaxing. Appeared some guests were upset with the shuttle service for some reason, but we had no problem with it. I would recommend this hotel for a quick layover.

When looking on Expedia and their website they advertise free shuttle. So I expected that. Our late flight arrived, I called them and they said they don't offer free shuttles anymore..I was confused, I called again. Diffrent person same thing. I was very upset with a hotel a half mile wouldn't offer a shuttle. Got to the hotel questioned them about it..they told me I have the wrong number so I showed them the phone number and said yep that's our number..then laughed, and said well that sucks you paid for a taxi ( I had an infant or I would of walked) the rooms are crappy old! This place has potential but it's going to have to start with customer service.

My husband and I decided to stay at this hotel the night before our departure as we had an early flight and wanted pool the last evening we were here. The airport pick up was very good.When we arrived at the hotel we had to wait for a ½ hour, before we were served, though there was a staff member in the office behind who could have helped us, but he only helped a guest in suit before us and then went back to the office ignoring us.Second, the pool was unfortunately closed, we were told that could go use the pool at best western. We had a pool then but we had to pack our stuff and it was more intricately than we had hoped when we booked our stay. Only 2 stars because the room was nice it self, and shuttle service as well. But they didn't live fully up to their promised facilities, didn't try to compensate us for the inconvenience, and they let us wait and hang in the reception for too long. Not satisfied. Unfortunately.

Stayed here on a layover. Price was on the lower end among hotels near HNL but definitely not a steal. Room was quite old and the bedding was far from pristine, though did manage to get a decent night's sleep, which I suppose is the most important thing. Strangely did get 2x queen beds instead of the king size I had pre-booked, but meh, first world problems.Bathroom was clean and wifi both reliable and speedy. Did not try out the restaurant for breakfast but, on quickly glancing at the menu, saw that most things ran in the $8-15 range.I had to call for the airport shuttle when I got in. Fairly painless affair and there is a courtesy phone in baggage claim for folks without US cellular service. It circulates every 30 minutes but don't know if that is just during daytime; my flight arrived quite late.It's likely an artifact of Honolulu being more of a destination than a transit point, but the choice of airport hotels is unfortunately quite slim.

Convenient place to stay near airport. Just a place to catch up on rest. Starbucks walking distance. Shuttle service to and from airport. We felt we received a descent rate compared to where we were staying in Waikiki. It was safe. A convenience store in the lobby.

The workout room has only one treadmill and one elliptical which 1 week that I stayed the treadmill was broken and there was no plug for the elliptical. The one time I was able to use it, battery not!

We were laid over in Honolulu unexpectedly on our way to kauai, and had to get a last minute room at the airport hotel fro a 6 am flight. It was a crappy bed, with a door that looked like it could get busted through anytime, everything was extremely dated, and the room was worse than any red roof inn I've ever been in, it's a bed, and they charge $299 a night for it, no discount, no amenities, I would never do it again. Lastly, although it says airport hotel, its not at the airport, you have to take a shuttle, which leaves early, and when it does you get a lecture from the front desk about how your supposed to be there early, when I told her we were, she just huffed and went back to her typing, she couldn't care less. Seriously, never stay there, no matter won't , I know I sure wont!

Clean room with all the amenities. The WiFi had plenty of bandwidth. The restaurant had a good menu for me - I'm vegan. The waitress was amiable, quick, and very attentive. The only problem came before arriving. There was confusion about the shuttle. Unlike all the other shuttles, it picked up at the taxi pickup. I and another guest were waiting at the shuttle pickup point, and ended up waiting for over 45 minutes.

Be very careful if you are staying at this hotel Friday to Monday as for some reason they close their restaurant on these nights. Unless you want to catch a shuttle to another restaurant you are left with unapertising snacks from the in hotel shop or delivery from a recommended take away. Unfortunately we used this and ended up with very expensive very cold pizza. Also we bought a bottle of wine from the store which we had to drink out of paper cups as this hotel does not offer glasses in the rooms.

We stayed at the hotel for one night after our flight from Europe to Honululu.Shuttle service to the hotel worked great. Rooms were only ok, nothing special but ok for one night. What bothered me most was the front desk service.I asked them if it were possible to print our boarding passes for our flight early next morning. The lady at the front desk said that they would be polishing the floors in the lobby for the next couple of ours. Therefore it was not possible to use the computer in the lobby. I wasn't offered any other opportunity to print two boarding passes.Terrible customer service!!We originally had a second reservation on Aug, 1 before our flight back to Europe.I cancelled it a week in advanced because I found much better hotels close to Waikiki Beach for the same price. The charged my credit card anyway. After calling, they acknowledged their mistake but since I called after hours bookkeeping staff was not there to help me. Front desk told me they would take care of it. Nothing has happened so far.Another example of their terrible customer service.Would never return there. Would not recommend to anybody.You get so much more for your money when you stay close to Waikiki Beach. Its only a 15 minute car ride. This hotel is ridiculously expensive for what it has to offer!

The room was bland, just another hotel room. Which for people that are probably only staying for a night before a flight out in the morning is fine.  You cannot drink the tap water or use it to make tea or coffee it was disgusting.  There was no room service but there is a small shop downstairs that had some essentials in which was convenient.  We were on the second floor facing a car park. Be warned car alarms go off all night long.  They also allow dogs in the rooms! I didnt hear it barking but i was wary of what might have been on the carpets in our room. That did put me off and im not sure if i would stay there again for that reason.

Stayed there for a short overnight arriving at 10pm and leaving at 5:30 the next morning. Perfunctory check in, room very dated in dire need of a refresh. What was most disconcerting was that to get to our room we had to walk down two long hallways, leave the main building a cross a dimly lit parking lot to the dark entrance to the second building. I'm 6'2, would definitely not want my wife or daughter to do that late at night. Ridiculous at over $200/night.

Stayed here overnight after arriving for a cruise. Really close to airport and car rentals.Shuttle to airport (anytime) and to ship on day of sailing (2:00PM and later only).Rooms were adequate...beds were comfortable...standard bathroom...nothing special, but clean...kind of a high tariff for what you get, but everything in Honolulu is expensive. McDonald's right next door for a cheap breakfast. Good for one night stay only.

There are good things about this hotel. The location as it is next to the airport. The free and regular shuttle service to the airport. The room was very comfortable with a good bathroom.The real down side of this place revolves around food. They have breakfast every morning till 10AM. There is no lunch on any day. You are given a list of take away places from a centre down the road. Dinner at the hotel is only available 3 nights a week. The other 4 days it is available from their sister hotel and they offer a shuttle service to it. When it is available it is only till 9PM. There is no room service at all, so if you flight comes in a bit later it is very difficult to get a satisfying meal.You have a microwave oven in the room to heat up some tit bits from the shop at the hotel. They have paper cups for coffee, but very few supplies of coffee and sugar. We could not get a kettle to boil water to make a cup of tea and I was told to boil a paper cup in the microwave. I asked for a couple of glasses so we could have a drink and I was told they don't supply those. There is no bar in the hotel.There was TV but no movie channels. You could buy movies for around US$16 each, so if you need to fill in time (there is nothing close to the hotel) it can be either boring or expensive.Overall it is a comfortable room close to the airport but if you want food I suggest you book somewhere else.

I have stayed here twice, when I moved to Hawaii and when I left hawaii both times I was traveling with two dogs and a cat this is the only place that I had no issues with getting a room with pets. The hotel is nice the staff is great and the food is great. I really enjoyed my stay and definitely recommend if you travel with pets. Those are my babied at the hotel

This hotel is conveniently a few minutes from Honolulu Airport with a 24/7 free shuttle. This was useful because we also did a day tour which had an airport drop-off at the end of the day and we made a free call for the shuttle to return to our hotel. Helpful staff, clean, spacious rooms. One thing that would improve hotel service is to have its restaurant open on Friday and Saturday (only open 3 nights). Other times they offer their sister hotel, Best Western, a few minutes away which was OK but their menu is not as good.

Imagine trying to manage a high volume hotel with all sorts of travelers including lots of military families passing through. Management has done an amazing job keeping this o we night stay hotel functioning in all aspects. Rooms are clean, service is great despite the busy front desk and the facilities maintained despite heavy use.

Our housekeeper Marie was very friendly, professional & especially cleaning our room. Marie always had a smile on her face that made us feel welcome and she was very sincere and caring. Thank you very much for a great stay!
user_name:
Moana P
Pago Pago, American Samoa

review_body: You can not beat the location for a convenient, clean, comfortable and relaxing overnight stay which offers free airport shuttles every half hour. Book a quieter room toward the back of the hotel. Family friendly, with restaurant service and outdoor pool. The pool is located on the airport side, which makes it noisy. However, there are umbrella tables, shaded palms and lounge chairs that offer a quick 1-2 retreat between flights or prior to take off. Restaurant service was excellent, hotel staff very friendly and accommodating. Early check in was provided. The guest room is clean, queen size or double rooms. Bathroom amenities include toiletries.

The airport hotel is really only suited if you have very little time in Honolulu and you do not want to pay for a taxi to and from the airport. This hotel has free airport shuttle service and runs on a schedule. The hotel is dated and shows its age. It does have a pool and a small restaurant in the court yard, which are average.

We were quite happy with this hotel. The rooms and facilities are clean and sufficient, would stay again. Met all our requirements, the courtesy shuttle drop off and pick up were great. Quick trip to the airport meant we could take our time. Hotel was great in allowing us extra time with check out at no extra cost. Already the usual 12pm check out is great. Our flights were delayed and hotel staff very accomodating allowing us to stay till 1pm. The pool is great and there are shops within walking distance with great cheap meal options.

I stayed here for a week when the reservation I made elsewhere was accidentally cancelled. I must say it was a better experience than I thought it was going to be. The service was average, you have to remember in Hawaii that most people take their time doing things. The front desk people seemed to be always working on something on the computer. Sometimes they wouldn't look up for a long time. Even after saying "excuse me" they would be slow to respond. However they were very nice when helping. CThe staff in the restaurant was exceptional even though their prices were not. I was very pleased with the service and they attended to all of my requests quickly. The prices of the food was a big drawback for me. One of their specials was three mini chili dogs with a side of tater tots for $12.95. A little steep for a cheap hot dogs and tots. Especially since there is a McDonalds less than a block away with reasonable prices for similar fare. Additionally, it is open every day for breakfast, no lunch, and only a few days a week for dinner. B-The cleanliness of the room was very good and the cleaning staff was friendly and attentive. I often asked for additional things like coffee or towels and they went out of their way to help. AThe room was equipped with a flat screen that included quite a few channels and of course the normal movie selections. The bed was comfortable and I slept really well. I was surprised at how nice the pillows were, they didn't seem like some cheap off brand. The bathroom had granite counters and the water pressure was good. The furniture in the room had an early 80's white pastel feel but I found was the norm for Hawaii and tropical hotels. I also had a coffee pot, microwave, and a mini fridge. The fridge was perfect for when you had left overs from the high priced restaurant and didn't want to pay for another dinner. Overall I was comfortable in the room. B-The hotel had a small fitness facility with a treadmill, elliptical and a weight machine. Ample for a quick workout but not for the serious fitness guru. Additionally, the pool area was really nice, though it closed at sundown. I guess that is good if you want to relax and not be bothered with screaming kids from the pool area after dark. B+Finally I would be remiss if I didn't comment on the location. It he hotel is literally a block from the airport. So if you are staying here to enjoy Waikiki you may want to look elsewhere because it is a little drive from the main activities. If you want to be close to the military facilities though it seems pretty close. COverall this is a good hotel with average amenities. I would have liked a lounge or somewhere to get dinner through the week but none the less a nice place to rest your head. C

GiGi was our housekeeper our entire week stay at the airport honolulu hotel. She was fantastic and very efficient. She even helped to work around nap times for my son and she always new to come after he was done napping. She definitely made our stay much more comfortable!

Great location, suitable for family or group traveling from one destination to another. Price is right, good customer services, free internet and fast connection and convenient. Friendly staff, healthy environment, smoke free area, quiet place with many suitable amenities to entertain customer such internet, pool, fitness room, restaurants and small shops. Awesome. Maholo !!!!!

Arrived at 10.00 pm on a Monday night after 8 hours on a very full flight to find only two people working on passport gates, after about 40 minutes they decided to put on two extra staff.It took us over two hours to get to our hotel which was only 20 minutes away.A real downer for us, not a great first impression.However the other three times we passed through the airport it went a bit smoother.

The beds were hard. The hotel is a bit noisy from the freeway which is close by. The front desk staff were extremely helpful. One of the good things is the hotel is extremely close to the airport which is a plus!
user_name:
Bob W
Seattle, Washington, United States

review_body: We stayed one night at the Airport Hotel Honolulu before boarding a cruise. I had read some negative comments about the hotel, but we found it quite suitable to our needs. Yes, it is old but it is quite clean and comfortable, the beds are lovely, the bathroom is quite large and adequate and the breakfast was unbelievable, more than we could eat. The only downside was that I tried ringing the hotel to get their free shuttle from the airport with no success, the phone to that area of the hotel went unanswered. I would recommend this hotel for a one night stopover.

I didn't do much at the hotel other than sleep. The room was kept very clean. Bathroom was exceptionally clean. Thank you so much Norma for your hard work in keeping the room clean and inviting. You do a fabulous job and it is truly appreciated!

Staying here as a TLA family--two adults and one dog--and this hotel does not meet my expectations as a pet friendly hotel. There is a fenced potty area for pets, which is great, but other people do not clean up after their pets, so there is poop everywhere. My dog, who is well behaved, quiet, potty trained, and has stayed at other hotels, accidentally vomited in our room. This was after a long flight, a change in diet, and like I said, an accident for anybody. The hotel staff were pretty rude about it. I think one even mentioned charging us for it. Don't stay here with pets. They can't help it if they vomit no more than we can.

Fast and friendly check in, rooms was large and spacious with microwave and refrigerator. Had a room away from the freeway so it was very quiet. The beds was not the best. Nice restaurants and a gift shop. Lots of parking available for a fee.

Perfect in many ways! For those who need a place for a few hours, easy checking, reasonable priced, laundry facility on location with a near by Post Office within walking distance. We traveled in from London with 12 hours to catch our cruise- we were able to do laundry and send home stuff home. Staff Very Helpful!

I must admit, that my expectations for hotels in this area are high since my experience at the courtyard in Waikiki was amazing. There were 3 things I really liked about this hotel. It was near the airport, they provide a shuttle to the airport for free, and they have a souvenir shop. What i didn't like was the slow service. It took 45 minutes to check in with a reservation. The room that was given at first wasn't clean. Dirty towels were everywhere, the sheets were on the floor, and there were food on the tables. A complaint was made and I was given another room with some of my money refunded after the complaint. I couldn't enjoy the pool because too many kids were in it. The price for this was the same price as the courtyard so you can definitely do better.

This is the perfect hotel to rest in before your flight back home - the staff are very friendly and the restaurant is excellent overlooking beautiful gardens and pool. if you need any last minute items the little shop in the foyer stocks an amazing selection.

My husband needed surgery in Honolulu just before the Memorial Day weekend and we chose this hotel because it had a 24 hour shuttle to the airport and was very close to the airport. We were very pleased. The room was well equipped and everything worked. There is a variety of food available within walking distance (a full service sit down restaurant plus Starbucks, Jamba Juice, McDonald's, pizza, BBQ, sushi, noodles, etc.). I relaxed in the pool, which was was clean and very pleasant. (I just wish it didn't close at 7 pm.)Every person I interacted with on the staff was pleasant and polite and helpful. Families stay here and there is highway noise, so if you want a quiet spa or resort this isn't for you. But it was perfect for our purpose and I would even return for a couple days as a jumping off place to explore Honolulu
user_name:
Deb S
Portland, Oregon, United States

review_body: We stayed at this HNL airport hotel for one night -we had a full day of traveling, and was flying to Kauai early the next morning. The hotel is reasonably priced, and the room (king bed) is clean and the bed was comfortable. The shuttle to and from the airport arrived promptly and as scheduled.
user_name:
Peg C
King of Prussia, Pennsylvania

review_body: The rooms are...okay at best, no carpeting, andwe stayed on the first floor, near a fire exit which by law isn't an exit except in emergency, and oh by the way, it sets off an alarm which is loud and extremely annoying to hear ten times a day. Whatever they did to try to stop the exiting, if anything, was useless. The only reason this place got 2 stars is because staff were otherwise generally extremely accommodating.

Clean, no bugs but showing it's age. In need of updating. Comfortable in spite of it's age and wear. Nice restaurant with good food for breakfast. A taxi to Waikiki is $30 each. way. Traffic noise noted in rooms despite the a/c running.

Got into Honolulu at 1am , the staff quickly sent a transfer van to pick us up. the hotel is clean , there is a hertz rental office neighboring the hotel. There is a nice pool and the lounge is nice.The front desk staff were extremely accommodating

My family stayed here while on Military business for few weeks. Unfortunately this is where they put them for it. I was actually shocked when I heard where they were. It could have been better I supposed. But, the experienced we got was not pleasant. For anyone who are visiting to the island for the first time, it will leave a bad taste to your mouth. The interior of the room was bad, there were musty smell to it and when you turn the a/c, it was even worst as the smell coming from it. The only friendly person we have encountered here was the door man at that time. The lady with that huge fake flowers on her head, I could say the same. Not very friendly at all, no matter what we say, she doesn't crack a smile to any of us? And it was like that for over two weeks of staying at this place. Give me a break! The pool was clean, though it would have been better for wasn't below a highway. God forbid if there was an accident above that highway, and a car or something fell or roll down. You are out of luck! Signs everywhere says "no smoking" but as you get out of your car from the parking lot. You will get nauseated from the cigarette smokes, because of the employee as well as the patrons hangout right on the parking lot next to the entrance of the hotel. One of the loudest place I've ever been in. From inside the room, you can hear people talking and just as loud as the car passes by. This place definitely need a HUGE attention from owners...

This is a very difficult review to write. I have so many mixed feelings about this place. I'll do a list of pros and cons.Pros:Every staff member I had contact with was superb. 5 stars for those lovely people. Top notch customer service and hospitality; I was so impressed. When I had a scheduling issue regarding placement of my luggage, the staff helped resolve my issue.This hotel is in a very convenient location. Since this was not a leisure trip, there were morning commutes that would have been miserable if staying in Waikiki. Cons: MOLD! Black mold in the lobby lounge can be seen in the ceiling. Our room smelled horrible and upon further inspection, our AC unit was riddled with chunks of multi colored mold. My husband and I got so sick and it took us a while after we left to recover. Staff was extremely apologetic and offered to move us to another room, but that AC was also moldy, so they replaced the AC unit in our room with a clean one. We were already sick, though. The carpet smells awful and will leave your socks black. Disgusting. They have a roach problem. We couldn't keep any leftovers in the fridge because roaches would get in the food. Yes, Hawaii is tropical, yes you will see bugs here and there...but this amount of roaches is unacceptable. I now have a home here and have only seen one roach(and also clean dilligently to prevent mold/mildew in my home.) We didn't have roach or mold problems in the hotel we stayed prior to this one(we only left because the first hotel closed for a remodel.) The parking lot gets so full some evenings, you have to just sit and wait for someone to leave. One night I got so fed up and parked at the end of a row in a spot that wasn't actually a parking space. Thank goodness I didn't get towed. When leaving the parking lot, sometimes the gate malfunctions and you can't leave. This really sucks if you have to go to work in the morning. One day the security guard had to physically lift the gate so I could get out. The meal vouchers aren't as good a deal as they sound if you use them at their sister hotel's(Best Western) restaurant. The food is so bad there for dinnertime we didn't even bother to use our meal vouchers on subsequent nights and just paid out of pocket elsewhere. We weren't able to utilize the restaurant at the Airport hotel in the mornings for breakfast because they didn't open early enough. For someone on vacation this isn't an issue, but for someone who needs to get to work, spending 45min-1 hour for breakfast isnt possible with the nature of Oahu traffic. When we finally were able to eat there for breakfast on Saturday, it was good and we had breakfast there again on Sunday. This hotel needs a serious overhaul, mold cleaning, and extermination. So sad because in spite of the horrible conditions, the hospitality is on point.

After looking at the options that were given to us for TLA approved hotels that took pets, we decided to stay here for the 10 days we have until moving back to the mainland. The front desk staff were extremely accommodating, getting us a room for pets last minute as that information got lost in communication. Housekeeping staff very prompt, professional, and made sure our needs were met. If you're in the military and need a place to stay, I would recommend this hotel as they have people on staff whose sole job is to make sure everything stays within the TLA guidelines. If I had anything I was irked about, it was being expected to pay double digit prices for basic breakfasts in the in-hotel restaurant. This was easily overcome due to the number of options in the area, and in the grand scheme of things, if that's the worst thing I have to say about any place I stay while I travel, then I consider it a great visit overall.

Very much a 2 star hotel. Staff is very pleasant but this cannot make up for overall creepiness of halls and rooms. Unfortunately, United will put you up here if they foul up your flights (yup, thanks United). Guarantee their flight staff has not stayed here in years. Or if they have, they get different rooms. 5 minutes from Honolulu Airport and good shuttle service.

January 2015 one night stay on way home from New Zealand since connections didn't allow for a flight out that night. Dated and very busy with many military of whom they seem to take great and well deserved care. Basic but clean room. Front desk staff were always over worked but professional upon a 11pm check in as well as 7am departure. Closeness to the airport can't be beat. Don't arrive late at night hungry as no restaurant open that late. Shuttle to and fro from airport works well.

Just stayed the night, between flights, but after a long day of traveling, this hotel was just what I needed. I called them from one of the courtesy phones at the airport and they informed me where to meet the free shuttle. The shuttle runs every half hour from the lobby, 24 hours a day. The driver was professional and assisted with lifting luggage. Speaking of the lobby, it looked very clean, new, and modern. The room was decent and clean. Nothing fancy, but all I needed was a place to freshen up and sleep. Used the wake up call in my room to make sure I made my flight on time. You could hear the highway, but I likened it to white noise and had no trouble sleeping. There was a balcony to view the highway, as well. I was offered the government rate of $145/night.

We stayed here for 12 days while we were recently moving off island, and as the title says...I really wanted to like it. But for the price per night, we could have stayed at numerous other hotels that would have been nicer. They DO allow pets, which was why we stayed here (we have a kitty), but not sure why the pet deposit is so high if we would just be put into a room with tile that can't be ruined and they want you to carrier your animal each time the maids come. I wasn't really willing to do that, so between that and both of us getting sick, we didn't utilize the maids for much more than new sheets that we changed ourselves, towels and supplies as needed. I will say that the housekeeping staff was actually the highlight of the stay. They were friendly and engaging, efficient and unobtrusive. When we needed to borrow something, they were quick to help. Otherwise, $30 a night to park on top of your stay, our hot water on our sink was broken when we got there, so after a long day we had to wait for the maintenance staff to come in and fix it while we sat there, the batteries died in our TV remote...they had to put in a work order to change them (and we had batteries but couldn't put ours in there because they are screwed in...I guess people steal batteries?) and they NEVER got changed the whole time we were there, the restaurant was pretty gross for breakfast (husband got a stomach ache and I boxed mine and then didn't eat it later), our "do not disturb" sign was either stolen 3 times (there weren't enough for every room it seemed) or the staff took them, which is even weirder, and we were next to the LOUDEST, most obnoxious couple and their two kids, that spent their days (and I mean ENTIRE days) screaming at each other...the mother cussing and yelling, the kids screaming and crying and throwing tantrums...and because they had two rooms across the hall from each other, they spent a lot of that time yelling IN THE HALL. No staff EVER stopped it, and I know they were aware (I watched it happen numerous times around staff and other guests), the wifi was HORRIBLE and we couldn't run anything but one of our laptops from it (out of 3 laptops, a tablet and 2 phones) so I couldn't catch up on work or watch anything from Netflix or Hulu or YouTube or anything. I feel like I could go on and on...but you get the idea. The other positive was it's proximity to the airport and having a shuttle...but that was it for me. Wouldn't stay again and wouldn't recommend. The only reason it doesn't rate as horrible is it was pretty clean with the friendly cleaning crew, close to the airport and allowed pets...so it fit what we needed at the time with no other luxuries or positives.

Quick reliable free shuttle. Small store in hotel stocked well. Room had fridge, microwave and coffee. I walked to Big Kahuna Pizza around the corner and thought once maybe I shouldn't have been alone at night because I saw a few homeless but no guts no glory. They will shuttle you to the Best a Western which has a restaurant but I would just walk around the corner to the better food. At least you would be closer if you let them take you half way but it was really only about a 10 min walk. There was also BBQ, sandwich places, Starbucks, sushi and McDonalds right there. The room was very clean and quiet. I liked this room better than the Best Western room. I walked the next morning about 15 minutes to rent my car. Too convenient.

This hotel served it purpose of being close to the airport for a 1 night stay, I was a bit worried about the noise from the freeway, however this wasn't an issue as the aircon unit was so loud it you couldn't hear the planes or freeway. The room was clean and functional and the check in staff were friendly, the free shuttle to the airport was handy. However I feel it was overpriced for what we got.
user_name:
Amber H
Auckland, Auckland, New Zealand

review_body: Average motel that is convenient to the airport. Recommend this place only if you have an early morning flight. Has a 24 hour shuttle to the airport. We were on the 5:00 am shuttle, and they left on time. Pros: Airport shuttle, comfortable bed.Cons: Hotel was pricier than I think it should have been. Charge for parking. Restaurant closed Friday to Monday night (there is a shuttle to/from a nearby hotel that had dinner).

It's not a grand hotel by any standards, but it is clean and friendly, and spectacularly close to the airport. Everyone I met was competent and friendly with it, something not every hotel can offer...My room was spacious and had everything required for one night. Beds are average and everything else was very good. Free wifi.I enjoyed my breakfast near the pool, surrounded by gardens (if you didn't look up too high and notice the freeway, it could have been anywhere in Hawaii).Shuttle service is regular every 30 minutes.

We chose to stay here because we had a an early morning flight. The room was clean and tidy, a bit dated but served the needs of our family of 4. The shuttle service is reliable and efficient. There are some food shops within walking distance if you are hungry. We got up extra early for our flight only to find at check in that our flight was delayed 5 hours (our fault, we should have checked). So we decided to return to the hotel and see if we could check back in to our room. The staff were very obliging and we were able to go back to bed! So much better than hanging around at the airport for 7 hours. We were so grateful for this opportunity . Highly recommend this hotel for convenience and excellent service.

The rooms in the hotel need some work but they are passable. Just by looking around the room you can tell customers bought animals into room with them. My suspicions were confirmed when I was walking down the hall and heard several dogs barking in different rooms. Having pets in the room makes it almost impossible for the maids to keep the room clean. The soap in the room is inadequate for shower use.The hotel staff, from maids, to receptionist, to gift shop workers were all great and very friendly and accommodating. If you got to make quick arrangements I think this is a good Goto hotel. It is within walking distance of a very nice Starbucks. .

We chose this hotel for the convenience after an overseas flight from Japan, the price, and reviews. This was a good decision. The hotel has a friendly staff, comfortable rooms, and a lovely pool that my kids enjoyed very much. The shuttle from the airport was quick and easy. It's a short stay for us because we are going on a cruise. We would choose this hotel again.

Coming to the island and looking for a hotel that supports TLA is not a simple task. I make this a point as this is the key reason as to why I am recommending this hotel. Its support of military members and their families is seriously unmatched by an commercial non government hotel out there. The military rep, Les, hosts a TLA brief that explains everything you must do to maintain TLA status. They offer other services such as free parking (not something easy to find on island) or vouchers for meals that help to discount the price of food. Add those things with the friendly staff and you get what I call quality service unmatched by even some 4 star hotels in honolulu.I know what you are thinking; "It is near the airport so there must be airplane sounds throughout the day!". Despite this concern we only heard airplanes 4 times out of the 40 days we were here, woops actually 5 (one just went over as I was typing this). This was surprising so either the airport is lacking in business or they have created some form of stealth noise system! (just kidding) Whatever it is you don't hear them often enough to be a concern.The location is close to Pearl Harbor and the NEX so even if you do not have a car when you arrive you can easily walk 20 minutes to get to where you need to go to get processing done. The island has a rather robust BUS system that can be tracked via TheBus app on all android and iphones. We found ourselves using this every day until our vehicle arrived. It would be wise to use google to find the routes and then check the BUS times with the app. HINT! There is three bus stops just outside of the hotel that take you to all places on the island.As for the staff we were greeted by a friendly person named Marilou who explained to us the TLA process for the hotel and introduced us to Les. Within a few moments we had keys to our room and were placed on the third floor for easy access to the laundry facility. My only complaint here is that the facility is fairly expensive for laundry, but everything on this island is more expensive. Three dollars for a one dollar burger at burger king was a real shocker, but I digress. Our cleaning lady Norma was very friendly and accommodated our schedule. If we asked her to clean later in the day she would, and if we needed her to clean before we went out she would. We had several thousands of dollars in electronics in the room (laptop, goPro, and cameras) and nothing went missing. This speaks volumes to the integrity of the staff. I have been in places before where you would not even dream of leaving out a camera much less something of real value.You will not find the best views on the island at this hotel, but you will get a great deal and have your family taken care of. I would trade in great view for quality of life any day of the week.

No frills hotel. We had mechanical issues coming from St. Louis and missed our connection. United provided us a room and a few vouchers for dinner and breakfast. $7.00 per person for a meal~ when you try to eat at either the hotel diner or the gift shop expect Hawaii rates. You will not get much for $7.00. A snack at the gift shop (to use the voucher must be a single serve and there were two options) it was $5.50. So we ended up ordering Domino's pizza and spending $40 for a large pizza and a coke. But after the travel issues it was probably the best $40 pizza we have ever had. Breakfast was better at the in hotel diner. But again really expensive, the voucher does not go far. This hotel has a lot of military, so much that they have an onsite military liasion. It was noisy first thing in the morning.

This is my 3rd time to stay at the Airport Honolulu Hotel while traveling on to the Pacific Islands. The staff is exceptionally friendly. Alex was helpful with my luggage and transportation. Norma kept my room clean and was so polite. The breakfast in the restaurant is delicious and the open air concept reminds me that I am in Hawaii.

The best thing about this hotel is its proximity to HNL. The worst thing is its nightly rate. It's clean, adequately furnished with good beds, and a really good restaurant, which, unfortunately, is not open every evening. The shuttle service is reliable and efficient. The drivers, as well as the rest of the staff, are courteous and competent. My wife and I will stay there again when I have a morning flight out of HNL, which is usually the case.

There are limited hotel choices near HNL, none of them above 3*. It is not an attractive locale, in that a noisy double deck freeway runs right next to the few hotels. So you only stay here if you need to be near the airport, or near the Kaiser Hospital. For a few dollars more, you can stay in Waikiki.Hotels in Honolulu are pricey for what you get, and the airport hotels are no exception. When we stayed here overnight late March 2015 (for some Kaiser Hospital procedures) the kama'aina rate (for Hawaiian residents) was $159 plus $22 tax. Another nearby hotel was $170 +$25. The very nice 4* Prince Honolulu hotel near the yacht harbor was also $170, better value, ocean views, great beds.That said, it's a $50 cab ride across Honolulu in traffic! So we stayed here. We were pleasantly surprised that the hotel was clean, well-maintained and comfortable. If you ask for a room on the side away from the freeway (odd-numbered rooms) noise is not a problem. Our only quibble (apart from the price for a 2.5* hotel room) is that the elevator is very, VERY slow. I walked down the stairs several times instead.Nice staff, clean comfortable (not fancy) rooms. Nice to have decent wifi in room at no charge. Recommended for HNL overnight.

This is an open air airport. Meaning there aren't many windows. Considering it's an island that's ok. The airport looks like it's straight out the 70's. Well a certain part of it. The airport is more modern on the other end. The sights from the airport are breathtaking. ALOHA

I had to stay at the Airport Best Western Honalulu, the hotel needs a lot of updates, but the staff was excellent, especially Sharon our shuttle driver and front desk lady! She was so helpful, and had a great additude!

Our flight diverted to Honolulu and we arrived very late without a place to stay for the night. We found the Airport Honolulu Hotel on Trip Advisor. It fit what we needed for a one night layover. Although the hotel is dated, it is clean and comfortable. We didn't eat at the restaurant, so I can not speak to that. It has an airport shuttle which arrived quickly. The hotel is very close to the airport and the highway, so it is a noisy area. The hotel itself was quiet.

Our family stayed at the Airport Honolulu Hotel for 5 weeks while waiting for a house. The staff is very friendly and helpful. Our housekeeper Norma was wonderful. The front desk staff are great. The restaurant staff are also amazing. Highly recommend the hotel especially for military families.

I stayed here after landing at HNL very late. I called the shuttle and it arrived 10 minutes later. Staff was excellent. The hallways are outdated and even the room is but it was quite clean and comfortable. The bed was excellent. Breakfast in the restaurant was very, very good. It's noisy on the outside - it's surrounded by highways - but the room was quiet.

This hotel is sandwiched between the airport and the highway. Tip: ask for a room away from the highway... no noise. We stayed at the Courtyard on our outbound layover and here on our return layover. This place is clean, not beat up, not dated, pleasant and has a restaurant. The opposite of the Marriott Courtyard. The rooms are much nicer, current, wall air conditioner but not too noisy. I find the bedding soft but I like firm so, it is a matter of taste. There is an outside pool.The restaurant is OK. Not great but, look where you are an what you need. It is fine. They do not open until 6:30 AM.. too late for us. Also, they are open for dinner on Tuesday, Wed and Thursday only. Otherwise, it is off to the Best Western. NO lunch, see below.Tip: walk out the back, turn left, go through the lot and follow the fence to the very end and use you key to exit. Walk down the street in the same direction and... a Starbucks. Around the corner is a Jamba Juice, Sushi place and a handful of other eateries. We had the sushi... not much to look at inside but, the sushi was fresh and very good.We would not hesitate to stay here again, for one night. If you are looking to stay for a while, you are no where near.... anything. They do however, have parking so, there is that. Free transport to/from the airport too. When we called, they said 20 minutes and he was there in 5. It is only 5 minutes by shuttle.

We didn't realize this on our earlier visit, but Airport Honolulu Hotel provides a free shuttle to and from the airport! We paid for a taxi last year, but this time we avoided that extra expense and hassle. The bus was very clean, bags were loaded for us, and the driver was the nicest guy. Plus our hotel visit (just for a quick layover) was perfect - very restful, safe, and quiet. We'll keep this place on our future agenda!

Great place for transit stopover for young families.Efficient and friendly service.Fairly good retail store with prices not over-the-top.Prompt shuttle service to/from airport.Room noise minimal durign our stay.

I booked this hotel solely because of its proximity to Honolulu International Airport, and I was very pleasantly surprised. I had expected a pretty average hotel/motel, and I have to admit that, based on curb appeal, this is not a place I'd have chosen. It looks fine, but it certainly doesn't announce itself. Our experience, however, convinced us that we'd return to the Airport Honolulu Hotel without question the next time we overnight in Honolulu.Our room was very clean and comfortable, though not spacious. We both slept very well and noticed no noise from adjacent rooms. The air conditioning was effective and did not disturb our sleep. I requested a quiet room and we were lodged near the end of a long hallway, away from the elevators. The restaurant was open during our stay, and we had very good meals, both dinner and breakfast. Our breakfast omelettes were among the best we've ever had, and the dining area at poolside was quite pleasant. The "view" is of the pool and the hotel surrounding the courtyard, but the breeze was delightful and the atmosphere was relaxing. I read that the hotel shuttle will deliver you to the restaurant at a "sister" hotel on the days this restaurant is closed. That would certainly save a taxi ride, but would be boring and inconvenient if you stayed for any length of time.We called for the airport shuttle after we'd claimed our baggage and it arrived promptly. It ran right on schedule to return us to the airport the next morning. The staff we encountered were all tremendously pleasant and helpful. Enjoy your stay!

The reason I gave 5 stars is that I had all I need in the room. The hotel has its own restaurant and a convenient store. Very near to the airport good staff and free shuttle service. Looking forward on my next stay.

This hotel is ok for a night or two but no longer. I travelled from the UK and stayed 10 nights on business.The restaurant is only open limited evenings, so you have to result in using the con artist taxi drivers to get somewhere to eat. Tip-always ask the cost or fixed price or the cab driver will literally take you for a ride. The hotel rooms are dated but clean and comfortable. The staff can be a little rude but are helpful when needed.Be careful of beggars around the ground of the hotel. They live in the under ground of nimitz highway and can be a nuisance.Stay no longer then 2 nights if using a stop to the airport. Any longer find a hotel in wikiki/honolulu ...they are also cheaper than this place.

Our room was the only room in all of Oahu .we had to come early because we had a big snow storm back home.it was loud at night .i did not like at all that the pool opened at 9:00am and closed at 7:00pm.the breakfast was okay.the gym opened at 6:00 we were waiting they would not let us in.the beds were very small and it was fine I gusses .the only thing I liked was the hot water in the shower.the staff were nice. But I would give it 3out of10.

I have never been to a hotel where the staff are so friendly on a personal basis. Nieda is an amazing housekeeper and so sweet with my 18 month old son. The dining downstairs has great breakfast and dinner, i just wish they had it open for dinner more than 3 nights. Very convenient location to other places to eat and the bust stop which is a pretty easy system to use.

This hotel was my last choice. And only choice no hotels available in Waikiki I paid a crazy $239 a night for two nights only because it was an emergency the positives. Close to the airport, free 24 hour shuttleNegativesLoud noisy rooms very close to highway Tired aged room. I saw I think a gecko or spider under broken microwave but can't confirm didnt hunt it down. Too creepy Bathroom was cleanish. Shower disaster head shakes. Notes on lobbyThere is security free parking free wifi and diner type restaurant. Pricey And small convenience storeBed felt soft a plus. Tv LCD worked 20 channels no HD.

We are a military family and this was our first station, I was so scared to be so far away from home. When we arrived at the hotel we were tired and jet lagged. I got up my first morning and my husband went to work and the house keeper came and just like that I had an amazing kind lady, who not only cleaned but also told me places to visit, where to shop, and has become a smiling face for our time here. Nieda has been an amazing blessing to our life's, as she cleans the room she makes me smile and feel that I am not alone in this journey 5000 miles away from home. I look foward to seeing my friends Nieda and Elizabeth ( who also has been so kind and helpful to me each day). I feel that these ladies have given me and my family an amazing, solid start to this amazing journey in Hawaii. I do hope that any one that is PCS to Hawaii or just visiting has the pleasure of this hotel and of Nieda. Thank you Airport Hawaii Hotel for being more than just a hotel, thank you for being our first Hawaii home away from home.

We were here for a month and it was a pleasure. Our children enjoyed the pool,which was clean and never crowed. The staff here are awesome, especially our housekeeper Lorna she was super great. I will definitely cone back just because of the hospitality.

We stayed here at both the beginning and the end of our vacation. Neither stay was planned, but both were enjoyable, especially the latter. Our flight from Honolulu to Moloka'i had to turn back because of fog, so we had to spend a night here. To our surprise, Hawaiian Airlines paid for the room. We got to Moloka'i the next day, and a week after that returned to Honolulu. However, our flight back to Massachusetts was canceled because of a snowstorm there, so we were forced--FORCED, I tell you--to spend another night in Hawai'i. We were not surprised that United Airlines refused to pay for accommodations, but the AAA rate at the Airport Hotel was not outrageous. The room was pleasant, and the staff was even more so. Because our return to the mainland was postponed by a day, we got to watch the Super Bowl on the TV in our hotel room instead of just getting updates from the cockpit during a flight from San Francisco to Newark. Before the game we ate lunch at Ninja Sushi (excellent), and after the game we had dinner at Da Big Kahuna's Pizzas-n-Stuffs (good), two restaurants in the Airport Trade Center, just a couple blocks from the hotel. The next day, we came home to drifting snow and rejoicing Patriots fans.

The hotel is very nice and clean. The restaurant is very nice and the food and prices are great considering the location is Hawaii where everything is very expensive. Shuttle service every 30 minutes was outstanding. I am writing this review to comment on the employees. I don't know if I have ever stayed at a place where everyone was exceptionally courteous and friendly. Everyone greeted us with a smile on their face and asked if I needed any help. A joy to stay there even with the noise from the airport. The employees make the place.

This was a really nice updated room that I stayed for one night. I had a delay with a flight and this is where I stayed until the next flight. The bathroom was nicely updated. The room was nice and clean and the staff was really nice. The hotel design is odd and look of the hotel needs to be updated, this is my personally opinion. Overall I would totally stay in this hotel. I thought the room was perfect especially for the location.

Airport Honolulu Hotel is another hotel that we found that was enjoyable to stay for a night or two or maybe even longer. Nice comfortable room. Roomy well decorative lobby. Friendly desk clerk. The pool area is excellent. It is a great place to hang out and get some sun. There are places that you can go to eat close by just a couple of minutes away. We are looking forward to going back if the chance arrive to stay longer than one night.

Like a lot of travelers we were looking for a hotel close to the airport after a late arrival. This was a good choice as it was very convenient to the airport, has good service and acceptable comfort. The bed isn't the best, the rooms are a bit dated and there aren't many amenities. However the desk clerk was great in sorting out a problem with our reservation (which wasn't the hotel's fault). In the end, we are glad we chose this hotel for our arrival day in Honolulu.

The hotel itself is not bad, though it is really not great either. It is ok for a layover. However, the service is terrible. We had to stay there twice on a recent trip through Honolulu. The first time we reserved a king bed and asked for a crib in the room. We would not arrive until 3:00 AM and really needed rest for our 16 month old daughter. We got to the hotel and found that instead of a king sized bed we had two doubles and no crib. The girl at the front desk said, "I see that you reserved a crib, but there is not one in the room and their is no one in housekeeping right now." So in other words, she thought that we would just figure something else out. We insisted she figure out a way to get us a crib and finally someone from security was able to get us one. No king sized beds were available though. The next time through I reserved the exact same thing. This time though I called the day before and told the person that answered how important it was that I have a crib in the room. We show up and, you guessed it, two double beds and no crib. It took around 20 minutes to get us a crib and we were just out of luck on the bed size. My thing is if you aren't going to hold a king sized bed for those that reserve it, why even offer one? Why not just say, "Reserve a room, we'll decide what kind of bed you get when you arrive." The worst thing is they basically have no competition since the only other airport hotel is owned by the same company. Looks like next time we will just pay the money to get a cab and stay in Waikiki. I would rather be inconvenienced than give these people anymore of my money.

We stayed here to break up our flight. The room was spacious and the wifi was excellent. Front desk staff were helpful with directions to eat out and their is a little shop located within the hotel. The airport shuttle was very convenient and wouldn't hesitate in staying here again for a lay over.

If you want/need to be near the airport, it's worth considering. It is clean and everything including the wifi works. The air conditioner was a bit noisy, but it was an ambient noise so not really a problem for sleeping. The shuttle pickup was prompt, but load the hotel number on your phone as I could not find a courtesy phone in/near baggage claim. Only meal served every day is breakfast. They offer a shuttle to the Best Western for other meals. Also, if you can find the nearest Starbucks about 2 blocks away, there are some quick food options in the same building. The hotel shop also has snacks.

We stayed here because he had an early morning flight. I had read reviews so knew what to do in relation to the shuttle. As soon as we landed, I called the hotel on the free airport phones and asked for them to send the shuttle. By the time our bags had come out the shuttle was already waiting for us.Rooms were dated, but it was relatively clean and functional and air con and wifi worked fine. The hotel was very big so we did have to walk a long way to our rooms.Upon check out, the shuttle bus was there and left at the scheduled time. Unlike other reviewers, we had no issues with the shuttle bus.You only stay here for the convenience of being close to the airport. Don't expect too much.

If you ignore the ugly exteriors, this hotel is exactly what you want in an airport hotel. Nicely appointed with fresh bedding, friendly staff when you arrive exhausted, a prompt van pickup, and decent breakfast to send you on your way. No frills, but just right. The public bus to town is right outside, and they hand you a little paper so you know which ones you can take. It's $2.50 or $1.00 with Medicare card.

This is a very unremarkable hotel that we sometimes all need to stay because of early morning or late arrival flight times. Rooms are average size and decor is dated. Food is quite pricey considering the price of the dishes.What irritated us is the price of the car parking at $ 6 per hour or $30 per night. ( first hour free)We refused to pay $30 and returned the rental car in the evening. A taxi to Waikiki that takes 30mins cost only $25 or so. We think it is a bit excessive to charge so much.

I left my room to walk my dog and when I came back the key didn't work. I knew I was not supposed to walk around the lobby with my dogs but I HAD NO CHOICE, I had to go to the front desk to get a new key. Before I started explaining myself the clerk started yelling at me, telling I had to leave the premises right away. Whatever happened to the Aloha spirit?I would not recommend this hotel to any military family.Be prepared to be ripped off. Outrageous fees if you have a pet and a car. Dusty rooms and moldy bath tub.

I don't really know the price of this hotel because it was arranged by American Airlines (our luggage where we had a tent, didn't make the flight and was coming the next day so they had to arrange us a hotel). But we got there around 20.30 with the vouchers, the staff was ok, they told us dinner and breakfast were served on the Best Western which was a short walk away. We asked her if we were on time for dinner and she said "Yes, absolutely". We got to dinner literally 9.01 and the guy told us sorry, the kitchen is closed you can't have dinner. We went back to the hotel on a rage. The room was OK (clean, a typical US hotel) but I could see that the hotel itself was a bit dated and some things (like doors and alleys) weren't in the best of conditions, but I'm not complaining about that. Then we had a problem next day on breakfast were the lady said we couldn't combine our vouchers in the end, but that wasn't this has nothing to do with this hotel. I would say it's OK for one night only.

The hotel is very close to the airport, but it's hard to get to without shuttle bus. They claimed the shuttle is every 30 mins and 24 hours, however, the shuttle bus is never on-time, I was sending my parents to the airport first in the morning, and the bus was about 15 mins late. When I asked for the pickup later, I waited in the terminal for about 40 mins. I checked out around 1:20PM and confirmed with the staff in front desk that the next shuttle to airport is at 1:30PM; the shuttle eventually came at 1:45PM, and driver told me that the next one is 2PM , the 1:30PM one was leaving and already came back. The driver was lying in my face, I was waiting for the shuttle since 1:20PM, and there is no shuttle at all! It's not huge deal if the shuttle is late, but it is if someone lying. At the end, they sent another driver to drive me to the airport. The driver who was lying didn't apologize at all, and kept saying that I missed 1:30 shuttle and wishing me "good luck" because the traffic is bad.The staff in the front desk is nice but the shuttle service is terrible!

We stayed at this hotel overnight in December 2014 in transit between flights. It was very handy to the airport and the free shuttle worked perfectly. Once we collected our luggage, we rang the hotel and the shuttle was there to collect us in 5 minutes.Check in and check out was super efficient and staff were very friendly. The room was large, clean and comfortable and perfect for a short rest in between flights. If I was going to Honolulu for any longer time though, I would not stay here as it is not too close to all the action!!!..ie. Waikiki beach, shopping, etc.

This was a very decent hotel.Right next to the airport, which is a wonderful way of getting to your flight on time.The rooms were clean, the beds were comfortable. But the air conditioning was extremely loud, and it was very difficult to sleep.

I found this hotel to be a very convenient place to spend the night when passing through Honolulu to go to the Big Island.The hotel is very clean & neat, staff members are extremely friendly & helpful, rooms are very comfortable and there is a 24 hour free shuttle from the airport.I arrived at the hotel at a God forsaken hour, 3 in the morning, but the front desk was very nice to accommodate me as soon as a room was available. They usually let people check in at 3 p.m., but the nice lady at he desk put me in a room as early as 8.30 in the morning when the cleaning lady was at work. I thought it was a very friendly gesture toward this very weary traveler. Before they could do that I fell asleep on a sofa in the lounge knowing very well it would not be nice to do this in a hotel. The security guard who woke me up and told me that I could not lie there, instead had to sit according to the hotel policy, apparently, felt very bad for me. Anyway, I really appreciated that they were very understanding of my situation.The room was spacious, had a fridge and a microwave, a coffee machine and all other basic amenities. There was also free Wi-Fi. So, my stay was pretty comfortable.Here are some constructive criticisms I have for the nice people at this hotel:Please try to create at least a small bar; when the restaurant closes at 9.p.m the whole pool section is closed. If you do not have transportation and if you do not want to walk out at night, there is no place to get a drink other than a buy a six pack of beer or a whole bottle of wine at the hotel store at a very high price. I find this rather unfair.Also, I think the restaurant has poor quality food. It is just one step above a fast food joint. I think you can improve the quality of the restaurant and make it nicer for the guests.

I have stayed at this property once, and it is evidenced that the room has gone through some renovations. At least it feels less like a motel than my previous stay. However, the decor is still on the classic side and the carpet is just nasty. But I am surprised at its internet service, which works quite well and is free. The shuttle service operates twice per hour, and is on demand from the airport to the hotel. The drivers are friendly, and there are many returned customers especially residents from other islands. The front desk staffs are friendly, but obviously short-staffed. There are often waits for check-ins. The restaurant offers breakfasts daily and dinner on the weekdays. But don't worry! Within a five to ten minutes walk, there is a 24 hours McDonald and an airport strip mall, which features a few casual fast food restaurants, a Starbucks, and a Jumba juice. In general, I will return to this hotel if I need to fly to other Islands for day trips or need to be closed to the airport. However for visitors of the island, you should stay at Waikiki or other hotels. This is truly an airport hotel, which serves its purpose of providing short term stay for transit passengers.

I was so impressed by the authenticity and integrity of the staff, especially in the restaurant (breakfasts are divine) and house keeping (Name begins with N) was super. Everyone was so helpful and interested in my well-being and comfort.

My wife and I ended up at this hotel by accident, when our flight got cancelled and American Airlines put us there for the night. I can live with 1 star basic hotel, but the rudeness of staff was outrageous. The morning after our unexpected sleep-over, I asked for a late check out (we got in at 2am). Front desk said, "Denied," and hung up. I asked to speak with a manager, "not available." Ugh--- we got up and packed. Regrettably, our flight was delayed until the following evening. The bar was closed in the hotel, so we bought two beers in the gift shop. I asked for a bottle opener--- they did not have one and sent me to the front desk. Over to the front desk where the delightful staff informed us they did not have one either. By chance, a guy in lobby had one on his key chain and opened our beers. The front desk lady then said, "you cant drink that here!" I said, we would exit the lobby and go to the back area, where a TV was playing and no one was around. She said, "not allowed." I was tired and had two open beers in my hand (why did the gift shop sell me if I could not drink?), I ignored her and walked away. My wife and I sat down to enjoy our cold refreshment-----when the rental cop security guard was sent over from the front desk and told us to dispose of our beers or he would call Honolulu PD. My wife and I are two 50 year old adults, celebrating our 25th anniversary, exhausted from terrible night and no extra sleep in time and now, we cant even enjoy a beer in privacy?! Outrageous and disappointing. DO NOT PATRONAGE A PLACE WITH SUCH HEARTLESS STAFF!
user_name:
Michael M
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: Stayed at this hotel for one night between flights. Free Shuttle for which I had to wait long (~45 minutes) despite calling the hotel telling them I was ready to be picked up at the airport.The hotel is a bit dated, but the room was nice with a comfortable bed.There's a convenience store in the hotel which is nice. Restaurant was closed the evening I arrived and I was directed to the sister property Best Western 1 block away. Only other alternative in the area that evening was McDonalds. Everything else was closed.

Excellent, clean and good location for business people. If you're coming in late or leaving early morning this is a great hotel to stay at. It is 3 minutes from the airport but quiet. It is not near the beaches but great location to meet up with business associates, rent a car, shopping within a mile.

If you have a night layover, this is the best place to stay because it's close to the airport and has a free shuttle. We're local, but we also have stayed here and had family stay here. I'd recommend it to anybody. A night stay will probably run a little over $100. The free shuttle will pick up at the airport if you call them when you arrive. There's no sight-seeing around this hotel. It's in an industrial area right off the freeway. The onsite restaurant serves breakfast and dinner (no lunch), but ends their service at 9pm so not helpful if you're arriving late at night. There is a new 24 hour McDonalds nearby.

We originally chose Airport Honolulu Hotel for its location. We visited Pearl Harbor, and various locations on the Island, and after 3 days we were very happy with our choice. Our room was very nice, clean, quiet and comfortable. We ate breakfast every morning in the restaurant, and our food was delicious and the portions were large enough that my wife and I split breakfast after the first morning. From the moment we walked in the door till we checked out the staff was super friendly and very helpful. Starbucks is a short walk out the back gate, If we ever return to this area again, we will stay here again.

I was returning to Honolulu from Peoria, Illinois, in route to Bangkok. I wanted to stay near the airport. The rooms were very comfortable. The staff was helpful and courteous. There is a shuttle service to and from the airport. The only thing that was a bit of an inconvenience was that the 'key' cards stopped working after putting them in my wallet for an extended period of time and I would have to return to the front desk to have them 'fixed'. I ate breakfast in the hotel's restaurant and the food was quite good with large portions. W-fi worked good.

This is the only Hotel close to the airport with a free shuttle. We stayed overnight between flights heading home. The driver was polite and courteous and helpful. The front desk was the same. The room was a long walk, the furtherest from the front door,room 457. It was standard size and comfortable for the night. Only paper cups for coffee and only powder milk substitute.We ate dinner in the restaurant downstairs. The wait staff were friendly and efficient. The food was good, burger and chips, and shrimp fettuccine. Breakfast was in the restaurant also. The staff ( only 3 ) had too work very hard and fast, which they did, on a busy Friday morning. Management did not give the customers the necessary number of waiters required, more like 5 were needed. We were seated immediately but had to wait several minutes just to get water. Then it took about ten more minutes to get coffee ( which was very good ). Several tables were piled with empty/dirty plates. There was not enough staff to clear tables. It seems to occur on a regularly. The breakfast itself was very tasty and filling. When we return to Hawaii we will stay in elsewhere.

We chose this hotel because it was close to the airport and it has a free shuttle! The hotel is a bit dated, but the room was great, plenty of room for our 2 suitcases and the kingsize bed very comfortable. There is a coffee machine in the room and we would have liked to have proper cups in stead of the plastic ones provided. Also no glasses. The convenience store in the hotel is very handy to buy water, something to eat etc.

Stopped here for one night waiting for next connection to the mainland U.S. Liked having the small convenience store inside main hotel to purchase some breakfast items(cereal/banana/milk) for early departure before restaurant was open the following day. They have a place to purchase stamps there and quite a few other items as well. I felt the room was basic and could use some updated furniture. There was a small fridge in the room. My greatest discomfort was the bed-much to hard personally. Needs a pillow top or foam topper. Got about 2 hours of sleep before a long journey the next day. There was a beautiful pool but didn't have the time to enjoy it. The pool is open to the restaurant area. The airport shuttles run on the hour and then on the half hour-reliable and friendly drivers. Ck-out was simple and easy. Would only stay if necessary due to the bed issue. Takes about 5-10 mins. to get from the hotel to the airport by shuttle. Wi-Fi didn't work that well.

We stay here when we have Dr visits at the nearby Kaiser Hospital. There is a shuttle to and from the hotel and if you combine this with the Kaiser shuttle a car is unnecessary. There are a lot of military passing through and it's nice to see the young soldiers with their families. The rooms are standard hotel furniture but quite spacious and sparkling clean. Very clean comfy beds the sheets feel like they've been ironed. The pool is pleasant and opened till 7:00 at night for a pleasant swim before dinner in the restaurant. The food is okay, service is good. It's a pleasant reliable hotel, no surprises. Free wifi. Noise from nearby freeway is the only bummer.

We are really happy with the Airport Honolulu Hotel because they accept pets. We are local residents that needed a one night stay because our home was being tented for drywall termites. Having three cats made it a challenge to find a place to stay. I should have given a 4 star rating because of the restaurant. $14 for bacon and eggs breakfast is ridiculous. But, the hotel is pet friendly and gives military discount. So with that in mind I would stay there again if the same situation arises.

Arrived at 5:30 am after flying all night from Tahiti. First room we were given was full of paint cans.Second room the plastic key wouldn't open the door. Went to the front desk for the third time and was told Security would come and open the door. Waited twenty min but no Security came so after the fourth trip to the front desk I lost my cool. We then were let into the room by Security and showeredand went to the restaurant. Fantastic waitperson but the food was GARBAGE. We then had to ask again to let into my room. They sent an email asking for a review and I had a ball filling that out. Gotan email agreeing to a 50% credit and was instructed to call and verify my CC #. Tried to explain to their Customer Service Rep but it was very apparent he could have cared less.In over 60+ years of traveling this was the worst HOTEL we have ever been in.

Front reception staff were courteous on arrival, however they were more interested in their own conversations another time I approached the desk for directions to bus, food venues etc. This hotel is very dated however the room was clean. Wi fi was available throughout the hotel. The air conditioners are old and the controllers were not stable enough to operate correctly.There is a shop within the hotel which has a range of drinks, snacks etc.The free shuttle to the airport was great and the driver was very courteous and directed us to the correct area for check in. The hotel is reasonably quiet considering it's close location to the airport.I would stay in this hotel again for an overnight stay but not for a longer period of time.

We were looking for a convenient location and it's that. That's where the joy ended! Check-In was adequate but hardly welcoming. For first time visitors they needed to make a better effort with the room assignment: small, overlooking the car park, sadly dated furnishings and a bathroom door that had to be cut to close over the toilet seat! Given we were only staying 1 night, got over it. Worse was to come. The small pool was full of daredevil kids-was looking forward to a relaxing swim:( The restaurant was open that evening and the menu was adequate but the meal was cold. Leaving the restaurant, we asked for some tea bags as there were none in the room. Were told we'd have to PAY for them, seriously?! Back to the sad room for an early night, surprise, the sheets were soiled!! Not interested in apologies at that point... For $180, this was a disgusting experience. Do yourself a favour and go the Best Western-could NOT be any worse! !

Stayed for one night in late October. Just outside the airport. Within a mile of 2 strip malls with restaurants. Not much else around. Rooms decent size - Beds o.k.. Gift Shop and restaurant on site. Staff very helpful. Shuttle to airport every 30 minutes.

The main pull factor for this hotel is ofcourse its proximity to the airport. I stayed one night for an early departure and for that purpose it served well.A free shuttle departs every half hour, 24/7.Room is OK, the bed was comfortable which is the main thing.Other than that there was not much around. The pool was already closed when I arrived and the restaurant is only open a few days a week. There is a handy mini market which closes at 11pm.The night staff was friendly but I didn't find them very knowledgable. I asked for directions to any takeaway restaurants nearby. There is a McDonalds around the corner that I spotted from the bus. One staff did not know about it, the other said the McDonalds was the only food place nearby. Once I arrived at McDonalds I spotted several other places including a night market across the street, literally next door from the hotel.

Clean, comfortable rooms very convenient to the airport. Room furniture needs to be up-dated. Microwave and refrigerator added to the convenience. Lance (hotel manager) responded quickly to a problem. He was very customer service oriented.
user_name:
William S
North Haledon, New Jersey

review_body: Basic accommodations. Place is a bit dated. Free shuttle. Call to arrange pickup from phone near baggage claim. Check in was fast.Room was clean and comfortable. Bed was good. Shower was great. They had small frig, coffee maker and microwave.Over priced restaurant and gift shop/general store but we were able to buy some cereal and milk for the morning. Also free WiFi.Recommended as a hotel near the airport.

The hotel appears cater for two audiences- those people who are getting an early morning flight and military personnel. Neither of which have any choice about staying there...The hotel is clean,but functional and rather dated. The air conditioning is an impressively noisy tank from the 1970s (we chose quiet over cool). There is a complimentary shuttle bus twice an hour from courtesy bus stop at the terminal (no signs), though our bus had 'God radio' blaring out, which was rather awkward for those who weren't devoutly Christian and slightly odd for a bus service. If you're just staying over a night for a flight it makes sense - if you're not then there's better and cheaper places elsewhere in honululu

Trying to grab that extra day in Hawaii, we were 1 nights accommodation short. Having an early flight, we just needed something close to the airport. After spending as long as possible in Waikiki, arrived about 6 pm at hotel, there was a seamless check in, found our room, then explored the hotel. Hotel was clean, staff efficient, small shop with all the right things ( which was good as there was nothing within walking distance) Restaurant only open a few nights, shuttle service offered to take you to their sister hotel to use their restaurant. We just bought food from the in house shop. Hotel located very near the airport. Check out too easy. Free Shuttle service to airport very good, Hotel a little bit dated. Early morning wake-up call worked.

What a dump and an embarrassment to Hawaii. I'm usually quite articulate in my reviews, but there are so many negatives, I'm just going to list them 1. There is no restaurant or room service after breakfast hours. Yes, I'm not kidding. 2. The shuttle only leave twice an hour and takes an unacceptable time to arrive - a taxi to downtown would be quicker 3. The rooms are seriously tired and outdated 4. It's way overpriced5. The room towels are so small it's a joke6. There is no kettle to make tea (just a coffee machine) 7. The bed is uncomfortable 8. The aircon is so noisy its unbearableThere simply is no reason to stay here. Downtown is close. I'm angry at myself for staying here and hope you don't make the same mistake.

My sister and I enjoyed our quick shuttle trip to the hotel, an easy check-in late at night, speedy assistance with our luggage -- then a chance the next day to wind down from a long plane trip from Down Under. We spent the day by the pool (or in it), and ate lightly from a convenient restaurant delivery. Early the next morning the hotel shuttle whisked us to the airport when we appeared at the front desk. The room was clean, well appointed, and exactly like the photo. We truly didn't hear freeway or airport noise until we went outside to poolside. The bed was the most comfortable we'd slept in in the past 6 weeks.We were well pleased with service, staff, and amenities at Airport Honolulu Hotel, and agreed we would stay there again.

I have stayed at this hotel for its' convenient location and earlier more reasonable rates.HOWEVER, after checking what they want for a stay in late January, I have to caution others. Go Elsewhere. It is not worth almost two hundred a night. In reality it isn't worth half that! Take the shuttle into Honolulu.
