Stay at someplace nicer and have a quieter stay with more dining options.a two hundred a night...give your head a shake!

I have stayed in all the hotels on Honolulu, Oahu including Hale Koa Hotel. For convenience, I have found Airport Honolulu Hotel to be it. Your stay at this hotel will meet your expectation. I highly recommend Airport Honolulu Hotel to you. I always enjoy my visit.

The hotel is close to the airport; pickup is a simple phone call away and service is wonderful. The new decor and paint have given it a fresh new look. We stay here often when we visit relatives and have never had a negative issue. Friendly, clean and very accommodating staff. The location is perfect for us enabling us to avoid the downtown traffic.

The hotel staff did an outstanding job providing room and rooms to support our needs. Would like to give a special thanks to the ladies at the service desk or check in. Awesome is all we can say. The only draw back is the lack of a club to socialize and relax.

Confirmed late arrival. Called for pickup and told moved to their other airport hotel. Put in an old cinder block building right on noisy Nimitz Highway for same price. The desk clerk gave us a small credit that in no way made up for poor location.
user_name:
Kat S
Kaunakakai, Hawaii, United States

review_body: Terrible service. Trouble getting picked up, and later being told it was my hearing that was impaired. Next day, with checking out the same again. These ladies just standing there saying the same and the same, while I obviously didn't understand what she was saying.

Start by saying I live on Oahu and used hotel for location. Can walk to/from airport. I've stayed in several hotels and this one is a pretty solid 2.5 star. Not a full 3 because of no free parking, lack of food services, and not enough staff (and bad tempered rude old shuttle driver)Staff is friendly with the exception of the old guy that drives the shuttle. Note to management "find a new shuttle driver." And forget free guest or occupant parking. The hotel recently gated off the lot and charges everyone for parking (not cheap).Only real pro is its location to the airport, if like me you need a few nights stay to island hop.To my friends, family, and tourists. Look into Waikiki hotels if on vacation. Can find better deals and better hotels.This hotel for just under 200 a night was "meh"

Needed a good airport hotel with a free shuttle because we arrived in Honolulu late and planned to pick up our rental car back at the airport the next morning; this was a perfect option. To get the shuttle, you just pick up one of the Courtesy Phones in baggage claim and call the number listed (is it 66? can't recall! but it's noted there), and the shuttle service was prompt and friendly. For going back to the airport, the shuttle leaves every half hour (no need to reserve) but be aware that they're sometimes so prompt that it may leave a few minutes early (which I loved! But good to know for more pokey travelers.) The hotel itself was clean, very friendly staff, just great for what we needed for the night. I had been also looking at the airport Best Western, but glad we went with this one and would do it again (recommended it to friends who will be staying there for their trip in a few weeks.) One good tip is that they have an awesome gift shop - like really!! awesome for a hotel gift shop - almost like a small grocery store in terms of selection, and if you were on your way out of HI staying here, many of the "good" souvenirs we saw/wanted you could pick up in their little gift shop! Not sure of the hours, but without knowing what's around for stores in walking distance, knowing that there's a little store on site is really calming :) in case you forgot anything or just need some macadamia nut pancake mix or Visine or postcards…or whatever. ;) Great stay and just what we needed for a near-airport overnight (also: the shuttle drove us right to the Hertz rental pickup in the AM; I had expected to get dropped off at the terminal and have to do the bus etc., and maybe that's the case if they're busy, but it was a nice surprise.)

They have an awful lot of rooms but its easy to find, and the airport shuttle bus that they have, makes it even easier. There is a convenient shop open here 24-7, so you can get a few snacks and so even when arriving late. the rooms are big and got everything you need.

What's good?transit to from airportclean roomWhat's not so goodif you ask for a room away from the freeway noise it's quite a long walk through a car park to reach the buildingthe air conditioner rattles all night longThere are two airport hotels, The other (best western) is better although don't expect to be blown away there!

From the day we checked in until the day we checked we received top notch service and care! The staff was always helpful and catered to our needs. The Military program offered there was indeed one of a kind. LES and Rebekah are amazing and we are very thankful for them! ! Resources were provided to meet our personal needs and the staff always had a smile on their faces! Improvements to rooms and hallways were being during our time there and it never interfered with our stay! All of the workers seemed very please to make the hotel beautiful. Our housekeeper Neida was amazing. She always smiled and always made sure our room was nice and clean. Really going to miss seeing her daily! We will be settling in to the other side of the island but I'm sure we will stay here again and recommend to family, friends and fellow service members! Thank you all for your hard work!!!

Police /security in lobby several dogs all over. Appears to be people living there in long term basis clothes drying from open windows no working pool or operating restaurant no room service or assistance offered It was basically clean Looked like old alcoholics n low Income guests

The Veterans Administration made the reservations for me. I was scheduled for foot (left and right) surgery on September 17th. We checked in on the 16th. The personnel at the front desk were extremely helpful and very accommodating. We requested a rollaway bed and didn't have any problems. The maid service was excellent. Marilyn did a tremendous job taking care of the room as I was laid up in bed for 5 days. I would definitely stay here providing Marilyn would be our room attendant. The parking was very good as I was wheelchair bound for my stay. Handicap parking usually was available.
user_name:
Harold R
Hilo, Hawaii, United States

review_body: We chose this hotel based strictly on location. We did not arrive in Honolulu until 9pm and needed to be at Pearl Harbor at 9am and this property was the closest to both. We enjoyed a refreshing shower and a very comfortable night's sleep after our 12 hr flight. It is not the ideal location to spend a week in the area, but it exceeded our expectations of a high volume, high turnover hotel near a major airport. There was obvious effort by the staff to provide exemplary service, regardless of how brief our stay, and we felt that the property was in above average condition, given the high traffic use. We almost called back a couple of days later to get additional nights as we were so disappointed in the Diamondhead B&B, but again, location won out- the inferior B&B was near the beach and that's what we preferred the rest of the trip. The on site restaurant provides a wonderful breakfast for $10-15 each. The only thing we did not like was paying an additional parking fee, on top of what we felt was an inflated room price. The parking is so limited they contract a company to park and retrieve your car for you, but this was handled with no problems. The cars were packed in the tiny lot 3 deep but the attendants handled the cars competently and promptly. This is a great place to stay if you need to be near the Honolulu airport, but you will pay for the location.
user_name:
Kimberly T
High Point, North Carolina

review_body: There's not enough kind words for my sentiments on this hotel. It is very visible the constant efforts to upgrade and maintain this already immaculately maintained property.PCSing is definitely hard and leaving friends and family behind is even harder but Ohana Honolulu airport hotel staff made the transition so seamless. Our first POC was with Les before arriving and you will learn that there is no time rush here in Hawaii. But no matter what time of day it is, this man will bend over backwards to contact you and once you are here, he will do the same to help you with anything.Most importantly, what made this almost 2 month stay at the hotel perfect was the staff. From day one, we knew this was going to be awesome. Not sure of her name but the young lady that drove the shuttle bus was super tiny but don't let the size fool you. She greeted us with a wonderful smile and proceeded to lift our luggage in beast mode! Mrs K and Mrs. Ann worked the front desk and they were always so nice and helpful. From recommending places to go, how to get there, ways to save money here and making sure we ended up in convenient rooms.This is where I get teary eyed. Rofel was the lady that maintained our rooms. She not only kept our room immaculate but made our rooms feel like home. By the 3rd day she immediately picked up on how our daughter slept. When she walked into her room, the bed had been made with her own sponge bob blankets, pillows and extra blanket. She treated us like her daughters and I looked forward to seeing her everyday. The day she was not on our floor I was sad but she said "Janice is there and just as lovely". She was right. Janice greeted us with the same smile and she automatically felt like my sister. There is also a young man named Richard. I needed help one day and much like the ladies on our floor, he went out of his way to help and he did it with a warm smile. The hotel also provides you with vouchers to eat at their diner. Although we only ate breakfast there, mostly due to it being quite pricey, the proportions are huge! The cook, in which I've never met, puts his heart in every single dish he prepares. To top it off the waitresses are amazing. They all take their time to learn your habits and likes/dislikes. Mrs Robin, Sharon, Tes, Donna and Tim love their customers and have the warmest smiles. My only constructive criticism would be to find a better system for the parking. The vale parking and redoing the parking spaces are a great start but it's still quite frustrating, especially on the weekend. The taxis also have designated spots in which I believe not only takes up needed space but they park in an awkward way and in undesignated spaces that make it difficult to get by. Besides that, mahalo for making us feel like family and I plan on returning to visit!!!Rehina and Victor Lee

We've had a mediocre experience at this hotel. First, the entire building, including rooms, is in need of a deep cleaning as our feet and socks turned completely black after walking on the room's carpet. There is not enough room for parking and all the cars kept blocking the passage for lack of parking space. I was late at work twice because of this problem and had already discussed this issue with the management. The most ridicolous and absurd thing came from the security guard who knocked at my door asking me to take away my swimsuits from the balcony because "it was not allowed". Now, I have been staying at Outrigger Waikiki Beach Hotel, a four-star resort, hanging my clean, washed swimsuit over the balcony and no one ever complained about that. Here, in a two-star motel facing a noisy highway and nothing else, I received an absurd request to move my swimsuits because "it is not allowed". Well, they should provide a hanging line in the bathtub or at least one miserable chair outside the balcony to allow guests to dry their things. If it wasn't for my son's school district requesting to reside in the commuting area we would still staying at Outrigger Waikiki. I give it two stars for the courtesy and niceness of Teresita, the maid, who seems to have nothing to do with all this surrounding misery.

Stayed one night, in transit waiting to catch flight next morning early. Hotel was nice & clean and room excellent. Free shuttle was on time,so quite happy with the Hotel. Within walking distance there was a number of small food places where we had a nice meal.Just a small point of annoyance is the Robotic personality trait adopted by some of the Hotel reception people in the US.and unfortunately by one person at this Hotel. But for a one night stay it was very good.

We had a late night flight into Honolulu with a connecting flight to Brisbane in the morning. I chose the airport hotel mostly because of convenience, proximity to the airport, and the free shuttle service. The hotel was dated, but everything was clean and in good condition. Shuttle seemed to take a while to arrive after we called on the phone from airport considering they are located less than a mile. If we had to wait much longer we would have ordered a taxi. Also the room we had was a very LONG way from reception. We had to walk with all our luggage to another building then it was located last room on the floor. Seemed crazy we had to walk so far. Only nice thing was the room was already air-conditioned when we arrived and the temperature was extremely comfortable for sleeping - even on a very warm Hawaii night. The aircon though was quite noisy. Not sure we would go back again even for an overnight stay. The computer and printer usage rates were outrageously high - if you're going straight to the airport, wait to print your boarding passes there.

I was staying here for Medical reasons and I am so glad.I felt as part of the family here. Ms. Phillips Warm and Beautiful smile made my troubled time so comfortable that I forgot at times why I was really here, and then Marilyn and Marites a whole story in itself. Marilyn and Marites ensured that my room was always in top shape and all my needs where taken care of. Thier smile, care and concern about my Health made me forget that I was here alone and made my healing so much easier, they ensured I was comfortable at all time and thier concern for my Service Dog made it easier for me to relax. I totally enjoyed everything from Security Staff, Your Front Desk Staff to Maint. I am So Greatful to have stayed here. I once again Must mention Rebekah, Marilyn and Marites from deep down I Thank You and so does KOA. I was here for almost 2 months and will always return.

We stayed for just a night when we arrived in Honolulu late at night. Because we were departing for another island the next morning it made sense to stay here. This hotel was absolutely fine for just a night. They had a free shuttle service which picked you up and dropped you off at the airport, they had free wifi, and the rooms were clean. We had no issues with the noise but the aircon drowned out any outside noise. I wouldn't recommend this as a base for a long visit (due to location) but it was great for just a night.

We stayed here for 3 weeks due to medical reasons. It was so comfortable for me and my friend. The front desk ladies Ann and Kehau made it friendly and we felt right at home. Shuttle drivers also were nice and polite. And our housekeeper Marilyn was on it. Made our room so refresh when we came back from our days at Tripler. It's a perfect place to stay especially if you will be away for a while on medical leave. Small and quiet. More so we did not have a rental car, but there are bus stops outside of our hotel. And at the front desk they give you a flyer to see what buses to get on for where you are going. That really helped.

This is n airport hotel and relatively inexpensiveIt appears to cater for service personnel and families, but it's primary role is facilitating stopovers I imagineIt's shuttle service is excellent and although there is a half hourly shuttle went out of the way to take me after I just missed the shuttle

I am very pleased with both the staff and hotel itself. A warm welcome (by name!) and excellent housekeeping ( thank you Marilyn! ) along with the helpful amenities (micro fridge fast wireless) - only real complaint is that the wired internet is opposite from the only really accessible power plugs in the room... I have an old laptop... Probably not a problem for most folks... As for the haters who see a bug and hear traffic noise, it's HAWAII, crawling thing capital of the Pacific. I'd rather see an ant or a tiny bug than think about the amount of chemicals that some properties use to keep them completely and totally pest free... As for the noise, it's next to the freeway, it is what it is, I've sat by the pool many times and not even thought about it after a bit (and it really is noticeable out there.). All in all I WILL stay here again for the purposes of transit/medical/quick trips and I look forward to every return, thank you!
user_name:
Amy L
Ili'ili, American Samoa, United States

review_body: I stayed for almost two months and the relationships my family grew with the hotel staff is unforgettable. Mrs. Robin and Mrs. Sharon are my favorite. They remember my orders and ask me how my days go while I'm gone. Mrs. Racquel is my most favorite of all. When she made my bed she saw that I used the big blanket and my sponge bob blanket, not the sheets. So instead of making my bed everyday with sheets, without asking her to, she made my bed with the big blanket and my sponge bob blanket. It was the most heart warming thing I have ever seen. It made the hotel feel like home. Like staying with family.

I was pleasantly surprised by our stay. The free-shuttle service was with us a couple of minutes after our call. Check in was friendly and speedy. Although the rooms are dated, they're spotlessly clean and everything worked. For a quick overnight before heading onto another island, this was exactly what we needed at a reasonable price.

A great place to stay if you are leaving early in the morning. However, they need someone to help with luggage. I called and asked and no answer. Thankfully a Military person I met in the hallway helped.

Average stay. Rooms were clean and quiet. We stayed one night on layover to Maui. Restaurant on site is pretty good and stays open late. Airport shuttle was quick. This is an older hotel and is a bargain for the rate. This was the cheapest hotel we could find close to the airport w/ a shuttle.

We had a late night flight into Honolulu with an island hop early the next morning. We picked the airport hotel mostly because of convenience, proximity to the airport, and the free shuttle service. The decor was somewhat dated, but everything was clean and in good condition.Pros:- The room was clean and well-taken care of. The bed was comfortable enough (and the pillows were excellent).- The hotel was very quiet. It was a great place to get a good night's rest before early morning travel. - The free airport shuttle was fantastic. Not many hotels in Honolulu offer this, so it was great to save some time and money on a day that we were only in town for a few hours.- The room was already air-conditioned when we arrived and the temperature was extremely comfortable for sleeping - even on a very warm Hawaii night. - Very friendly and courteous staff.Cons:- The TV in our room wouldn't work, we couldn't get it to turn on even though it was plugged in and everything seemed to be in order.- The vending machine in the hallway wouldn't work. My fiancé tried to buy a gatorade, and the machine said it would only take exact change. The drink was $2.50, but the machine wouldn't accept any quarters.- The computer and printer usage rates were outrageously high - if you're going straight to the airport, wait to print your boarding passes there.

To all military personnel traveling to Hawaii for change of station. Yes, other hotels are cheaper..but the Airport hotel is centrally located, has a bus service and is very military friendly. Single soldiers, families and even pets are welcome. Just spent 40 days here and the staff is friendly and customer oriented. They offer a program dedicated to military personnel and are willing to work around our finance system. Cant really say that for most places we get stationed too. Room attendants are friendly and always ask you about your day and have a smile for you (Nieda - my room attendant was awesome and always cheerful)

A fairly mundane hotel that is fine for a quick 1 night stay-over only. The have a contract with the military and there are a large number of military staying here for a nearby base. This overflows the car park each night. A little plain and the hallways are musty and a little stale. Bed comfort is adequate. Airport shuttle runs every 30 minutes (5 minutes away). There is nothing near the hotel as it is in the middle of an industrial like area. For a $150-$200 a night hotel it is only average but this is Hawaii. For a break between long flights it was fine. Staff are pleasant enough

Shuttle picks you up, five minutes later shuttle drops you off both ways. Very good if you are just passing through after stays on the other islands. Reception is efficient and rooms are clean and comfortable. The early morning road noise is heard even over the relatively noisy air conditioner. Most people are getting an early start on to planes anyway. I wouldn't use this place as any more than a way stop. Too close to the airport with not much around for a long stay and the restaurant which is average at best only operates two or three days a week. Restaurants nearby are decidedly ordinary. The hotel is good enough for a quick stay and move on. The hotel is used by families so there are lots of children . There is a bit of noise in the corridors and if you get to the restaurant. it is a family friendly restaurant not a fine dining place. Overall this is a good stay for travellers. If you are aiming to stay in Honolulu as a tourist there will be much better places to stay.

This hotel services a purpose and it fills it nicely! Perfect location for a quick transfer. Clean tidy and has a mini shop for breakfast. Free quick airport transfers and you don't need to wait long. Would always stay here on way to maui. Connecting room worked well with 3 adults two kids (<3 years).
user_name:
Allison R
Auckland Central, New Zealand

review_body: over all a good stay. friendly staff and helpful. My house keeping person Nieda was especially nice and went out of her way to accommodate me as I was working over night and sleeping in the day when she usually does her work. She would come by early and stop by late as she could to see if she could catch me when she could do some cleaning or just change my towels and get my trash. Her kind attention made a real difference in my stay.Regards , Robert Phelps

We stayed at this hotel last year and returned again this year. Great location for us as it was close to the airport for early morning flights. The hotel is clean, tidy and had everything we needed. The staff are friendly and helpful. The free shuttle to the airport is prompt and efficient. On our arrival we just phone and the shuttle is there within 5 to 10 minutes. It took us less than 5 minutes to get to the airport in the morning for our flights. You can catch the bus to Waikiki, a very short walk around the corner, which is very convenient. Great price and we will certainly return again. Thanks

My family and I stayed at this hotel for a month. I really enjoyed the staff and the respect they gave me. Their primary goal was to make my family and I as comfortable as possible, while we waited for on post housing. They definitely achieved that goal. I wish every hotel would follow the customer service practices of Airport Honolulu Hotel.
user_name:
karend881
Columbia, South Carolina, United States

review_body: After a two week holiday in Hawaii staying at four different locations we checked into the Honolulu Airport Hotel in order to have a good night’s sleep before our early morning flight to LA and then an onward transfer to the UK.First the good points: The free shuttle bus. Our room was clean.Unfortunately these were far outweighed by the bad points. On arrival at 7.30pm we were told that the restaurant was closed and we would have to catch the bus to the sister hotel. There was very little time as the restaurant in the sister hotel stopped taking orders around 9pm. We decided not to bother.The window in our room was partly blanked out with a leaf design which we thought slightly odd but we could hear the noise of traffic coming from outside. I stood on a chair and found that we were level with a very busy road which later we discovered was Highway 1. Our room on the second floor was next to the lift so we were able to hear it and guests coming and going late into the night. The noises from the road combined with the lift and the air conditioner meant that we were unable to sleep.We had an early flight but as the restaurant was not open we were unable to have breakfast.This is the worst hotel we have ever stayed in and what should have been a restful end to our perfect holiday was just the opposite. This hotel is very basic and OK if you don’t want to eat or sleep!

My husband and I stayed here recently as we were waiting for our house. He is in the military.They take good care of everyone here, as they did us. Our cleaning lady Neida was wonderful. Never had such a friendly, hard working cleaning lady.She did an awesome job! Our room was nice, and everything is very well clean. I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone staying in Honolulu.
user_name:
Alec F
Saginaw, Texas, United States

review_body: Thank you from the Sumner family, where our stay here was two months and with a pet! Les, the Military Liaison was very thorough before we even arrived so we knew what to expect with no stress and the front desk takes care of your TLA paperwork and keeps you well informed of any changes or weather concerns. Enjoyed the Cafe, Sharon greeting us to Donna, Emil, Stella and Robin for knowing our usual order patterns by heart and the food was always to our liking. Our room attendant Annabella was wonderful, just loved her! Our room was always clean, fresh smelling and no bugs what so ever! We utilized the pool and found it to always be clean with fresh towels on hand. The entire staff was never without a smile! Yes, two months is a long time to stay in a hotel and all I can say is, I highly recommend this hotel to anyone, short or long stay. We were treated with respect, love and a family feel and I know when I'm in this area, I would not hesitate to stop by and say Aloha!

I had an early morning flight to the mainland. Flew in from Kona. The airport pick up was convenient. Room basically has what you need. I asked aobut an upgrade but they told me it was all they had. Their restaurant was closed but they gave me a list of options. I found a great sushi place a block away. The neighborhood behind the airport is a little off putting but there are nice options. No view of the airport. The pool was crowded with military families but I liked it. It had a deep end that was 8 feet, not many hotel pools have that these days. Internet worked fine. Morning pick up to airport worked well. Cost was about $200 whichj is alot for what I got.

Military and others beware do not choose this hotel unless you want to shake all your belongings before you check out. I am so disappointed with this hotel. Roaches are everywhere. I have been in this hotel for 2 weeks and have been moved from one room because of roaches to another room with roaches. The excuse I get well this is a tropical environment and that's normal. No it's not normal for roaches to be everywhere throughout the hotel. The only reason I stay is because there are no more available hotels on island that are taking the military rate at the moment. I have been taking videos and pictures of roaches to show management that its a problem. I would post the pictures but I think this response should help this hotel get their act rightSo disappointed!!!!

If you are lucky enough to be staying at this affordable hotel, don't bother going out to eat. Don't let the hotel location fool you. There is no better value in the area. Amazing food, prices and service. The get five stars for three different dinners and two breakfasts. Highly recommend. Hotel is modest, clean and friendly. Staff are great!

IF you need an airport hotel in Honolulu then this is a good enough option.It's location surrounded by flyovers wouldn't suit me for a holiday stay, but the proximity to the airport; the free airport shuttle; the adequate rooms; the Ok dining room & the friendly staff make this a reasonable place to stay IF an airport hotel is what you need.

We stayed at the Airport Honolulu Hotel from June 26 to August 11. It was my husband, myself, our 3 year old, and our 1 year old in room 431. Our 1 king size bed bedroom was small for our family of 4 but, really, that was just something we had to get over because in the end our stay was only temporary. Let me say, though, that I have never experienced housekeeping anywhere like I have here and I've spent a good amount of time in hotels. Our housekeeping gal, Neida, was/is FANTASTIC. She was interactive and patient with my 3 year old daughter who always wanted to help her clean and straighten up. Neida was friendly, lively, and always smiling! I remember my first interaction with Neida and trying to keep my daughter out of the way. Neida said, "It's okay. Your daughter can help. I have grandchildren and she reminds me of them." I'd take Neida home with us if we could afford to afford her wonderful work, attitude, and help.

Hi I stayed in room 28, the Andrews, and the rooms were clean, staff was friendly and food was awesome! Our room attendant Josie was the best! I was actually excited to see her every morning ! She took great care of us! In the cafe Tim was just over and beyond! Thr nicest man I ever met, and always made us feel welcomed and made us laugh ....we hate to leave, but we have found our home, and if everyone here on the island are as nice as these two....im glad to be apart of this island family! :-)

I admit I was originally hoping to stay down in the Waikiki area, but due to RIMPAC, there was nothing available. After calling around to several places I was directed to Les, who is the Military Liaison for this hotel and one other close by. I did not know what to expect, but I have to tell you that after staying here for 6 weeks, I would not have stayed anywhere else. Not only is Les's team great, the entire staff here is great. The front desk takes care of your TLA paperwork perfectly, they know you by name, can answer all questions, and you can tell that they truly enjoy their job. The room service is incredible, which is why I try to leave them some cash as frequently as possible. The wait staff in the hotel are very pleasant and the food comes out quickly and tastes great. Overall, I can't thank this entire hotel enough, they have been great. Lastly, they let my dog stay here for free after she was released from quarantine, they provided a meal voucher when I did not have the dog, and the parking was free. If you are PCSing to the island or if you are just another traveler, please don't rule this place out. It's clean, has a great location, and the staff will take care of you. Thanks Airport Honolulu Hotel!!

This hotel is close to the airport, which is why we chose it as we were doing a 18hour layover. Was very pleasant and more than adequate for our needs. Lovely pool, good restaurant, simple but hearty meals which were good value. The room was fine, not flash or fancy but very acceptable. Hotel looks a bit tired but would stay again. Starbucks and food court within 100 metres/yards. We had a room near the highway which had a bit of road noise but that didn't worry us it just faded into the background. Overall, just what we needed.

Airport Hotel is walking distance from the airport, if needed due to luggage a shuttle is available. Around the corner is a Starbucks, Korean BBQ, Jamba Juice, a Ninja Sushi, and a 500 ft a bar/diner, Lisa's, with one of the greatest English muffin mini pizzas. The base is 1.3 miles to Hickam, 1.5 to Pearl for those PCS'ing. Postal office is around corner to ship gifts. There is a bus stop right outside the front door to catch bus 19 for Waikiki, which runs seemingly all day, non-stop. Rentals can get expensive the bus is a good way to transport kids to the beach for 2.50ea for all day, keep your paper ticket. Now if you feel like taking a car to explore the island the hotel has many rentals 5minutes away.Walking up to the front don't get put off by the freeway, the noise can't be heard from within the rooms and if your like me you will be out most of the day exploring. Parking lots are safe, they have security walking it often, but that doesn't mean to leave your valuables in the car. Lobby is excellent, quiet. For snakes a little shop with food and small gifts are available from dawn past dusk. There is a choice on dining as well. I have yet to eat dinner here but the breakfast is most excellent. So, compliments to the chef! My croissant sandwich never failed a start of a good day. If you can take a seat on the balcony and enjoy the breeze and watching the pool and sometimes kids. The service was great, always full of smiles. Every day I received a wonderful greeting from Sharon who seated me, Jeanne, Robin, and Stella with excellent service. Good day starts off with a cup of Joe and smiles, right? Thank you ladies. The rooms are average looking, like many other rooms I stayed in but I does the job, and my wallet isn't screaming. Sheets are light, and if you need an extra blanket front desk will send one up. AC does the job, kept it running through the night. Due to the tropics there are sometimes bugs, not often. Usually due to food left out and possibly ants. Having AC on helps. If there are issues the staff will help you in any way and possibly change your room. I stayed here for 2 months, and only saw 3 ants. So, it will be pretty slim running into issues with bugs.The maids are wonderful, they will greet you in the hallway anytime. There is one that stuck out, Angie. Wonderful woman, always a smile on her face and would ask if I needed anything, every morning I could expect to see her in the hall. Thank you Angie for cleaning up after me. I'm not a messy person but she was so thorough with cleaning. Well, I could possibly write more but I think I will spare you the rest, and allow you to form your own opinion. For someone simple like me who is out most of the time I give you all above excellent! Thank you for the wonderful stay!
user_name:
Witty101
Mountain Home, Idaho, United States

review_body: Stayed at the Airport Honolulu Hotel during a PCS to the islands. The hotel would get 5 stars for any normal traveler, but for any military personnel PCS'ing in particular, this place is the bees knees and would get 6 stars, had they offered it on trip advisor. The military liaisons do a great job of making the transition easy and the hotel bends over backwards to accommodate those personnel coming or going to the islands. The location is prime and is a short drive to any location on the island. The hotel staff are knowledgeable and extremely helpful. The staff at the front desk are particularly well versed in the PCS and TLA procedures. My experience with Rose was outstanding. I wish all hotel front desk staff were as helpful as her. The room service is challenged with a wide variety of situations with families in transition, but go above and beyond the call of duty to make our stay comfortable and they are great at what they do. Our room service, provided by Nieda was truly professional and courteous. She was a huge part in making our stay a great one. I would not hesitate to recommend this hotel to any traveler, and would not hesitate to stay here again!

We were looking for a one-night hotel with a shuttle to the airport and within close proximity to Pearl Harbor. Although we weren't expecting much we were pleasantly surprised. We arrived via their airport shuttle around 7am, dropped off our luggage in their storage closet and spent the day at Pearl Harbor. We checked in upon our return later that evening. The room was quite large and the a/c worked great. It did overlook the pool so I was a little concerned about the noise, but we always bring a noise machine when we travel and turned out to not be an issue. This is an older hotel, but was clean and well maintained. The Airport Honolulu Hotel was perfect for our needs. We enjoyed a casual dinner poolside while the kids swam. The food was delicious!! Better than what we had at the 5 star resort on the Big Island! Would definitely stay here again...great location, affordable, and fantastic restaurant!

If you're looking for a place to bring your pet cockroaches on holidays, then this it! They'll feel right at home among all the ones already in the rooms.There's also a range of dogs barking into the night in the next room down.And the staff, although they are there, leave much to be desired.

My daughter amd I booked two double beds through booking.com and when we arrived at the motel were told there was only a king size bed available. We weren't terribly impressed. The room was clean and pleasant. The plus was the shuttle bus to and from the airport. Very helpful.

Was not expecting much from an airport hotel but was surprised by the size of the room and cleanliness. Air con was great, comfy bed, dark curtains and fairly quiet during the day, great for a nap after a long flight, Restaurant downstairs was convenient and priced quite well. Staff were friendly and helpful.Perfect for a short stay close to airport.

Three weeks prior I booked two beds in a room for my wife and twin teenagers. They gave us one king size bed! Asked for two rollaway beds. They only gave us one. Three of us slept in one bed! They would not budge to offer a second room or suggest any other form of compensation to alleviate our inconvenience. Totally disgusted with their efforts to satisfy their customer!

We have stayed here twice on overnight layovers. Location is ideal, right near the airport. The rooms are clean, and large enough. Beds are fine. Rates are reasonable. The is a good variety store in the lobby. The restaurant is pretty nice and food is good with a good variety. Service was good at reception and in the restaurant. We would use it again.

This hotel is exactly what you want in an airport hotel. The staff was friendly, the room was clean, there was wi-fi, it is about 2 blocks away from the airport, and the AC worked. I would definitely recommend this hotel to people passing through for a night.

We arrived to Honolulu late at night with plans to fly to the Big Island the next morning so all we did is sleep here one night. It was clean, comfortable and convenient for our needs. You have to call the free shuttle after getting your luggage from baggage claim but it arrived pretty quickly. The hotel staff was super friendly. Our rooms were in the back building which you have to drag your luggage to but the rooms were fine. The return shuttle to the airport comes only every half hour and made some other stops along the way so plan for that when leaving.

If your laying over in Honolulu this is a good hotel that is easy for your flight change. We stayed for one night and it was very easy to jump in the rental car and get back to the airport in a hurry. It is not an extravagant hotel, but it offers just enough cleanliness to be worthy of an overnight. I definitely would not want to stay long term here for any reason. But it is a great location to venture out into Honolulu from. The beds are decent, and overall it was quiet and relaxing. Price was fair as well. The pool, which we did not try out, looked nice and I understand the food is good at the hotel restaurant. We just like to venture through the city and eat rather than waste a day in a hotel.

We needed a one-night hotel with a shuttle to the airport, as we had no rental car. The Airport Honolulu Hotel was perfect for our needs. I agree with maroubragirl that ALL of the hotel employees are exceptionally friendly and accommodating. We asked if we could store our 4 suitcases at the hotel at 6 a.m. (even though we hadn't checked in yet) while we visited the Pearl Harbor Memorial, then and come back at 2 p.m., which is their regular check-in time. They were glad to do it, put our luggage in a locked closet, each bag tagged, and gave us a receipt. We finished the Memorial before noon, and weren't sure how to get back to the hotel, so we called the hotel and they told us which bus to take and where to get off (the bus stop is literally in front of the hotel). Then, when we arrived, they had a room ready for us, even though their official check-in time was still 2 hours away. As we walked down the hall, everyone on the housekeeping staff smiled and greeted us. The room was clean. The free wifi worked great. So did the air conditioning (I mention this because some Hawaii hotels don't have air conditioning). The pool was nice and clean, as were the other common areas and the restaurant. Although they only advertise a free shuttle to the airport on the hour and half-hour, the driver took us as soon as we were ready. And he took another couple, at their request, to some other nearby destination (not the airport), no charge. If you want a glitzy hotel with an ocean view, go to Waikiki Beach and pay $400 a night. If you want a clean, practical hotel near the airport, stay here.

To be honest this hotel is over priced for what you get. No water or tea bags in the rooms, only coffee. When asked if I could get a tea bag it was a straight out no! For $150 USD excluding taxes a night a dated tired room with no extras for the customer is disappointing. We have travelled all over Hawaii and have to say it's disappointing for the price tag. It's the small things that make the difference, not everyone drinks coffee at night after dinner.

This hotel is a typical Hawaii hotel stuck in the 70's but unless you are paing over $300 a night they all are, What makes this hotel are ALL their employees they are exceptional. The pool is nice and clean as are the rooms.There are a fee restaurants with easy walking access, great sushi place Starbucks and more.I had a better night sleep here than I ever have in Waikiki only heard 2 sirens as opposed to Waikiki with their non stop ones.It is what it is so if you want to save time and money stay here.

I choose this hotel because it was the closest to the airport (approx. a half mile) and i had a very early flight the next morning. For the price, I guess it is a good value. There were reasons for the value though. The towels were worn and frayed at the edges. i have not seen this at any other hotel no matter how good the value. The television had a limited amount of cable channels but of course it had a pay for movie channel. I figured I would just watch netflix on my laptop. That was not possible for any length of time since there were no power outlets along the entire wall behind the bed. Hmmm... hint: buy the movie channel? I think so. I had to use the power outlets in the bathroom to charge my cell phone and laptop. There was complementary wifi in the room...but you had to pay to use the hotel pc and printer if you wanted to print out your boarding pass. All in all....next time I will pay a little more and go to a Marriot. I do not recommend this hotel.

Like many on here, we booked this hotel to facilitate catching a flight after our Oahu vacation. In our case, we were catching a flight at 11:55 pm, but as we were traveling with a toddler, we thought it was worth the $100 (discount site) to get in a nap/shower/meal before heading to the airport. I even dropped off the car early to the rental place and walked back (approx.1-1.5 km away) since there would be a shuttle bus to the airport - this all went very promptly and smoothly and the driver was helpful with our luggage, etc. There is a good sushi place that I found in a strip mall on my walk back from returning the car, along with a Starbucks and a few other restaurants open around 7pm on a Sunday.The room was decent, BUT - as soon as we dimmed the lights so our daughter could sleep, out came the roaches. I realize it's the tropics, but we were pretty disturbed to see them. I would say I saw about a dozen crawling near the microwave/coffee pot and the bedside table. Some were tiny, and some were about 1.5 cm. I don't want to come off as overly alarmist or critical, but I do want to report what I observed in case this helps anyone. I don't think the family would have been comfortable spending the night, though for the 8 hours we were ok.

The website images conceal an average property (although they are working on it) - We thought the Outrigger brand would underpin value for money. Restaurant closes 3 or 4 nights and they offer a shuttle to a nearby competitor hotel. Unattractive area to venture out - convenient but!

We booked this hotel because it was so close to the airport. We tried to take the shuttle bus but ended up waiting forever so we took a cab. The check in was easy. The room had two double beds, the room was small, hotel was quiet, there was air conditioner and we did not have any problems. The room could use updating. It was fine for the 10 or so hours we needed to use it.

We needed somewhere to stay to catch an early morning flight the next day. The room itself was fine, not that dated like some of the reviews have said. Whilst it did face onto the freeway I didn't find it as bad as some other airport hotels (and we stayed in three on this trip!).The main downside was that we had to get a shuttle bus to the sister hotel for dinner, as the restaurant in our hotel was closed. That's not really what you want when you just want to eat and have an early night....

Stayed here numerous times for layovers. Staff friendly, rooms clean, with decent linens & bed. Offers free shuttle to airport. Dining area nice and food is good. Convenient to locals shops, dining & attractions. Good prices on rooms, will defiantly book again.

The hotel staff wasn't bad. The restaurant for dinner was excellent. An excellent server.On the first day I am lying down on the floor sleeping with my dog. A maintenance man came to fix the door? Nothing was wrong with the door? The bell hop didn't open the door proper. Push up on the handle to open it, not down. The cleaning opened it right away. The maintenance man came anyways seen me sleeping on the floor with my dog and he calls a medic? What was he doing in my room, in the first place? "NO PRIVACY" I could have been nude? I sleeping he could have walked in and taken money off the dresser???The next morning at 10:00 AM a maintenance man knocks on my door I was still sleeping? I have a WAKE UP SERVICE for 11:15 AM. He woke me up? Has the door open. My dog runs out the door outside. I can not find her. My dog ran into another hotel the cleaning woman yells is that your dog in here? I go inside the other hotel to see its my dog. I go back to my room an I tell the maintenance man "GET OUT"! He will not listen to me I tell him I am going to call the police. The front desk calls him on the radio to leave. He is still putting a new part into the door. He won't get out! I talk to the manager about this. He asks me are you and your dog safe? I had said YES! I had said I am leaving at noon time why couldn't he wait until I left? I was shaken up that I almost lost me dog in this hotel. My dog is a Service Dog to protect me having PTSD. I am shaking all over. You have "NO RIGHTS TO PRIVACY" ! AT THIS HOTEL! If I ever have to go to Honlolulu again be sure that I don't go there ever again.The maintenance working there to 10:00 PM? The beds were bouncy. I had asked the front desk do you have cameras in the rooms? Who knew that I was sleeping on the floor in my room ? If I never answered it? That means the maintenance opened my door uninvited?

This Hotel was dreadful. We choose it because it was. CLose to airport and ran a free shuttle back and forth That was the positives. Hotel very dated and run down. Reception staff offhand and disinterested no restaurant except breakfast. Worst feature is hotel is located right next to flyover of freeway. I was worried about the planes flying over but they were drowned out by the constant drone of traffic. Felt as though I was staying in a third world country

The location is not so great here but we arrived late and they have a shuttle that picks you up at the airport and they were very quick to come. The staff was nice when we checked in also. The restaurant has a small selection of menu items but it wasn't too bad. The rooms are older but were clean. The pool are was very nice. I would stay here again to avoid a late night drive to my final destination.
user_name:
Janet C
Heber City, Utah, United States

review_body: We have stayed at this hotel twice for early morning flights to Australia.It is clean and not too noisy considering the location. I would avoid eating at the hotel restaurant. Shuttle to the airport is great, will probably need stay again although it is overpriced! Definitely not recommended for more than one night.

We needed to stay somewhere close to the airport for one night, as we had an early morning flight back to the mainland. Honolulu Airport Hotel seemed to fit the bill. The shuttle service to and from the airport was quick and convenient. However, after we got to the hotel, our experience rapidly plummeted. Although we'd already booked and paid for the room in advance, the lady at the front desk was rude and unwelcoming from the minute we stepped up to the counter. The lock to our room stuck. After several tries, we were finally able to get in. The room was dingy and run-down -- the type of place where you'd want to wear flip flops to avoid coming in contact with the critters that may lurk in the stained carpets and showers. I don't need a 5 star hotel to have a satisfactory experience, however, I would not stay here again. There are other hotels that have shuttles to and from the airport.

We only spent one night here between flying in from new zealand and leaving for maui and this was sufficient. As a stop over i suppose it is OK but not for longer. breakfast was awful. room was ok with coffee/tea making.

Hotel is an overpriced hotel, similar to a Comfort Inn type hotel. It's essentially under a busy highway so it can be loud, but it is less than 5 minutes from the airport and walking distance to L&L (good food), pizza, and some other food shops and a mini mart type business about 1 block behind the hotel. The hotel restaurant isn't open often, so don't count on it. Staff was friendly and room was fine, but it's way overpriced for what it is.

Have just returned from Hawaii and needed to stay at this hotel for one night, as our flight out was an early morning one. Was very pleasantly surprised. The hotel looks a little tired from the outside, but when we walked into the reception area our first impression was how clean it was. The staff at reception were very friendly and efficient. We had a room on the 3rd floor that overlooked the freeway, but once again the room was very clean. This hotel doesn't have a bar, but we had drinks of our own down in the lounge area, enjoyed a swim in the pool and dinner at the hotel restaurant. The restaurant is only open on certain nights from 5 to 9, can't remember which nights, we were there on a Tuesday night. The menu is not a large one, but we found something for everyone and we all enjoyed the meal. The restaurant only sells wine and beer, so if you are a spirits drinker you would need to take your own. We also had breakfast at the restaurant the next morning (restaurant opens at 6.30am for breakfast) once again a good meal, before hopping on the free shuttle bus to the airport. Obviously this hotel is not a place to stay for anymore than a couple of nights, other than Pearl Harbour being close there is nothing else around the area, except for a few take away shops and a Starbucks. You can catch The Bus, which takes you into Waikiki and Pearl Harbour, trip to Waikiki takes about 45 minutes and costs $2.50. Not sure how long the trip to Pearl Harbour is, cost is also $2.50. Would definitely recommend this hotel for a short stay.

If you only stay one or two days for transit this is the best solution. The rooms are good and clean and have all you need (coffee, internet, micro etc.). Especially when you come late night you will only find taxis to town to other hotels and one way will cost you approx. 50 USD, so the rate at the airport is acceptable. You will find a food court a 3 minutes walk away including Starbucks and the airport is a 10 Minute walk away. The people at the reception are friendly and room service is good. Good choice, I would and probably will come again.

Probably would choose something closer to the beach if Honolulu was my final destination, but for layovers it's great. You have to call the hotel from the baggage claim area for a pickup. There are courtesy phones right by the exit, or you can call the main switchboard directly. The shuttle ride is 5 minutes, if that. Return shuttles run every half hour and don't require pre-booking, but for peak times you probably want to be in the lobby about 10 minutes early.Rooms are basic but clean, and the beds are ridiculously comfortable. Free wifi in the room was faster than my wifi at home.Will stay there again the next time I have an overnight stopover in Hawaii

Good value for money spent. Quick pick up and return next morning to airport. Clean room, very helpful, friendly and efficient staff. Breakfast was very good. All in all a good one night stay. Not close to anything, but we took the bus to Waikiki Beach for dinner and to explore the area, approximately a 45 minute ride with bus stop right outside hitel.

I am impressed! Quick pick up from the airport once we contacted the staff via the courtesy phone based in the airport. Check in fast and professional. Everything we needed and more was in the room. Microwave, lovely coffee, room was really clean. Perhaps, a bit outdated but still nice and a good nights sleep was had by us all.Transfers back to the airport went without a hitch. We will definitely be back.

We travel to Hawaii often for pleasure, but try to get off of Oahu as quickly as possible. We sometimes have to spend a night, usually close to the airport. The Airport Honolulu Hotel fits the bill. It is very close, the service is excellent, and it is everything you may want. The shuttle service was spot on. We will definitely use this property again when necessary.

Nice rooms, good location but a bit pricey. The hotel provides free transfers from the airport baggage claim areas but you must call for a pickup either through you own mobile phone or call from one of the exits from baggage claim where there is a listing of hotels and direct phones. If you have little baggage, it is a five minute walk to the hotel from International arrivals though the route to get there is not obvious through the maze of roads from the arrival area. One of the great things offered by the hotel is free WiFi in the rooms that is actually pretty good. The restaurant is above average and there is a room designated as a fitness center with typical hotel type equipment. Coin operated washers and dryers are readily available and the room I had (standard) included an ironing board and iron as well as small refrigerator, microwave and coffee maker (not instant coffee but brewed!). While the room rate is not cheap, by the time you take a taxi to a downtown hotel you will have spent more than the difference in room rate. It is also quite close to the Pearl Harbor memorial and the USS Missouri, a huge battleship from WWII, Korean War and Vietnam eras that is now essentially a museum. The hotel is a 20 minute walk from a couple of small shopping centers and a $2.50 bus ride to famous Ala Moana shopping mall and Waikiki beaches. Easy to book online. Note, however, that if you arrive before 3pm (!!), you will be charged a substantial additional day rate so make sure you are prepared for that, I was not and had to come up with an extra $150. They will store your bags if you arrive before 3pm and want to tour a bit before checking in though.

This hotel in my experience has an amazing manager and staff. Our housekeeper Marie S. Does an outstanding job on our room daily. She not only services our rooms and family above and beyond, she is great company with superb customer service etiquette. We are staying here with our 2 children which are 3 and 8 months old. I love and greatly appreciate the manager and hotel supplying us with a crib for my 8 month old. It helps a great deal considering we're in the military and staying here for a longer period of time than anticipated. This hotel is great with convenience but isn't the marriott obviously.

I only spent a night here as I was transferring to another flight the next morning. But this place needs some major work. There is some wall construction going on and the place is quite musty. Also the windows in my room were just filthy. I mean not that it matters too much since I had a lovely view of the overpasses. That was the least of the problems. I had at least 3 to 4 cockroaches running around my room at all times. First on the table near the microwave. And then on the dining table. And then on my bed. Nothing worse then bugs in your bed. Crawling on you. I guess you can't expect too much from an airport hotel but this was a bit much. I am giving it 2 stars because the staff were very nice and accommodating.
user_name:
Daveded
New York City, New York

review_body: Arrived off NZ 9 waited for 30 minutes for hotel transport to drive us 800m. No hotel restaurant food available at 9pm. Staff suggested we go to a bar. The hotel convenience store had a semi-articulate attendant who barely understood English. The rooms were dirty and stunk of some kind of spiced Asian cooking. We did sleep as the beds were comfortable. We only stayed because we had a Kona connection at 9 am. Never again. The trip to a hotel in Waikiki is a better option.

We stayed here for a short overnight between flights. Our flight got in very late. The taxi line was a mile long, so we called the hotel for the shuttle. It came fairly quickly. There were several of us arriving at the same time. Check-in was fairly slow. (Not what you want after flight delays leading to a 1am arrival), but it could've been worse. There was a sign on the front desk saying their parking lot was full. If you had a car, you had to park at a sister hotel and take a shuttle back. Thank goodness we didn't rent a car! To their credit, they did at least have 2 desk clerks working. We finally got our room. It was ok. Pretty clean, dated, and right next to the elevator. It kept us up through the night and especially in the morning. My husband went to the hotel store for yogurt (no free breakfast), but there were no spoons. Our bag was damaged during our flight, so we checked the store for tape, twine, etc, but they had nothing. We asked for help at the front desk. The staff and manager were no help and indifferent. Next time we'll be staying elsewhere in Honolulu.

The best things about this hotel are the shuttle which picks you up & returns you to the airport, which is really close. The next best thing is the price is reasonable for Oahu. Then finally, the best thing is how they treat military families. A lot of military families staying here while they transition to housing. We ate in the restaurant for convenience and watched as the wait staff served military families. We were so impressed that the families treated the restaurant like home. We watched as Moms and Dads picked up after their children and expected table manners, so if you really want a treat, eat in the restaurant just to watch the children and be encouraged that manners are still being taught.

Although our house search was somewhat stressful, we always came back to a clean hotel room thanks to Nieda. Nieda is by far a professional at what she does and she takes a great deal of pride in our work. Great job Nieda and we appreciate your service and support.Smith Family 2014

My wife and I recently spent one month at the Airport Honolulu Hotel. Every employee that we met treated us with respect and dignity. Our room was much better than expected and House Keeper "Dalia" went over and above to make our stay a great experience.One can take hotel shuttle to/fro the HNL Airport, or walk. Step out the front door and take The BUS which covers the entire Island of Oahu is a good bet, show Medicare card and deposit one dollar, obtain transfer for return trip. We saved much by not renting a car. Note: Traffic is a real pain! We spent eight years living on Oahu so we know the does and don'ts. Winter of 2015 will be a repeat.With Aloha,Mr. & Mrs. Gary A. PlathWausau, WI 54403-6975

Housekeeping was amazing, teresita was the best, if i could i would take her as my personal housekeeper!!! So kind, friendly, great attitude an personality! Im sure the job isn't easy but she always had a smile on her face very rewarding to see every day

OK for an overnite stay.... Very close to airport and there is a free shuttle service.Seeing I was paying over US$220 a night for three nights total thought that was way too much as the hotel is looking a bit dated these days and would be pushing to class it as even 4 stars.Lots of US military stay here which gives its an unusual feel but that was no problem for me. As I was going away for a few days front office wouldnt let me keep a very small bag in luggage storage for two days citing no space and I also couldnt borrow a breakfast bowl from the restuarant as the cashier/manager was too busy to help me as she was counting the nights takings after they had just closed  My point here is even though that sounds a bit trivial I couldnt imagine this happening if I had stayed in a better class hotel even though I was paying a considerable rate to stay at this hotel in the first place!. Front staff and housekeeing were quite friendly and efficient and so overall it wasnt too bad..maybe even rate it 3 and half stars if I could. Just way too expensive considering overall quality of the hotel.But then again maybe thereare a shortage.of hotels in Oahu or maybe Honolulu/Waikiki. its just seems an expensive place to stay,regardless of the level of accomodation!

From the moment I tried to call the shuttle I knew it was going to be a disappointment.our reservation confirmation issued by the hotel called the property " the outrigger Honolulu airport hotel". The registry for the shuttle has no outrigger hotel mentioned , just "the Honolulu airport hotel". I called that number and asked if this was the outrigger Honolulu airport hotel .the operator said no it wasn't and ,get this, hung up.Asked several folks where the hotel was and I was assured they were one and the same place. Called again and this time the operator acknowledged that they were the same property .when I asked for the shuttle he said "what luggage ladder are you at "? I asked what that meant and he repeated the same question and added "don't know what to say a luggage ladder is a luggage ladder"? I asked him to hold and asked the information people the question and they had no idea what he meant. Oh, and he hung up again .Finally got the shuttle. It was packed with about 25 people with seats for 20. The driver was very nice .Reached the hotel and as expected there was a 25 person line up and for the first 20 minutes 1 employee at the front desk. When the second arrived the 1st stopped helping customers for 10 minutes. The hotel si filthy.hallways beat up .they look like a social housing building I volunteer at . Our room stunk of urine . No exaggeration here. We travel a lot and stay in all types of places in 1st and 3rd world. This was the worst and it cost 210 dollars per night. Sleep in the airport if you have to but stay away from this dump.

This hotel is one of the two choices if you need to stay right at Honolulu airport. The price/performance is steep, especially when comparing it with hotels in much nicer locations in the islands. We stayed here twice, once upon arriving and having to sleep before our flight to Maui and once before leaving the islands, having to catch a very early flight back to LAX. The rooms are very basic, free wifi though, but the place is quite tired already. Pluses are the friendly staff, free shuttle to the terminals and also breakfast was nice.

We enjoyed our brief stay at the Airport Honolulu Hotel. We were just staying overnight and catching a very early flight out the next morning, so this hotel was perfect for us. We had excellent service checking in, and assistance in storing our bags (many and huge!) downstairs, and taking other bags to the room. It was very clean, large and comfortable. We are at the hotel restaurant, Willoughby's Restaurant, and thoroughly enjoyed our food and attentive service. Upon leaving, even though it was 3:30 AM, we had friendly assistance with our bags again to the shuttle. All staff we met obviously took pride in their service and genuinely showed concern for their visitors' comfort.

Everyone at the hotel was very friendly and helpful. I especially liked our housekeeper, Delia. She was very friendly. Not only did she do a great job cleaning our room but she also took time to talk with me. Tell me about a few restaurants close by. Some things to explore. I do wish the hotel would invest in some fitted sheets. But other than that everything was nice.

Stayed for one night in order to catch an early flight following an island transfer with my husband and baby. Collection bus came quite quickly once we had called from the airport phone. There was no-one obviously around to help with bags after we had checked in so manoeuvring the luggage/stroller/portable crib and baby was a little tricky. Room 301 was right by the lift and had space for a portable crib to be put up next to the bed and away from the air con machine. For dinner we got take-out from Sushi Ninja which was a short walk away and was reasonably priced and tasty. There is a filter coffee machine but no kettle but we were there for such a short time we didn't ask to see if one could be supplied. Fridge had plenty of space for baby food. Room itself was fine and clean.Return buses to the airport depart on the hour and half hour so we had to catch the 5am bus to meet the JQ4 08:15 flight which was very early. If I didn't have the baby I would advise getting the later bus as JQ4 is one of the first flights and there were no security queues on the Saturday we travelled.

I was very pleased with the housekeeping staff, specifically Delia who was in charge of my room. She was very pleasant everyday that I saw her, did an excellent job, and made me feel at home. There were other issues with the hotel that I didn't like, particularly the parking, but she made it worth the stay. Should be commended on her customer service and job performance!!

My rating is based on the fact that the hotel exceeded my expectations, not that it's the best hotel I've ever stayed at. I booked my reservation over the phone with a person who works with government employees (I forget his name, but he was extremely helpful). My primary interest in staying here was the proximity it had to the airport. I did not want to haul all the way into Waikiki for a single overnight stay. Honolulu has surprisingly very few places to stay outside of Waikiki Beach which is a real hassle if you're not there to vacation. I could only find two realistic options, and this was one of them. Under the same circumstances I would stay here again without hesitation. The rate I paid was very fair, the bed/room were comfortable and clean, and it is located super close to the airport. That said, I would definitely not stay here if I were in town to vacation... it's way too far from the things most vacationers come to do (beach scene, restaurants, shopping, etc.)

Stayed here 2 years ago and title of my review was "only for the airport". Definitely seems to have 'upped' it's game since then.Check-in is much more friendly, rooms are smarter and wifi is now free and available in the rooms.Restaurant was still closed (does it ever open?) and prices increased.Still a good option for an early or late flight but not a lot of other reasons to stay here.Would have given 3.5* if that was possible.

We stayed here for about a week because we were moving off island. We have 2 dogs and they accept dogs and the hotel is convenient to the airport. They put the people with dogs on the first floor and have rooms that have laminate flooring so it doesn't have smelly carpet from the animals that stay in the rooms. The staff was really friendly and the guys that operate the shuttle to the airport were awesome. The day we flew out they helped us load our suitcases and 2 big dog kennels with our dogs on the shuttle and helped us get it all in to the airport. The room was nice and a great size. The designated pet area outside REAKS and there's a lot of people that don't clean up after their pets, but I guess that's expected and we were just happy to have found a place that was affordable, nice, clean inside, and allows dogs!

The housekeeping staff is excellent. The rooms were kept clean and tidy by the staff. Delia was our housekeeper during our stay. And I must say, she made us feel at home and ensured that we had everything we needed.

if you have a short time in HNL this is the place. one bus to Ala Moana BLVD you can do all the shopping. One bus to Pearl Harbour. Wifi is free. restaurant is nice too. comfortable rooms and clean place overall.

During my stay here Ms. Teresita, one of the house keepers, made may stay very enjoyable. Everyday I looked forward to seeing her because she was always smiling and accommodating to our needs (from towels to the change of our linens). Her positive attitude towards her job is amazing, as well as her work ethic. As she works for hours, I always notice a smile on her face regardless of how tired she was. I really admire her hard work and her compassion for all the guest she encounters. She has really made my stay in this hotel very enjoyable and unforgettable! I will miss her! This hotel is GREAT! It's close to everything!

my house keeper Marilyn is the best house keeper here she is always so friendly and nice! we look forward to seeing her each day, and are disappointed when someone else is on duty! she always does an incredible job making sure our rooms are nice and clean! my kids also like her a lot she is always so nice and friendly with them! I strongly recommend her she made our stay here VERY comfortable !

Agree with others - the positives - the hotel is minutes away from the airport and there is a free 24 hour shuttle. You can order by using a courtesy telephone by the baggage carousel once you land. The hotel is pretty basic,as is the service. There appear to be a lot of military staying there. Pearl Harbour is down the road and buses are $1.75 (no change) to get there. The beds are double not queen,the air con was noisy, the room was dated. Good option if staying overnight. We were overall happy with the hotel.

We flew in from Maui late one afternoon and had a flight back to the mainland early the next morning, so we booked one night at this hotel for its proximity to the airport, its free shuttle and its restaurant, Willoughby's. The shuttle arrived at the airport shortly after I called for it. Our rooms were clean, quiet and basic. The restaurant was open for dinner and the food was passable with good options for kids.Some suggestions for improvements:1. Open the hotel restaurant earlier than 6:30am so that people departing for early flights can grab some breakfast. Alternatively, sell some sort of continental to-go breakfast.2. Run the shuttle back to the airport every 10-15 minutes instead of every half-hour.

Very satisfied with the hotel service as a whole. But wanted to comment regarding maid DELIA -- she is an excellent worker; very courteous and always making sure we were comfortable! I recommend her as the "outstanding employee" of the month/year!
user_name:
Carolyn C
Pago Pago, American Samoa

review_body: The attraction of this hotel is that it is located minutes away from the airport and is serviced by a 24 hour shuttle which you can order by dialling from the courtesy telephone by the baggage carousel once you land (saving $100 return cab fare into town). The hotel was very responsive and sent the mini bus immediately. Other than that thus hotel is pretty basic,as is the service, but we didn't mind as we only needed a few hours sleep before our next flight. They only seem to offer double beds which was a bit of a squeeze,especially with our 2 teenagers sharing a bed, and the air con was old and rattled a lot. The room itself was dated and tired looking. The restaurant closes at 9pm and is only open alternate nights which is interesting given that it's billed as an airport hotel. As we arrived at 10pm we couldn't get dinner and were told we could order take away pizza from a local pizza place or walk to another restaurant 8 minutes away. After a long flight, we weren't interested in these options.Fortunately, there was a small mini mart within the hotel so we managed to get something for our starving teenager. The rest of us went without. Tip: if arriving late and you don't get food on the plane, either take food with you or get it from the limited eateries at Honolulu airport.In summary if you are in transit this hotel is convenient and inexpensive, especially if you book online in advance via booking. com. However, as it is often booked up ( there aren't too many airport hotels in Honolulu) get in early.

Located a 5 minute shuttle form the airport this is a plain no frills and slightly ageing hotel.Check in experience frustrating with not enough staff on - took almost 45 minutes before all our group was in their rooms.The shuttle pick-up works on a phone system from baggage area but they only pick you up when you have all your luggage - what they didn't say is that it then takes about 20 minutes after that before the bus arrives making the whole process painful - the thought of a cab ride back into Waikiki for a better hotel was appealing if impractical!Restaurant is actually closed on alternate days when one has to walk to a sister hotel around the corner, however there are a few eating options 5 minute walk away.Gym facility is very basic and small but at least they have one.

We always stay at the Airport Honolulu Hotel for our overnight transit stops. Yet again, we had a great stay. Check-in and check-out went smoothly and we enjoyed buying a few late night snacks at the small gift shop upon arrival. We had a great sleep in our cool AC room and made use of the small fitness room the following morning. We enjoyed our stay and will continue to stay here during our transit stops. It is only a 7 minute walk from the airport terminal, so once you know where the hotel is, it is quite easy to walk. Highly recommended to all travelers needing an overnight stop at the Honolulu airport.

The Airport Honolulu is 5 minutes away from the Honolulu Airport and is perfect for an airport layover, a nothing fancy Outrigger that provides a clean room, a restaurant serving a diner type menu. They have a liquor license so wine and beer is available. I don't know about cocktails. Upon arrival, one calls the hotel for a pickup but there was some confusion in the use of the word "island". Coming in on a US mainland flight, I was told to go to the far "island" opposite gate G. There is the wide sidewalk of the terminal building, the road, then an island, a road, and then land. In the mainland, an "island" is the middle divide between 2 roads by in Hawaii, the state of islands, the far island meant the vast land past the 3rd road. This language misunderstanding caused my pickup to take 30 minutes. The pickup point for internationalArrivals has only 2 roads so there is no misunderstanding of "on the otherwise of the road. The drop off to the airport was punctual.
user_name:
Dui S
New York City, New York

review_body: We needed to stay one night here before we flew out to Maui. Its steps from the airport and theres a starbucks and a couple of other restaurants within short walking distance. The room was like a blast from the past, taking me back to the early 90's. I can't truly complain because the price is right and I got a good night sleep. It could be nicer as far as the decor goes.Best Part: The breakfast was really really delicious, and we travel a lot and eat a lot of hotel breakfast.

The strong point of this hotel was customer service, staff are very friendly. Rooms are basic and in need of some attention. The restaurant was not open in the evening for the three nights we were there. The shop was open but you cannot charge to your room. the shuttle service is haphazard particularly when requested from the airport. Security is poor, outer doors are left open rendering the request to enter using room key meaningless. The door to our room did not close automatically and had to be slammed to get it too close and lock. The hotel is very close to the airport, be prepared for aircraft noise.

I stayed here on my own for one night before my flight home to Australia. I was put in the building behind the main building which didn't seem to have any security at all; the main doors were constantly propped open and the lift did not require you to scan a room card to access guest floors, despite signs saying it did. As a young female travelling alone, I was not impressed with the lack of security on arrival. Additionally, I was then told that I would have to travel to a different hotel to get something to eat! Not to worry, I thought, if I go nice and early I will be safe. I took the shuttle to the sister hotel for dinner, where I was seated at a table that was already occupied!!! Apparently it is ok to seat someone dining alone at the same table as a couple dining together? At least that couple was lovely to me.I went back to the hotel feeling both uncomfortable and unsafe as I walked alone through the dark car park to the building my room was located in. Went to bed, only to be woken by 'housekeeping' banging on my door at 10.30pm. Why on earth would housekeeping knock at 10.30pm?? If you think that's bad, they knocked AGAIN at a quarter to 1! Needless to say, I did not answer the door, but lay awake for most of the night.There are two things potentially wrong here:Number 1: if in fact it was housekeeping who was banging on my door at this time of night, perhaps the staff need better training. Aside from fire, I really can't understand what wouldn't be able to wait until morning to bang on my door about.Number 2: if it was someone pretending to be housekeeping knocking, then the security of the building really, really needs to be looked at.I will never, ever stay here again. I have travelled alone hundreds of times for work, and I have never felt so unsafe in my life. And please don't tell me that I should have rung reception and requested a different room; I shouldn't have HAD to. Simple as that.
