My advice to other travellers is if you absolutely HAVE to stay here, request to stay in the main building. I would hope that the security would be better there, though I'm not certain.

We arrived on a late night flight and departed on a morning flight and found the Airport Honolulu Hotel to be a reasonable stopover.The facilities are dated but everything is clean, the staff are friendly and helpful, the airport shuttle was convenient and the breakfast was very good.Our room was on the 4th floor facing the side of the building and it was quiet.We called for the shuttle from the phones in baggage claim after our luggage arrived. When the hotel picks up the phone they ask what baggage claim area you are at and will tell you where to stand to pick up the shuttle. In our case, we were in baggage claim F and were told to walk only a short distance to G and stand not in the middle island outside of baggage claim but on the next one across the street. There was a security person there who confirmed with us that we were in the right place - and sure enough the shuttle arrived. So when you call for the shuttle, be sure to find out where to stand to pick it up. It wasn't so obvious without having the information of what to look for.

Great for a stopover/recovery from a flight.Room was reasonable size,well maintained.No eating facilities in the hotel.You can get a bus into town or to Pearl Harbour at $2.50 one way. The stop is outside the hotel and the staff will explain where to get off for a restaurant.But really its a place to crash out after a long flight.The shuttle bus is free (driver liked his tip) but its busy in the morning so be there on time.Expensive but good value as you dont have a taxi trip into town to a better hotel.Its what it says on the tin ...an Airport Hotel

We stayed at this hotel as a stopover in Honolulu for one night. As we arrived late and departed early, it was ideal as this hotel is close the airport and there are complimentary shuttles to and from the airport. The room was clean and functional. The negative for us was that they had no room service and the hotel restaurant closes in the evening. Hence, when we arrived late at the hotel, there was no food to eat and there were also no restaurants nearby. (Note they have vending machines for snacks). Also, the A/C was noisy.

Stayed in the hotel one night before our flight on 12 floor. Staff is helpful but the hotel is completely old. Good location but shuttle service every 30 minutes it is not so comfortable. Rooms' size is ok but bathroom is small. In rooms is very noisy due to highway H1 located close to the hotel. Price does not relevant for those conditions taking into account that staying here more than one night does not make sense. It seems a cheaper way to rent a car and stay in Waikiki.

Stayed here with family between flights. Everythings kind of old, the furniture and everything. Ok to stay one night, wouldn't want to stay longer. Shuttle was great and staff friendly. Loud noise of traffic. Old airconditioning and baby bed was really like a cage.. Rooms were big enough. Expensive..

Stayed November 12 2013 1-Night. This is my, second time staying there. The place is a 1st. class operation from Airport pick-up to return. I arrived 11:00am in the morning fully expecting to have to wait until the 3:00pm checkin. The desk clerk got me, a nice room.Spacious big comfortable bed.The hotel is located in a business districk. There is street noise. However, I simply turned on the room fan and.slept good. I highly reccomend this hotel.You, want a resort hotel go get one. Folks! You, want a good place to stay after a long flight through many time zones? This is the place . I will stay again February 2014....Steve N

We were going to Kauai and we had to make a stop overnight in Honolulu. When we go to Honolulu we usually stay downtown but for one night it didn't make any sense renting a car or paying for a taxi. The hotel shuttle picked us up at the airport and dropped us off the next morning with no hassles. The room was clean with no smells and looks like the photos. The staff was the best, super efficient amd island friendly. The views are non existent and the hotel is next to the airport in an industrial area. There was no food at night when we were there but the gift shop at he hotel does have some snacks. You can take the shuttle to the hotels sister hotel that had a open restaurant or we took the airport shuddle back to the airport and ate at one of the restaurants there. Im giving it a 4 solely based what we used the hotel for. I wouldn't stay here for a vacation but for one night when island hopping it serves the purpose.

We waited about 40 minutes for the airport shuttle yesterday evening. We were told on the first call they were sending the shuttle right away. In succeeding calls were were given a similar story. When the driver finally arrived he said he didn't receive any previous notice to pick us up. This was extremely poor service for an airport oriented hotel.The hotel options near hnl are very limited when you have an early flight. There are few options for dinner except this hotel and the best western plaza, which it turns out is an affiliated property. They offer dinners on a rotating schedule. The food is basic. They all shuttle you between the hotels I had located a nearby restaurant with good reviews, but with the lengthy delay at the airport it was too late for us to take advantage of it.The front desk person was very apologetic as the operator had apparently alerted her to the issue. The rooms are adequate for a single night with early am departure.

Very good stop over hotel, we were on our way from Sydney via Honolulu to Las Vegas, we decided to stay a day and a half in Honolulu before going on to Las VegasThe Airport Honolulu Hotel was a great choice as we didn't want to go to Waikiki until we returnedAlso being close to Pearl Harbour is a bonus as wellStaff very friendly and helpful

As the name would suggest, this hotel is very close to the airport, and as such it is essentially a transit airport, in which most guests would stay only one or two nights at a maximum, at the one time. For this purpose, this hotel was perfect. Check-in was fast and efficient. There is a FREE airport shuttle to/from the airport (which is only 5 mins away) which leaves every 30 minutes. My room was very clean, neat and tidy. The bathroom was excellent, and the bed very comfortable. Each room has its own air conditioning unit, so you can control the temperature of your room easily. Whilst the airport is close to the airport and the Nimitz Highway, I was surprised at how quiet the rooms were - particularly once the air conditioner is on, really i wasn't bothered by noise at all. The restaurant was pretty basic, could be better and have more options (incredibly it had absolutely no vegetarian options) As a transit hotel, this place is excellent!

Why on earth would anyone stay here? We had to stay due to our flight being cancelled and Air New Zealand had to accommodate all of us in a hotel for a potentially 12 hour stay while they fixed the plane. We now have had the curious experience at the end of a vacation of being told our flight was delayed five hours, then boarded at 3.15 AM then off the plane and shuttled to this "hotel" . We got checked into our room at 6 AM . The things you notice even at that hour of the morning when you haven't slept ? First impression was the smell of old musty and dank in the room.Bugs in the toilet ( lid was closed so they couldn't escape!) sand on the floor( we are NOT adjacent to a beach), sand in the cubby where the towel was stored, and dead bugs all over the floor under the wash stand. So we try to get some sleep. But the air con would be a problem. No matter! The freeway noise would cancel the air con noise out!! We are in the block at the end of the complex,outside and across the walk from the main building. Maybe it would be better in that building? I'm being kind, dear traveller. Don't stay unless you have to like we did. As our flight was rescheduled we had the opportunity to stay another night! Joy of joys. So we order dinner. A starter each followed by a main course. You guessed it. It was a starter followed immediately by the main course which we had only just received. My husband had soup as his starter but it was cold so asked for it to be microwaved ( see not fussy, just want warm food) so the waitress took it way and as our mains were already on the table we were all a bit perplexed about the order of things. Our waitress implied it was a management issue so my husband asked her to send the manager to us so we could convey our thoughts. Didn't happen. Soup returned to the table and my husband was offered dessert by way of compensation. Now you might be thinking we are hard to please. But this place is a shocker. We finished our meal and I had some wine left in my glass. I thought we could take it to the sitting area ( no bar) after the meal. The charming hostess said I couldn't take the glass away from the dining area so I said I was going to the sitting are. Apparently this was ok. Guess what? I defiantly returned to my room with it! Before doing so I went to reception to convey the details of the state of the room. She started by saying we should complain this morning. Now remember,we only got here at 6 am, so that wasn't going to be acceptable. And secondly, where does it say that if your room is dirty due to sloppy housekeeping,that there is a limit on when you can complain? Really if you have to stay near the airport, there has to be a better option than this.look I could go on but I note two things in the reviews of this place. If you write a bad review, Brent apologises for your experience. Hey Brent. Sort it out before you put people in the room so they don't have to moan on trip advisor! Second is that some folk are so pleased to be close to the airport they will accept anything. It's a 40 dollar ride from Waikiki to the airport by taxi cab so you might take that into account before planning your stay here. There are other options to consider and freeway noise air traffic noise don't make up for proximity to the airport.

If you just need one night's stay near the airport, this one is fine. The room is clean and spacious. Our room has a highway view, but who cares. There is free shuttle bus to and from the airport. Very convenient.

The hotel was, as others have noted, average. Not much that was exceptionally good or bad. Two breakfasts in the hotel dining area, however, for two people totalled just over $85.00. The breakfasts were simple buffets, and not worth anything akin to what was charged. Get your breakfast from a vending machine or somewhere down the road.

This was just 1 night stay before we flew out early the next morning to Australia to return home. Perfect location to the airport and the shuttle service was great between the airport and the hotel. The hotel had free WIFI which was great. The restaurant in the hotel was good with friendly staff, could not complain. Only complaint I had was as it was there was a lot of noise around the area but this was always going to happen being so close to the airport, but if you are looking for just a bed its a good place.

A good basic hotel to use when you are between flights in Honolulu. The fruit for breakfast was excellent. The room was clean and comfortable. Recommended when you need to be near the Airport. You phone the hotel when you arrive to let them know exactly where you are. There is a free phone just past the luggage carousels. We mistakenly took the bus for their sister hotel the Best Western so be sure to ask because the buses look the same. But it was no problem because he did drop us at our hotel.

We arrived at this hotel at 10:30 pm, and had a flight to catch the next morning at 6:30. The shuttle driver was great, prompt and friendly. Once we got in our room, we quickly figured out there was no water. We made a call to the front desk, they said they would send someone. It was so late we said no, but that we would appreciate a bottle of water. At the front desk, the sassy desk attendant told us there were vending machines - go buy it yourself. Next morning we got up at 4:30 to catch the shuttle, and the desk attendant did not offer any compensation for no water, and told us we could be transferred to the sister hotel to bathe. Too late now! Why didn't they suggest that the night before? We were told it was a water main that broke, and the city shut off the water. That wasn't our fault either. But we were the ones who paid for it with a full charge for the room. Honolulu is an old city - hotels need to be better prepared for stuff like this happening. THey had to have had some bottled water they could have put out for their guests. And the manager - she wasn't even there for the event. If you were a manager wouldn't you be on site to "manage" this kind of problem that affected all of your guests? Incompetent. Don't stay here.

This hotel does not look or feel like an airport hotel. Beautiful decor and pool area, super clean room. We were staying the night before a 6am flight back to the mainland. We were able to return our car down the street and walk back to the hotel, enjoy dinner at the restaurant, and then use the shuttle to get to the airport at 4:30 am. The windows let in a lot of noise from the highway and the airport, but the A/C fan and our traveling white-noise machine made sleeping in the comfy bed easy. Bring earplugs if you are a light sleeper. Great option for easy access to the airport!

We stayed here late September after arriving from London and before heading to Kauai in the morning. I wasn't sure what to expect but was pleasantly surprised, the rooms were a nice size and the beds were enormous, we would have fit 4 people in there at least with room to spare! The location is obviously not glamorous which is to be expected at an airport hotel, but it was very convenient for an early flight and I wouldn't have trouble choosing to stay there again.

This is an airport hotel; not a resort. Hawaiian recently put me at this hotel for one night after a missed connection. Having stayed at the other 2 choices near the airport, this was by far the best. The lobby is nice. The rooms were nice. The restaurant is next to a soothing pool. The only complaint I had was that the price of breakfast seemed high even for Hawaii. It cost me around $20 for eggs, bacon, hash browns, and coffee. The staff was pleasant. Remember to take ear plugs. The freeway is right next to this building. The occasional motorcycle is very noisy.

So convenient for a stay just next to the airport. I walked to return my car as all the rental car companies are very close, the room was clean, quiet and the staff was wonderful. I was very happy, felt safe, ample parking and made my first stay in Honolulu just perfect. I would highly recommend this location.. About ten miles from Waikiki - walking distance fro small shops for snacks and necessities.

Let,s be clear. I am a five star snob. I like nice and I like it a lot. This is not a resort hotel.....BUT... It is clean and very convenient to HNL ( we walked to it after our flight, just to stretch our legs). The folks that work here are kind, helpful and welcoming. The rooms are OK but the furniture is dated ( not trashed, just dated) . The bathrooms have been upgraded but they are small and again CLEAN The cafe puts out a reasonable breakfast at a reasonable price.I recommend it for a stop over in Honolulu , if you don't want to drive into Waikiki or out to Ko'Olina. I wouldn't stay here as a base for your Hawaiian vacation.

Its nothing fancy, but the staff members were really helpful. Rooms were clean, and the housekeepers were friendly and was always cleaning. One housekeeper that made it really comfortable was DELIA. She was so nice and very very helpful. The only downfall, was that the restaurant was not open everyday for dinner, and had to take a shuttle bus to places to get something to eat. But, it was still very good customer service....,!
user_name:
Melry W
Atlanta, Georgia, United States

review_body: I was originally staying at the Naval Lodge and they ran out of space. I came to the Airport Hotel because I could have my dog and was blown away with how nice they are. The rooms are simple and there is a mini fridge and microwave which makes it hard for extended stays. But there is a restaurant which is pricey but military receives a voucher to help offset the coast. The pool is nice and it is located close to the airport and Hickam, Pearl Harbor and Tripler. If you are coming for vacation it is away from the beach but the bus comes right out front and you can go anywhere on the island.

One of our less than positive hotel experiences - starting with a long wait for the shuttle, certainly not the 1/2 hour maximum we'd been lead to believe. And what a lot of money for what you get. We arrived with 2 kids in tow, only to be told that there was no food available at 8pm and we could wait for the shuttle to the other Hotel. No thanks, enough of the shuttle waiting. After getting my thoughts on that off my chest at reception and retrieving the key, as an aside the receptionist mentioned that there was a shop open within the hotel and we could buy microwaveable meals there. OK, well that would have worked except they sell 2 minute noodles but....there's no kettle in the room. Ignoring the noodle warning NOT to use the microwave to heat, we managed to scrape something of a meal together. And then settled in to a night full of partying next door, and the door next to that...and that. I gather a few military personnel were making the most of a get together. Anyhow, when I turned on the light to read, I noticed a couple of cockroaches on the bedside table were enjoying the music from next door. Hey, it's all just another travel experience....except this one cost us more than our nightly rate at the Hilton Hotel Waikoloa which was like comparing apples with shoes. Unless your flight times really are that tight, just pay the $40 extra to get a cab into Honolulu and stay at an actual Hotel. There were none of the usual benefits of an airport hotel (late night food, quick transfer etc) here.

There's nothing fancy to this hotel. It's clean and comfortable, but far too expensive for what it offers. Though, maybe that's just Honolulu in general. The airport shuttle leaves every half hour I believe, and the hotel is close to the Navy Exchange (if you have privileges).

This hotel fit our needs-a bed. The late evening airport pick-up and check-in went smoothly. We found that we had a roommate in our room-a cockroach. I had requested a superior room, but doubt that is what we got-I was only interested in getting to sleep rather than complaining to the somewhat inhospital receptionist. Wife appreciated the bathroom. In the early morning, the express check-out was convenient, then off to the airport again on the shuttle. I wouldn't want to spend more than an evening here.

I arrived at the international terminal with 2 children, called the number as advised for a transfer, the front desk clerk asked me what number location we were at the airport, I said I couldnt see a number, she insisted it was above my phone, there was nothing she could do without it, I explained I was at the hotel calling booth at the international terminal and there was no number. She told me to get off the phone and find it she didnt have time to talk to me as she had calls holding. I hung up and spent time walking around with 2 toddlers trying to find the number she referred to then be told by the staff at airport the International arrivals does not have a number. I called the hotel back, someone else answered and they dispatched the shuttle. I got to check-in, where someone was being treated very rudely in front of other guests. I was happy to get to my room and have as little as possible to do with the front desk staff, as after a long flight I didnt want to take the brunt of their bad day. I paid over $220 USD to stay here for 1 night and chose it over the others in the area as I do prefer good service and quality. I didnt get it.

This is a very convenient hotel located close to the airport. The hotel provides a 24-hour shuttle service from the airport to hotel and back to the airport. The rooms and bathrooms are clean. There is a Starbucks about a block away and other convenience stores but they close about 11:00 at night so if you are arriving after 11 you're out of luck trying to find something to eat. The food at the hotel restaurant is good but it is not open all day. Overall, it is a comfortable place to stay for one or two nights. It's more for people who are just passing through Honolulu on the way to somewhere else. It is not a place you'd want to stay if you are vacationing in Hawaii.

I was there for only one night as one usually does at an airport hotel. Was on my way back from holiday and so fair enough, maybe not in the best of moods., but still this was not a good experience. First of all, one positive point, very well organized pick up service from and to the airport. Arrived at the hotel at 9.10 pm to be told that the restaurant of the hotel is closed at 9pm and that unfortunately nothing is close by so my only option is to order pizza from Dominos... i go around the corner from the check in counter to find a convenience store with food and beverages opened until 11pm... Wanted to go to the gym.. it closes also at 9pm... thought of ordering room service... no room service. Being part of the hospitality industry myself i was really disappointed with the service, which was non existent. You expect an airport hotel to have 24h facilities as the guests are arriving and leaving usually in odd hours: very late and/or very early... and none of the hotel's facilities seemed to be organized to accommodate those needs. And on top of that, the price was very expensive.

It was good experience I was coming from Melbourne Victoria Australia and I was very exhausted and I like the location of the hotel and the service was ok. The staff need to work on their customer service skills and work on their attitude. If there was more to say. Would but there isn't much to say.

My visit started at the airport. I called for a pickup van and a clean white van was there to pick me up in 5 minutes. It probably helps that the Honolulu Airport Hotel teams up with a Best Western a couple blocks away and jointly provides the van service. Next onto the hotel where I was greeted by Suzie and Suzanne at the front desk. I stopped off at the hotel gift shopped and was greeted by the charming Florida C. All in all, everyone I met bent over backwards to make my stay pleasant.Having read previous trip advisor reports, I was not sure what to expect. I found a friendly establishment, clean, great location, good price and military friendly. I am retired military. Don’t go there with a surf board and expectations of a beach front resort. This is the closest hotel to the airport…clean, friendly and with most all of the services you might need. For the military folks, there is transportation (compliments of JN Chevrolet) to the Pearl Harbor Exchange/Commissary. The hotel is family friendly. Fly into the airport, pick up groceries at the commissary and store them in the room refrigerator. They come with microwaves. The hotel is pet friendly. This is a big plusI will certainly stay there again if I am going to the bases, connecting to a cruise or stopping for a visit to Tripler or the VA Center.

We stayed here for the 10 days before PC'ng from the island heading back stateside. The hotel is nice, but service from everyone was always awesome. Every morning Dalia would take care of our room with a smile and pleasantries. The front desk and front doormen were always nice and professional as well. The restaurant inside is good for breakfast but ok for dinner. Pricey and very dry chicken sandwich. It is convienently located near the NEX and plenty of food places.

The hotel is in a great location and close to everything we need. The service is wonderful. The hotel had a restaurant and mini store inside just in case you need something. It also has a mini gym and nice swimming pool.

This is the closest you can stay to Honolulu airport. It is only a 5 minute ride in the free shuttle bus! We used the shuttle for both pickup from the airport and drop off in the morning. You have to telephone for pickup from the free phone in the baggage claim area and we had a very short wait. The shuttle runs every half hour in the morning and this is managed very efficiently.Our room was very nice, clean and comfortable and included both fridge and microwave.There is free WIFI in the rooms and free boarding pass printing is available in the lobby.We will definitely stay here again next time we visit Honolulu.

We stayed here for about a month while my husband received medical treatment. The hotel staff were friendly and professional. Norma T. from housekeeping did an extraordinary job. It was nice coming back from the hospital daily and finding our room with clean towels and the room clean and fresh.

We had a late flight in from Chicago and an early flight next day out to Kauai and stayed here for one night. The hotel is just a few minutes from the airport by shuttle, the staff is friendly and professional, and the rooms are on a par with an older Motel 6 or Super 8. Let's say that the rooms are adequate. Our room seemed clean though I felt the chill of the air conditioner on my side of the bed. The staff kindly reminded us to provide our Hawaiian airlines frequent flyer number to earn miles. We got in late and the only place convenient to get food was the gift shop. My husband and I split a sandwich purchased at the shop and it was fine. If you are getting in late and need a full dinner, you might want to buy it at the Honolulu airport and eat it there or take it to the hotel. The morning shuttle was reliable and got us back to the airport with plenty of time to spare. Contrary to other reviews, it didn't take us a long time to check in and perhaps we were just lucky. This hotel is a good place to crash for one night when you need to get from Honolulu to one of the other islands, and I commend the staff for their friendliness and professionalism.

We stayed here for 60 days and my kids loved the pool. Close to all bases and they have a shuttle going to the NEX every day. We loved house keeping .. Especially Marilyn.. Always smiling and making our day better.

Hotel Staff are extremely professional, polite, and accommodating. Housekeeping (Delia) is extraordinary considering this is not a 5 Star property. Best value for military families utilizing TLA. Contact Mr. Les Nishimura via hotel front desk as soon as you receive order notification.

Stay was just OK... The negatives: Rooms A/C smells like mold and the filter looks like it hasn't been changed in years. The gym is falling apart! half the equipment was broken or dirty.. The laundry rooms are crazy expensive to do a load of laundry if you can even get a washer; because they were broken also. Lastly the hotel restaurant was overpriced and service wasn't that great. The positives, My cleaning lady Delia was very nice and always had my room spotless when I came back from where ever. Also the location is close to the Airport and rental car agency's and they do have a airport shuttle as well.

The hotel is very close to the airport, only about 3-5 min by shuttle and the rooms are very clean however the location is rather noisy. However I arrived at 7pm local time from my flight with 2 tired kids and found the lineup to check in was 12 people deep, out the door. It took me 40 minutes to check into the hotel. I have travelled around the world and never had to wait more than 10 min to check in anywhere. I addressed this to them the next day on checkout and they only replied we don't know when people will arrive so how are we supposed to staff accordingly? I find this hard to believe. It is summer time in Hawaii, the place was full of marines so they may as well open all three check in desks. On top of that I had an airport shuttle at 7am to catch for my flight out. I called at 6:45 to have a bellman come in and help me down to reception. He happened to also be the shuttle driver and was returning from another airport run so I had to wait for some time for him to come to my room, nearly missing my own shuttle. They are understaffed in that regard as well.

We paid $200 AUD for 6 hours at this hotel. When we checked in we were treated to a negative nancy at reception who made zero attempt at personal communication. Rooms are small and noisy (you can hear cars and people in the carpark). Free shuttle to and from airport was a bonus but there's a sign on the bus saying to tip per bag. Nothing is free. Ripped off!

Absolutely Fabulous- get there early to avoid crowds- Very large and lots of people. We were comfortable in our room and enjoyed the breakfast as well as the managers social. The occasional entertainment was very good. Close to the beach and stores as well as lots of variety in dining. The room was very clean, you walk in to hear Hawaiian music playing on the stereo, the bed a massive, and there were 'his and hers' bathrooms. The staff were excellent, the front desk in particular was great. The location was perfect! Close enough to the beach and shopping, and close to all the restaurants and food outlets..The pool and other guest facilities were good. I especially appreciated the access to the Waikiki Trolleys (which are free) as well as free wifi.

Restaurant closed. No live music. What service. Don't go there. If you want to sleep forget this place as the noise from the local homeless goes on and on. When we asked for pizza takeaway menu they gave us one and said it was there last one. You would think they were giving us something for free. Another guest was having the same trouble to find something to eat.

Rooms are nice and clean. The location is not the best if you are looking for lots of attractions in walking distance but there is a strip mall nearby with several places to eat and a Starbuck's. I stayed here for work, not vacation, and found the experience to be great. The best part of my stay was the housekeeping, specifically Rofel. She was very efficient and always asked if I needed anything and did not bother me if I had my Do-Not-Disturb sign out. (I worked the midnight shift) I guess the only downside was the laundry. Only had a couple of washers/dryers on two of four floors in my building and one washer was perpetually inoperative. Overall, my stay was great.

Yes it's old and dated Yes it's overpriced Yes it's noisyBut the worst? On arrival I found in the corridor a dirty band aid and crushed French fries in the carpet on floor 2 at about 7pm.I informed the front desk as a courtesy to get them cleaned . They made a fuss about getting it cleaned ASAP .It's now 8:30am and its all still there.Not good enough

So much our experience apart from why we are here was made easy by the attentive and approachable Delia of housekeeping. She made us comfortable enough to ask anything and she worked so fast and unobtrusively. Her kind voice and nice smile lived up to the "old school" respectfulness and courtesy. Her services are unmatched in my experience.,

My experience staying in this Hotel has been a comforting thoughts.I have always been somewhat a private type personality,but thanks to the professional service in particularly room service ..I would say no matter what the out come of your day turnout to be wether it be BAD to WORST A morning SMILE from room service CURES all .Thnx!!, ms DeL'ia,it's been an Pleasant Experience.Mahalo.

My stay at this hotel has been very pleasant. The room upkeep is outstanding and the level of customer service from the room service associates go far beyond in what I would expect in customer service. This is especially true in regards to the room service associate named Delia. She is by far the nicest and most professional room service associate I've encountered.
user_name:
Demetrius D
Macon, Georgia, United States

review_body: Marie froom hskping dept was very nice and respectful. Up til our last days, she has made our staVery nice. Usually, when they come to our room, we are still either sleeping or just waking up. She would ask us if we are going out and asks us if we would like for her to come back at that time. That makes us feel respected as respect is very important in our culture. This is our first stay here in Hawaii and we areglad that ee stayed here. She made that big difference. I will make sure that when my parents come back, they will stay right here.

This hotel is divided into several sections. Our room was on the fourth floor facing the airport. The soundproofing around the glass doors to the tiny patio is not very good, so the airplane noise is pretty significant.Otherwise, if you need a hotel just for a layover in Honolulu and don't plan on going out (unless you get a car), this hotel could suit your needs well.

Delia in housekeeping does an excellent job with my room everytime I stay at this property. She is very alert on the small details that mean alot to me.Ann at the front desk is also an asset to the hotel, always accommodating to my request for certain rooms.Both ladies are always with a smile. I look forward to seeing them on my return arrival.The entire staff is friendly and always helpfull.

We had a 15-hour layover on our way to Micronesia. I had read reviews of this hotel that weren't very good, but chose to stay anyway based on its close proximity to the airport. I was pleasantly surprised! After claiming our bags, I used the courtesy phone to let the hotel know we had arrived. The shuttle showed up quickly and we were checking in within a few minutes. The front desk was helpful. We arrived before check-in time, but it was not a problem, our room was ready. It was lunchtime and the on-site restaurant was not open, so they gave us a map with directions to several local restaurants. We had to get up at 3 am for our early flight. The room was quiet and the a/c was cold. We got a good night's sleep and the shuttle was ready to return us to the airport. We plan on staying here anytime we pass through HNL.

Flight cancellation created a 15 hour layover between DFW and Seoul at last minute. We had to leave airport with lots of luggage, and definitely needed a place to crash. A friend who lives in Honolulu found this for us. $169.80 for one night was steep for us (especially since it was unexpected), but very reasonable for HI. This place was clean, had great air conditioning, and spacious enough for us (sisters). The front desk was very friendly and courteous. The free shuttle service was most welcome. (The hotel shuttle cost $36 per person, round trip to our Waikiki hotel on our return leg.) So, for last minute and very needed accommodations, it was a very good value. The restaurant stayed open until 10:00 p.m. and the food was excellent.

Standard rooms, comfortable and clean, little expensive for what you get but then, everything is in Honolulu. Free shuttle to and from the airport with friendly, helpful drivers. Front desk of hotel is staffed by extremely friendly and helpful people. Not really for a holiday destination but great if you have a short layover in Honolulu. We had a 5:30am flight.

So the reviews were not encouraging but we didn't want to go into Honolulu for one night. I think it is too pricey for being quite dated and the rooms are small. It is very close to the airport and the shuttle is free so it is very convenient. If I need to stay in Honolulu again for one night I think I would like to try staying somewhere else.

We flew in late and walked to this hotel which was nice after a five hour flight. The rooms are dated but clean. If you can get a room here for $170 or so...it is probably worth it. Check in was easy and staff was polite and helpful about local attractions...i.e. Pearl Harbor. When I looked at this hotel for our return flight it was $229 a night. I opted to stay elsewhere at that price.
user_name:
Tracy M
Byron, Wyoming, United States

review_body: I came to Honolulu for a dinner meeting and my company arranged this hotel as it is close to the hotel and it is VERY CLOSE! It is not noisy, and the airport shuttle is free, 24-7, on the 1/2 hour and hour. The staff had mixed recommendations on how early to go for my 5:52am flight, but I figured earlier was safest. So, I took the 4:30am shuttle and had more than enough time to spare. I might have even been able to take the 5am shuttle, but that would have cut it close and not fallen within the recommendations of when to get to the airport for TSA, etc.Also, please note that there is a little strip mall of food shops, including gourmet pan pizzas about a block or so away. The Starbucks also opens at 4 or 4:15am, but I decided to skip it.My room was clean and a normal size with 2 Double beds, dressing table and a small round table with 2 chairs.. The sister property is a Best Western and the manager works at both. This property is equivalent to a Best Western or other similar property. There was a dead roach in the far corner of the room, but I'm just really good at finding these things. No live bugs, and a clean mini-refrigerator and microwave. It was nice to be able to make a cup of tea in my room at 3:30am and it was nice to keep my bottle of water chilled during the day/evening. Coffee-maker and fresh coffee was included as well. Basic amenities were available in the room as well: lotion, shampoo, conditioner, iron, ironing board, etc. I didn't use the pool, but soon after my check-in in the afternoon, the pool filled up with families enjoying one last night of vacation. The pool was clean from my window view and there appeared to be a handicapped accessible device at the side of the pool as well. The restaurant didn't open up till 6:30am, I think, but there was a gift shop that opened up at 5, I think. The gift shop, which was in the far side of the lobby, had snacks for all different meals, including microwaveable food items. And, as I said, just a block out the back of the hotel was an entire array of food shops.I had read all the awful reviews and called the manager prior to my arrival. He made it a point to greet me soon after my arrival. The staff were cordial, friendly and professional, regardless of whether I had mentioned trying to meet the manager.Probably, the only thing, I didn't care for was the price tag, but the hotel is less than 5 min away from the airport. Otherwise, the place is fine. It's not noisy and while the decor is slightly worn, it's overall clean.

We spent here 2 nights, it was short stopover after we arrived fromEurope via Seoul. We have arrived to hotel at 11.00 morning and we have got room even before 16.00, which we really appreciated especially after 25 hry travelling. I do not want describe more detailed hotel and rooms, because u can find it in other rewiews. What is important? Hotel and rooms was clean, not any bugs as was mentioned in some reviews. Staff was really very helpful and pleasent. Retaurant worked only 3 days, and meal is good, but 300 meters far away is several fastfoods - starbucks, sushi bar, hamburgers and others. So from my point of view, typical AirPort hotel with standard service for reasonable price (we webe 4 people in iné room) for short staying

Ok for one night. We stayed here after our flight from the east coast of mainland USA. Clean and about 2 minutes from the airport. Very industrial area, next to highway; fairly noisy. Decent restaurant with super nice servers.

We stayed here for two weeks while I was recovering from surgery. The housekeeping service was outstanding! Delia, made sure our room was always clean. Anytime we needed anything Delia made sure it was taken care of. I would definitely stay here again.

They helped us a lot with getting to know the area and helped with transportation before we were able to get a vehicle. Luckily, the pools had the towels out and available for us. I enjoyed the restaurant food and people, they knew me and my son pretty well. And Ms. Delia, was helpful when it came to keeping up with the room. Being polite, knowing my son was asleep. She also showed me to bag my son's nasty diapers so we didn't have to deal with the smell. Over all, we really loved staying with the airport Honolulu hotel.

This has been a wonderful experience so far. I had excellent room service. I couldn't have had a better person to take care of our needs. Mrs. Delia is on time with all the things we asked for and very sociable. She made our trip even friendlier. Thanks a lot.

First, let me say that every single staff member I have encountered has been friendly, professional and helpful. From Kehau at the front desk for check in (thank you again!) to my wonderful housekeeper Marie and even the guy vacuuming the hallway when I had a problem with the doors (sorry I missed your name...) and even the concession store ladies have made the stay easy.I have stayed here numerous (10+) times over the years, on a VA ticket, on gov rate and for personal travel. I understand the frustration of the higher rates, but the specific advantages of the location and convenience usually trump the cost. I would not choose to stay here for a "vacation", but for VA medical, military in/out and quick layovers it works.The staff can help you get the bus to shopping, or walk to a small shopping area (5-6 min) or if you have ID there is a free shuttle to the NavEx/Commissary less than 10 min away.If you rent a car, they do charge for parking (nearly every hotel on Oahu does...) and bear in mind that the parking spaces are REALLY tight (economy ok, compact better, big SUV forget it...)They permit pets, and I have heard a dog barking occasionally, but not to irritation (more like makes me miss mine left at home...) and the housekeepers like animals! If you are coming to Hawaii for a vacation, keep looking for a hotel that will meet your vacation expectations, but for a quick layover, a medical trip, or a family (all of the family; meow, woof) move to/from, this one should work for you too.
user_name:
Amy L
Ili'ili, American Samoa, United States

review_body: Our stay here has been very nice..we didn't have any problems during our stay. It was so convenient. Close to the hospital, stores and the complimentary shuttles. One the things we liked most about this trip was our housekeeper DELIA. She is a quick worker and always worked with a smile on her face. She is a committed and hard worker. Aside from her, the whole staff was super friendly and ready to help.

i never got so nice and great service from any hotel i have ever been... i was greeted, help and shown to my room so fast and so friendly... but the best part was the house keeper ( DELIA ) i never problems on the time speed and the cleanliness of my room. and the trust i have that i can leave my high value items on my room. such friendly and inviting staff kept my stay here one of the best hotel on the island... one negative parking is not enough and too small for my vehicle (SUV)

I don't understand the negative reviews here..we are currently staying at this hotel and are enjoying ourselves. We are getting ready to PCS off the island (we're military) and we are staying here for 9 days. We have not had one problem nor one complaint. The staff is friendly and the rooms are quiet, comfortable and very adequate. This is a perfectly lovely hotel. Yes, the decor is a bit outdated but still nice nonetheless. Honestly, I think people just like to piss over small issues. Some people seem to have champagne taste with beer money. I'm only saying...

This is a hotel that is on the approved TLA list for PCSing military families. It was the closest we could get to where I worked on the west side that still had a shuttle and took promissory. It was always clean but the beds were not comfortable at all and the detergent was very harsh on my skin. The restaurant downstairs had an odd vibe to it and the prices were very expensive for what you got, even with the little discount they gave you (which covers half a dish). It is located under the free way off Nimitz and it has the crappiest parking ever. You can walk to a Starbucks, which is nice though. Bottom line: Stay here if you have to but otherwise, skip it.

We checked in at 11pm Friday with a contracted rate, yet couldn't find my reservation, so I was charged $169 a night not $109 a night the contracted rate of 8years back when it was still the Ohana Hotel.The rooms and hotel Dated and old, it smells of old and run down.The front desk staff was rude, and when asked for extra towels(only had 2sets for double bed room) I had my 2 children with me, I was also questioned if I only had 2 children in my room, then said I'm paying a lower rate? Which was not true and very over priced for this "motel" type place.DON'T WASTE YOUR MONEY HERE, and the restaurant food was terrible!!!!

Not bad for an airport hotel given that there aren't many to choose from. We arrived late at night and flew out the next morning so it worked for us, but for a longer stay I'd probably go to Waikiki as there's nothing much around this hotel (they do have a restaurant and a small convenience store). The decor is somewhat dated but everything was in good repair and not worn-looking, plus the bed was comfortable. It is a bit odd that they provide a fridge and a microwave, but not drinking glasses (just two paper cups for the coffee machine). Phoned from the airport for the complementary shuttle and it was there within 10 minutes. Returning to the airport, the shuttle leaves every 30 minutes (on the hour and half-hour) as long as there are passengers. They don't take reservations for the shuttle so if there are a lot of people waiting in the lobby you have to make a mad dash when the driver opens the door to make sure you get on.

this place is overpriced and ridiculous - hotel where last option for a beer is 9pm and there is no bar? cant believe that.exists and that for 160 a night? ridiculous is the word.if you stay here you are lost after 9pm, the area is devoid of any other option in the evening. makes it even more difficult to understand why they dont have a bar.

If you need a one day or less stay near the airport, this would be a good hotel. The airport is a five minute drive or a ten minute walk from the hotel. Not a Hawian experience, no views, next to the highway and under pass, in an industrial area.Free convenient shuttle service to and from the airportRoom small but adequate. Bed a bit saggy but had a good nights sleep. Some dust bunnies and flaking paint on ceilings in both bathroom and Bedroom.Bus to all areas of the island right outside the hotel, leaving every 20-30 minutes.

I especially need to appreciate my house keeping - DeliaShe is so enthusiasm and spend a lot of time to answer my questions at the first day.That is very important to a new customer, especially when I am unfamiliar near by.She always keep the room very clean, and greeting customer by their name just like we are family.However, hotel's facility is very aged.Swimming pool is tiny and dirty, without lifeguard, also the towels for pool customer is usually in shortage.There have only 2 Laundry room , total 4 washing machine and 4 dryer machine need to work for over three hundreds of room. besides of that, Machines is aged and always out of order.I sincerely suggest to renew some facility in this hotel, and setup some dollar coin machine to decrease the inconvenience of the customer.

Several of us waited for over 45 minutes for airport pickup, only to arrive at hotel after restaurant and gift shop had closed 10 minutes early. Hotel has no cocktail lounge. They suggested we walk, in a terrible part of town, to a bar for drinks and food. AC did Ok, but rooms felt dirty and tired. Elevators no where near checking, and too overworked. I'd spent a bit more and stay in a better chain.

This property and the other Honolulu airport hotel (Best Western) are now apparently affiliated, and the resulting lack of competition has allowed them to price gouge. Rooms that formerly routinely went for $110-139 are now over $200 with tax. We were given a noisy room with an antique TV and patched walls where the new paint was mismatched to the old. There was also a shortage of hot water. We would have been better off paying cab fare to Waikiki rather than spending our overnight layover at this hotel.

Pros:Excellent location, very quick to/from airportFree shuttle servicestaff were very friendly and helpfulRestaurant and gift shop on premisesCons:The room I was in was a little crammed. The dark carpet looked old and worn. Restaurant was only open for breakfast and lunch (at least when we were there)There was the odd unfriendly/ tough-looking characters in the hotel. There was no incident, but some people had a "you better stay out of my way" kind of look on their faces. Perhaps If there was a friendly security guard wandering around, that would make my family feel better (I had my wife and 1-year old with me). Again, most of the guests were friendly. I just mention this as a side pointOverall, I would stay at this hotel for a stop-over stay. The value you get is fine, and the friendly staff are very helpful

I had to stay here again since my flight got delayed. When I got there the front desk clerk was nice and very courteous. She gave me a room that was close to the front. The room I stayed in was very clean. The complementary coffee was good since I starbucks down the street was closed. I have always enjoyed staying here. Free internet service too was good :) Thank you for always making my moneys worth.

This used to be part of the Best Western chain and was known as Ohana Hotel. We are PCS'ing off the island and this is only one of TWO hotels that accepts cats (The Navy Lodge is the other one). Pros: Good central location near to Waikiki and the highway (good for running all those clearing errands)-Accepts cats!The first week (we stayed for 10 days) our housekeeper was Maritsa and she was great! So friendly and she really took care of our cats. We would lock them in the bathroom during the day so she could come in and clean up and she would then let them out of the bathroom when she was done so I never had to worry about them being too cooped up.-free wifi, free parking-restaurant on location-for a pet room there wasn't any obvious stains or bad smellsCons:-the location, while central, is super noisy with the freeway literally a stone's throw away. Bring earplugs.-SAFETY. They leave the exterior doors open all night!! With the crime and homeless issue here this is a big security concern for me. Also, what if one of the pets slips out of the room? They can run right outside next to a busy highway before the owner could get them. There is obviously a wing for pet owners and it isn't as nice or as big as the other non-pet rooms. I don't appreciate being in a subpar room just because I own pets.-massive price gouging "Hawaiian prices" for everything...$2 for 300ml of Dasani water?! $7 for peanut butter?-the gym requires a special key and has set hours-everything keeps breaking down, the washers, dryers, the vending machines...-with the exception of Maritsa, everyone else wasn't that friendly -they need more people at the front desk, always had a line-the laundry takes only quarters, but there is no change machine-they charge $0.25 A MINUTE to use their business computer. Seriously?!-parking lots are small and if you get there in the evening you have to seriously searchI only chose this place because the Navy Lodge was full and no one else accepted cats. If you don't have cats, go somewhere else.

The hotel offered all the things we needed for our short stopover: a good king size bed, a warm shower in the morning and a free airport shuttle. In the hotel you will find a small store where you can buy water or a sandwich – the restaurant closed at 9 pm – we arrived later. Like all other airport hotels this hotel is not located in a nice area but it did not matter for us. The free WIFI worked well. But we could NOT sleep well because of the automatic ventilation in the bathroom – it was very noisy and you cannot turn it off – you will hear it also when the bathroom door is closed.

We stayed here due to a PCS move and it was the hotel the sponsor set up. If it wasn't for the meal vouchers and the fact that we have housing in the next week we would have moved a while ago. The park is over crowded, MOST of the staff is pleasant, but a few of them are very very very rude. When you check in (military) they say they take care of getting the certificate of non-availibilty for you, however, ours never got one so we have to fight that battle. Then when we paid for our first 10 days, we were over charged. Eventually it was all fixed, but it was still the hassle of having to deal with the mix up in the first place.The restaurant in the hotel, is well mediocre to be nice. The staff while pleasant (most the time) is soooo slow. We average 10-20 minutes before having our drink orders taken. The food is okay, most days, but nothing to drive for. If it wasn't located down stairs from us we would never eat there. In addition, the prices are way over priced. Milk for a child is $4. I understand that it is Hawaii, and things are more expensive but for $1.50 more I could buy a gallon of milk, just saying. I am soooooooooo ready to not be staying in this hotel anymore, and I will definitely not recommend it to anyone else.

The staff very helpful and friendly.Housekepper Delia besides she cleaned the room was always willing to help if anything asked.Aiport is walking distance and was very helpful to me.If possible the windows should be soundproff as its located near the airport.

We needed a close Airport hotel due to an early morning flight. We were disappointed that the dinning room was closed when we arrived around 6:00 p.m. We ended up walking a block to a small strip plaza w/ a couple of fast food locations and convenience store for beverages. We went to the L & L BBQ restaurant, and found the food to be very good and not expensive. They have a very large menu to choose from, and the place was very busy, due to the quality and price of the food. We would recommend this location to anyone staying at the airport hotel, because it's not very far.

Because of lateness of a flight into Honolulu and connecting with Maui last flight I stayed overnight at the Ohana Hotel. I need to tell the Ohana that I had a room that was last down a long hallway which had a noisy air-conditioning unit on the end wall. It was so loud I needed to come out and turn it off in order to try and sleep however in addition the air-conditioning unit in my room was so noisy it was a choice whether I could not sleep because it was airless and hot or because the air-conditioning, when on was so loud it did not allow sleep. I often travel to Honolulu and need to stay overnight and this is the last time I will stay in the Ohana - customers beware. I would rather sleep on a chair at the airport than pay $200US for a sleepless night in the Ohana unless they replace their air conditioning units for quieter ones. Other than that the room was adequate, clean and the beds comfortable.
user_name:
Gaye H
Auckland Central, New Zealand

review_body: Our stay here while we've been waiting for a house has been great. The staff is very friendly and helpful. DeLia cleans our room and is so sweet! She has also been helpful with information about the island! We really appreciate her.

This hotel is all about location, you could actually walk from the airport to the hotel. I have stayed here a few times, so I'll just explain my grades so as to not bore you.Service - One of the strong points of this hotel, the front desk staff is very friendly as are the employees who work here. I was pretty jet-lagged arriving from an international flight, arrived prior to 3 pm check-in time (actually just after noon) and it was no problem, they had rooms ready.Value - A big knock on the hotel is that the restaurant is not open all day. It has select hours (breakfast and dinner if I remember correctly) only. I never tried the food so I cannot comment on that. The rooms are just ok, standard for a 2.5 star hotel.Sleep Quality - The beds are decent, but the blankets are a little thin. It's Hawaii so you're going to have the a/c on all the time.Cleanliness - My room was clean, met my standards. The hotel in general seemed to be the same way.Location - Because it's beside the airport, (like a three minute shuttle ride) high grade here. That being said, if you don't have a car there is not a lot of options within walking distance if you're hungry. I ordered a pizza for dinner because I was just staying overnight. Rooms - Average rooms, the usual amenities for this class. I think they upgraded their internet because it was faster than I remembered.Room service - Low grade because the restaurant is not open that much.Spa - They have one, I believe. If not they get a "1" rating here.Overall, the hotel is alright, but way over-priced (in excess of $140.00 per night).

I read some of the other rating but I think people need to remember this is a airport hotel and largely ment for transit passengers. Shuttle was quick and on time. Internet was free and the "gift shop" had everything from tooth paste to sandwiches. This was great because I landed In between lunch and dinner. Fri-Sunday dinner meals are at another hotel and there is a shuttle. The fast shuttle service makes it less inconvenient than it sounds. Bathroom also had shampoo and conditioner which was great meant I didn't have to unpack. People were very friendly and food was served fast. Loved the waffles and prime rib. I would have liked to have room service but it is not available. The 4th floor was a little loud bc the jets were taking off I'm sure lower floors were fine. Also the AC unit is old so turn on while your out of the room so you don't have to have it on to sleep

I would like to say that this hotel is very accomadating to the military. I have been here going on three weeks and should be here till the beginning of May. My house keeper Delia is very pleasant. She always has a smile and is very frienddly towards me and my children. They allow pets and keep me well informed on tla information. They have laundry facilities and small ammentities in the rooms. It is very close to a lot of businesses. They have shuttles to some locations. So you will not be stuck in your room until you get your vehicle or your houseing.
user_name:
Amber R
Clarksville, Tennessee, United States

review_body: I wouldn't recommend this hotel if you like your sleep. There was a dog that barked all night in the room next to me. It was apparent the people had no control over the dog. I had to put a pillow over my head to get some decent sleep.

I am writing this to report the excellent care that is provided to me. I am in a wheel chair and Delia my housekeeper always goes the extra mile for me. She is very pleasant always has a smile, kind never in a hurry, I have never had such great attention. I have been here now over three weeks and she has never changed her pleasant attitude. Thank you for your attention in this matter.

My husband was in Oahu for business so staying here before I flew in. We considered moving to another hotel closer into Honolulu and with more comfortable beds but decided for the rate we would just remain where we were and moved to another room away from the side of the hotel with the dumpsters (truck was extremely loud every morning!). This bed was much better! Rooms were very clean! Staff was very accommodating! Restaraunt over priced for breakfast but food was okay-nothing special. But hey, if you're in Hawaii you should be out of the hotel anyway right! We had a rental car so travel was not an issue and we only ate at the hotel one morning and one evening.Overall, we enjoyed our 10 day stay!! We would stay here again if we go back.

Slightly acceptable late night alternative to taking taxi back to Honolulu for flight delay to next morning. Free shuttle from airport to hotel.Phoned from airport for rate and availability. Quoted $145. At check out, rate went up to $189 but challenged this and they honored lower rate. The hotel is nothing fancy and probably overpriced at $145. Everything dated including bed linen/blanket but cleanish. Fair to say more of a motel.Breakfast in dining room (overlooking nice pool and pool area-good if you have a few hours to kill before flight) Lipstick marks on cups etc. so no attention to detail. Staff pleasant.

This hotel was the closest to HNL after a connecting flight was delayed and I missed the flight. This hotel was dingy, in need of major infrastructure improvements/remodel. The rooms were a blast from the past, late 60's early 70's. Was OVERPRICED at almost $200. Definitely not the level of hotel one would expect at that price point. Shuttle service was only reason it was chosen. Never again, period!

For $193/ night, the room smells and feels like a $50 a night motel. No place to eat after 9pm, only the lobby food mart. Free shuttle to terminals is the only good thing. I guess everyone stays there is not by choice.
user_name:
travel2288
New York City, New York

review_body: we had an 8hr stopover in Honolulu before we headed back to the mothership and needed a place to shower and recover sleep after our red eye flight...this was the perfect pick! was a bit pricey at $230/night (we booked the night before) but it was clean, room was spacious, had free airport transfer and was just minutes away from the airportnot much else to say as we came, slept, showered and left... although if you are going to be there for longer, there is a pool to keep you busy but not much else to explore outside the hotelgood e-mail comms from staff pre booking too

We arrived in this hotel near the airport after a long flight from New Zealand to be greeted by an overwhelming smell of mildew. It was only 8:40 in the evening but we were told that it was not possible to get any food, and we ended up locating some crackers and string chees at a convenience store. The decoration in the lobby area was pleasant enough, but the rooms were depressingly out of date and a view of various industrial establishments didn’t help. On the plus side, the bed was a comfortable king, and the air conditioning worked. There were no glasses in the room and when I called the reception desk I was told they only had paper cups. Do they usually have guests who smash the glasses? We were shocked that the Honolulu airport did not have a first class airport hotel. We had just come from Auckland where we stayed at the superior Novotel which is right at the airport and cost less than $40 more. My advice is that if you have any time at all between flights you should go spend the night in Waikiki.

This is a good airport hotel efficient and clean. Has a very good half-hourly bus service to the airport nearby.The downside is that it has check-out time 12:00 NOON. International travellers would expect 24 hour checkout for an airport hotel in Honolulu.Restaurant and coffee shop not open late. However there is a well stocked shop on the ground floor with good sandwiches and bit of grog too!Best place for overnight halt. We stayed here on our way to Kona, Big Island and on return. We took the public transport to Arizona Memorial Pearl Harbour.

If you are PCSing into Hawaii; do not think twice of which hotel to book into, this hotel is close proximity to Shafter, Hickam, and Pearl Harbor, although Schofield is a ways out there many folks who stay here are from Schofield. The restaurant is great, especially breakfast, not to mention the vouchers you receive if on Orders; Robin our waitress is exceptionally wonderful, she knows our order off the top of her head. Which is very cool, and fast.

This place was great to stay at. I loved my housekeeper delia. She was so friendly and gave me a lot of answers to my questions. Very honest and hardworking. I would recommend her to anyone. :) LOVED HER.
user_name:
Danielle L
Fort Lee, Virginia, United States

review_body: Stayed here 2 nights while visiting family on Hickam AFB. Check in and check out were both very fast and easy. Ate breakfast in restaurant both mornings. Very good food with large servings. Our waitress, Stella, was exceptionally nice and helpful. Overall, a great stay. If you are looking for a view, this is not it, but for the convience of the base and airport, great.

Was a great place to stay on our way out of Hawaii we checked in around 5 my husband was able to drive our rental car down to thrifty for drop off and walk back to the hotel, the staff were friendly and helpful at was clean and convenient right next to the airport so worked well for our early flight out the next morning the pool area was clean and cute for an airport hotel would stay again for a night or two stop over for sure

A large hotel with good sized clean and comfortable rooms and friendly and helpful checkin staff. We were pleasantly surprised that our room was ready even though it was only 10:45 in the morning. The 24hour shuttle is excellent for an early flight. The bus stop for Waikiki is very close if you have time to spare.
user_name:
Trevor B
New Milton, United Kingdom

review_body: Stayed here after an 11-hour flight from the East Coast--up early to connect to an inter-island flight the next morning. Must say we were pleased that it was more attractive, safe and comfortable than we expected--you never quite know what you'll be getting when coming from so far away. The shuttle service was helpful from the main terminal--it really WAS only 5 minutes away. The lobby was modern and comfortable, and the room was adequate for our needs. The lobby staff was very, very helpful. I would definitely recommend this to anyone in need of a layover close to the airport. Beyond that, I can't really give it much of a rating--calling it a four- or five-star would be misleading. The only service we took advantage of was the shuttle, which was excellent--there was a shop onsite, and a sometimes-restaurant (we had to go to the sister location, an 8 minute walk away). Adequate for literally a 12-hour stay.

We have stayed here twice and it is very wonderful. Ms. Gigi was very kind and respectful, she had a nice personality, our room was always very cleaned and smelling good. Loved my time being here. Room 347

During our stay Here, Ms. Nieda, really made us feel welcome and at home. Her personality, really stood out, and made our 6week stay here pleasurable. We could definitely tell when it wasn't her that cleaned our room. Thanks Ms. Nieda, from room 478-480.

I stayed there overnight, flying in from one island before leaving US with the early morning flight the next day. Airport shuttle is convenient. The room is compact and clean. The staff are helpful. I will definitely stay there the next time.

We have rented the hotel at two occasions. On our entry and exit from the remote islands in Hawaii. Each time the room are clean and the service is efficient. We could only suggest a better synchronization of the bus to the Airport. The management even help us with our choice of restaurant in China Town. Thanks

I had a very long stay at the hotel, the housekeeper Theresita was the Best!!..very kind, polite and attentive:-):-):-):-):-):-):-):-):-) Room was always cleaned and stocked with necessities! Front desk service was very helpful.Shuttle bus service was good. The only thing I can say is i wish the pool was heated.

Easy to fly into and getting to gates easy! Car rental return was a breeze off property but quick to get back to airline terminal. Security crowded to get through, but moved quickly. Lots of shops and eateries for a quick bite or to pick up a forgotten souvenir.

This hotel is horrible. The owner is a lier and the hotel is infested with cock roaches. In not just one room but several. It is noisy and there is mold growing in the vanities in the bathroom. As well as a mildew smell that comes fron the ac.The sister hotel as well is horrible. The smell of feces comes out of the faucet when you turn shower and sink on.Dont waste your money. As well the front desk workers are rude and unprofessional.
user_name:
Grace H
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: In short... This hotel is a temporary housing for military families. OVERPRICED 1- Parking is a nightmare with cars parked in the middle of the driveways at night, causing arguments with security guards, 2- Hotel rooms are old and in need of remodel, 3- There is water damage in the hallways, 4- pool closes at 7:00 pm with no jacuzzi, 5- Restaurant is overpriced and service is terrible. I would only hope that our military families would be treated better than this by our government. If you’re thinking about staying for vacation, THINK AGAIN SOMEWHERE ELSE!!! However, this opinion will never be posted based solely upon the 3 other (all positive) responses. As much as I heard people complaining, you can't tell me that I'm the only one.

The best thing about this hotel is proximity to the airport. I arrived at 9pm and was gone by 8am the next morning. As other reviewers have mentioned, this hotel is located near several freeways and even though I was given a quieter room, it was still noisy, especially after about 5:00am when the traffic started. The room was mostly clean (something sticky on the bathroom floor and something sticky on the buttons of the alarm clock) but the fan in the bathroom was making a weird noise. If you just need a place to stay like I did, this hotel is fine (if not a bit pricey for what it is -- obviously you're paying for proximity) but if you're vacationing in Hawaii you'd be much better off choosing another hotel located closer to Honolulu's attractions.

Thumbs up to the house keepers for always keeping our room klen and neat.Teresita,.Easy to talk to and always helpful.My daughter is always asking for Sita every now and then.LOL But on the other hand i really wish there was a mini playground on site so the kids have somewhere to run around.The hotel is right off the highway and its not safe to walk along the side walk.But location wise is great.Close to everything...Thanks for the great experince

This is a great location to stay when you come in or are flying out. Takes about 2 minutes to get to the terminal. Rooms are clean and the staff was always friendly and helpful. Not a fancy vacation type of hotel but given it's location and purpose I'd say its a good one.We used the meeeting facilities a number of times and they were good as well.

Good place to get a night's sleep if you are passing through Honolulu late at night. Pleasant staff, clean and quiet room. Kind of expensive , but It is Honolulu. Not somewhere I would chose to spend a vacation, but it's proximity to the airport is key. Also has free shuttle service to and from terminal. Takes about 3 minutes.

This hotel is very convenient to the airport. It took only six minutes door to door from the airport pickup point to the hotel or vice versa. If you need to stay overnight in Honolulu for an early flight out the next day, you can't beat the convenience of this hotel. The hotel is located beside an elevated expressway and some warehouses, so there isn't any eating establishment within walking distance. Of course you can the the shuttle back to the airport for more choices there. The hotel staff is friendly and courteous; the rooms are very clean. The pickup point is not identified but it is across from arrival Gate G. You cross several lanes and a divider to reach the pick up point. There is a restaurant in house with a range of choice but it is pricey for what you get. The hamburger dinner was $13 but then this is Hawaii. The service is very prompt and friendly. For an overnight stay near the airport, you can't beat this hotel.

This is a very convenient hotel for travelers staying overnight before catching another flight the next morning. It is literally only a few minutes from the airport. The Honolulu airport is spread out and the signs are not very convenient. In fact there aren't any identifying specific pick up areas. The hotel picks up its guests across from arrival Gate G. You have to cross several lanes and a divider to reach the pick up point. The hotel staff are very friendly and accommodating with very clean rooms. The hotel area is beside an elevated highway and some warehouses so there aren't any eating areas within walking distance. There is a hotel restaurant with a good selection, generous portions and prompt, friendly service. It is a little pricey for what you get ($13 for a hamburger dinner) but this is Hawaii. There are a lot of military families using the hotel prior to obtaining their permanent housing. It is heart warming to see these dedicated young people who are serving our country.

This unpretentious hotel is OK provided you avoid a room too close to the freeway especially rooms on first or second floor which all back to the freeway. Request a room numbered 25 or above, e.g. 825 since these are further away from the freeway. Hotel rooms are fine, decor is dated (although there are some refurbished rooms I think). Reception staff are helpful. Shuttle takes 7 min and leave hotel on the half hour and terminal at 15 min past and to the hour. Restaurant is a hoot. Busy with lots of kids and plain fare but staff are very friendly.

We booked this hotel through Outrigger. I don't think it is possible to get any closer to t he airport, or the rental car returns than at this hotel. So, if being nearby for an early flight is your goal, this place will fit the bill. If you are looking for deluxe/luxury, try a different location. This is an older, motel style property.The lobby is pleasant, with several large areas for sitting and lounging. We noticed a restaurant area for breakfast, but were told nothing about it on check in, so we did not use it and can not report more on this. There is a small, outdoor pool, free parking and a shuttle to the airport terminals every 1/2 hour for most of the day and night. The hallways are a bit of maze and could use a update in painting and carpets. The room is a decent size, but quite dated. the positive: they do have a small fridge and micro for drinks and snacks. The bathroom is tiny and very out of date, but everything worked. The staff is friendly.

This former Holiday Inn was updated recently. I would guess that it was built sometime in the 60's. the hotel is clean and comfortable. The entire staff is very friendly and helpful. The restaurant is good but has a limited menu and it is not open every evening. The hotel has a sister hotel about a half mile down Nimitz and they alternate nights that they are open. I had a room facing the swimming pool. It also faces the interstate. Lots of road noise and dirt on the window. All in all it was a very nice stay.

I was very impressed with the shuttle service both for pick up and drop off. They have a great pool area, nice and clean rooms. My special requests were also accommodated which made me very happy. This is no 4 star hotel, but for what it is its great. I will most likely stay here again and would not hesitate to recommend others. Good job!

i had requested a handicapped room when i arrived, i was told rhat no handicap rggms were in the main building. i had to walk with a cane quite a distance to another building if i was informed, beforehand, i would have made other arrangements no local shuttle for local atractions

If you just have an overnight stay in Honolulu and want quick access to the airport, this hotel is ideal. I personally check my bags through Honolulu to the Marshall Islands and just use a carry on bag and walk to the hotel.

I found 4 cockroaches while I was there. The beds are hard as a rock and the food is very expensive and the taste does not match the price. I slept across from the elevator and had to listen to the door open and close all night. Also my door did not complete match up to the frame so it was louder than it probably would have been if the door actually worked properly. The cleaning folks never actually cleaned my room they just came in and made the beds every night and put towels (that had black hair all over them) back on the racks. How do I know they didn't clean, because my first night there I killed a cockroach on the table, to see if they actually cleaned the rooms I left it there, in PLAIN sight and it was there that night when I got back. Also killed one on the wall and on the dresser, over my 3 night stay. All there when I left on Friday. Trust me there are better places to stay then this dump. Oh and they allow pets so if you don't want to hear a dog whine don't stay here.

We stayed at the Airport Honolulu for 5 nights and were very happy with our accomodations. It was booked because it was the cheapest we could find for that time period and we weren't disappointed. Our room had a small fridge, microwave and coffee maker which is always nice to have. When we came back at night Elizabeth had done a great job making up the room. It is not on the beach but couldn't be closer to the airport. We did not notice the noise from the airport and as we had a car we were able to drive all over the island. We did find parking was always in short supply as we tended to get in later at night, however when we would check with security they always found us a spot.

My husband and I stayed 1 night at this hotel when we first arrived in Honolulu. We were leaving early the next morning to Big Island and getting in late, we needed a place to sleep. This hotel has all that you would need for either one night or longer. Big rooms, bathroom products, fridge, tv and we were lucky enough to be given a room on the quieter side near the carpark and away from the highway. Easy airport shuttle - just call the hotel from the baggage claim and they tell you to go to the outside section of baggage claim E where they will be waiting in their van. As the hotel is only 5 mins from the airport, no long waits are needed. Getting back to the airport the next morning the shuttle runs on the half hour, every half hour - couldn't be easier.They do offer breakfast in the morning which we didn't need as we left early (not included in the price), and the restaurant closes at 9pm and only runs a few days of the week, however, reception staff gave us a map and highlighted restaurants nearby within walking distance as needed. All staff were very friendly and helpful and we would highly recommend this hotel to anyone!

My girlfriend and I reserved a room online, only to arrive and find that while we had paid for and reserved a "Superior King" room, we were given a room with two double beds. Nothing superior about it. On top of that, the room smelled (smells, actually -- I'm writing this review from the hotel's WiFi) like some combination of wet dog and dirty diapers. While the front desk staff was polite, they were unable to offer either a solution or any reasonable compensation for these issues.
