They offered to: 1) spray down the room with some sort of perfume to cover up the smell, 2) comp our parking, when we JUST returned our rental car because they charge an additional $25 to park, and 3) give us meal vouchers for the hotel's restaurant, which our 8am flight will not allow us to use.Thanks for nothing.To make matters worse, the manager I spoke to at the front desk alternated between telling me they didn't have any rooms to move us into, and telling me that since we had already thrown our bags into the room before running off to get dinner, the room needed to be cleaned again and we could no longer be moved to a different room. This seemed to suggest that there WERE other rooms available to move us to, but he just didn't want to go to the trouble of making it happen.In the end, we overpaid for a smelly room that did not come close to matching what we reserved. We would NOT recommend this hotel to anyone else.

This hotel is real close to the airport - in fact you could actually walk there if so inclined. Rooms are clean and comfortable. Some are close to highway and hence noisy - so be sure to ask for a room away from highway if noise bothers you. Wireless internet is free but there is a charge if you wish to print any document in the reception area. Airport shuttle runs every 30 minutes on the hour and half-hour. By the way, it is confusing but the shuttle van has a Best Western logo on it as apparently the service is shared with the nearly Best Western.

The Airport Hotel is very convenient to the airport and the shuttle service is great. My disappointment is in the overall quality of the hotel, which is different than the website indicates. We were told at check in that our room key was necessary to operate the elevator, which gives the impression of security. This wasn't true - push any floor and there you go. We asked to see another room because of the freeway noise and the outside door to this back building was completely unlocked. We walked in with the security guard who was very nonchalant about the 2 questionable women in skimpy clothing waiting at the door. Again the elevator operated without a key.

We need hotel near airport with airport transfer for out night flight. Hotel is 5 min drive with airport shuttle. You can call for shuttle from phones located in airport arrival hall. Rooms are clean, spacious and well equiped (microwawe) There is small shop in the hotel, you can buy small necessities. I think there is a bus stop near, but do not excactly know where, we use taxi from hotel to short visit of Pearl Harbour ($15) for taxi. Internet connection in the hotel are complimentary and working without problem.

We stayed here one night before our cruise. This is not a vacation destination. There is a highway on one side a car lot of some kind to the rear, some commercial buildings on the other side. Didn't have a Hawaiian vacation feel. A little smelly, not too bad, and very worn out. It is close to airport. Has two buildings so you have to walk outside to get to the other building with the lobby.

We had 24 hours in Honolulu before flying on to Chicago from Australia and I booked this hotel as we had stayed at the Outrigger Reef a couple of years ago and believed it would be of a similar quality. Unfortunately, on arrival we discovered it was on a different scale and not up to our expectations.When we booked in we were given a room in another building. We started on the long trek to the room and decided we didn't want to stay so far away from reception so we returned and were happy to wait until a room became available. We were told it could take a few hours but as soon as we had eaten breakfast, we were given our room. It was quite comfortable though the air conditioner was very noisy. This is an old hotel and the air conditioners do need to be replaced.We discovered that there isn't anywhere to eat in the hotel at lunchtime and for the evening meal we had to take the shuttle to the Best Western Plaza Hotel which apparently is a sister hotel where we had a hamburger. This was not quite what we expected and it wasn't a good start to our 5 week trip. Luckily, once we left Honolulu things did pick up.We did sit around the pool for a couple of hours but it wasn't anything special not as I had imagined when looking at the photos of the hotel.The shuttle next morning left as soon as we went downstairs which was a bonus though we did have to wait at least 30-40 minutes for it when we first arrived in Honolulu after a long tiring flight.

We stayed one night at this property on our way to the Big Island during our recent journey.This is a not a vacation-destination hotel; but as an in-transit hotel, it is convenient and reasonably priced.We were both exhausted from a long day and got a good nights sleep on the bed here.The room was clean and the staff freindly. The shuttle service was efficient and quick.If you need to overnight in Honolulu before you fly out the next day, this is an excellent option.

My husband and I spent one night here, after a flight from Auckland and going to Maui the next day.The good was a decent room, comfortable bed, pleasant staff.The bad - having to wait nearly an hour for the shuttle from the airport to the hotel. After a 9 hour flight, and having flown from Sydney to Auckland the previous day, all we wanted was a bed to sleep in. We waited about half an hour for the shuttle after I first called, then some more after a second call. The shuttle driver said he hadn't been told we were waiting, but who knows? No apology from the receptionist either. I certainly would have reviewed the property higher, if not for this. We didn't use the restaurant or pool, so can't comment on either. Our return shuttle to the airport the next day was fine. Maybe we were just unlucky, but after long flights, it wasn't the ideal start to our Hawaiian holiday.

We stayed here for a 2 night layover before heading to Maui. Have to say, they have some of the speediest airport pick up and drop off I have ever experienced. Check in was slow since they only had one person working the front desk anytime we went by. Just remember you are on island time and relax!! The job was done well and checking in and out was painless. The pool area is nice and clean. Could have used more pool towels around but we got by. My only complaint would be that we were in the second part of the building; not connected to where check in is. Schlepping 4 large bags through the halls and across the parking lot, up the elevator and down another hall was exhausting. Room was clean and great for the rest we needed. Took the local bus to get downtown and to Waikiki beach. $2.00 per person each way; allow for approximately an hour to get there. It sure beats driving in the traffic of Honolulu.

Decided to have a brief stopover en route to a wedding in Palm Springs from Australia so I would arrive sans jet lag. The Airport Honolulu Hotel would appear to be the only airport hotel I have ever stayed in that has no facility for guests who stay for a portion of a day rather than the usual overnight in at 2pm out by 10pm scenario. I required a room from 7am until 9pm and was charged for two nights, despite the fact that there was cleaning staff on duty when I checked out (meaning the room could have been serviced for an incoming guest).The room was clean and exceptionally comfortable. Great bed, good blackout curtains so I could sleep for several hours during my brief stay. Free shuttle bus too and from the airport is a plus. Courtesy phone as you leave the airport arrival area gives quick, free access and the van was there within minutes.In house restaurant was good standard fare, not ridiculously expensive but only open three nights. Other nights (like the Thursday I was there) the hotel shuttles guests to the Best Western down the road which is a bit fiddly (but the food, once again, was reasonably priced and not bad). Very busy, full of family groups. Not a large number of choices nearby if you want to dine elsewhere.Front-of-house staff were pleasant and courteous.Pool area was clean and well maintained.

Used to go here every couple months visiting family, mainly for location. But recently left a valuable coat in room, called same day,said never was a coat. My word against housekeeping, so someone goat my leather dress jacket I got a new hotel to go to.

Compared to many hotels in Honolulu, this hotel is fairly outdated. It has very welcoming staff, and an interesting lobby, but beyond that things pretty much go downhill. Rooms are dingy and shabby - it could ruin a good trip for the fastidious traveler. You have to keep an open mind. Rooms have very basic furniture, and they are certainly clean. Our beds was well used but not overly uncomfortable. Halls have a pronounced musty odor. Towels in out bathroom smelled of chlorine. One outstanding and redeeming factor, however, is the proximity to the airport and frequency of the shuttle service. The shuttle makes getting to and from the airport very easy. I wouldn't recommend this hotel unless you have no choice and must be near the airport.

Stayed one night to catch a early plane.Web site makes rooms look big but so small and tight. You bump into everything.Kinda old and worn.First we got the wrong room assigned. Then we got another. They blamed it on me. What the heck you work the desk not me!!! I checking in I don't know what your computer says. Plus you did not say anything about my bed request and what you gave me so..............I won't know until I open the door!!!!! Come on think that thru!!!!Next correct room. Air Con don't work. Takes 1/2 hour for maintenance to show up. It would run for 10-15 sec (seriously) then shut off for 30 min. It was mid after noon the room was hot!! Maintenace came in. I will give credit to the one guy right off he said it was broke but the Filipino with greased back head said nothing wrong I did not push the right buttons. It kicked on soon as he walked up to it. I had to hold him by the hand cause he wanted to leave to make him watch it for 15 sec to watch it turn off. I had to make him feel the air when it was running that it was just room air circulating!!!!Long story short to broke to fix they carted it away and brought in a new one. Infact they said they had brandnew one!!! I said nothing I was pissed. It was refurbished not brandnew it had many areas of rust on it!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! We went out to eat while they replace the whole air con. Guess what we get back they gone, air con running room still hot. We now even more pissed. We said heck with it. Went sleep to rest and catch early plane and planning this report on thier poor Hotel.This really had to be the worst hotel ever.Give some credit 2nd lady that gave me correct room was nice.Lady at 4am when I checked out was very pleasant.Maid in the hallway when checking in was nice and pleasant.Beyond that I sorry. Please don't stay here. Most employees don't care.Pricey for crappy as room are. Kanaiana rate no different than advertised rate. Same rate exactly same rate!!!!Military rate was only $4.00 dollars off. Serious!!!Did get free park da car. But all slots taken up had to park in the way back!!! but on thier property!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!Can you read my frustration with da place!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Rooms were clean, nothing fancy. Front desk was very helpful. What was nice about this hotel was it was close to points interest like Pearl Harbor and when you are leaving for the airport the next day we used it as a base to leave our luggage and stopped there for a break before we left.

Really terrible run down god awful place. Every single room had atrocious traffic noise from the numerous highways that cross every aspect of this run down joint. The walls are all paper thin, the beds have about as much lumbar support as a hammock, and the stench of damn punches you in the face as you walk in. Airport hotels are never great, but we found this place simply unbearable and left to spend the night at Renew, which was much much better. You wouldn't be able to get much sleep in a place like this, so it isn't really suitable for overnight stays at all. Just spring for the cab fare to Waikiki, where at least you will have some choice, and some peace and quiet!Avoid.

I travel a bit for my job and usually I will have to stay several days. I've learned to tag along with me my PS3 when I want to relax with DVDs or just to play some games before bed. Most hotels I've been to have outputs for it, if not HDMI at least A/V. The tvs here have a/v outputs but are not compatible with ps3 or any console. Assuming this is so you're forced to spend more money buying movies THEY have. otherwise the hotel is extremely outdated but concierge and staff are helpful. Only wish is that they'd get rid of the 90s Zenith box TVs and invest in some flat screens. But that's just my personal preference.

Although hotel close to aiprot and free shuttle etc, it remined me of a basic motel and not an airport HotelThere is no bar - Restaurant only opens 3 nights a week and to eat you get bussed to another hotel.on other nightsStaff were OK but I expected more - I was travelling on business and had 2 1/2 nighst to wait on the way to my detsination and 1 day 2 nights on the way back. I ws tired but had to go find somewhere to eat when I wnated something or buy some noodles at the shopWould I stay there again No would look for something whcih services my needs more but just did not want to go all the way to Waikiki Probably Ok for families who might snack in etc Just felt that property lacked any real desire to be anything but provide the absolute minimum in servicesI chose a brand name ghotle figuring as a tarnsit palce it would have open restaurants and a bar where you can sit and chat with someone while watching the sports

We were pleasantly surprised by this hotel. We stayed here in September overnight as we had an early flight in the morning to LA. The staff are very friendly and helpful and the kids loved the pool. We didnt hear any freeway noise as others have mentioned.The room was very clean and roomy. The shuttle bus to the airport was free and ran regularly which was very convenient I probably wouldnt stay here for more than a couple of nights as it isnt close to much, but for an overnight stay it was more than adequate.Would definately choose to stay here again.

The Ohana airport hotel was an express bid on Priceline. We were pleasantly surprised at how nice the entire hotel was. The pool closed early. The best thing is that if you are just stopping in Honolulu to fly to another island the next day, this is probably the closest hotel to the airport with a free airport shuttle. The beds were only full sized beds and a bit small. Good morning coffee in the room.

Our travel agent suggested we stay here overnight on our way home from Canada, as we had an early departure the next day. We arrived late with fellow travellers, and the check-in process was long and painful as there was only one lady on duty and she appeared to be on "island time". Our room was basic - clean and comfortable, but one of the bedside lamps didn't work. We were tired and hungry after a 6 hour flight and were told that the pool closed at 7pm and the restaurant wasn't open on Mondays. Whilst convenient, the free airport shuttle is not really free as you are expected to tip the driver $2 for each bag you have. The shuttle was made available to take dinner guests to the restaurant at their "sister hotel" (Best Western) down the road. Unfortunately when we finally got there it was noisy and crowded with young families and undisciplined children running around - not the ideal place for us. The staff here were also on island time, and made you queue up just to be seated. Then you had to wait again to order, and they offered us soup and salad to offset the delay in delivering our ordered meal - which we declined. The menu was classic American junkfood - so we chose what we thought was the healthiest option and ate an hour and a half. after our arrival. On the upside, the food and accommodation was fairly cheap. As Hawaii is a large US military base, the airport hotels are popular with military personnel and families, who seem to be given preference over regular tourists. Therefore next time I would stay longer than one night and go into Waikiki where you will have a better experience.

Attractive rooms, clean and good value airport stopover for morning flight. Convenient airport location with shuttle servive. Very reasonable prices. We were very pleasantly surprised at the quality of this hotel for the price we paid in Honolulu, an expensive city.

Spent one night and room was clean and comfortable, nice pool area and lobby. Easy one block walk to Starbucks, small grocery, barbeque, Asian and other fast food. Airport shuttle was reliable, and near a bus stop if you want to got into downtown Honolulu w/o a car.

Although a little pricey for lower budget travelers, this hotel is only 5 minutes from the airport. So if you are just passing through Honolulu, it saves a trip into town. It's a pretty standard Best Western style hotel, was very quiet, with friendly staff. Downside was the restaurant was mediocre and often not open for dinner, though there are some cheap eateries within a five minute walk. Also, they do offer free transport, but you have to ring them to collect you and it can take a little while. I stop here between Australia and the US to break up the travel.

We stayed here overnight as a break in the journey from Sydney to Vancouver. Free shuttle service from airport to hotel and room was good size and clean. We ate at sister hotel next door (courtesy of another shuttle) as the restaurant wasn't open on the night we were there. Pool area very inviting and all in all a good place to stay. The staff were extremelyhelpful and friendly.

Our month long stay at Ohana Honolulu Airport Hotel was excellent. Our stay was for my husband's medical treatment. The friendly, caring service of the employees at the hotel made us feel part of the family. The hotel staff went above and beyond to assist us. The hotel room with the comfy bed, plenty of storage space, microwave and fridge was perfect for our long stay needs. The location made it easy to get to restaurants, grocery store, medical appointments and to The Bus for trips to Waikiki and other attractions.Maholo to the hotel staff.

The staff at the hotel are great. They are very helpful and the cleaning was awesome. Dalia cleaned my room and greeted me every day with a smile. I love the location because of my work. It is easy access to the highway and close to the airport. The hotel is family friendly and the cost for honolulu is pretty good.

We used this hotel for an overnight before flying again. It is close to the airport and well patronized, so book early if you want to stay here.Monday nights there is no restaurant or bar. The hotel provides a free shuttle to their other hotel down the road where they run a buffet as well as an a la carte menu supported with bar service.The restaurant is open for breakfast starting at 6 a.m.The rooms are standard. If the a/c unit is not running, it's fairly noisy.The shuttle runs to the airport every half hour. If you wish to check out personally as opposed to automatic, then you need to arrive down at the desk early as when we were there they had two lines four deep. There were people checking in as well as out at 6:35 a.m.! It took nearly twenty minutes!Our shuttle was full with bags stacked everywhere.
user_name:
StewLee
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: The hotel is nice and very close to the airport. Te service at the reception was slow, it took half an hour to get the room cause they could not find our reservation. Staff nice. Shuttle to the airport free every 30 minutes very comfortable! The hotel is not well indicated if you have to reach it by car. Room was big and clean. Good for travelling!

The hotel is very clean and looks recently renovated. The staff is incredibly friendly and helpful. The rooms reminded me of a run of the mill roadside motel. The walls are not very thick, so noises from other rooms, the airport, and the adjacent highway are easily heard.A great choice for the last night on the island if you have an early flight and don't want to fight traffic.

This plain jane hotel is really close to the airport and convenient for connections. I cannot think of any other reason that anyone would stay here. There are no real services close by, so a bus or cab ride is needed to get to a decent restaurant or any attractions.Pearl Harbor is an easy bus ride away, so this is a big plus.The rooms are very spartan but clean and functional. The highway sounds are 24 hours a day, so keep the window closed.The staff was very friendly and helpful.

After a 9 hour flight to Honolulu, I was looking forward to a quite dinner after checking into my room. Well, let me warn you. Don't bother having dinner at the hotel if it's close to 9pm when they close. I'm having the so so buffet (which I wouldn't eat again), and promptly at 9pm I see a worker bring out a broom and vacuum cleaner to begin the nightly cleaning, 4 other workers rushing to the buffet with to-go boxes that they start dumping food into. There were at least 3 tables with guests still eating! One of them saw me looking at them, stopped everyone, came over and asked if I was finished. The next morning while sitting in the lobby waiting for the shuttle, a worker comes over with a vacuum, and proceeds to vacuum the carpet around my feet! I guess if nothing else the floors are clean at this hotel!

I booked a king size superior but when I got to my room, it was had two double beds. One with stains on the sheets. I called and the receptionist told me that it was an hotel option. Not until I told them that I booked a King Superior and I wanted a King Superior did they get it. Then they told me to come wait in the lobby to see if a King would open up. I was told that I could not even pee in the room because just being there would require a room makeup. So what! I have never had a hotel, not even a dive, treat me this way. Ten minutes later the phone rung and I was told they had a King Superior ready. The rooms are small and for $150 a night you do not even get a movie channel. I was told, however, that I could buy one from their "Premium List". Can you believe it. $150 a night and no movie channel. No History. No Bio. Nada!Oh yea. Somebody needs to replace or at least shampoo the carpet. It looked like something you would find in a cheap dive that was way past the replacement date.My recommendation. Find Another Place To Stay. Hotel is located in industrial area and next to two busy highways on two sides and a busy warehouse on the other. Did not feel safe in going outside after dark.Forget the restaurant. The food and the service both were sadly poor. My silverware had dried food on it. I left without finishing my meal.

We checked in at around 9 PM after taking the hotel shuttle from the airport. The shuttle had wheelchair lift for my daughter. The driver was polite and helpful. Checkin was quick and our rollaway bed was in the room before we reached there. There is a store in the premises with all kinds of food/snack items. Room was clean with comfortable beds. Took the shuttle back to the airport at 6 AM. Shuttles run every 30 minutes from the hotel and on demand from the airport.

This hotel is the most convenient if you are only staying 1 night in Honolulu because it's 2 blocks from the airport and it has a free shuttle. It is not a good hotel if you want to spend some time in Honolulu since it's about 45 minutes away from Waikiki beaches and the nicer areas. Unfortunately the hotel itself is very very outdated, in fact, some rooms are just gross looking with a 90's decor, stained carpet, and musty smell. I wish they would just completely remodel this hotel, it would make our stay a lot nicer since we go thru Honolulu quite a lot. On the plus side, the price is good for what you get, and the people that work there are very nice. I especially like Les, the government liaison, he is awesome.

This is a good place to spend the night if you have an early flight out of Honolulu. We flew in from the Big Island in the afternoon and stayed here overnight because we had an early flight back to Australia the next morning.The rooms are clean and fairly good value. Ours had 2 double beds, sleeping 4 people (2 adults, 2 children). The bathroom was small but adequate. The swimming pool was quite large and warm.There is a shuttle bus that leaves the hotel for the airport every half hour (on the hour and half hour). The hotel restaurant was not open on the night we stayed (a Friday) but the shuttle bus took us free of charge to the nearby Best Western where we could dine in their restaurant.

This review is helpful to those who travel with a family and need to stay at the hotel for a long period of time. We are a military family pcsing to Hawaii and and had to stay temporarily at this hotel 2 months until housing was available on base. There were allot of things we liked and a few dislikes about our stay at the Ohana Airport Hotel. Likes: Location was great, very close to 3 military bases and the NEX Mall, and 20 mins bus ride from Waikiki, $10 food vouchers to the hotel restaurant help save money, breakfast menu was great, room service and maid was excellent, the room and beds were comfortable, highway and airport noise was never an issue. Dislikes or things that needs changing: the restaurant dinner menu needs updating bad and needs more island type dishes on it, the down stair restrooms needs a baby changing table, the rooms need to have brooms & or push none electric vacuum so the tenant can clean up a mess if needed, parking is limited, hotel needs a playground for small children, the high cost of $3.00 just to wash clothes.

We stayed here for our last night after spending 9 nights in Waikiki and then travelling to the Big Island for 4 nights, we decided to stay close to the airport to convenience on our last night. Lovely airy, bright rooms, very clean and good sized bathroom. Comfortable beds. Pool lovely with towels available. Shuttle bus very reliable to airport. "The Bus" at door to go into Waikiki for $2.50 (which we did for the evening). They do breakfast and dinner, but no lunch, but just a short walk is several lunch type places to get food. We had a good quiet room overlooking the pool, but I think it would be noisy if you were closer to the front of the hotel next to H1 freeway. Staff very friendly and helpful. Good little store downstairs for drink, snacks, etc. Overall a lovely place for one or two night stay.

Perfectly fine for late arrivals or early departures. Very convenient, friendly staff, clean facilities. Good value for money. Starbucks a short stroll away and it's not completely isolated. Wouldn't stay here for more than one or two nights due to location outside the city.

It is an airport hotel, nothing more. The decor is dated and a horrible yellow colour, but it is a convenient location for early/late flights and comfortable enough. Inter-linking doors in room let in far too much noise from adjacent rooms though, especially when there are loud familes around (and there seemed to be a lot of them!). With better sound insulation and a less depressing decor, it would be better than average.

I have been at this hotel twice since the last twelve months and have found it to be more than correct for it's services. .I personally think that the location make it more suited for some travelers than for others: better for stop-overs,short stays or for new military transfers(Pearl Harbor & Hickam AFB are neighbors). The staff was friendly and helpful, the room extra clean( thank you, room service ladies!) and coffee machine, fridge and microwave which were wonderful to have. My husband appreciated the pool very much. And yes, the free shuttle service was so useful.The hotel location is of course, not a Waikiki experience(it is in an industrial zone and with the airport behind, the highway in front), but, that is what an airport hotel is. Not all rooms are under the highway with the noises; ours faced towards the industrial zone side.Some tips: if the hotel restaurant (Willoughbys), is closed, the free airport shuttle can drop you off at nearby Plaza hotel to eat at their restaurant. There is also a small mall on the street behind the hotel (exit out the back parking lot and then 5 minutes on foot). The mall has a Starbucks on the corner and also a few others behind Starbucks (sushi shop,pizza, L&L local style food,convenience store, etc). If you don't have a car(which was our case) the city bus lines pass in front of the hotel( $2.50 w/ a free transfer). Ask the desk clerk to point the stop out the stop to you. Buses reguarly that are bound for Waikiki and Ala Moana shopping center will take you where you want to go downtown very easily.

I was traveling to Singapore via Military Space-A and couldn't get convenient military lodging. The hotel was close to the airport and Hickham Air Force Base. The staff was friendly and professional. My room was very clean. I had a very nice breakfast at the hotel restaurant. I would rate my overall as very good for the money.

This hotel is a good option for a bed and shower if you have to stay over night. Clean and comfortable.The hotel has its own direct dial from the airport and the minibus was there in minutes.Our only grip was an over noisy air conditioning unit in the roomOverall good value if you are only passing through

We decided to drop in Oahu for two nights to break up an extremely long flight from San Francisco to Sydney, Australia. We were about to embark on the Queen Mary 2 so we decided that "roughing" it for a couple nights in Honolulu were acceptable. We were carrying 200 lbs in luggage and decided that staying near the airport would make life simpler for us. A friend had stayed at the OHANA Honolulu Airport Hotel and said it was OK. He was exactly right. The price was approximately half of what a Waikiki hotel would cost. The Hotel was very convenient to the rental car pick up and drop off. So we booked it and were more or less completely satisfied. If you want a nice inexpensive place to stay near the airport, this is your place.Cons -- there was only one serious flaw. The WIFI was absolutely the worst I have ever encountered in a hotel. The only thing that could have been worse is if it had not been working. It worked ever so slightly better in the lobby than in our room. I wanted to download a movie for the flight and it took many, many hours. The front desk staff was highly accommodating an kept my Kindle at the front desk during the download. In the end I got my movie.Pros -- the price for sure. This was a great bargain. The hotel staff was helpful. They explained to us how to take the city bus to Waikiki and we had a great ride and saved a bunch of money on transportation. The hotel was clean and neat. The room was spacious and had an acceptable tv and comfortable beds. We did not use any of the amenities of the hotel. It was quiet. The shuttle service from the airport was excellent.SAVING THE BEST FOR LAST -- We woke up in the morning and went outside our room and discovered dozens of people running around with TV cameras and microphones on booms. There was a food tent set up in the parking lots. There were all kinds of equipment trucks everywhere. I was convinced that there had been a mass murder over night. I was almost right. Hawaii Five O was using the hotel for a location shooting for one of their shows. All the stars were there. Does it get better than that????? They didn't even charge extra for the thrill. That is unusual in the hotel world these days.
We just stayed here for one night after a 14 hour flight from the east coast, but it was a smooth check-in and the bed was comfortable, what more can you ask for?

The Ohana was the least stressful part of relocating from San Diego to Pearl Harbor. They were very knowlegable of all applicable military benefits and practices and helped put our minds at ease during our transfer. The rooms were very clean and comfortable and the staff was extremely helpful and friendly. And parking is included for military and would otherwise be quite pricey. My only complaint was that the internet service was slow and inconsistant. Dinner service is alternated between the restaurant at the Ohana and it's sister property the Best Western down the street. There are shuttle but the hotel is walking distance. The food at each is decent though the menus are somewhat limited. Overall we had a great stay at the Ohana. I wouldnt recommend it for tourists as its near the airport and away from anything you'd want to see but it was the perfect place to transition to our new home and they treat their military clientele very well!
We stayed here on a one-night layover to Sydney. Although it is close to airport, it is hard to get there by car. And parking is $24 per night.Room was clean and of equal value to the price.

We booked that hotel only for one night between our flights. That was enough. The rooms were old, small and not really clean. The worst thing was the highway that is close to the hotel. We could hear every car and truck during the night and had a bad sleep. We were happy to check out in the morning.

The place has really brightened up in appearance since we last stayed there in 2006 but the staff are still just as helpful and efficient. Special mention must go to Acika who picked us up and the airport, looked after our luggage while we went downtown and delivered us back at the airport. He is an exceptional employee who is a great asset to the hotel and its clients.

Ok here's how it started called for the free shuttle and they said 10 minutes. The idiot driver took over 30 minutes to pick us up. The messed up part is that the driver flat out lied to me twice as he said that he wasn't The shuttle driver for us. So we make it to the hotel and get a room but the front desk lady fells to mention that are room is on the other side of the building. So I had to go back to the front desk and the lady looked at me like I was stupid. So I just decided to go to bed. Woke up to go eat in the lobby and I asked if I can order to go. They told me they would have to charge me extra for every item I ordered. So if you want to be disrespected and ripped off stay here. I hate writing but I have to warn everyone. Good Luck!!!!!!!

Great property!! Accomodations are clean and updated, rooms are spacious and well equiped. Staff service is excellent lots of aloha. Location is very convenient with close by freeway access making getting to anywhere in Honolulu relatively quick.

So my son and I were getting ready to take a shower when this cockroach as big as my thumb jumped from the drain. My son freaked out and almost slipped on the bathtub running away for his life (I'm not exaggerating, surely you've seen how some preschoolers react to pests, even grown-ups jump when they see a yucky cockroach). In panic, I grabbed a towel and tried to hit the roach, I ended up hitting the faucet with my middle finger. Adrenaline was still rushing in me though so I was able to pick up the wiggling roach and lock it in the trash bag, that's when I was able to assure my son that the bathroom is safe. In the shower, I realized I can't move my middle finger and that it was bruised and swollen. I called the operator for some first aid but she forwarded me to the manager who just said he'll call the emergency to take a look at it. Surprise! Surprise! Well, after talking to emergency peeps and after asking the hotel security an ice pack for the 3rd time, I finally got the ice pack (after 2 hours!) Well, after 20 minutes of ice, my finger finally felt fine. I paid $150 including tax for a one-night stay and ended up hurting myself because of the dirty bathtub! I would never recommend this hotel to anybody.
user_name:
May808Hawaii
Mililani Town, Hawaii, United States

review_body: We needed a one-night stay hotel near the airport. This is very near to the airport but we didn't hear any planes flying over. The staff was wonderful ... plenty of aloha. This hotel is not high end but it's clean and comfortable. My friends told us later it used to be a Holiday Inn. It worked good for our purpose (sleep). We used the free internet with no problems. We didn't hang in the room long ... we had friends to meet and local food to eat.

United put in this pit beacuse of a 16 hour delayed flight. What can I say? No internet, outdated tacky rooms, cheap uncomfortable beds, rude and poor quality service. Had to be bused to a Best Western down the street which had poor quality food for exhorbinant prices. I would pay to not stay in this hotel. Shuttle service is at their convenience. The only good thing was that the room appeared clean on the surface but I was afraid to look too hard.

When I book this airport hotel for a one night stop over i wasn't expecting much but I have to say it exceeded my expectations. It was imaculately clean, soft towels, comfy bed, large room. The funiture is slightly dated but in good condition, the room was well equiped and even had a mircowave ( perfect as I needed to heat up baby bottles). The only downfall to our room was the aircon unit was alittle loud ( room 300) The staff were friendly and helped us with our transport questions and check in and out was great. The free shuttle was also great leaving every 30 mins to and fro. Great lobby and resturant with free wiifi, a little convienience store and there's a pool but I didn't check it out, not enough time to. I would not hessitate at all to stay here again.

I was forced to stay here on a business trip ... Not a great experience. It's not as if they make up for the noisy location right next to the freeway with superior customer service either ... I felt like they were out out if you asked them anything!The rooms are OLD ... Bathrooms are tiny,the TVs are from 1987, and the beds were made for 2-year olds who can sleep on a bed of rocks!!! Location wise I suppose it's convenient if you like to be on approach for the airport, but if you're here to experience Hawaii -- do yourself a favor and stay elsewhere. This hotel was nice ... In 1940, but somewhere along the way they forgot that you have to continue to invest in your property in order to keep it nice. I wouldn't stay here again ... Definitely not on my own dime.

Location was not bad. Near the airport and car rentals. Rooms were clean and neat. BUT the lack of internet service, Wi-Fi or wired made the stay very bad. The hotel says it has high speed internet service (wired in the rooms and Wi-Fi in the lobby) but it is slower than any dial-up I have ever used! In this day and age the internet service at this hotel was substandard compared to comparable hotels. Even the lobby computers were very, very slow. I would rate this hotel much higher if it had good internet service. Most travelers I know are very busy and in a hurry even if they are on vacation. And who has time to wait on slow internet service. Even in the middle of the night (2am) the internet service was slow...

This hotel does NOT have internet, no matter what they say. In room hardwire internet hardly ever works even if you spend an hour on the phone with their IT service - he only made it work for about 20 minutes or so then it crashes again. Free wifi in the lobby doesn't work. I went to the lobby to try to get online and overheard other people talking about how the internet in their room doesn't work so they went to the lobby where the wifi doesn't work either.That said, free meal/day is a good deal & the rest of the hotel is alright. Very friendly staff, just don't stay here if you need internet.

Expensive, expensive, expensive (paid $158 a night) . Not even worth $100 a night!!! Front desk is not friendly and not willing to help. Don't even bother asking anything because they don't feel like talking. If you plan to start with a question with What, how, when you will get their ugly faces in response with an attitude.The rooms are clean and spacious. Bathroom is cheap and up to date. Bring your own shampoo and conditioner because you will only get 2 soap bars. The walls are soooo thin you can hear everything including the cars driving by or even people closing their doors to get into their cars.I only booked this because i had a 7 AM flight to catch and needed to be close to airport. If i knew this hotel was like this I would of rather stayed at any hotels near waikiki beach and woke up 30 min earlier to catch a shuttle. It would of been cheaper and nicer stay even after paying a shuttle.

The hotel is close to the airport but not wtihin walking distance. The hotel offers frequent free shuttle that departs every half hour, and provides a direct line telephone at the baggage pick up area. Check in and check out was fast, reception staff are friendly.The hotel is a bit old and in fact need some refurbishment. One can easily see that in the corridor and inside the room. However, the room is big, with a microwave oven, and there is a convenience store on the ground floor that opens till midnight. Air conditioning is an individual unit inside the room. Though a bit old, the air conditioner works well.Bed is OK, but the comforter is a bit too thin and light. There is always a humming noise inside the bathroom but I don't know where it came from. Bath towels look dark but there is no alternative. Luckily I did not hear any traffic noise, only noise from the AC.It is definitely a good choice for early flight travellers, although downtown is only about 20 minutes away from airport. However, a renovation of rooms is needed.

We stayed the night before an early flight and hotel was really convenient and comfortable. Staff were very friendly. Hotel only does dinner some nights....so we took the free shuttle to their sister Hotel just a minute away. Free airport shuttle was also very easy. Room was generally quiet, maybe a little distant highway noise but nothing that kept us awake. (and we were travelling with our 21month old, so no issue). Rooms reasonable size with king bed and fits portable crib easy enough. Only downside was the wired Internet in room, and wireless in reception area was terribly slow....even after service centre tried hard to rectify it. Overall, I recommend for anyone needing airport convenience.

I found this hotel from the recommendation of a friend of my brother. I was amazed when I arrived that the front desk staff already knew the sad reason I was in Honolulu, since I hadn't told anyone except my brother's firefighter friend. It turns out the Honolulu fire department thinks this is the best hotel near the airport--and the airport shuttle allows one to easily link to the hospital shuttles for Kaiser and Tippler at the airport.I found the room clean and comfortable. When I looked out the window I thought I would be hearing road noise all night, but that wasn't the case--it was quiet. Everyday when I returned to the hotel someone at the desk asked how it was going and expressed their concern. They told me where I could find Starbucks and eating options other than the hotel restaurant which has limited hours/days of operation. And when it became necessary for our party to move closer to downtown Honolulu they made a reservation for us at another property.I couldn't have asked for better service and Aloha than I received at this hotel.Mahalo to Suzy, Noni and the rest of the staff.

Hotel staff at the desk and housekeeping are friendly and very helpful. The rooms are in good shape. The hotel is renovating the pool. The Internet service here however horrible. The system is so slow opening a basic text email can take a minute. So if you need Internet service for business I'd suggest bringing a mifi card as it would be dramatically faster.

Had a need for an overnight stay before flight and this was the best we could do. Took forever to check in and from what I could see, the manager, wearing long sleeves and thin was talking on his cell phone totally ignoring us in line to check in. The workers looked overwhelmed and he just walked away on his cell phone!

The hotel staff was friendly enough, the rooms was clean and the price reasonable. The shuttle service to and from HNL runs every half hour. There are very limited dining options in the immediate area (strip mall with take out/eat in and restaurant in a nearby hotel). The breakfast offered in the hotel is ok. The sound from nearby HNL and highway was less than expected but present. I would stay there again should the need arises.

New hotels open at airports all over the world on a daily basis. Honolulu is an exception. Nothing new, nothing planned. There are two or three hotels here and they have been here for a long, long time. We arrived near midnight from Europe and did not want to waste money for an expensive room in the city that would not really be utilized to it's fullest. So we decided to sweat it for one night at the airport. For price ( rates are not inexpensive )we picked the Ohana which is part of the Outrigger Hotel and Resort chain. The shuttle picked us up quickly, check-in was typically Hawaiian, laid back without urgency to get it done quickly. The hotel is a trip back in time, 1960's standard, but it's clean, the rooms are large, bathroom was adequate and for a one night stay we had absolutely no complaints. I wish there was a more modern option at HNL, there isn't, but if we are in the same boat at another time, we would come back here.

We stayed at Ohana Airport Hotel for 2 nights and enjoyed . Friendly staff , good service , conveniently located near the interstate . There is a fabulous Chinese take away nearby .Compared to the hotel at Waikiki Beach , where we stayed afterwards, we found that Ohana Airport hotel was the better choice . We will come back .

This hotel is very convenient to the airport and the free shuttle is great. The hotel is clean and the rooms are large, but the property is well worn and much in need of renovating. The elevators are very slow. The price is actually a little steep for basic lodging. I will shop around the next time I need to stay near the airport in Honolulu.
Very basic but handy for a quick connection. Unattractive area with no fine dining within walking distance. Breakfast in the coffee shop was good.

Location, location, location. The good news is that this hotel is near the airport and has a free shuttle that goes there. If, like us, you need to stay overnight in Honolulu before catching a flight out, this is a good place to do that. The bad news is that the hotel is in an industrial area, far from beaches or other tourist attractions. Sun-bathing by the pool, you hear the roar of trucks and motorcycles on the adjacent freeway. The staff is friendly and capable; a desk clerk named Nani told us about inexpensive restaurants just a couple blocks away. We especially liked Ninja Sushi. Our third-floor room was clean, pleasant, and quiet.

We made reservations over a month in advance for a one night stop over before heading to Kauai the next morning. It was the start to our honeymoon vacation. We arrived late (we had alerted the hotel to our late arrival time and our flight number). We had to wait 20 minutes to check in even thou there was one other party in front of us and 3 staff behind the counter. We were sent to a back building that was old and dirty and then found our room was small with two small beds. Upon calling the desk to let them know we had reserved a king bed, they basically said "too bad". We do not guarantee what bed you will get even thou our staff guaranteed it when we made the reservations and the note on the desk said if there are any problems with the room to let them know. HUH... So they just lie. Don't believe your reservations. Obviously to them a reservation only means they can hold $ from your credit card, but the hotel does not need to be held to their side of the reservation. DONT STAY HERE. RUDE and UNHELPFUL. And the room backed up to the freeway. Traffic noise the whole night.

I never would have booked this place. But my husband did as we got in quite late on our flight from Seattle and them had an early flight to Maui the next day. So it was very close to the airport, had a shuttle, and was easy to just land, crash for the night and leave the next day. The room had the AC cranked and only a thin sheet on the bed. No blanket no comforter so make sure you have a warm something to sleep in if you are sensitive to cold like me. I don't have any thing negative to say in terms of the hotel or service itself. It is what it is. It's reasonably clean, it's just really more a of motel. I just prefer a bit (lot) more upscale, even just for a night. So it's really a matter of taste.

We stayed one night in February. We were allocated a ground floor room. It was unacceptable. It was a hot night, the air-conditioning was off and the room stank of dogs. We were then allocated a room on the second floor that was fine. We were given a modest reduction in the room rate.We used the shuttle. To call it use the courtesy phone in the baggage hall; it leaves on the hour and half hour from the Hotel.Only use if you must!

I had no problems with the front desk, my room or anything else for that matter... contrary to many of the other reviewers. I've stayed here quite a few times since they renovated. Renovation means whatever they did is an improvement. The recent photos by the management is true to what I saw and experienced.

Convenient for the airport with free shuttle. Free wifi in lobby but not in the rooms. There are 2 PC’s also in lobby which will allow you to check-in online for your flight for free but anything else is chargeable.It’s a hotel but the rooms remind me of older motel rooms complete with big, noisy aircon! The rooms looked clean but were well worn and felt grubby.When we were there the restaurant was closed and it didn’t look like it had been open for a while.Check if that’s one of your reasons for booking.Like: shuttle to airport, free airline check-in. Dislike: noisy aircon.

Well it's an airport hotel. Good if you just want to spend a night before flying in/out of HNL. It's close to the airport and has a free shuttle. The rooms are a bit dated and a little shabby but not too bad. Wired Internet was free, which was nice. It's a little overpriced for what it is but it could have been worse. The staff was friendly.

We needed to overnight at the HNL airport between a late arrival and a morning flight to Kauai. For this, the Ohana serves its purpose, but other than the "aloha" from the efficient front desk staff, there's nothing to distinguish this hotel from a motel just off the offramp in Mobile, AL. If you are looking for a Hawaiian experience, look elsewhere. The room (and bathroom) was small, basic and dated, but clean. The floor lamp was broken and in pieces, balanced in a corner. The furniture was basic. All in serious need of refurbishment. The restaurant was bleak, though there is a plaza within a 5-minute walk with a few other options. I don't think the other airport hotels are much better, so if I had another stayover at HNL, I'd consider the Ohana again - it's convenient and offers a free shuttle. Staying elsewhere in Honolulu would require the expense of a shuttle, though you could get a much nicer room for the same price. There are only 3 airport hotels, 2 of which are under the same management, so they have a real lock on the price, which is at least double what you would pay for this level of quality anywhere else.
user_name:
iandarkpilot
New York City, New York

review_body: Treat this simply as a convenient airport location. The rooms are spacious but the "free" internet is limited to ridiculously slow transfer rate. The Google home page took 45 seconds to load. Normal communication - foggedaboutit. The front desk staff are burned out and make you feel unwanted and unwelcome. The airport shuttle took off 5 minutes early, returned 20 minutes later, and almost made us miss our flight.

Needed to stay near the airport for 1 night and found this great property. Free shuttle service to/from airport and great room. Room was clean and the staff are so friendly made you feel very welcome. Thank you for sharing that special "ALOHA" spirit with us during our stay. Will stay again in the future even if we do not need to be near the airport. It's the perfect "In-between" location for Waikiki or Kapolei! Thanks again.

Due to mechanical delays on flight from DFW missed last flight to Big Island so ended up here for one night. Room was clean and bed comfortable. Shuttle service prompt and no issues. Reasonable priced since walked in no reservation. Would stay here again if needed early flight out or last flight in. Did not notice any noise problems.

Recently stayed with family at the Ohana Honolulu Airport hotel. Main criteria was location close to Aiea, Pearl City and Mililani, without the hassle of major driving traffic. On this goal I was not disappointed, the access and driving was relatively easy, and the price was right.I will however mention my expectation of the property was not very high, which it definitely met and even exceeded. If you are looking for a 4 star resort experience, adjust your mindset because this is more a motel and simple business property. You'll find the basics with a friendly staff.A few things you will NOT have are; in room Wifi, in room Safe, modern flat screen TV, spotless rooms, covered parking.However you WILL have; smaller-homey feel with refrig and microwave in room, good housekeeping with clean linens, decent hotel restaurant, easy walk to Starbucks/Jamba Juice/Pizza/Plate-lunch food, free airport shuttle.

Convenient location close to airport, but very noisy, with many roads intersecting and a warehouse at the side with lorries loading and unloading in the morning. The evening receptionist was not particularly welcoming or friendly- I had to report a couple of things about the room and she neither smiled nor apologised. However the morning one was charming, so it's pot luck who is behind the desk. The room was clean and adequately furnished, although I was surprised to be told guests had to buy their own milk. I don't think it's much to ask, to be given a couple of little pots of milk for a cup of tea or coffee. The free wifi is only available in the lobby.

We recently needed a place to stay in Honolulu overnight to catch an early morning flight. The Best Western was full so we were basically stuck with this hotel. When we arrived and tried to call for a shuttle pickup, the phone just rang and rang. We tried repeatedly to get through over a fifteen minute period, then gave up and took a cab for $10. Then, we stood in line waiting at 3:15 PM to check in for another 15 minutes before we were helped. There seemed to be something sketchy going on with a guest who had charged $5000 worth of rooms and services while there on a family vacation and then having his credit card reject the charges. When we finally were able to check in, things went smoothly from there. We were given a room in the back building on the second floor overlooking the parking lot. It was extremely shabby and in need of major freshening up. We left almost immediately and bussed it to Waikiki, returning at 10PM and falling into bed. The bed was actually comfortable and the shower in the morning had amazing pressure. We were ten minutes early for the 6AM shuttle and it was packed. If I had paid maybe $100 for this hotel I wouldn't have felt so ripped off but we paid $192. I could have stayed on Waikiki for this price and just had a longer trip back to the airport. Next time I will. And I feel really bad for the guy who spent $5000 for a family vacation at this hotel. It is not a Hawaiian experience.
We expected more. Room was not filthy, but looked like it had not been cleaned well in a few days. Front desk clerks made youbfeel that you wer interfering with their busy day.

An easy location, albeit a good 20 minutes from the 'heart' of the city, especially if you're catching a flight and/or are arriving late. The shuttle bus service to/from the airport is really helpful. The reception staff were very friendly (it's that 'Aloha Spirit'), welcoming and pleasant - always nice when you've been traveling. The rooms were clean, spacious and fully out-fitted including a coffee machine which I certainly appreciated. There's free wifi in the lounge area as well as a small shop and restaurant. We had breakfast in the morning which was also quite nice, and very filling. I would definitely stay again, but if staying longer than 1 night would probably find a place closer into Waikiki. We did use the city bus service (bus stop is just out front) to go into Waikiki on the day we arrived - while it did take a bit to get into the city it was easy to use, comfortable and very good value.

We used the Ohana hotel for a one night stop over in Dec 2011. It was located very close to the Airport which was very convenient. The free shuttle to & from the airport worked well, appreciating that the shuttles run each half hour. The room was very adequate & suited our needs. We were able to get a late (5.00pm checkout) for an additional $50. There was very little to do within walking distance of the hotel, but we would stay again if passing through Honolulu.

We stayed at the Ohana Honolulu Airport Hotel both before and after our flight to Papeete. It had everything we wanted for a one night stay — close to the airport, on a bus route into the city, free wi-fi, and quiet, comfortable rooms. The desk staff was great, especially Ann, who gave us a very early check-in on our 7:00 am arrival from Papeete. Greatly appreciated! The free shuttle to and from the airport was a bonus, and the room rates were reasonable.

A semi-depressing parade of persons coming and going. From young families with kids, to military personnel on their way to or from Hawaiian bases, to strange older folks who talk to themselves while using the lobby Internet access, and the endless procession of smokers going from room (all non-smoking) to outdoors and leaving the strong stench of smoke in the elevator along the way. Staying here was an experience, and one best kept short, but if you have to catch an early morning flight out of HNL, it is a reasonable choice with quick and easy access via a complementary shuttle service. The bed is not too comfortable. The TV's are from the 90's. The A/C bangs, rattles, and wheezes, but does the job, and the Bathroom is clean, with a shower that holds temp nicely while providing ample water pressure - and who doesn't appreciate that.There is some airplane noise, but it is usually washed out by the A/C - which is good and bad.
Free shuttle, small clean room, good service. Arrived late and restaurant closed. Room was simple and dated. Great for a layover. Breakfast staff was very nice

Although this hotel is within 1/2 mile of the airport, it is pretty tricky to find (directions included, "Go to the airport through baggage claim area,") and it took us 3 tries and two phone calls to locate it, given the one-way streets, overpasses and unclear directions. Parking is an extra $25 per night, so that should figure into any comparisons. Once we arrived, we found our 2 doubles room to be nice, with a small fridge and microwave and generally very pleasant furnishings and a quiet night's sleep was had by all.

Stayed here for one night in September after our late flight arrival of 9:00pm. The rate was pretty reasonable with AAA (paid around $100). There is also a free shuttle from the airport to the hotel but we had to wait for about 30 minutes in a dark shuttle stop. The hotel is ok but kind of dated but pretty clean. We left the following day to stay at a resort by the beach.Pros: - Proximity to the airport- Free shuttle to the hotel- Convenience store open lateCons- Hotel is pretty dated

The rooms are clean, the bed was comfortable, the shuttle service was prompt, the front desk was pleasant and the corned beef hash for breakfast in the morning was excellent. The price was good too. The location isn't exactly senic, but if you didn't need to be near the airport it's great.
user_name:
dabbler45
New York City, New York

review_body: This is a hotel that lives up to its name – it is within walking distance of the airport. The shuttle is quick and regular and the drivers helpful.We had requested a quiet room – the view of and noise from the Nimitz didn’t fit our definition of quiet – but perhaps that is the quietest it gets. We had booked in for 2 nights but our room keycards stopped working after one which was annoying – this was quickly rectified.All staff on the front desk were friendly and answered our questions eg about catching TheBus (bus stop right outside) and even made sure we had the correct money for our fares.The restaurant was not open at night while we were there. We went to the restaurant at the sister hotel nearby – it was basic and had run out of one of our choices.

If you need a hotel near the airport because of a late arrival or early flight out, this is about the best of your choices. I have also stayed at the Best Western Airport Hotel and I think this is the better of the two. Although, I don't really think either one is as bad as some of the reviews. Maybe they have improved over the years. However, I would go back here. Good shuttle service to airport. The room was nice and recently updated. The bed was great. Not much noise even though it is right next to the airport. Very good price if you search around for rates. None of the Honolulu airport hotels have restaurants and your choices are limited. There is an area about a block away with some fast food restaurants which is better than nothing. If you have time, stay in Honolulu or Waikiki but if you need to be close to the airport this is your best option.

Extremely convenient to the airport......I even walked to the hotel from the Hertz airport drop off point.Rooms are standard. Yes, they're a bit dated but everything was quite clean.The hotel is not convenient to anything else other than the airport. We chose to stay here because we had an early morning flight back to the mainland. We ate dinner on the way to the hotel. After checking in the family, I returned the rental car to Hertz and could walk back to the hotel. It was great to have such a short shuttle ride in the morning!The pool was too cold for enjoyable swimming, and I wish they had a hot tub.We left before breakfast was served so I can't comment on its qualSity or timeliness.Service personnel were friendly and we experienced no problems.

The Ohana is located close to the airport and provides a shuttle service. There is a phone in the airport luggage area to call for the bus which came within an acceptable time. The room was clean but was a bit dated however, if you are only staying between flights then this is not a problem.The staff were friendly and there is a small convenience store in the hotel which was handy for a drink and a snack. The hotel is located away from all the tourist things in Honolulu but the room rates are good. So if you only want a clean bed for the night the Ohana will be Ok.

I booked a Single King room on the Choice Hotels website since that is the chain they are attached to and of which I am a platinum member. I got my confirmation number etc. I got to the hotel and they said they couldn't find my reservation even after I provided them my reservation number. They said they would do me a favor by honoring the rate I obtained on the website of 109.00 but said they were selling the rooms for 119.00. I was blown away they she would have the gall to tell me they were doing me a favor when I had a reservation to begin with. To boot, she said she had no king rooms available and assigned me a room with 2 double beds. Not cool. I told her I had a reserved King room from their own website. She said the website has not idea what rooms they have available. That would be insane if that were the case. Can you imagine 500 people wanting the same room that there might only be 100 of? Then to top it off after she took my credit card she asked me if I had a car. I said I did. She then handed me a slip and told me that it would cost me 25 dollars to park my car overnight on their premises. There was no mention of this on the website or anywhere else one might readily observe. Then they didn't add my choiceprivilages number to the room so I can book credit or it.The room was decent sized with a small armoire and a 25" Zenith Tube TV. The bathroom looks to have been updated with new fixtures and granite counter top. The Shower was very hot and had high water pressure. It stayed hot for as long as you needed. There is room for you luggage. The microwave is small as is the micro sized refrigerator. The air conditioning worked but never got the room very cold. Other than that the room is pretty stale and boring. There is no wi-fi in the rooms. Only an ethernet cable. Also, don't mind the garbage truck that showed up at 6am on Tuesday morning and had its reverse beeper going for more than half an hour. My #261 room was quiet for the most part. Based on my experience with the desk agent and the manager with which she conferred, I would not stay here again nor would I recommend it to anyone else.

We spent a night here after a flight from New Zealand. They have a shuttle to pick you up from the airport. The rooms are clean, and comfortable. Very convienent for a stop over on a long journey. Restaurant on site.

This hotel is well located for an overnight stay in Honolulu.Our flight from Canada arrived during the evening; our next leg was a hop to Kauai with Hawaiian Airlines early the next morning.There is a suitable convenience store on the first floor.The shuttle from and to the airport was prompt and courteous.The quality/cost ratio at Ohana Honolulu Airport Hotel is very reasonable for temporary accommodation.

The proximity to the airport and cost for simply a night's sleep between flights makes this hotel appealing. The stench of the rooms is unbearable, even for an animal lover. Choose the sister hotel, Best Western for the same location, price, friendly staff, as well as the same dingy rooms less the smell of animal excrement.
It did the trick for a quick layover but room was dated and a bit grungy. We killed a roach in the bathroom. Shuttle was great, service was good too. Rooms just weren't that great.

Not a 5 star hotel, but it was clean, had very friendly staff and the shuttle service was excellent. Had read some of the other reviews and found that mattress and pillows are based on personal preference. We found them comfortable. For the price and convenienced of an overnight stay - it was great

This is your very basic, no frills, airport hotel, where all you wish to do is sleep a night and catch the plane the next day. I would not recommend longer stays but for this one purpose, it does the job. They pick you up with a shuttle bus from the terminal and take you back free of charge. There is free internet in the room and it works well so you can catch up on the office work. The restaurant is ordinary, and not open everyday. It is quite a way out of town so it is a cab ride to go anywhere. There is no safe in the room which I personally think is mandatory in a hotel of this kind, but you can leave valuables reliably at the front desk. It is clean and for $114 for the night it was reasonable value and did the job. A satisfactory if basic experience.

This is an older hotel, but is in good shape and reasonably updated. Not a vacation destination, but an excellent choice if you need a hotel near the airport for a night. Compared to other Honolulu hotels Ohana is a a good value and could be the base for an Oahu exploration, if you would rather spend money doing things rather than on a hotel on the beach.

We all know how airport hotels can be - dirty, grumpy and overall, completely aware that you're there for a night only, so what does it matter how it is?This one isn't like that. The staff was friendly, the room was clean, and the free shuttle made getting to and from the airport very easy. I'd definitely stay here again if I needed to overnight between flights.

Kehau at the front desk was excellent! She worked with the local Fed Ex to get the package containig my forgotten cell phone delivered just in time to make my departure. She took ownership of the problem and didn't let go until it was resolved. She also make special transportation arrangements in case the time crunch got even worse. The other front desk staff were also very professional and helpful with navigating Honolulu.Phil NReno, NV

We were supposed to be jetting home from a Philippine trip, but our plane we delayed, delayed, delayed and delayed. Hawaiian Airlines offered to place us at this hotel. Shuttle service as mentioned in other reviews is free. Check in was professional and friendly. Our room was a hike from the desk, but was nice and spacious. The beds were better than comfortable and the shower felt luxurious (good flow). There were families with small crying children whom we could hear while in the hall, but did not hear when we were in our room.I'm not sure that I would want to stay here for several days because it is near the airport and one could hear the super noisy jets taking off, but only the super noisy ones and only when we were awake. We arrived after dark and left at o'dark 30 so can't really comment on the view, but saw our window from the parking lot, but why would you want to spend time in your room when you are in Hawaii? We did not utilize the food service secondary to arriving late and leaving early.

Needed to stay somewhere near the airport, and found this unexpectedly great. The rooms, service and shuttle were all good, but the surprise was the restaurant downstairs, which had a really good chef, prompt and courteous service.

This was our last stop for some R&R,and to break a long haul flight back to NZ. The free shuttle service was brilliant,both to and from the airport at various times of day and night..Top Class.The reception Staff Rose and Suzie, were so helpful with advice about absolutely evrything we asked, and sooo friendly,and interested in where we had been travelling.Our room was very clean, as was the swimming pool. Our early wake up call was on time which was important to us.They have a very good souvenier and snack shop which me made use of. The only down side was that our room was on the Motorway side of the hotel,which meant that our earplugs were necessary to maintain sleep. Would definately stay here again.Loved it.

GOOD FEATURES: It was very close to the airport, which was what I wanted, since I was arriving about 9 PM and leaving the next morning. Its free shuttle service was important. Cleaning ladies were very friendly and gave me some extra coffee.NOT-SO-GOOD: My room was situated in an area which had not much of a view...the side of a building...I could not see either the mountains or the sea. The price was reasonable for a downtown Honolulu hotel, but I thought that at least a Continental breakfast should be included.

I stayed there a week for work due to it's access to resources I needed. First night I was awakened by the trucking company behind the hotel. They were throwing pallets in a dumpster and backing up trucks that beeped. I asked for a different room and was moved to the newer wing. The beds are firmer there, but no noise. Parking was scarce, but I always found a spot. Two associated restaurants were ok, but plan on finding other restaurants for a more Hawaii experience. Had to pay to use and print from lobby computer. Parking is expensive. I would stay again, unless I was there for vacation, then I'd go to a resort.

Pros:- Good room cleaning service with very nice cleaning people.- Eating location is just a block away.- Laundry on floor with detergentsCons:- Front desk staff not as friendly- Elevator was broken on stay- First floor restaurant is overpriced and below average quality of food

I used this hotel because it was convenient for the airport, and my awkwardly timed flights.There is a courtesy shuttle bus from the airport to the hotel. When you arrive, use one of the courtesy phones by the baggage carousel, let the hotel know where you are, and eventually the bus will turn up.Check-in was a little slow but the staff were very friendly and helpful.The room was quite a good size, clean and comfortable. On my first visit, I was in the main building. On my second visit, I had to stay in the annex, which I didn't particularly like having to walk to and from in the middle of the night. It isn't really very far, but it does feel a long way when you are lugging a suitcase.

I had no high expectations of what I thought would be a downmarket airport hotel, the one my company had booked me into, but as the titel of my review says, I was very pleasantly surprised. The room was clean, bright and, well, roomy! Wired internet is free in the room and free wireless is available in the lobby, along with a computer & printer where one can print boading passes (for free). Although the restaurant is open for breakfast it is not open for lunch and only on certain nights for dinner but there is a printed guide to local food outlets, including a Starbucks (most are within 5 minutes walk) at reception and the hotel will provide a free shuttle to their nearby sister hotel, The Plaza Hotel. Guides to which bus routes serve which destinations are also at reception as well as a restaurant delivery menu. The hotel also has other standard amenities such as a pool and a fitness centre. My only small gripe is that while there is the standard-issue coffee maker in the room, I had tto ask Housekeeping for tea bags. As a Brit, tea is important! I will be asking my company to book me here again on my next business trip to Honolulu.
The service is great especially the housekeeping service..thanks for always making sure we have all the proper supplies needed daily.

We stayed at this hotel the evening of August 21st because our flight was cancelled. This is one of the closest hotels to the airport. I definately would not recommend this hotel as your main stay during your visit to Honolulu. It is just o.k. for a quick stop-over. The check-in process is fine; the rooms were kind of dingy looking (I was afraid that we would bring bugs home); there are some shady looking people hanging around the hotel; depending on where your room is situated, it can be a very long walk to your room. There is an elevator, but not necessarily conveniently located. The shuttle service is free and runs every 1/2 hour to/from the airport. The bus system is close by and you can take it to Pearl Harbor or to shopping areas (I would not recommend Pearl Harbor Shopping Center). It has very few stores and the mall is dingy looking. Good luck and enjoy your stay in Honolulu!

Needed an overnight as returning from outer islands and had early flight next day. Hotel is clean but basic....has a pool, laundry, convenience store and free airport shuttle which works well...saving on taxi or shuttle into Hon or Waikiki. Restuarant not open every night but they'll take you to the nearby Best Western or do what I did and order in...they will provide menues and phone numbers for restaurants that will deliver...after staying in some nice hotels this trip though some of the other guests at this hotel were just a little scary though! Took a long time to check in too! Lift is a bit antiquated. Microwav e and coffee maker.

Stayed here for two nights on a layover and it was great. Staff were friendly and incredibly helpful. I was very happy with the room, very clean, and ample facilities for my needs (cable internet was very nice to have). Shuttle service to and from the airport was a life saver.

My husband and I stayed here for one night only in August 2011. It was only one night as a stop over between Maui and returning to Australia. They have a complimentary shuttle to and from the airport which is only about 1 1/2 km away. The hotel was extremely clean and the room was quite large and very quiet. The reception staff member was very welcoming and efficient. They have a restaurant which provides good quality fresh food at a reasonable price.I would definitely recommend this hotel for anyone wanting to stay close to Honolulu airport.

Missed our flight out of Honolulu from Molokai so had to stay over and we were very pleased with the shuttle service from the airport to the Hotel. Thereceptionist at check- in was helpful and friendly. The room was clean and we had 2 beds which I do have to admit not very comfortable but ok for one night and we certainly appreciated the last minute reservations as they werevery busy. Prices were reasonable and the Hotel was well maintained.

I have stayed 3 times at this hotel during vacations in Hawaii. It is very practical if you just need a place to sleep , as it is very close to the airport , and their shuttle picked us shortly after we had contacted the hotel. The rooms were clean , beds were confortable and the cable internet worked fine in the room ( there is wireless at the reception area ). Bathroom was clean, with a nice shower. We had both dinner and breakfast during our stay there and the food was reasonable. There is a bus stop right next to the hotel , that will take you to Honolulu for a couple of dollars , but if i would have stayed in Honolulu for a longer period , i would recommend another hotel more central , close to Waikkiki beach . The hotel has a pool and a small fitness center , as well as a small souvenir shop right in front of the restaurant, but we did not use it. All in all, for a short stopover i would recommend it without hesitation.

Stayed here on two separate occasions recently between connecting flights. A clean, comfortable hotel with all the usual amenities. Efficient courtesy shuttle service to/from airport, just call the hotel using the free phone in the baggage claim area. Front desk staff were friendly and helpful. Has free wifi in lobby, a small convenience store, restaurant and swimming pool on site (I didn’t try the restaurant or pool). Airport Trade Centre close by has Starbucks for morning coffee and several dining options, hotel is also walking distance to car rental chains (to save getting the shuttle to the airport then another to the car rental office). Hotel is located on Nimitz Highway so good access to freeway and Pearl Harbour if you’re looking to get there early before the crowds.A good option if you’re looking for an overnight stay before continuing your travel.

Used the Ohana as a stop -over and like other reviewers we loved the airport transport and the efficient staff, but the actual room was noisy due to traffic until early hours. The light flickered when turned off, so had to remove bulbs and the ceiling dripped in the bathroom right over head when in front of the sink. The aircon was also noisy and the hotel restaurant was being used for a function.

Very Clean, convenient place to stay if you are transitioning through Honolulu. Rooms are clean, good internet, nice restaurant when it is open (during the week with the Best Western down the streer open the other days).
