Not the place to stay if you are looking for the Hawaii experience though. It is just a mile from the airport almost under the freeway with only only a couple of small strip malls nearby. For a quick overnight, it is perfect.

Rooms are spacious and pretty well equipped for this class of hotel. Location is in the middle of the airport industrial area, our room overlooked loading bays so we had trucks reversing, sometimes several at a time, until late at night with a chorus of beep beeping keeping us wide awake. The restaurant was pretty average, not somewhere I would recommend but I think the only other choices nearby are fast-food outlets.The location & price is what sells this hotel with a good courtesy bus to the airport nearby.

Have stayed many times here and appreciate the convenience and shuttle service in particular, as most travel is through and not to Honolulu. On this trip the room was not clean, the door's deadbolt would not work, and ISpecifically requested wake up call for early flight which didn't happen, so had to depend on computer system (worked but staff should have done also).Convenience is not worth it if the value is not there. If you want a single bed call, as the Internet system never seems to share that info...

I wouldn't say this is the most glamorous hotel nor the best I've stayed but it's decent. It looks a bit old but it seems to be well maintained. The rooms are basic which include a microwave, small refrigerator, coffee pot and tube television. Ours had a balcony but it was a solid and high construction so we couldn't really enjoy it. Cable is limited and there are a quite a bit of channels that are on a constant loop so the same programs play all day long. I still can't get that "Waikiki Beach Walk" song out of my head. Believe me if you've stayed here before than you know what song I'm talking about. ;-)It's not in the best location either. It's located in the business district so the surroundings are a little drab and there isn't much to do if you happen to have any small children. It's either drive some distance away, hang out in the pool or stay in your room. Like many other reviewers mentioned, the on site restaurant isn't open every day but when it is, I recommend catching breakfast and trying the waffles. They are delicious! The cashier that we always got was not especially friendly though...On the days the restaurant isn't open you can walk or catch a shuttle to the sister hotel, the Best Western up the street. We went there for a few dinners and the staff is friendly there but the service is slow. Make sure you have lots of time and patience when you eat there. The Ohana has an on site store which carries a good selection of health and beauty aids as well as snacks and some clothing. A lot of their products are travels sizes and very expensive. There are vending machines located on most floors of the hotel as well. You also get free internet in your room but you have to plug in what I think is an ethernet cable into your computer/laptop or netbook to use it- it's not very fast either. But you can always go into the lobby and use their business center which consists of two computers (pay to use) and a printer. Faxing services are available for $2 a page. Parking is a nightmare. Oh my goodness you had better not leave in the evening otherwise you will be circling about trying to find some place to park when you return. There are a lot of military families (like us) staying in this hotel while in transition to or from Hawaii so parking is usually crowded. The few nights we did have trouble finding parking we did get assistance from the security guards. One night we just couldn't find a spot so the security guard allowed us to park in a tight spot behind another vehicle and phoned front desk to have them call us when a parking spot became available. It was either that or circle around for who knows how long.The hotel is pet friendly which is great and it is literally right next door to the airport which is another bonus if you are just arriving to the island or are going to catch a flight out. It's reasonably priced and relatively clean as housekeeping does a good job. There are bellman available to assist with your luggage as well as show you to your room. I would recommend staying here if you are looking for a place to rest up for a few days. If you are looking for some place really tropical and close to a beach- this is not it.

My family and I stayed here for one night on July 15th after arriving from Auckland and were flying to Maui the next day. Check in did take a while as the lobby was quite busy, within half an hour of arriving we were in our rooms. Rooms: The rooms were comfortable, tidy and quite clean, the room was capable of sleeping 4 people in two double beds, although the beds were not quite big enough to sleep two people comfortably. We booked two rooms so everyone had enough space. The aircon was very effective but was also very loud, so I turned it off in the middle of the night partly because of the noise and partly because I was cold. We had three rooms between the extended familyServices:The restaurant served good food but as always with American restaurants the "gratuity" made the meal very expensive. The hotel staff were very friendly and helpful during our short stay, check out was quick and easy as there was less people than when we were checking in. Summary:This is a very convenient airport hotel that has good rooms and good service. There was no aircraft noise. I would only recommend this hotel for short stays of one or two nights as the rooms are quite small and it is not centrally located in Honolulu for shopping or swimming in the sea. The free shuttle to and from the airport is great and comes very frequently, every 15 minutes from memory. One tip is to try and get to the hotel quickly after your flight to get ahead of all the people who are also going to this hotel.

My husband and I have stayed here 3 times for short stays. We live on the Big Island so this hotel is a good place for us to stay when we're in Honolulu for medical appointments. The staff is very friendly and efficient; the room was comfortable; and the pool was small but refreshing. We appreciated the availability of shuttles to Tripler, the VA hospital and the airport. The only drawback is that the restaurant is open only on certain days. On alternate days, you can eat at the Best Western nearby, but both places close pretty early. Not a problem if you have a rental car or don't mind taking a cab but we decided to walk a few blocks to a small drive-in-type restaurant. The food was pretty good but I wouldn't have felt comfortable walking there by myself after dark as the area is pretty deserted after 5PM or so. Another option is to pick up some snacks at the gift store/convenience store in the hotel. It has a little bit of everything and is open until 9PM.

This is one of only two airport hotels at the Honolulu Intl Airport. We've been staying here regularly since 1990. It's old but mostly well maintained. We've only had to ask for a different room one time and that was because the A/C didn't work in our 1st room. Other than that, we've been mostly satisfied with our stays here. Front desk is friendly most of the time (but sometimes you get a sourpuss). Front desk is responsive most of the time too if you have a question/problem. Their restaurant isn't open all the time, but behind the hotel there's a strip mall on Paiea Street, within easy walking distance, that has quite a few selections. Try Big Kahuna's Pizza. Considering the convenience factor of this airport hotel, we think this place is worth the approx $100/night price.

We only stayed two nights to visit family on our way back to Oz from Central America. The staff here made our stay very special and it is the best way to break up a long journey. We are planning our next trip for November and will include a few more days being looked after at this wonderful spot only a mile from the airport and on the main road to everywhare else. I look forward to seeing you all before christmas.

Good hotel for stopover or in transit layover. Conveneient location provided access to airport for flight and also a 40 minute bus to downtown should you want to do a short trip to the beaches. Clean and decent size room with virtually anything you could need. Also had in-room internet access.

We chose this hotel due to it's location to family who live in Honolulu. It was just a 5 minute drive to see them daily. The hotel is located next to the airport and the Nimitz highway. The room was very clean and well maintained, all the staff was friendly and courteous. I didn't see any area of neglect in the hotel. It also has a restaurant on the property but it has limited hours of operation that are clearly marked. There is also an outdoor pool. A big bonus was a small gift shop/convenient mart located in the hotel, near the restaurant. This came in handy for us when we got the munchies. It's a bit of a drive in that area to find a quick mart. I must say that I originally thought I would be bothered by the noise from the airplanes but it didn't bother us in the least and we barely heard them. The biggest drawback was the bed not being very comfortable. I slept but not well. (Most hotels need better mattresses.) I would not recommend this hotel if you enjoy walking to activities and nightlife- there isn't any! We will probably stay here again on our next visit.

The shuttle picked us up from airport promptly. The front desk staff and bellman gave us bus and wikiki and pearl harbor directions which were perfect. The room was very clean and the bed was very comfortable. The staff was very willing to help.
We needed to spend one night there and were satisfied. It was just what we needed. Room was clean and comfortable, a/c was efficient. Staff was very nice.

We stayed here because our flight itinerary required an overnight stay in Honolulu. The positives are a good price, free shuttle pick up/drop off and free wired internet access. It is on the fringe of the airport precinct, which is both a plus and a minus!! As a place to rest our heads en route, it was fine, but don't stay here if you are wanting to experience Waikiki etc, as it is not in a pretty location. The hotel is well serviced by The Bus (local public transport), so you can ride into Honolulu, Waikiki and also the Ala Moana shopping centre for $2.50 each, about a 20 minute journey. The bust stops right outside the hotel. A special mention to the guy who drives the shuttle. A military family with lots of luggage, small children etc got into the shuttle, thinking that it would take them to the Best Western (part of the same group, logo on the shuttle). Even though this wasn't correct, the driver took them to their hotel without charge, because he could see how frazzled they were. It's great to see that sort of kindness - indeed, Hawaiins generally seem very helpful and good people to be amongst.

A basic place to stay, if you're finicky you'd be disappointed. The freeway is less than a hundred yards away, although it get's quieter in the late night, the swishing sounds starts up around 4am. The room amenities come with a coffee maker, only coffee no tea, a small microwave, a mini refrigerator, a blow dryer, a clock radio, air conditioning, pen and note pad for messages. The rooms are okay, just a little to close to the freeway. There is an inhouse restaurant but a block away (walking distance) there are local restaurants (korean, chinese, local food, star bucks, jamba juice) and a local pizza place(big kahuna).
Functional hotel. Good shuttle service to hotel. Coffee provided in the room, which was appreciated. Check-in staff were quite unfriendly though.

I stayed at this hotel due to a late flight into Honolulu and didn't want to travel coast to villa until next day. I found it to be very convenient to airport with free shuttle service, and the room was very clean. It is an average hotel, in good condition for its age. Service- good. The amenities they provide... some of the best lotion I have had! Impressed with value, cleaniness, and ease of shuttle.

We stayed overnight in transit. Our stay was much better than anticipated from the reviews. The hotel is a bit dated but the room was clean, bed and shower were fine and everything worked. I asked for a quiet room away from the highway and we got a sound night's sleep. Breakfast at the hotel was good value with an adequate choice. The shuttle bus departs on the half hour for the airport. Departing from the hotel was fine but we had difficulty on arrival finding the pick up location for the shuttle at the airport - the hotel is rung once you have collected the luggage and then you are told where the pick up is. It was confusing especially at night.. Directions were to cross the road and wait by a green curb - impossible to find in the dark especially as there were 2 crossings and we crossed at the closest to the phone which happened to be the wrong crossing. Fortunately the shuttle driver waited.

Stayed the night between flights from the mainland going to Kauai. THe hotel was reasonable by Hawaii standards and comfortable. The staff was very friendly and helpful. The hotel has a restaurant on site but it was a bit pricey and we always go to Byrons Drive In just down the street (a 5 inute walk) which is very local and open 24 hours, much better prices. The breakfast was reasonable and good at the hotel and the airport shuttle was on time and efficient.

Mattress was soft and very uncomfortable. The air conditioner was noisy. The room was small as was the bathroom. On the plus side: good water pressure in the shower, really good in-room coffee, good shuttle service to the airport. This hotel is adequate for a quick stay if you need to be close to the airport but otherwise don't bother.

Due to a bout of diarrhea I was rather ill on the morning of my departure.I had to have the bus driver return me to the hotel lobby where the ladies at the reservation desk - and the housekeeping maid - were very sensitive to my needs. They saw to it that I was properly looked after and that I made an alternate flight reservation so that I could still fly out on the same day. Their kindness and understanding and efficieincy were all above excellent.
Serviceable. Nothing fancy. Kind of dark. Staff was nice.

They lure you in with a decent price & then charge you $20- a night to park. You go to your room, it looks decent. You get comfortable & then you notice... Things crawling around. Look at the nightstand, you might see a few critters running around. Take a shower & look carefully there might be a few bugs looking for a drink. The hotel looks like it caters to the Military, so a lot of family's stay there. Would you want cockroaches crawling over your kid's while they sleeping & you too? This place is the original roach Motel. When you return home Do Not bring your bags into the house. Unpack outside & inspect everything before you come into your house. Beware of this place.

Everyone on staff, from the shuttle drivers to the housekeepers I passed in the hallway, shared a smile and friendly greeting. The desk was lovely about allowing an early check-in (I was exhausted and so appreciated this!). Even though this is at the airport's doorstep, I slept quite well and didn't have any distracting noise. I travel alone sometimes, so appreciated that the parking lot was lighted and patrolled. The pool appeared clean and popular; the on-site mini-mart had reasonable prices for bottled water, soda, and snacks.My room had a coffeemarker, microwave and mini-fridge - great for me! The Bus has a nearby stop that goes to Waikiki and shopping centers, and it's a short and easy drive down Nimitz to several good places to shop and eat if you have a car. The hotel has a small restaurant that serves some meals and had a free shuttle to a nearby restaurant The location is somewhat isolated - but perfect for an early AM flight out!

Like other travellers have mentioned, we were also unfortunate to have landed the night of the impending Tsunami. Our trip was only a stopover between Los Angeles and Sydney. The shuttle driver was rude and abrupt (not sure if he was stressed or what!!). He basically threw the luggage in the shuttle and when people tried to move it aside or stack it he basically told them to "leave it alone". A nice welcome to Hawaii sofar! It took us over 45 minutes to check into our room - there was one family being served at the time and we were the only other ones there. Perhaps this was because of the Tsunami? It was late at night and our kids were tired and cranky - all we wanted to do was go to bed. The room was fine - standard but fit the purpose. In the morning when we went downstairs for breakfast we again waited over 45 minutes to be seated at the table (the place was empty!) then it took an additional 35 minutes for anyone to serve us (or even offer us a drink). Again cranky kids! The food was overpriced but Ok.We ended up staying two nights because of the Tsunami happenings in Waikiki. For dinner we caught the free shuttle to their sister hotel (down the road a bit). I can honestly say this was the worst meal I have ever had in my life!! In fact so much so - I couldn't eat it. I was worried I was going to spend the next 24 hours with food poisioning.Anyway, in the end - the rooms are comfortable and ours was clean. In other circumstances perhaps the service would have been better also! If you want a hotel close to the airport for a brief stay (stop over or overnight) - I think this is probably okay.... but not for any extended period of time.

This was the first hotel room we stayed in that wasn't cramped! It was very nice and pleasantly decorated. Nice courtyard with a pool and a lovely lobby area. The shuttle doesn't run on time, so consider taking an earlier shuttle so you arrive on time at the airport. Everyone was very helpful.

Was conveniently close to airport, which is good for early flights. Free 24 hours shuttle but only every half hour. Not much to look at. Restaurant was closed almost constantly which was inconvenient as one person in our party could not walk very far and we had no other transportation to get to meals. Industrially located area - had view of used car lot. Was reasonably priced for 4 people at 181$

So, you need a hotel in Honolulu near the airport? Here's the bad news: you don't have many options. The only other hotel that's almost as close as the Ohana is the Best Western. Low competition = high prices... including taxes our room at the Ohana was almost $120, which I consider very pricey for an airport hotel. Now here's the good news: this place is alright. Nothing fancy, but if you just need a room by the airport for an early morning flight, this will do the trick. Our room was clean, quiet (we did not face the freeway), and comfortable. The shuttle arrived about 10 minutes after we called. A few things to note: they have a restaurant, but it only operates about half the nights... the other nights (including the one we were there) they have a shuttle to the best western maybe 1/4 mile away. We passed on that, since the seafood buffet at the Best Western would have been ~$26 / person + tax & tip. Instead check out Big Kahuna's pizza... lots of unusual choices, and a fun atmosphere. Also, the pool has a sign that says it closes at 7 pm, which seems kind of early. Overall though, I'd stay there again.
From the time of arrival at the airport we felt we were in good hands.Shuttle service ,hotel staff and convenience to all places was JUST great .I would stay here again.BK

We stayed only one night in this hotel, but unfortunately it was March 10, 2011...the night the 8.9 eathquake it Japan and when Hawaii went into Tsunami warning mode. The rooms were clean and mostly quiet. The onsite restaurant wasn't great and was somewhat expensive....but was convenient since we didn't have a rental car. Luckily, we were outside the tsunami evacuation zone and the hotel had posted signs all over the hotel to let their guests know that we were safe. We were supposed to fly out the next morning but the flights were delayed due to the tsunami warning so our flight got moved to the evening. We didn't have anywhere after we checked out to go so we asked the hotel if we could put our luggage in their bag storage room. Twice, the folks at the front desk told us that they did not have a storage room (despite the door next to the check-in counter with a clearly marked sign that read, "Baggage Storage"). Coincidentally, we were talking with the shuttle driver and he confirmed that they indeed did have storage and helped us get our luggage stored. I'm not sure why the front desk lied but it left a poor impression (especially in the crisis we were in).

Stayed at the Ohana Airport Hotel in Honolulu two separate times within 10 days in February 2011. Its no frills and rough around the edges. On my first pass through I had cockroaches in my room and they couldn't move me because they were booked solid. On my second stay (not by choice) it looked like there was a huge bloodstain on the bathroom floor/wall. I've stayed in worse, but they are few and far between. I would avoid it if you can. Its only saving graces are that its at the airport and within walking distance of Big Kahuna pizza.

Very helpful staff on the desk. I lost my wallet and by the time I called them from LA they had it ready for posting back to me in the UK....Customer care very good. Good no frills budget airport hotel.

The Ohana Honolulu Airport Hotel met my expectations of a decent aiport hotel with a few aloha flourishes. Rooms were spotless, reasonably modern and nicely appointed with a mini-fridge and a microwave. The breakfast (the only meal served at the restaurant) was a treat in a hotel restaurant that opened up to the pool. The shuttle worked like a charm, and the hotel was more than accomodating getting my luggage from the room and onto the vehicle. I found the service effecient and friendly, but I should have double-check my bill. I was running late and didn't get to find out about a strange $9 fee, because I was already on the plane going back home. People complain about the hotel being near a highway; but they could simply request a room facing the pool.

I booked at ohana via expedia and requested the king bed we knew this was a buget hotel(however the price did nothing to suggest this)and purely booked it due to proximity to the airport having to leave on early morning flight home.Previously we had stayed at two other resorts(turtle bay resort and hotel renew in waikiki-both AMAZING price on renew similar well worth a early wake up and 20 min taxi ride)We arrived to find we had two single beds so we called reception and were told all rooms had been booked(many prior to our booking)and had also requested the king beds so there was nothing she could do as it was a full house very annoyed at expedia for not making us aware of this however what can you(not ohana's fault either) do so we stayed and how i wish we didn't i awoke in the middle of the night to go to the bathroom during the night and saw a cockroach carawling around the vanity thinking it'd be a one off as it was bug season got it and disposed of it to look accross at the wardrobe and see another larger version crawling near my clothes hanging down towards my suitcase i literally sweated my bum off in the holey polyester sheets and washed my face with a thin had it flannel that also had a hole in it the next occasion to the bathroom was the same sitting on the toilet seat too scared to put my feet on the floor as a rampant roach swarmed accross the ground at my feet.Now might i add i did stop the count and didn't even shower at the hotel in the morning nor could i drink my coffee soo annoyed at this injustice of the price and the disgust to think that this place had a restauront? how does this place even get a food licence?? i didn't even want to drink coffee in this place yet alone a meal!!.However the one saving grace was the patient lady at reception and the friendly house keeping staff shame on you ohana! your staff shouldn't have to work in these surroundings let alone have guests to stay! E-X-T-E-R-M-I-N-A-T-E!!! It's not that hard.Considering i had stayed on the island for two weeks at two other places and never saw one bug beetle roach etc until my few hours at your dump!.Refurbish simple modern furniture not such busy things for roaches to hide in,the housekeepers had done a great job considering what they had to work with however would also benefit with more cleaner air circulation and natural light and some new linen and towels the housekeeping was immaculate for what their working with otherwise charge less as your standards are.Worst night of my holiday just awful.If we still had the rental car i'd have rather slept in that.

This is our second time here again, it's so convenient and it's clean. At reception you will find "The Bus" note that tells you what buses to catch to major attractions. If you have done it all, go the the Pearlridge shopping center - just as large as the Ala Moana Shopping Center.There is also an eatery close by to the hotel, just walk out the front turn left and left again walk for about a block.

The free shuttle took forever, the pool closed at 7pm, the on-site restaurant was closed even though the front desk said it would be open. We had to take another shuttle to a different hotel to eat dinner, then shuttle back. And that hotel only stayed open for a short time after our arrival so we had to run to catch it after throwing our luggage in our room. We felt bad for the elderly folks that couldn't run to the shuttle in time. Felt like herded cattle. Rooms were clean and somewhat updated. Also, our coupon was "lost" by the front desk and not honored. We were told they would speak to management but we never heard back. Close to airport; yes. Worth the hassle; no. Very few amenities.

We stayed there on Feb. 21 because of a delay getting into Honolulu caused us to miss our connecting flight to Kauai. We got there after dark and left before dawn, but the area didn't seem to be in a great part of town. There was no option for food except to walk down an alley for fast food a couple blocks away. Because we didn't feel safe doing that, we ordered pizza delivered to the room. The room itself was fine. Nothing fancy at all. It would not have been a hotel I would have chosen, but since it was paid for by the airline, it did the job. I felt sorry for the front desk as I'm sure that many people in our situation take their frustration out on them. They were very nice, however.

Clean, simple accommodation. Very friendly and helpful staff. Quiet rooms with enough space to move around. We had reserved a crib and it was there waiting for us in the room. We didn't get to try out the pool because it closed at 7pm, but it looked lovely. Breakfast was a little expensive but tasty, but the restaurant was not open for dinner. The airport shuttle was very convenient! Quick easy place for our overnight stay.

This hotel was great for what I was looking for: a clean and secure place with shuttle service to the airport. I came for a quick getaway to visit some friends and was actually very impressed by this hotel. I have stayed at other OHANA and Outrigger properties in Waikiki for previous stays and liked the change of pace. The lobby was a lot nicer than I was expecting for an airport hotel. It was clean and looked fairly new. Security had a very strong presence on the grounds, so the area felt very secure which was nice being that I was on the ground floor. The room was well maintained from the bedding to the floors to the bathroom. Room had a faint musty smell upon entering, but once the air conditioner was turned on it was fine. I really appreciated the microwave in the room. Not many standard hotels in Hawaii provide this amenity. Despite being close the airport, the hotel room was very comfortable for sleeping with no airport noise (a HUGE plus). The night auditor was very kind in finding me some eating utensils at 4 in the morning despite the restaurant being closed. I didn't get a chance to eat the restaurant, but it was a nice convenience to know it was right outside my door. I was also pleasantly surprised by the vending machines at this hotel. I'm a late-night snacker and to have the option to buy cereal and fresh fruit, aside from your standard candy and granola bars, before the restaurant is open was great.The ability to print your boarding passes for FREE was also a positive! The shuttle service is a great service for any hotel regardless of proximity to the airport. Overall, my stay was comfortable and relaxing and I would definitely stay again.

I was forced into a stay her because of a late arriving flight causing a missedconnection. At $159 a night it was wildly overpriced for a place that doesn't includea breakfast or have a computer for guest use without a fee. The room was OK and cleanand the staff pleasant. The shuttle was a nice service.

Your hotel met the "bare-bones" needs of the traveler. No room service - no seven0day restaurant offering thee meals per day - no laundry bag in room - no exit from back area of pool to hallway - flat pillows - no choices for eating establishments near by.All in all - it was a very basic facility that does not live up to the Outrigger & Ohana reputation.H. F. Clayton

We choose this place for a 1 night stay before flying back home. We choose due to the shuttle. After staying on 2 other islands and paying a little more for the rooms at the other hotels- This place was a pleasant surprise.I want to feel comfortable when I walk into a room. I dont want to worry about if the carpet is dirty or the beds are worn out.The place has been re-done and I was expecting to check into another dumpy hotel but I got a clean room and a nice mattress.Pros-Clean and updated furnitureNice flat screen TVComfy bedsQuietCons-late night food was a 1/4 mile walk down the street- However the food was great!!

Management of this hotel is traveler unfriendly. Even though travelers (including ourselves) often arrive after 9 PM, management has decided to close the restaurants at Ohana and at it's "sister" hotel @ 9 PM. After a long flight with "airplane (so-called) food", being told no food service at all (including both restaurant and room service) is available after 9 PM is ridiculous. But it gets worse...On our way to our room, we passed the "gift shop" @ 9:30 PM. All lights were on, an employee was behind the counter. We wanted to buy at least a bottle of water, perhaps some peanuts...but no, the employee wouldn't open the door! A security guard came by, saw us, tapped on the door...she still refused to open the door. The guard gave up and walked away. The saga continues...We then went to the "vending machine" on our floor (3rd floor), put in $2 (a bit much) for a bottle of water (we don't consume sugar or artificial chemicals)...and out came a bottle of Coca-Cola! We took the Coca-Cola to the front desk, where a nice employee gave us the $2 back. We then went to the machine on the 2nd floor, put the $2 in, pressed the water bottle symbol....and out came 8 quarters. No water.Twenty minutes after a 'phone call to the front desk, a kind employee brought a bottle of water to our room on the third floor. Unfortunately, no food was available. But that's not all.....Next morning, we went to the restaurant on the 1st floor, and ran into another customer-unfriendly "management policy". We asked for substitutions on part of our orders since I am quite allergic to wheat, eggs, and milk, and my wife is allergic to milk and wheat. We asked for rice or potato instead of the wheat and milk part of the menu item....andwere told "management policy no substitutions" ! We were advised we could "just not eat the part of the order" to which we are allergic! The employee was sympathetic, but told us they'd get in trouble for violating "management policy"!We left the restaurant--no food the prior night, no food in the morning--went to the front desk, asked to speak to "management". We were told that "management" didn't come in until 10 AM. It was 9 AM, and we had a 'plane to catch, so we left.All the employees (except the one in the 'gift shop") were very nice, but they couldn't go against "management policy". Definitely not recommenced....unless of course you bring your own water and food!!

We stayed at the Ohana Airport overnight in January, 2011. We just needed a hotel close to the airport so we could catch our flight the next morning to Maui. We found the hotel to be clean and convenient. The staff were all very friendly and helpful. The breakfast was delicious and served quickly so we could catch the shuttle to the airport. I would definately recommend this hotel to the traveler who just needs an overnight stay without all the extras.

We stayed here in January of 2011 for one night while waiting for our flight to Kauai. The front desk was very pleasant when we arrived. The room was clean. And the price was reasonable. The front desk has safe deposit boxes you can use if you are going out and need a place for your valuables. The next morning we had no problem getting back to the airport as they offer a free shuttle service between their hotel and the airport. I would not hesitate to come back the next time I'm traveling to Oahu, Hawaii and need a place for a night. Mahalo!

My family and I stayed for the day while waiting for our flight. The room was clean and comfortable. The staff seemed friendly but didn't really have a lot of time to answer any additional questions. The hotel boasts about having a restaurant but does not serve lunch. The free shuttle is convenient. The elevator sounds like it needs to be looked at ASAP.I had to call the hotel after we got home because my husband thought he forgot his ring there. I was told that they couldn't help me at the time and would call back. They never did.

We stayed at this hotel overnight as we had a flight to LA early the next morning. I booked this hotel because I wanted a hotel close to the airport. It was close to the airport and provided a free shuttle.We were supposed to stay for another night several weeks later but I was so disgusted with how we were treated on the first occasion that I cancelled. The only pleasant helpful lady I encountered was a blonde lady at reception the day we arrived. Apart from that it was all downhill. A specific request to another staff member to freeze an icepack for medical reasons was met with reluctance and returned the next morning, barely cool so obviously had not been put in the freezer. We enquired about the free shuttle to the airport and were told that it ran at half past the hour and on the hour and to be downstairs 10 minutes beforehand.The morning of our departure, we rang to request the bell hop, half an hour before the shuttle was due to leave. When the bell hop failed to materialise after about 10 minutes, I went downstairs and enquired as to his whereabouts. The reply from the woman in her 20s at reception with her hair piled on the top of her head in a loose chignon was condescending in the extreme. Whilst I was talking to her I noticed that the shuttle was there and loading passengers. She told me smugly and in a mocking tone that we would have to wait for the next shuttle and that this one was full. She then waved it off at least 10 minutes early. I could see quite clearly that the shuttle was only 3/4 full and could have easily accomodated an extra 3 passengers. The next shuttle arrived and left late so we were later than we should have been to check in for our flight.I really think that management need to have a long hard look at their reception staff because they are the frontline of the hotel. No guest of any hotel should ever be humiliated or treated so appallingly. That's exactly how I was treated and it was horrible.I would not recommend this hotel to anyone. There are numerous airport hotels in Honolulu or stay in Waikiki and get a shuttle early in the morning to the hotel. Most shuttes cost between $23-$35 and you can find many reasonably priced nicer hotels in Waikiki.

******* MILITARY BE WARE *******The Ohana Inn is an absolute dump. Military be ware!! Don't be mislead by Les, the so called military liaison or the images on the web site. Rooms:The website gave the feeling of an extremely comfortable, well maintained facility. The lobby looked amazing & the rooms looked as though a good nites rest would be easy. The facts were - the rooms smelled old and musty and had an overall unclean feeling. The hallways, elevators and laundry rooms were very dingy. The A/C filter hadn't been cleaned and circulated smelly air. My son and I made some soapy water and re-cleaned our rooms ourselves. After cleaning the water was gray and smell sour from the "clean room".False Marketing:I was told that the hotel had a free shuttle for military personnel. I was lead to believe that this was an exclusive service and only offered by the Ohana. This was used as a selling point as gas was very expensive in the area. The truth was, the military base sent their own shuttle and it went to all the local hotels. Front Desk Staff:Rude would be a compliment. Often military personnel are held to a higher standard of conduct, even during non-duty activities. Often civilians use our status as citizen soldiers to treat us with a rude or less-than friendly posture. This was certainly the case with the Ohana Inn. I often asked the desk clerk assisting me, "How was your day?" in an effort to diffuse any poor attitudes i may have inadvertently caused. However, it soon became glaringly obvious to me that rudeness was the standard procedure at the Ohana.Restaurant:The military received free daily food vouchers. This was presented over the phone as a major incentive for military families. However, when I presented the vouchers, we were treated with an air of being a welfare recipient. We were only permitted to order from a specific menu of bland foods like, Spaghetti and meat balls, Chicken, Noodles, etc. My family often ate at other locations just to avoid the lunch room feeling and to actually order food we would eat and enjoy.Final Straw:When I realized I had been duped into staying at a two star joint, posing as a Hawaiian Resort I made reservations at another hotel. When I informed the front desk staff i was planning an early departure I was told that I would have to pay the full $3200.00 to leave early, the amount typically paid to the hotel by the military for incoming personnel. This mad it even more clear to me that the Ohana was operating an extremely lucrative, albeit dishonest-to-military-personnel business tantamount to the off-post used car dealers we frequently warn our junior personnel about.SSG,US Army

If you are trying to decided which airport hotel to stay then this is the better choice over the Best Western, IMO. While moving to the island we stayed in a total of three hotels, this being the last one before we moved into our permanent housing. We had our dogs with us and were limited to pet friendly hotels of which there are few. This location had a friendly staff and seemed to really care about their guests. The rooms were roomy and quiet. I could not hear the airport traffic at all. The location is the typical industrial type of airport location you would expect. Guests seemed to be primarily military pcsing tothe island. For a vacation I would still suggest staying somewhere else, but for the budget traveler or if needing an airport hotel this is a better chocie than the Best Western. Both are fine, but I having to choose between the two this would be my choice. However, if I were coming to the island for a vacation I would find a resort hotel or another Ohana hotel located closer to Waikiki which would certainly make for a more enjoyable vacation.

I am Edwin Seui, and I would not hesitate to reccomend this hotel to my family and friends. The staff and service are always first class and very friendly/family oriented. It will always be a pleasure for us to stay here anytime we're on Oahu.Again, thank you so much for making our stay enjoyable.

My husband was medivaced to Honolulu for a medical emergency. I didn't know how long he would be hospitalized, or how long I would need to stay. They were very accomodating, and compassionate. The hotel was clean, and I felt safe while staying there. The shuttle to the aiport was on time, and the driver was very helpful. I really appreciate the staff at this hotel.
For an overnight stay, this was a great hotel. Clean, friendly service, restaruant was good, free shuttle to airport and back, very close to bus stops, quiet.

We flew in late from Alaska and stayed near the Airport since we were flying out to the Big Island the next day. Fast, efficient check-in then off to the room. It could have used a little more vacuuming (both the carpet and dirt on a chair seat from a previous guest's shoes), and it appeared that the hair conditioner in the bathroom had been used by a previous guest since it was half-empty. HOWEVER, the hotel staff was wonderful in taking care of our needs. Quick, responsive waitstaff in the restaurant and very good food. My husband and I wanted to visit Pearl Harbor before we left, and the desk clerk recommended we take the bus to the Harbor ($2.50/pp), which was much less than a taxi. We were able to leave our luggage in a locked room with the concierge. The bus stop was right across the street from the hotel, and it dropped us off at the Pearl Harbor entrance. The return was just as quick; the bus stop is literally right in front of the hotel. Their customer care was exceptional. I inadvertently left my wallet in the room (thank goodness I keep my driver's license and credit cards on my person!), which they promptly mailed it to me with all cash and cards intact. Thank you, Ohana, for hiring such a wonderful staff! I sincerely appreciated it. You were wonderful.

We booked a King Bed Deluxe Room. Upon checking in, we discovered we had been booked in a room with a single double bed instead. When we brought this to the attention of the front desk, they insisted it was a queen bed and said that they never guarantee the bed size in their rooms and that the rates are the same whether they give you a king, queen or two doubles. My husband and I are both over 6 feet tall. It was an interesting night. Had we not gotten there so late, we would have checked out and stayed somewhere else for that night. Thankfully, our stay was only one night anyway before we checked in somewhere much nicer with staff that actually knew what customer service was.

We caught a night flight from Sydney to Honolulu and wanted something close to the airport for a reasonable price that we could rest in for a few hours when we arrived. This hotel was fantastic because:- They run a shuttle bus to the airport- We were able to check in at 11:30 am- The hotel was very quiet and of a standard much higher then we expected- The rooms were very clean and spacious with a comfortable bed- The staff were very friendly and helpful- The bus stop for going to Waikiki is right out the frontWe had an early morning flight to Kauai (05:30) and it is only 5 minutes to the airport on their shuttle bus.
We needed a place to stay for one night as we were returning from New Zealand. This hotel was perfect for us - convenient, comfortable, friendly and great price.

Not a very impressive location or hotel but OK for an overnight stay. When we arrived the desk was swamped with about a dozen guests checking oin at about 9pm with two staff on the desk. It was a bit slow but the staff were helpful and eventually got our room. Ordered delviery pizza as there is no restaurant in the building other than for breakfast. Breakfast service is friendly but the food is pretty ordinary. Shuttle service was reliable and helpful.Could probably find a better hotel but not one so close to the airport.

My husband and I stayed here one night on our way to Australia and very much appreciated its closeness to the airport, its friendly staff and convenient restaurant. We slept very well in the comfortable bed. The breakfast was particularly good and the waitress that morning was so charming. My only suggestion would be to have directions on where to pick up the shuttle at arrival at the airport. I will certainly recommend this hotel as a stopover location to family and friends.
